loans.name: Tuoi Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Tươi năm nay 38 tuổi.Gia đình chị  hiện có nghề làm đậu phụ bán. Trước đây do nguồn vốn gia đình còn hạn chế  nên anh chị mỗi ngày chỉ làm 5 kg đậu bán cho thu nhập 400.000đên 600.000đồng/ tháng.Đến nay  sau gần  tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn gia đình anh chị mạnh dạn đầu tư làm nhiều hơn  mỗi ngày làm 10kg đến 15 kg đậu và nuôi từ 10 đến 20 con  lợn cho thu nhập ổn định 2, 1 triệu đồng/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị Tươi mong muốn được vay 9 triệu về mua 800kg đậu tương làm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho việc sản xuất đậu phụ
texts.en:
Mrs. Tuoi Thi P. is a 38 years old woman. Her family makes their living on tofu. Before, they did not have enough money, so every day, the couple could only make 5 kilogram of tofu to sell, making from 400,000 to 600,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. After joining the TYM fund, they started borrowing money and tried to expand the production, producing from 10 to 15 kilograms of tofu every day and raising from 10 to 20 pigs. Their income now reaches about 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Mrs. P. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy 800 kilograms of tofu supply.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Thắm năm nay 50 tuổi, chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 10 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị chủ yếu làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư đi buôn chiếu. Hiện nay đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với mức thu nhập 2,500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn cho việc kinh doanh buôn bán chiếu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tham Thi D., 50 years old, joined the TYM fund 10 years ago. Before joining, her family focused on farming and livestock. Then, she borrowed money to start selling sedge mats. Now, this business generates 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Mrs. D. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Trước đây  kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do các con còn nhỏ vợ chồng chị buôn bán ở chợ thu nhập thấp. Sau 8 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn về đầu tư vào buôn bán và trồng cây cảnh đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều đổi thay. Hiện nay thu nhập từ buôn bán, trồng cây cảnh đạt 2,5triệu/tháng N.ài ra gia đình chị còn có một vườn cây cảnh trị giá gần 100 triệu đồng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay  9 triệu đồng để đầu tư vào buôn bán và kinh doanh cây cảnh
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi N. joined the TYM fund in 2000. Before, the family faced many financial difficulties because their children were still small, and their business made little revenue. After 8 years of borrowing money from the fund and cleverly investing it in bonsai, her family’s finance improved much. Now, income from selling bonsai reaches 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Besides, the family possesses a bonsai garden, worth 100,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. Mrs. N. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đào 46 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Đào thường đi làm thuê. Sau  khi tham gia  Quỹ tình thương chị Đào vay vốn để buôn bán  hoa quả. Qua 2 năm vay vốn của Quỹ về buôn bán cho thu nhập ổn định nên vòng vốn tới  chị dự định vay 9 triệu về sửa sang lại quầy hàng và đầu tư mua thêm hoa quả về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi T., 46 years old, joined the TYM fund in 2006. Before joining, she was a seasonal worker. After 2006, she borrowed money to sell fruit. 2 year later, the business was successful, bringing in a stable income. Therefore, Mrs. T. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to rebuilt her kiosk and buy more fruit inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc T., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Hường năm nay 33 tuổi. năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ  tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, tranh thủ thời gian nhàn rỗi chị Hường còn đi làm thuê để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 3 triệu đồng/ tháng không chỉ trả vốn đúng hạn gia đình chị Hường còn có điều kiện hơn trong việc cải thiện cuộc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 12 triệu đồng để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua lợn giống vè nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Tran, 33 years old, joined the fund in 2007. She first borrowed money to raise livestock. Currently besides the livestock business, she also takes advantage of her free time to work as labor for hire to increase the family's income. With an income of 3 million VND per month, her family is not only able to make all loan payments on time, but they are also able to enjoy a higher standard of living. In this round of funding she is requesting 12 million VND to invest in renovating the holding pens and buy a sow to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate holding pens, buy a sow

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa M. sells children’s used clothes in Rongo, Kenya. This business is a recent venture, as Teresa has been selling her products on the side of the road near the local market for only three months. She travels to Nairobi (approximately seven hours away by bus) twice a month in order to purchase the clothing.

The enterprise is doing moderately well so far, with jackets and jumpers being her most popular products during this season, but Teresa would like to be able to offer a wider selection of such items for her customers. She is therefore requesting a loan of $150 for this purpose.

Teresa’s husband drives a tractor in the area surrounding Rongo, and they have three children. Two of them are in school, with one attending form 3 in secondary school and another in class 2 in primary school. The third child is yet too young for school.

loans.use: To purchase more children's used  clothing.

loans.name: Lena

texts.fr: Mme Lena est une femme mariée mere de famille agée de 30 ans.Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le domicile conjugal.Son activité principale est la vente de bouteilles recupérées dans les hotels et autre endroit.les boutelles recuperées sont stockées chez elles avant d'être vendu aux fabriquant de produits synthetique diluant vernis et colle.Elle fait ce metier depuis deux(02)ans les revenus qu ' elle de ce travail lui permettent de participer aux depenses du menange.
texts.en:
Ms. Lena is 30-years-old, married, and a mother. She lives with her husband and her children in their marital home. Selling bottles salvaged from hotels and other places is her principal business. The salvaged bottles are stocked at her place and then sold to makers of synthetic products used for thinning varnishes and glues. This has been her trade for two years. The income she earns from this work enables her to help cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elie Salimosse

texts.fr: Elie B. agé de 37 ans est marié et pére de famille.Depuis six mois il a ouvert un restaurant fast food qu 'il gére avec son ami dans un quartier de Mbour .Avec le pret sollicité il va renforcer ses activités en diversifiant le menus et elargir l' espace en de l' ouverture de la saison touristique.
texts.en:
Elie B. is 37 years old, married, and a father with a family. Six months ago, he opened a fast-food restaurant that he manages with his friend in the Mbour district. With the requested loan, he is going to bolster his business by diversifying the menu and expanding the space for the opening of tourist season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Salome Y. from Mwanza. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 17 and 23. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one orphan child. Salome has been running a maize business since 1998. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets. Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before purchase and specify the exact amount they would like to purchase.

Salome works at the business for 16 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Salome currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to buy maize in bulk in order to resell it. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Salome thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42 year old Joyce N. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of nine and 21 years old. Joyce has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Joyce currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase material so she can create clothing (her specialty is women’s clothing) to sell them to her customers. Joyce thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase material for making clothing

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira was born in 1950 and lives by herself in Gračanica, a village in Bosnia. Emira has two primary businesses. She sells clothes and shoes at a local market, and she also works as an account manager, helping people to monitor their finances. She has used two microfinance loans in the past to help her develop these businesses. Emira used her first loan to buy clothes that she resold at a profit and she used her second loan to purchase a computer so she could work as an account manager from her home.

Now, Emira is hoping to develop a third business. Using her computer, she can prepare promotional materials for local businesses and schools. She requests a loan of 400KM from Women for Women, International which she will use to buy a scanner and printer to support this business venture.

loans.use: To buy a scanner and printer

loans.name: Ajšuna

texts.en:
Ajšuna was born in 1973. She lives in Grapska, an agricultural village in Bosnia. Grapska was completely destroyed during the Bosnian war in the 1990s, but Ajšuna returned to the village in 2000. She is married with 2 children, who are 6 years and 18 months old. Her husband has a steady job, but earns only 400KM/month, the equivalent of roughly $262 USD/month.  

To help support her family, Ajšuna grows vegetables and raises cows and chickens.  

She is requesting a loan of 600KM ($400 USD) from Women for Women International which she will use to purchase a calf.  She hopes to sell milk and milk products in the local market, and use the additional income to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Nesiba

texts.en:
Nesiba was born in 1948. She lives in Kotorsko, an agricultural village in Bosnia. She is married and lives with her husband who receives a retirement pension of 400KM/month, (about $261USD). She also has an adult son, who continues to live with her.

To support her family, Nesiba grows vegetables and raises chickens and cows.  She has had four microfinance loans in the past, all of which she repaid successfully. She used the first two loans to buy calves, the third loan to buy chickens, and the fourth loan to buy food for her cows. Her husband helps her in the field and with taking care of the animals.

Nesiba requests a loan of 1,500KM from Women for Women, International, to purchase food for her three cows. In the future, she hopes to use another loan to purchase another calf.

loans.use: To purchase food for cows.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Neema M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children between the ages of seven and 11 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because the child's parents do not take care of him. Neema has been running a tailoring business since 1998. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Neema currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy thread and kanga. In the future, she plans to employ more people. Neema thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy thread and kanga

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira was born in 1976. She lives in Grapska, a village in Bosnia.  She is married and has two children.  To help support her family, Elvira grows vegetables (potatoes, onions, and carrots) and raises two cows. She sells her cows’ milk to a local factory for income. 

Elvira requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to purchase food for her cattle. This food is needed to sustain the cows through the winter. This is her first microfinance loan.

loans.use: To buy food for cattle

loans.name: Inspiration Group

texts.en:
Emma T. is 44 years old and married with four children, who are between the ages of 2 and 15. Emma also takes care of a 26 year old girl named Pamela.

Emma started his first business selling beverages and cartons of eggs in January 1998. He worked very hard and his business prospered. However, in 2006 thieves broke into his business and took all of his money and goods. He lost approximately $770 as a result of the theft. Due to this traumatic event, Emma closed his business. He and his family went through a hard time as he had neither a job nor anything with which to support his family financially. His life and future became dark.

Emma’s sister Dethy Tshama then gave him $300 as a donation and in 2007 Emma bought a stall and started a new business selling second-hand clothing. He likes this business because it's profitable and helped him stabilize his family economically. Emma sells in a heavily populated area of Eastern Kinshasa. He is now able to provide food and housing for his family, and pay the electricity and water bills and school fees for his children.

This past November, Emma joined a Hope DRC group called Inspiration with 40 members. Emma is very glad to have joined because he wants to enhance his business with a loan. With this loan, he plans to rent a building and move his business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains during the rainy season. He says that a loan from Hope DRC is his “saviour.”

loans.use: To rent a building and move his business indoors.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Ashura M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children between the ages of seven and 15 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because the child's parents do not take care of her. Ashura has been running a tailoring shop and selling clothes since 2007. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Ashura currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to buy more stock for sale. In the future, she plans to expand the business. Ashura thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 40 años, convive con su pareja de muchos años, han tenido 4 hijos que viven aun con ellos. Ana es ama de casa, y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en horas de la tarde le ayuda en sus labores después de llevar el almuerzo, su actividad es de todos los días, desde que empezó a su relación conyugal, y les va muy bien. Ellos siempre han sembrado grandes cantidades de café y cacao, porque cuando tiene buen precio recuperan todo lo invertido, a pesar de pagar peones, es por ello que es fiel ha sembrar café. Su preocupación es que sus plantaciones ahora no están reaccionando como debería ser, considera que necesitan ser abonadas. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Y con el dinero va a comprar abonos para regar en sus plantitas de café, para que el adelante pueda cosechar grandes cantidades, esto le costará un aproximado de S/.920 a más.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and has been living with her partner for many years. They have 4 children who still live with them. She is a homemaker, and her husband works in agriculture. In the afternoon hours, she helps him with his work after taking him his lunch. They work every day, as they have been since they got together, and things have been going well. They have always grown large quantities of coffee and cacao because when they sell at a good price, they recoup all the money that was invested, despite having to pay the farm workers. For this reason, they have been faithful to growing coffee plants. She is worried, however, that her crops are not growing properly, which is why she thinks they need to be fertilized. This is the first time she requests a loan from MFP. With the money, she will purchase fertilizer for her coffee plants so that she can harvest greater quantities from now on. This will cost her about 920.00 PEN or more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for coffee plants

loans.name: Geraidina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Geraidina Mwambo from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of four and 15 years old. Additionally, she supports one dependent orphan. Geraidina has been running a clothes business since 1993. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is an expressive textile: the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Geraidina works at the business for eight hours per day,five days per week. Geraidina currently earns about 325 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she plans to expand the business. Geraidina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Nevenka

texts.en: Nevenka was born in 1978. She lives in Bratunac, a village close to Srebrenica in a region that endured some of the worst damage of the Bosnian War in the 1990s. Nevenka is married and has two children. Her husband is a high school teacher. Nevenka is a housewife, but she wants to start a business to help support her family. She requests a 600KM loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to build a special type of smokehouse that can be used to dry meat and plums. She plans to sell these products at the local marketplace, where they are considered a specialty.

loans.use: To build a smokehouse to prepare dried meat and dried plums.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en: Dragana was born in 1979. She lives in Bratunac, a village close to Srebrenica in a region that endured some of the worst damage of the Bosnian War in the 1990s. Dragana is single and lives with her mother.  She is a saleswoman in a grocery, and earns about 600KM/month (about $392 USD).  To support herself and her mother, she also sells clothing at the local market. Dragana requests a 600KM ($400 USD) loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to purchase clothing that she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Mastidia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Mastidia R. from Mwanza. She is single with two children between the ages of 16 and 22 years old. Mastidia has been running a tailoring business since 1998. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, primarily for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Mastidia currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase vitenge and kanga. In the future, she plans to add additional stock of clothes. Mastidia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 55 años, es casada, D. ese matrimonio feliz tiene tres robustos hijos y muy trabajadores en la agricultura, a pesar D. que son muy pequeños. Catalina es ama D. casa, su esposo es agricultor, para que su esposo se vaya a la chacra, ella tiene que levantarse a la 5.00 am. y preparar un buen desayuno, a base D. cafecito con yucas, y en horas del medio día va llevando el almuerzo para su esposo y le ayuda cuando es necesario. Pero los dias viernes se va en búsqueda D. plátanos verdes, porque ha visto que ese negocio es muy rentable, y gana mucho más que vender los plátanos en su chacra, la única dificultad que tiene es sacar su carga desD. los montes, casi siempre no hay carros que ingresen, solo a veces motos, pero cobran muy caro. E.s su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprara plátanos y el líquido para la maduración, además D. aumentar su propia producció, espera con el tiempo, mejorar su calidad D. vida gracias a su esfuerzo
texts.en:
Catalina is a married 55-year-old woman. Out of that happy marriage came three robust children who work hard in agriculture despite their young age. Catalina is a homemaker whose husband is a farm worker. In order for her husband to go to the farm, she has to wake up at 5:00 am and prepare him a good breakfast, which consists of coffee and cassava. At noon, she takes him his lunch and helps him whenever necessary. On Fridays, she picks green plantains because she has noticed that this is a lucrative business, and she makes more money then when she sells plantains in her farm. The only problem is when she has to bring her crops from the mountain because it is accessible to trucks. Sometimes, motorcycles can be used, but it is too expensive. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase plantains and the liquid for the ripening process. AsiD. from increasing her own production, she also hopes to improve her quality of life over time thanks to her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in crop fields and purchase green plantains

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa vive en casa propia en la calle los pinos de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene un hijo el cual trabaja con un taxi que su padre compró.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar el auto ya que es una herramienta de trabajo para su hijo quien puede solventar sus estudios y su alimentación solo con el auto porque esta estudiando.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Nicolasa lives in her own house on Los Pinos Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She works as a maid, her husband as a builder and she has one son who drives a taxi his father bought him.

The loan she is requesting is to fix the taxi as it is the tool of her son’s trade who currently only makes enough to pay for his education and food as he is still studying.

Her credit history with Impro is good and qualifies her for a new loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing the taxi her son drives to help his parents

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David vive en anticrético en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos, la actividad que realiza es el ensamblaje de computadoras y la confección de pantalones, la esposa es profesora de primaria  y como sus ingresos son mínimos desde hace un mes ella ayuda a su esposo con la confección de los pantalones, negocio con el cual les esta yendo muy bien, pues han recibido pedidos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y una maquina ojaladora. Y así mejorar la calidad de sus prendas y al mismo tiempo mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. David G. lives on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Las Lomas district of the city of La Paz with his wife and children. He builds computers and makes pants for a living. His wife is an elementary school teacher, but since her earnings are minimal, she has been helping her husband make pants for some months now. The pant-making business is prosperous because they have received orders from their customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy material and a sewing machine that does buttonhole stitching, thus he can improve the quality of his apparel while at the same time boost profits. He has good credit history with Impro, which approves him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a buttonhole stitching sewing machine and materials to make pants

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
De 47 años, la señora Flor vende menués por pedido desde hace 1 año y, paralelamente, cuenta en un ambiente de su casa con otro negocio: cabinas de Internet. Su trabajo es duro pero ella sabe que vale la pena, y muchísimo, porque es así que puede costear la educación de sus 3 hijos: 2 en la Universidad y 1 en el colegio (de 26, 25 y 12 años de edad), en sí, son 6 personas con las que vive en casa. Sabe que en los rubros de sus 2 negocios hay mucha y dura competencia pero ella va para adelante, no se intimida y va diseñando sus metas a punta de esfuerzo.

Es consciente que a veces no basta esto, por lo que requiere de una pequeña ayuda, es decir, necesita de 500 soles de préstamo que le servirán como aliciente a su dedicado esfuerzo para con sus hijos.
texts.en:
47 year old Flor has been selling meals to order for 1 year and, at the same time, she has another business of Internet cabins in her home. Her work is hard but she knows that it is worth it because with these jobs she can pay for her 3 children’s educations: 2 are in the University and 1 in secondary school (ages 26, 25, and 12). In total there are 6 people who live in her home. She knows that in both of her business fields there is a lot of hard competition but she is succeeding, is not intimidated, and continues designing her goals and directing her efforts. She knows that at times this is not enough, which is why she requires a little help. That is to say, she needs a loan for 500 soles which will serve as incentive to continue dedicating her efforts on behalf of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make her food and continue implementing her Internet cabins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  vive en la calle Inca Roca  de la zona Alto Tacagua  de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El es casado vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años respectivamente.

Trabaja como chofer de automóvil en una de las líneas céntricas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para el motor de su movilidad y realizarle un mantenimiento general.
 
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el primero  via kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives on Inca Roca street in the area of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz. He is married and lives with his wife and his three children; 22, 20 and 18 years old respectively. He works as a driver in one of the main routes of the city. The loan is going to be used to purchase spare parts for his vehicle's motor and to perform general maintenance. It is his third loan with Impro, the first via Kiva, the assessment showed that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for the engine of his taxi and for general maintenance

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Caroline S. from Mwanza. She is married with two children ages four and six years old. Additionally, she supports one dependent because she is an orphan. Caroline has been running a pharmacy business since 2005. A pharmacy in Tanzania is traditionally a small store that has many glass shelves on which a variety of medicines are displayed, from antibiotic soap to malaria medicine. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Caroline currently earns about 30 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy more medicines to sell. Caroline thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija de 2 años, actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Hace 5 años atrás trabajaba en la ciudad de Lima, vino de visita a Pichanaki, se enamoro y se quedo. Y hace un año empezó a sembrar una chacra de plátanos, a la cual le falta un año mas o menos para que ya empiece a cosechar, mientras tanto está contrayendo su casa, con anhelos de poner una tienda de abarrotes y claro seguir con la agricultura, porque cuando empiece a cosechar le ira muy bien, ya que el plátano se cosecha cada 15 dias, por el momento no conoce dificultades todavía en la chacra, pero sí tiene muchos anhelos de crecer en su negocio. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero lo invertirá en sus cultivos, además de comprar mercaderías de acuerdo lo que le alcance para su próxima bodega, la cual aun esta en proceso de construcción.
texts.en:
Fredy is 23 years old, has a partner and 2 year old daughter, and lives in the home of his parents. 5 years ago he used to work in Lima – he came to Pichanaki for a visit, fell in love, and stayed. One year ago he began to plant a banana farm, he still needs one year, more or less, until he can begin to harvest. Meanwhile he is building his home with the goal of opening a grocery store and of course continue with agriculture, because when he begins harvesting things will go well for him as bananas are harvested every 15 days. Today he doesn’t yet have any difficulties on the farm, but he has many dreams of growing his business. This is his first loan with MFP. The money will be invested in his crops in addition he will buy merchandise for his store, which he is still in the process of constructing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his agricultural production in addition to buying merchandise for his future grocery store

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier  vive en la calle Rafael Zans  de la zona Achachicala  de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El es casado vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 10, y 7 años respectivamente.

Trabaja como chofer de automóvil en una de las líneas céntricas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos y llantas para  su movilidad y realizarle un mantenimiento general.
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Javier lives on Rafael Zans street in the Achachicala area in the city of La Paz. He is married and lives with his wife and their three children; 12, 10 and 7 years old respectively. He works as a driver in one of the main routes in the city. The loan will be used to buy spare parts and wheels for his vehicle and to perform general maintenance. It is his first loan with Impro, the assessment showed that he is qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires and vehicle maintenance

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 23 años, es soltero, aun está viviendo en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus hermanos. Toda su vida ha sabido cultivar frutos cítricos y plátanos, ya que es la fuente principal para el sostenimiento de su familia, le levanta a las 6.00am desayuna y se va a la chacra. Hace 2 meses ha decido incursionar en el negocio de la maduración de plátanos verdes para venderlos luego, está viendo que a sus vecinos que les va muy bien en esta actividad. Nos comenta que cuando él se vaya a la chacra, a su esposa le delegaría esta actividad, por lo cual sería un ingreso adicional a su economía. La dificultad que tendría por  el momento es que le faltan los accesorios necesarios para el proceso de maduración del plátano. Es la primera vez solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará una cierta cantidad de plátanos para que sea su capital de inversión, asimismo comprará cubetas y tinas muy grandes para el sumergido de los plátanos, y otra parte para seguir invirtiendo en sus tierras.
texts.en:
David is 23 years old, single, and still lives with his parents in their home along with his brothers. His whole life he has known how to cultivate citrus fruits and bananas, as it is the primary means of sustenance for the family. He rises at 6:00 am, eats breakfast, and goes to the farm. It’s been two months since he decided to get involved in the business of ripening green bananas to offer for sale later. He is seeing that his neighbors do very well for themselves with this activity. He tells us that when he goes to the farm, he would give his wife this task which would generate additional income. The difficulty that he would have is the lack of necessary accessories for the process of ripening the bananas. This is the first time he requests a loan with MFP. He will use some of the funds as working capital to purchase a certain quantity of bananas. He will also buy buckets and large tins for submerging the bananas, and use another part to continue investing in his lands.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas and implements used to ripen them.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad  vive en el manzano “D” patio 1   de la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es una joven madre soltera que tiene una hija de 5 años, vive junto a su madre.
 
 Se dedica a la elaboración de pan especial en el horno de su propia casa, los cuales los vende en diferentes negocios de la zona comercial de la ciudad y con cuyas ventas solventa sus estudios superiores y mantiene su hogar.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de harina e insumos para su negocio.
 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Felicidad lives on manzano “D”, patio 1, of the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto.

She is a young single mother with a 5-year old daughter, and lives with her mother.

She dedicates herself to making specialty breads in an oven situated in her own home, which she sells to different businesses in the commercial zone of the city. These sales allow her to settle her educational expenses and help support the household.

The loan would be destined for the purchase of flour and ingredients for her business.

This is her second loan with Impro, and the second through Kiva; the evaluation conducted qualifies her to be granted the credit.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and other supplies for her business making specialty breads.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 35 años de edad, es separada, se quedó con sus cuatro hijos quienes le acompañan y a la vez le ayudan en los trabajos pesados. Cuando ella vivía con su esposo trabajaban en las chacras de otras personas, pasaron los años, su esposo se aburrió y la dejó. Este fue motivo para trabajar con más ganas para mantener a sus hijos, ahora que ya crecieron, juntos están sembrando en chacras alquiladas, de ello le sale para los gastos de educación técnica de uno de sus hijos que estudia en un instituto privado. Asimismo, hace 3 meses atrás, puso un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, y las tardes cuando va a la chacra, deja encargando a sus hijos la tienda, su bodeguita se está iniciando, y tiene muchas esperanzas en su crecimiento. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Ahora, con este dinero, invertirá en la compra de golosinas para su tienda, ya que por el momento para abarrotes no le alcanzaría, asimismo usar una parte para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Delia is 35 years old, separated, having been left with four children who keep her company and also help her with heavy work. When she lived with her husband, they worked on other people’s farms. Years passed, her husband got bored, and left her. This was motivation to work even harder to support her children and, now that they are older, they all together plant their crops on rented land. From this, she earns enough to pay for the technical education of one of her children who is studying at a private institute. Likewise, three months ago, she started a small grocery store and when she goes to work on the farmlands in the afternoons her children are in charge of the store. Her little store is taking small steps and she has great hope that it will grow. This is her first loan with MFP. Today, with these funds, she will invest in the purchase of candy for her store since there would not be enough for groceries right now. She would also like to use some of the money for her crops.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her crops, and also to buy candy for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Iram

texts.es: Iram tiene 24 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres de tercera edad, se dedica al cuidado de ellos.  Iram tiene la gran responsabilidad de la alimentación de sus padres y de su bienestar. Desde sus 15 años ya sembraba en grandes cantidades 2 a 4 hectáreas de café de manera alternada, la herencia del trabajo lo recibió de su padre. A el agrada mucho sembrar, sobre todo café, mas que los cítricos, porque los cítricos  tiene buen precio en cierta temporada, en cambio el café aunque baje no se cotiza en precios muy bajos, solo que para la cosecha se requiere de mucha gente y ahí es donde tiene dificultades, al no hallar mano de obra, nos dice que a su chacra de café le falta el abonado para que explote mejor la tierra y coseche en grandes cantidades. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será usado en la compra de abono para su chacra de café para luego proceder a trabajar, porque el café se trabaja cada tres meses, en esto gastará todo el préstamo.
texts.en:
Iram is 24 years old and single. He lives with his aging parents and has the great responsibility to provide food and care for his parents well being. From the time he was 15, Iram has planted large quantities, 2 - 4 hectares, of coffee, alternating the crops. This is a business he inherited from his father. He prefers growing coffee over citrus fruits for example, because the citrus fruits only have a good price during certain times of the year, while coffee, although the price goes down a little, doesn't have such big drops. However, the harvest requires a lot of people and this is where it gets difficult. He doesn't have enough fertilizer to fully work the land and produce big harvests. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use the money to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop, and later, as they harvest every three months, he will be able to pay back the loan in full.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his small coffee plantation

loans.name: Nurat

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Nurat S. from Mwanza. She is married with one four-year-old child. Nurat has been running a maize flour business since 2006. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets. Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before purchase and can specify the exact amount they would like. Maize is very important to the Tanzanian culture because maize is used to make one of their staple dishes, ugali, which is made solely of maize flour and water. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Nurat currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase maize in bulk. Nurat thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: María

texts.es:
A pesar de sus 61 años, la señora María sigue siendo más que un paradigma para su familia por su perseverancia y valores intactos. Con ya 10 años de puesta su tienda, también tiene su carro sanguchero por las noches. Viviendo con su hija mayor, sus 3 hijos (sus nietos) y su esposo que viene mensualmente por laborar en provincias, es el sostén económico del hogar por lo que no puede ni declina ante tamaña responsabilidad. 

Ante esta situación, ella quiere implementar su bodega (panetones y juguetes por temporada navideña) y los insumos que necesite para su carro sanguchero, por ello, la señora María requiere la suma de 2000 soles, los que le servirían como capital para sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Despite being 61 years old, Maria continues to set an example for her family through her perseverance and values. With 10 years of running her shop, she also runs a food stand at night. She lives with her oldest daughter, her three grandchildren and her husband who comes home monthly from working in other provinces. He is the main source of income and he cannot decline such a responsibility. Faced with this situation, she wants to open her store (paneton [sweet bread served around Christmas] and toys for the Christmas season) and the materials that she needs for her food stand. For that, Maria requires the sum of 2000 soles to act as capital for her two businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open her store with sweet bread, toys and other things in order to meet her clients demands in the Christmas season

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix  vive en la avenida 16 de noviembre  de la zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es soltero vive junto a su padre en una casa familiar.

Trabaja como empleado de una empresa textil en el sector costura.

Gracias a sus ahorros y con ayuda de su padre adquirieron una movilidad de segunda mano, a la cual es necesario hacerle algunas reparaciones, para luego ponerlo a trabajar. 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de repuestos (pastillas de frenos, llantas).
 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro,  la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Felix lives in Avenida 16 de Noviembre in the area of 16 de Febrero, in the town of El Alto. He is single and lives with his father. He is an employee at a textile company in the dressmaking section.

Thanks to his savings and with the support of his father, they bought a second-hand vehicle which needs some repairs in order to make it work. The loan will be spend on buying spare parts (brake chip, tires). This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation shows him to be qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires and spare parts for an automobile to function as a taxi.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa tiene 37 años, convive con su pareja y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar. Toda su vida ha estado en la chacra, sus padres eran agricultores, y cuando se casó, fue la misma rutina. Hace 2 años decidió incursionar en la compra y venta de plátano, el cual le deja un margen considerable a ganar, porque en las chacras por un aproximado de 11 kilos paga 6 soles, ella los hace madurar mediante un producto químico, entonces los llega a vender por cajones a de 9 hasta 12 soles. Ahora solo va a sus campos cuando en necesario, se dedica a mayor tiempo a la comprar y venta de plátanos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará plátanos en mayor cantidad, asimismo los insumos para realizar el procesamiento de maduración.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their three children who attend school. All her life she has been involved in agriculture, as it was her parents work. When she married, she continued with the same business. Two years ago, she decided to begin buying and selling bananas, which provide a good profit margin. It costs approximately 6 soles for 11 kilos, but she uses a fertilizer to help them ripen, and she can sell boxes of 9 for 12 soles. Now she only goes to the fields when necessary, dedicating the majority of her time to buying and selling bananas. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money, she will purchase large quantities of bananas, as well as the ingredients she needs to help in the ripening process.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas and the ingredients she uses in the ripening process

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Desde hace 8 años que la señora Dionisia, de 55, tiene una tienda en casa donde expende gaseosas y todo tipo de abarrotes. Convive con su esposo, sus 3 hijos, Y alberga a la esposa e hijos de 1 de ellos, pero ella no les cierra las puertas: quiere el bienestar para todos sus hijos. Siendo la perseverancia su segundo nombre, ganado gracias al ahínco con que desarrolla sus labores, ella ve su futuro mucho mejor, tan sólo para poder brindarle a sus hijos, y a sí misma, una mejor calidad de vida.

Para plasmar dicho futuro en la realidad, ella requiere de 600 soles, considerando la implementación que necesita su tienda en sí, tanto en su ambiente como en los productos que tiene.
texts.en:
For eight years now Dionisia, who is 55 years old, has had a store where she sells sodas and all types of groceries. She lives with her husband, their two children, as well as the wife and children of one of her sons. She never closes the door to them, as she cares for the well-being of all her children. Since perserverance is her middle name, earned thanks to the eagerness with which she carries out her tasks, she sees a much brighter future if she can only provide a better quality of life for herself and her children.

To make this wish for their futures a reality she needs 600.00 soles, considering the improvements her store needs – both for the atmosphere and for the types of products that she carries.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase many more products at wholesale for her grocery store with the goal of increasing her income.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel tiene 37 años de edad,  padre soltero con dos hijos que están viviendo con su madre y él vive en la casa de su madre, en compañía de sus hermanos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura, hace un año se planteó la meta de poner cabinas de Internet en su pueblo, en vista que no hay ese tipo de negocio en su terruño. La agricultura la realiza esporádicamente, entonces eso le va dar tiempo a atender el negocio que piensa aperturar.
Ha visto que le ira muy bien porque no tendría competencia, ya lo tiene todo preparado, la antena y las cabinas lo único que le falta es un poco de capital para los CPUs y darle por inaugurado su negocio, considera que no tendría ninguna dificultad. Es un nuevo cliente de MFP. Con el dinero comprará 3 CPUs de segunda para que le alcance. Para nuevos le faltaría mucho más.
texts.en:
Joel is 37 years old. His two children live with their mother, and Joel lives in his mother's house along with his brothers. From the time he was young he has worked in agriculture. One year ago he came up with the idea to set up internet booths in his town, realizing that there was no business like this in his area. Agriculture is sporadic, so this gives him time to work on his new business. He thinks it will go well as there is no competition now, and he has everything prepared, the antenna and the booths. All that is missing is a little bit of capital to launch his business and he doesn't see any difficulty. Joel is a new client of MFP. With the money, he will purchase 3 used computers so he can begin. For new computers it would cost much more.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase second hand computers for his internet booths

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene tres hijos dentro su matrimonio que alegran su existencia. Desde muy niño la actividad que predominaba en su casa era la agricultura, ahora, desde hace un año está en el negocio de procesar plátanos verdes. Todas las mañanas, muy temprano, se va a diferentes chacras a comprar plátanos verdes, en sus propias tierras siembra café, que nunca le ha fallado. Lo que más le agrada es realizar el proceso de maduración de los plátanos, dice una vez que los baña en el líquido de maduración, los tiene que envolver para que maduren y después de una semana ya estarán listos para que se puedan promocionar en el mercado. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una salchipapera para preparar salchipapas, platillo que consta en freír papas y salchichas, captando así, ingresos adicionales para su economía.
texts.en:
Manuel is 58 years old and is married with 3 children - who are the joy of his life. From the time he was very young, the main business of his family was agriculture. Now, since one year ago, he has been in the business of processing green bananas to ripen them faster. Every morning, very early, he goes to buy green bananas. On his own land he grows coffee, which never lets him down. But he appreciates the process of ripening the bananas in the special liquids, then one week later they are ready for sale in the market. This is his first loan with MFP. With the money, he will purchase a cart for preparing fried potatoes and sausages, which will provide additional income for him.

.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cart for frying sausages and potatoes

loans.name: María

texts.es:
D. 41 años y con 1 D. ellos en L. crianza y ventas D. cuy, L. señora María cuenta con una gran predisposición para cualquier tipo D. negocio así como L. fuerza D. voluntad y perseverancia para sacarlo adelante. Tal esfuerzo lo viene realizando años tras año para poder solventar L. educación D. sus 2 menores hijos: D. 16 y 12 años. Volviendo a lo D. su negocio, le está yendo muy bien, lo que ha causado una gran demanda que, lamentablemente, no pueD. abastecer por sí soL..

Con ánimos D. darle el empujón que necesita a su negocio, dándoles así L. oportunidad D. una educación a sus hijos, L. señora María necesita 1000 soles y, así, poder acariciar tan añorada realidad D. unos hijos bien educados.
texts.en:
At 41 years old, and with one year of experience raising and selling guinea pigs, Maria counts on her strong disposition towards any kind of business, as well as her desire and perseverence in improving the quality of life for her family. Her work ethic comes from year after year of effort to pay for the education of her children, ages 12 and 16. Her business is now going very well and she has a lot of customer demand. Unfortunately, she needs some help to meet that demand. She is motivated to give her business the push it needs, so that she can continue to proviD. a good education for her children. She is requesting 1000 soles to invest in her business and help her achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more guinea pigs and feed so that she can continue to invest in her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela tiene  58 años de edad, ha enviudado hace 5 años, desde esa vez se quedó en compañía de su única hija. Cuando estaba vivo su esposo no permitía que ella trabaje, pero desde que falleció se vio obligada a trabajar en las chacras de otras personas, quienes le pagaban un salario mínimo, que no cubría sus gastos. Entonces, hace tres años decidió comprar cerdos pequeños y después de criarlos los vende, eso le es muy rentable, ya que sus clientes le solicitan cantidades determinadas para que les abastezca en sus puestos cada cierto tiempo. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a MFP. Con este dinero comprará más cerditos y alimento balanceado para que maduren rápido y estén listos para ser vendidos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 58 years old and became a widow five years ago. Since then she has lived with her only daughter. When her husband was living he did not permit her to work but when he died she felt obligated to work on other people's farms. They paid her minimum wage and that didn't cover her expenses. So three years ago she decided to buy some small pigs and after raising them, she sells them. This is very profitable for her because her clients request specific quantities in order to take delivery and have them in their stands [at the market] at certain times. This is the first loan she is requesting from MFP. With this money she will purchase more pigs and balanced food so that they mature rapidly and are ready to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene  52 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y sus nietos, quienes trabajan todos en la chacra en mutuo acuerdo. Desde su infancia fue a los campos de cultivo, ahora con sus hijos continua la misma actividad. Cuando termina de trabajar en la chacra vende gaseosas, hace un mes que empezó, con el anhelo de que algún día, antes que muera, nos dice, pueda tener una pequeña bodega. A Nancy el trabajo agrícola ya le cansa mucho, es por ello que le gustaría tener una tienda para ya no trabajar en la chacra, piensa que el negocio no sería tan rentable, pero si tendría ingresos diarios. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Este dinero, es su oportunidad de comprar varios paquetes de gaseosas y golosinas para vender en mayor cantidad, por ello invertirá  todo el dinero en esto.
texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old. She lives with her five children and her grandchildren who all work on the farm together. Since her infancy, she has gone to work in the fields and now with her children she continues the same activity. When she finishes working on the farm she sells soft drinks. She started a month ago with the longing that one day before she dies to have a small general store. The agricultural work makes Nancy very tired and for that reason she would like to have a store to not have to work on the farm. She doesn't think the business would be very profitable but she would have a daily income. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP. This money is her opportunity to buy several cases of soft drinks and candy to sell in greater quantities and for that reason she will invest it all in this.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.en:
Gaby K. is 42 years old and the mother of five children between the ages of 4 and 16. In addition to her five children, she also takes care of three orphaned girls. Gaby runs a restaurant. She has been in business since 2006 and began her business with $50 in capital. 

Gaby has been a member a Hope group named Miel, which means honey, since November 2008. With her first loan she expanded her business by adding vegetables and palm oil, which is in high demand where she works in northeastern Kinshasa. Gaby would like to continue receiving Hope loans in order to achieve her dreams of modernizing her restaurant. She would like to use electrical appliances, such as hot plates, instead of charcoal. She also plans to start a catering service.  

The Miel group has thirty-three members. They are all working very hard to develop their businesses. With their loans, they aspire to meet the increasing demand of their clients and in turn generate higher profits that will help them support their families.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances for her restaurant.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 41 años, es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos quienes son la razón de su vivir. Desde los 10 años ha trabajado en las chacras de sus vecinos porque a sus padres no le alcanzaba el dinero, por ello que se ha fijado la meta de que sus hijos no tendrán que trabajar en chacras ajenas, para ello ha adquirido campos para el cultivo, de las cuales la mayor cantidad ya las tiene sembradas, y ahí emplea a sus hijos. Desde las 7 .00am ya deben estar cultivando sus chacras los fines de semana, su esposa está empezando a vender golosinas en su bodeguita que ha acondicionado en su casa, lo triste es no cantar con dinero suficiente para la educación de sus hijos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será para la compra de abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Roberto is 41 years old. He has a common law wife and six children who are his reason for living. For the past 10 years he has worked on his neighbors' farms because his parents didn't have enough money. That's why he established the goal that his children will not have to work on someone else's farm and has acquired land to cultivate. He has already sown a large part of it and that's where he employs his children. Starting at 7:00 a.m. they should be working on the farm on the weekends. His wife is starting to sell candy in a small store that he has set up in their home. The sad thing is they don't have enough money for their children's education. This is his first loan with MFP. The money requested will be used to buy fertilizer for their land.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Rubida

texts.es: Rubida tiene 24 años, su situación conyugal es conviviente, de esa relación tiene dos hijos. Vive en una comunidad nativa llamada “La boca del Ipoki”, en esta comunidad solo se dedican a la agricultura, otro tipo de trabajo no existe, por el momento tiene sembrado 1 hectárea y ½ de palta, pero nos dice que en estos tiempos la están cotizando a muy barato, por eso está preparan su chacra para la siembra de cacao, que nos comenta ahora es más rentable. Por eso, desde las 5.00am ya está trabajando, para avanzar antes que el calor ya no la deje continuar, a ella le agrada la chacra, pero si nos dice que es muy pesada y cansada esta actividad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con ese dinero va comprar semilla de cacao y contratar obreros para sembrar de inmediato.
texts.en:
Rubida is 24 years old. She is a common law wife and from that relationship she has two children. She lives in an indigenous community called "La Boca del Ipoki." In this community everyone works in agriculture and no other type of job exists. For the moment she has sown 1-1/2 hectares of avocado but she tells us that right now the value is very low. For that reason she is preparing her farm to grow cacao and says that it is more profitable. So at 5:00 a.m. she is already at work before the heat prevents her from continuing. She enjoys farming but says that it is very hard work and tiresome. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money she will buy cacao seeds and immediately hire workers to plant them.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cacao seeds and hire farm workers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, todos viven en la casa de sus padres. Se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los desayunos de sus hijos que se van a la escuela, después prepara el almuerzo para llevar a su esposo, donde trabaja en sus plantaciones de café, de inmediato regresa para atender su tienda de abarrotes. A ella le agrada estar en comunicación directa con la gente cuando vende sus productos, con este negocio esta desde hace un año atrás, y dice que poco a poco ya está ganado clientela, sobre todo por el trato que les da a sus clientes. Su dificultad es la falta de dinero para tener todos los productos que sus clientes necesiten. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mercadería, como arroz y azúcar por sacos para que le dure y esa inversión será de 1.000 soles, de ese modo puede dar un precio mas cómodo y atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is 32 years old. She is a common law wife and has two children. They all live in parents' home. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children who go to school. Later she prepares lunch to take to her husband who works on the coffee plantations. She then returns immediately to tend to her grocery store. She likes to be in direct communication with the people when she sells her products. She has had the business for a year and says that little by little her clientele has grown, above all because of how she treats them. Her difficulty is the lack of money needed to have all of the products that her clients need. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money requested she will buy merchandise like sacks of rice and sugar so that they last. That investment will be 1,000 soles and she can offer a better price and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: María Flora

texts.es:
De tan humilde familia, qué gran emprendedora es la señora Flora. Con sus 54 años, incursionó hace 6 meses en la venta de descartables implementado en un ambiente dentro de su casa, que también lo aprovecha para vender artículos de librería.  Ella vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, 3 de los cuales se dedican a la producción y venta de mochilas (su trabajo anterior, se lo dejó a sus hijos), mientras los otros 2 son escolares, de 15 y 9 años de edad. Empero que su esposo también trabaja, como cerrajero, no les es suficiente los ingresos y mantienen un nivel de vida algo precario, pero la señora Flora ve más allá: sueña con terminar de ambientar su casa y poder expender también una librería por sí sola y, no junta con la de descartables como ahora, lo que aumentaría sus ingresos, arista esencial en aras de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y los suyos.

Con la fe intacta y más voluntad cada vez, la señora Flora solicita el préstamo de 400 soles, con los ánimos de alcanzar su sueño, también el que anhela para su familia.
texts.en:
From such a humble family, Mrs. Flora is a great businesswoman. Six months ago, at 54 years old, she began selling disposables. She began it in her home environment where she also used to sell bookstore items. She lives with her husband and her five children, three of which produce and sell backpacks (her previous job that she left to her kids) while the other two (15 and 9 years old) are in school. Her husband also works as a locksmith but it does not bring in enough income and their standard of living is precarious. But Mrs. Flora perseveres: she dreams about completing her home environment and to be able to be able to run the bookstore by itself, not together with the disposables as it is now which would increase their income which is essential for improving the standard of living of her and her family. With faith intact and more will each time, Mrs. Flora seeks a loan of 400 soles, with hopes to achieve her dream as well as well as that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin to build her dream of starting a bookstore and to be able increase their capital, and profits later.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elhadji Ali Ndiaye

texts.fr: Ce garçon de 28 ans est sans femme il habite la maison familialle. son pricipale activité est l 'aviculture .Il dispose d'un poulaillet dans  la maison où il éléve des poulets depuis deux (02)ans .il a obtenu plusieurs prets de la caisse pour son activité.Pour renforcer son  activité par l 'achat de quantite importante de poussins et doubler sa capacite de production,il sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
This 28-year-old boy is without a wife and lives in his family's house. His main business is raising poultry. He has a hen house at home, where he has been raising hens for two years. He has obtained several bank loans for his work. To bolster his business through purchasing sizable quantities of chicks and doubling his production capacity, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D., 46 ans, mariée, 08 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Baghagha depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce de crevettes. Elle achète et conditionne le produit à Baghagha pour revendre à Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à améliorer l’entretien de sa famille et la scolarisation des enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D., age 46, is married, and has eight children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Baghagha for six years. She wants a loan to boost her commerce in shrimp. She buys the product and packages it in Baghagha for resale in Dakar. Her income enables her to help improve the care of her family and the children's schooling. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell shrimp

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi D. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de chaussures depuis 5 ans à Atakpamé, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle espère avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en alimentant son magasin. Cette chance lui permettra de gagner plus pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amavi D. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two. She has been a shoes retailer for five years in Atakpamé, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She hopes to use this loan to grow her commerce by filling her store. This opportunity will enable her to earn more in order to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 27 años, es madre soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres con 5 hijos, pues ella se hace cargo de atender a sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, hace muchos años atrás se dedicaba a trabajar en las chacras de sus vecinos, ahora que estudian sus hijos no le alcanza, por ello, hace dos años inicio el negocio de compra y venta de plátanos, en lo cual le esté yendo muy bien. A la semana va dos veces a las chacras a comprar plátanos y el resto de los días se dedica al proceso de la maduración, durante esos días se levanta a la 4.00am para que le alcance el tiempo de sumergir los plátanos en los químicos adecuados y luego envolverlos con plásticos y abrigarlos bien para que maduren, no espera que le compren los mayoristas, sino que ella misma los lleva al mercado y los vende al mejor postor.  Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero incrementará su capital para la compra de plátanos verdes, piensa invertir el monto total es esto.
texts.en:
27-year old Vilma is a single mother. She lives with her parents and five children, and she is also responsible for looking after her parents. Vilma is a very enterprising woman. Many years ago she worked in her neighbours’ fields, but now that her children are in school, the money she earned didn’t cover the family’s needs. So two years ago she started a business buying and selling bananas, and everything is going well. Twice a week she goes to the fields to buy bananas, and on the other days she works on the ripening process. On these days she gets up at 4.00 in the morning so there is enough time to submerge the bananas in the appropriate chemicals and then wraps them in plastic to protect them while they ripen. She doesn’t wait for wholesalers to come and buy them, but instead she takes them to the market herself and sells them to the highest bidder. This is the first time that Vilma is seeking a loan from MFP. The money will provide her with increased capital to buy unripe bananas; she is planning to invest all the money in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy unripe bananas for resale

loans.name: Los Responsables Group

texts.es: LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO LOS RESPONSABLES  REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA MIRIAM SON GENTE QUE  SE CONOCEN YA QUE RECIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO. ELLOS SE GARANTIZAN Y SE COMPROMETEN EN PAGAR  LAS CUOTAS PUNTUALMENTE Y A QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA TRABAJANDO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS. TODAS LOS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO TIENEN SUS PEQUEÑOS NEGOCIOS D. LOS QUE OBTIENEN SUS INGRESOS COMO SER LA VENTA D. ROPA, VENTA D. PRODUCTOS PARA EL HOGAR Y COMESTIBLES, PRODUCTOS COSMESTICO, VENTA D. COMIDA Y  ALGUNOS POSEEN CENTROS D. INTERNET .COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA PERO TODOS ELLOS DESEAN SUPERASE EN SU NEGOCIO.EL GRUPO LOS RESPONSABLES MANIFIESTA QUE EL CRÉDITO OTORGADO POR AGROCAPITAL SERÁ DESTINADO PARA AUMENTAR INSUMOS A SU NEGOCIO Y MEJORAR EN LA CALIDAD D. SUS PRODUCTOS.LA MAYORIA D. LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN SUS RUBROS Y CAPACIDAD PARA ADMINISTRAR EL CAPITAL OBTENIDO.
texts.en:
The group members of "Los Responsables" (The Responsible Ones) are neighborhood friends and are represented by Mrs. Miriam. They back each other up, are committed to pay the payments on time, and have experience working within solidarity groups. All of the group members have their own small businesses, which serve as their income, such as selling clothes, housewares, cosmetics, food, and some have internet centers. As in all business there exists the competitiveness of supply and demand, but all of them wish to excel in their business. The group "Los Responsables" assert that the loan received from Agrocapital will be used to augment raw materials for their business and improve the quality of their products. The majority of the members are experienced in their businesses and are capable of administering the capital obtained.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda S., 51 ans, mariée, 08 enfants  en charge dont  07 scolarisés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Baghagha depuis 6 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des poissons séchés à Baghagha pour revendre à Dakar. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce vont lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Penda S. is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children in her care, of whom 7 are in school. She has been a member of the village loan group of Baghagha for 6 years. Her business consists of buying dried fish in Baghagha to re-sell in Dakar. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her business. The income drawn from her business will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell dried fish

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla H. est un soudeur redoutable depuis 5 ans à Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Agé de 45 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail afin d’offrir un service de qualité à la clientèle et aussi aménager son garage. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Komla H. has been a formidable welder for five years in Atakpamé, a city located in the middle of Togo. He is 45 years old, married, and the father of four. He would like to use this loan to buy work tools in order to provide quality service to customers and also to fix up his garage. This will enable him to earn more money to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and to fix up his garage

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es: Rosita tiene 28 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, y una relación hermosa con su pareja. Desde su nacimiento a vivido en el mundo de la agricultura, es la única actividad que conoce, y por supuesto es una eficiente ama de casa, madruga todos los dias levantándose a las 5.00am para que se de tiempo de cocinar y después conjuntamente con su esposo se van a la chacra, su actividad le agrada mucho, es  por ello que no tiene ninguna dificultad, tiene anhelos de juntar dinero y comprarse más chacras para que pueda aumentar sus sembríos, ya no solo en cítricos, ni mamones de plátanos, sino también sembrar café en grandes cantidades. Es nueva cliente MFP. Con el dinero va comprar plantitas de plátano, por lo menos un millar, espera que el dinero prestado, ayude a hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
