Rosita is a 28-year-old married mother of four who has a wonderful relationship with her partner. She was born into the agriculture world; it's the only work she's ever known. She is an efficient homemaker, getting up early every day at 5am to make time for cooking and later, with her husband, going to the small farm (chacra). Rosita enjoys her work very much, which is why it's not difficult for her. She wishes to save money to buy more chacras to augment her lands, and not just grow citrus or bananas, but also grow greater quantities of coffee. She is a new MFP client. With the money she will buy at least a thousand banana starter plants; she hopes this loan will help her bring her dream to life.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase banana plants

loans.name: Akoele

texts.fr: Akoele N. est une jeune femme couturière à Atakpamé, une ville située à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit acheter un séchoir et des mèches pour la commercialisation. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Akoele N. is a young seamstress in Atakpamé, a town situated about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one child. With this loan she wants to buy a dryer and some hair extensions to sell. That will allow her to earn more money so as to participate in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a dryer and hair extensions for re-sale

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene un hija de tan solo 8 meses, quien es la razón de su vida. De padres agricultores, su infancia fue vivir y jugar entre plantas, de paso ayudando a trabajar a  sus padres, por ello que no deja de sembrar. Hace un año atrás sembró mamones de plátanos, y hace 5 años tiene sembrado frutos cítricos, de los cuales ahora ya cosecha. Hace 6 meses atrás estaba trabajando como facilitadota del Programa Gubernamental PRONAMA alfabetizando a personas adultas, le a gustado mucho educar, por ello ahora quiere ser profesora de otro programa del gobierno y claro seguir trabajando en su chacra, que por nada la dejaría. Es nueva cliente en MFP. Con el dinero del préstamo va a hacer trabajar su chacra con peones  y en seguida sembrar maíz, después café, le costara un aproximado de S/800 todo el trabajo.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 26 years old, married, and has an 8-month-old daughter who is her reason for being. Born to agricultural parents, her childhood was spent living and playing amongst the plants, sometimes helping out her parents, which is why she has never stopped planting. A year ago she planted bananas and 5 years ago she planted citrus fruits, which she is now harvesting. Six months ago she worked as a facilitator for the government program PRONAMA, teaching adults to read. She enjoyed teaching, which is why she now wants to be a teacher for another government program and, at the same time, continue working her small farm (chacra), which she wouldn't leave for anything. She is a new MFP client. With the loan money she will hire helpers for the chacra and immediately plant corn, then coffee; this work will cost her approximately 800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare farm for planting corn and coffee

loans.name: Fondoumi

texts.fr: Fondoumi F. est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché d’Atakpame depuis 5 ans. Agée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle désire avec ce crédit relancer son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mil, de haricots et d'arachides pour la commercialisation. Fondoumi habite à Atakpame, une ville située dans la région centrale du Togo.
texts.en:
Fondoumi F. has been reselling cereals in the grand market in Atakpame for five years. She's 49 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. With this loan, she wishes to reinvigorate her business by buying sacks of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts, in order to resell them. Fondoumi lives in Atakpame, a city located in the Central Region in Togo.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell sacks of corn, millet, beans and peanuts

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: Michael tiene 25 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija y por ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros. En su niñez se dedicaba a la chacra, después, en busca de oportunidades, migró a Lima con la finalidad de trabajar en otra actividad que nos sea la agricultura, pero no se imaginaba que su pareja estuviera embarazada, fue el motivo por el cual regresó para hacerse cargo de su hija. Hace tres meses formó su familia, junto a su esposa e hija, en primera instancia va a construir su casa a base de umiro que es como unas palmas que le sirven para el tejido de las paredes, de ese modo ya vivir aparte y en el futuro piensa poner una tienda de abarrotes, su dificultad por el momento es la falta de dinero para poder agilizar la construcción de su casa. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará hojas de umiro que le costarán un aproximado de S/250, y madera para la puerta.
texts.en:
Michael is 25 years old, lives with his partner, has a daughter, and, for now, is living with his in-laws. As a child he worked on a small farm (chacra), then migrated to Lima looking for other opportunities other than agriculture. At the time he did not know his partner was pregnant, which is why he returned to help raise his daughter. Three months ago his family came together, wife and daughter, and their first goal is to build a house out of umiro (a local plant from which the leaves are used to build walls) so as to be able to live on their own and, in the future, Michael plans to add on a sundries store. The challenge right now is a lack of money to expedite the construction of the house. This is the first time he has applied for a loan with MFP. With the money he hopes to buy umiro leaves which will cost approximately 250 soles and wood for the door.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase home construction materials

loans.name: Imer

texts.es: Imer tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres juntamente con sus hermanos. Le agrada mucho la agricultura, desde muy niño apoyaba a su padre y ahora con más razón, porque como todo joven con el vigor del momento trabaja y trabaja sin cansancio. Se va a su chacra eso de las 5.00 de la mañana, trabaja hasta las 6.00pm porque está preparando 3 hectáreas para sembrar cacao y café, anhela poder cosechar de aquí a 4 o 5 años y poder vender, espera ganar mucho dinero porque el café es muy rentable, lo único que se le dificulta es no poder abastecerse para sembrar mayores cantidades. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero lo invertirá en emplear a muchos peones para que puedan sembrar las plantas de café, de lo cual, solo mano de obra le costará los S/.300.
texts.en:
Imer is a single 24-year-old who lives with his parents and siblings. He enjoys agriculture very much, having helped his parents since he was a child and, even more so now, because he is young and strong can work non-stop. He leaves for his small farm (chacra) around 5am and works until 6pm because he is preparing 3 hectares to plant with cacao and coffee. He hopes to harvest and sell these in around 4 or 5 years, and expects to earn good money because coffee turns a good profit. His only problem is being unable to stock up on enough seed in order to plant greater quantities. This is his first loan with MFP. He will invest the money to hire many helpers to sow the coffee plants which will cost about 300 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire help for planting coffee

loans.name: Urruz Gonzalo

texts.es: El Sr. Urruz tiene 38 años de edad, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de ,4 y 6 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, uno de sus niño esta estudiando primer grado en la escuelita del barrio, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Urruz se desempeña como técnico de tragamonedas desde hace cuatro años, lo cual se le había dificultado encontrar trabajo, el esta solicitando un préstamo que lo quiere para invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de su casa para eso necesita comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para poder levantar sus paredes y poder tener una vivienda digna. Su mayor deseo es tener su propio negocio de tragamonedas ya que es un trabajo que genera mucha ganancias, también desea que sus hijos puedan estudiar para que tengan un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Urruz is 38 years old and his wife has given him two children of 4 and 6 years of age. They live in an area of the capital city of Managua, named Laureles Norte. One of his sons is going to grade 1 in the local school, and his wife stays at home. Urruz has been a slot machine technician for the past 4 years, which occured when he found couldn't find a job. He is requesting a loan that he wants to invest in the infrastructure and construction of his house, needing to buy stone, sand, cement, and steel rods to be able to put up walls and have a home with dignity. His greatest dream is to have his own business carrying slot machines because it is a business that generates a large income. He also wishes that his children be able to attend school so that they will have a better quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, cement, and steel rods to build two walls in his home.

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es: El Sr. Apolonio tiene 36 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad que su esposa le tiene, los niños estudian la primaria en el barrio del colegio donde habitan,  que se llama Hialeah en la capital de Managua, don Apolonio trabaja en el día como soldador y albañil y por las noches en servicios de vigilancia, es un poco agotador pero tiene que hacerlo devido a que todo esta  caro y su salario es bien bajo, tiene cuatro años de estar laborando de albañil, cuando inicio lo hizo como ayudante, hoy trabaja solo y se ayuda mas económicamente, con la solicitud que esta haciendo a Afodenic lo desea para hacer un muro en su casa ya que hay mucha delincuencia para tener mas seguridad para su familia y también poder remodelar las divisiones de los cuartos, con estas solicitudes ha sido de gran beneficios en su familia ya que gracias al capital que obtiene lo ha invertido en las mejoras de su vivienda. A largo plazo desea tener un trabajo donde pueda ganar mejor, terminar de construir su casa, y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios
texts.en:
Apolonio is 36 years old and married with two children, seven and nine years old. His children go to an elementary school in the neighbourhood of Hialeah in the capital city of Managua.

By day, Apolonio works as a welder and bricklayer and by night, he works as a security guard. It's quite exhausting, but he must do it as his salary is so small and everything is so expensive. He's been working in masonry for 4 years. He started out as an assistant but now works on his own, which helps financially.

With the loan he is soliciting from AFODENIC, he'd like to build a wall around his house to protect his family from any danger and also to remodel the divisions of the rooms in the house.

The loan he received previously has benefitted his family greatly thanks to the capital he was able to invest in renovating his house.

In the future Apolonio would like to have a job that pays more, finish building his house and help his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, and iron

loans.name: Miguel Fausto

texts.es:
Miguel es chofer de trufi de servicio publico inter ciudad La Paz - El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos, vive en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la conversión de combustible de su automóvil, de gasolina a GNC (Gas Natural Comprimido), esto hará que ahorre combustible en 50% del costo. 


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Miguel is a public service Trufi driver (Trufi drivers offer a taxi-like service but with a fixed route) between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. It is his main source of income which provides for his children. He lives in the area of Ciudad Satélite (Satellite City) in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to convert his automobile from gasoline to natural gas. This will cut his fuel costs by 50%. It is his first loan with Impro. Our assessment shows that we can allow for the approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools for car maintenance work

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida tiene 59 años, se quedo viuda hace 5 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y dos yernos que le apoyan. Es ama D. casa, se dedica al cuidado D. sus hijos, en su misma vivienda ha visto por conveniente hacer una granja D. cuyes, pero tiene una dificultad granD., la falta D. espacio para las jaulas. Por el momento los criá en dos jaulas, que por supuesto no se sienten cómodos los cuyes, a la vez siembra papa en chacras temporales para su consumo. Cada día a las 6.00am se va a comprar alfalfa al mercado, por paquetes le cuesta cada uno a S/7 invirtiendo a diario solo en pasto S7.14. Le gusta esta actividad, porque cada cuy lo venD. D. 10 a 12 soles. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero va comprar un terreno que está a su costado para que ahí pueda ampliar  y mandar a construir sus jaulas, ese terreno le va costar S/.1.200.
texts.en:
Alida is a 59-year-old woman who was widowed 5 years ago. She lives with her 5 children and two sons-in-law, who support her. She is a homemaker who takes care of her children in her home. She found it convenient to make a guinea pig farm, but her biggest difficulty is a lack of space for the cages. For the moment, she raises her guinea pigs in two cages, which of course is uncomfortable for them. She also grows potatoes in temporary farms for her consumption. Every morning at 6:00 am, she goes to the market to buy alfalfa in packs, which cost 7.00 PEN each. She invests 7.14 PEN daily in fodder alone. She likes this business because she sells each guinea pig for 10 to 12 PEN. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money, she will purchase a neighboring plot of land so that she can expand her business and have more cages maD.. This plot will cost 1,200.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plot of land for guinea pig farm

loans.name: Guillermo Froilán

texts.es:
Guillermo es diseñador grafico, actualmente trabaja en una imprenta como empleado a medio tiempo, en las tardes realiza trabajos por cuenta propia esperando en el futuro contar con su propio taller grafico, vive solo, no tiene familia, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Kiswaras de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora Macintosh que sirve para hacer trabajos de diseño.


Es su quinto  crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago permite que le aprobemos otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a graphic designer, working part time at a print shop. In the afternoons he works on his own hoping, in the future, to open his own graphics shop. He lives alone, has no family and his home is located in the area of Kiswaras in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a Mac computer that will be used to do his design work. This is his fifth loan with Impro, his good record of making payments allows us to approve him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a Mac computer

loans.name: Romer Celso

texts.es:
Celso tiene un  taller donde fabrica estructuras de metal para automóviles como ser chasis de movilidades. Tiene dos empleados, vive con sus padres y hermano donde apoya económicamente con la familia, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Santa Rosa de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima  (hierro), es vital que él pueda satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado.


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Celso has a shop where he makes metal parts for cars, such as chassis. He has two employees, and he lives with his parents and his brother, providing financial support for the family. His home is located in the area of Santa Rosa in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be destined to purchase raw materials (iron). It is vital that he satisty the demand that he sees in his market.

It is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out has enabled the approval of the loan requested.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Tilata Group

texts.es:
El grupo  TILATA, esta conformado por señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Zona denominada Tilata de la ciudad de El Alto de ahí el nombre de las integrantes del grupo.
La directiva esta conformada por las señora Ayde que es su presidenta y sus dos colaboradoras directas la señora Ursina y Janneht;  Las socias se dedican a la venta y confesión de prendas de vestir de lana y de otros materiales, venta de verduras y frutas así como a  la venta de comida y la comercialización de plásticos, joyas, juguetes y Cds. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su cuarto ciclo, la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen el trabajo de grupos solidarios, es un grupo de personas muy alegres y emprendedoras. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento de capital y de insumos para hacer crecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group TILATA comprises only women, most of them living in the Tilata area of the city of El Alto.

The administration of this group is directed by Aydee, who is the president and her two assistants Ursina and Yaneht.

These associates run businesses such as the confection and sale of articles of clothing made from wool and other materials, the sale of fruit and vegetables and other foods, and the sale of plastic, jewelry, toys and CDs. This group is starting it's 4th cycle, most of the women already know about working in solidarity; it's a group of happy people and of entrepreneurs.

The financing is destined to be invested as business capital to help grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Saturnina Rita

texts.es:
Saturnina es comerciante ambulante de mazamorra (api, arroz don leche), trabaja en las calles empujando su pequeño carrito de dos llantas con su mercadería, el esposo es ayudante de panadería. Esta ocupación le permite a Saturnina cubrir la manutención de sus cinco hijos que dependen de ella, Saturnina vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Brasil de la Ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito será invertido en la compra de un nuevo carrito porque el actual esta en mal estado.


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por  Saturnina.
texts.en:
Saturina walks around selling her wares (selling rice and milk). She works in the streets, pushing her small, two-wheeled cart with her merchandise. Her husband is a worker at a bread store. This work allows Saturnina to pay for the upkeep of her five children, who depend on her. Saturnina lives in the home of her parents, located in the zone Brazil in the city of El Alto. This loan would be invested in the purchase of a new cart, because the one she has now is in very bad shape. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The results of her evaluation allow her to apply for this loan which is requested for Saturnina.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes junto a su esposo e hijos realizan trabajos artesanales en piedra de huamanga (alabastro) como adornos, nacimientos, iglesias típicas, actividad que aprendió su esposo de su tío, sus ventas lo realizan en su casa y también reparten de acuerdo a los pedidos que tengan. Además Mercedes vende salchipapas por las noches en la puerta de su casa.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, aceite, arroz.
Mercedes sueña con  educar a sus hijos, mejorar su casa y construir un local para vender sus salchipapas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the community bank Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Mercedes is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. Mercedes, together with her husband and children, makes crafts out of stone (alabaster), such as decorations, Nativity scenes, typical churches; this is an activity her husband learned from his uncle. They sell their crafts out of their home as well as deliver them to clients. Mercedes also sells salchipapas (fried hot dogs and french fries) from the doorway of her home. Mercedes is requesting a loan of 600 soles ($200 USD) which she will use to buy potatos, oil, and rice. Mercedes dreams of educating her children, improving her home, and building a place to sell her salchipapas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mercedes will buy potatos, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Sonia es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Sonia vende juguetes, golosinas en las puertas de los colegios de manera ambulante, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Sonia vende helados del cual recibe un pago (comisión), actividad que realiza hace años.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y golosinas.
Sonia sueña con tener un restaurante en su casa, mejorar su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the community bank Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Sonia lives in a common-law relationship, is 45 years old, and has 7 children. Sonia goes from school to school selling toys and candies at the doors of the schools, for which she counts on her children's help. Sonia has also been selling ice cream on commission for many years. Sonia needs a loan of 450 soles ($150 USD) to buy toys and candies. Sonia dreams of running a restaurant from her home, making improvements to her home, and that her children finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and candies.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 61 years old and married with four adult children. Most of her children are finishing their studies, so she still supports them financially. Delfina owns a dry goods store, which she has run since 1975. She also runs a bar in the same space. 

Delfina is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles to buy dry goods (rice, flour sugar, etc.) and boxes of beer. She used to buy beer on a daily basis and have it delivered to the store, but she has since started buying larger orders twice per week. She buys 20 boxes at a time for 33.80 soles per box, and she earns 6.80 soles for each box she sells. In the future, Delfina is thinking about installing a call center in her store, but she isn’t sure she has enough money to do so right now. 

Delfina is a long-time client of FINCA. She says she has been working with the institution for almost as long as it has existed (about 15 years).

loans.use: Buy dry goods and beer

loans.name: Benita Juana

texts.es:
Benita es comerciante minorista de carne de res,tiene una tienda y un puesto de venta en la feria popular de su zona, el esposo es albañil. La pareja cubre la manutención de sus cinco hijos, vive en la Zona 16 de febrero, Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito será usado para comprar una maquina de cortar carne que le facilitara la comercialización de este producto.


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado
texts.en:
Benita sells beef. She has a store and a sales counter at the local fair in her area of town. Her husband is a bricklayer. They both take care of their five children. They live in the 16 de febrero area in Rio Seco in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy a meat cutting machine that will facilitate the sale of cuts of beef.

She passed the evaluation that allowed her to apply for this loan. It's her first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a meat cutting machine

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
Carlos es socio del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Carlos es soltero, tiene 47años y 3 hijos, Carlos vive con su mama, Carlos tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche.
Carlos necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una mototaxi.
Carlos sueña con tener mas mototaxis, un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a member of the microfinance institute called Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Carlos, who lives with his mother, is a 47-year-old single father of 3 children. Carlos has his own motorcycle taxi with which he provides public transportation in the city of Ayacucho. He works from 7:00 in the morning to 11:00 at night. He needs a loan of 2,500.00 PEN, which will be invested as a payment for a motorcycle taxi. Carlos dreams of having more motorcycle taxis, and of owning a plot of land on which he can build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She rents a space on Cuzco Street in the city of Ayacucho where she sells soups, breakfast and lunch. She has run her restaurant for the past year and a half; before then she served food at a local school. Dina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy drinks and cooking ingredients for her restaurant. 

Dina has been working with FINCA for one year and is a very reliable client. Her dream for the future is to open a dry goods store next to her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy drinks and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Alipia

texts.es:
Alipia es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Alipia es madre soltera, tiene 58 años y 1 hija, Alipia vende ropa, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, Tacna a donde viaja dependiendo de la demanda, sus ventas los realiza al crédito y ofrece a amigos, familiares y en instituciones, también viaja a las provincias de Ayacucho.
Alipia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Alipia son ampliar su negocio, tener una boutique y ofrecer a mas personas sus productos.
texts.en:
Alipia is a member of the microfinance institute called Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Alipia is a 58-year-old single mother who has one daughter. Alipia sells clothing, which she obtains in the city of Lima, Tacna, where she travels to depending on demand. She accepts credit for her clothing, which she sells to family, friends and institutions. She also travels to the provinces of Ayacucho. Alipia needs a loan of 750.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing jackets, t-shirts and pants. Alipia dreams of expanding her business, opening a boutique, and offering her merchandise to more people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jackets, t-shirts and pants

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Yaneth es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Yaneth junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de madera, sus productos los adquiere en la selva Ayacuchana, a donde viaja semanalmente, sus ventas los realiza a las madereras al crédito y contado.
Yaneth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera tornillo.
Yaneth sueña con tener una casa propia, un carro para transportar sus productos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the community bank Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Yaneth lives in a common-law relationship, is 23 years old, and has 2 children. Yaneth and her husband sell lumber. They acquire their products in the Ayacuchana jungle, where they travel weekly. They sell their wood to lumber yards on credit and account. Yaneth needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325 USD) with which she will buy tornillo lumber. (Tornillo, also known as white mahogany, is a hardwood tree, 100 to 160 feet tall with a trunk over 4 feet in diameter). Yaneth dreams of owning her own home, a truck to transport her product, and that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber (specifically, tornillo)

loans.name: Tomas Adolfo

texts.es:
Tomas Q.  tiene un taller de costura trabaja con sus hijos, elabora la costura de toda prenda (deportivos, poleras, camisas y otros).
Vive en la Zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de la Paz.. Tiene dos hijos y uno que esta en colegio. Es la única persona que genera ingresos ya que esta separado de su esposa. El crédito será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, sus ganas de trabajas y de superarse le ayudan para poder obtener este crédito
texts.en:
Tomas Q. has a sewing workshop where he works with his children. He makes clothing of all types (sporting, polos, blouses, and others.) He lives in the zone of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He has two children, and one is still in school. He is the only person who generates an income, and he is currently separated from his spouse. This loan would be used to buy a sewing machine. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan with IMPRO. His working successes help him be able to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Segundina es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Segundina junto a su esposo e hijo venden madera, que adquiere en la selva ayacuchana, a donde viaja semanalmente, Segundina tiene dos carros con los cuales transporta sus productos, sus ventas los realiza a las madereras. Además Segundina trae frutas de la selva y vende por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Segundina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano.
Segundina sueña con ampliar su negocio y que su ultimo hijo tenga su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Segundina is a member of the community bank Yachay Wasi, which means "House of Knowledge" in Quechua. Segundina is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children. Segundina, with her husband and son, sells lumber, which she acquires in the Ayacuchan jungle where she travels weekly. Segundina owns two cars to transport her products, which she sells to lumber yards. Segundina also brings fruit from the jungle to sell mainly to merchants in the markets of Ayacucho. Segundina needs a loan of 2000 soles which she will use to buy bananas. Segundina dreams of expanding her business and that her youngest son will have his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. Donata has a restaurant in the city of Ayacucho, and also has a plot of land with her family where they cultivate potatoes, broadbeans, quinoa and corn. She splits her time between the restaurant and her farm, working three days per week at each one. She also sells meals at a market near her farm in the country, where she serves traditional Peruvian meals like meat and beans, chicken soup, and “puka picante” (a spicy blend of fried pork and vegetables).

At her restaurant, Donata sells set lunches and side dishes. Her specialties are trout and “mondongo” (a traditional Peruvian dish made with cow’s belly), and her prices vary according to her customers’ preferences—they can buy one sol, two soles or three soles (33, 66 or 99 cents) worth of food. Sunday is her busiest day; she often serves mondongo to as many as 40 people. Donata has temporarily closed the restaurant for potato planting season, but plans to open again after she’s finished. 

Donata is requesting a loan of 2000 soles, half of which she will use to buy bulk ingredients for her restaurant, and the other half of which will go towards installing a large front door in her home. She is a long-time customer of FINCA Peru, and has been working with the institution for five or six years. 

In the future, Donata would like to start baking and selling pastries at her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients; home construction

loans.name: Edmi

texts.es:
Edmi, trabaja como comerciante de abarrotes y vende a crédito los abarrotes en los mercados y también a vecinos, su esposo es chofer de un minibús en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa.
El crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra de abarrotes.
Es la décima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir, buen cumplimiento bueno en el pago de  cuotas.
Su responsabilidad y las ganas de trabajas le dan la oportunidad para obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Edmi works as a merchant selling groceries, selling on credit in the markets and also to neighbors. Her husband is a minibus driver in the Eduardo Avaroa syndicate.

The loan she requests would be for the purchase of groceries.

This is the tenth time she seeks a credit with Impro. Her history qualifies her as a top client, in other words, she has a good history of paying her loan installments on time.

Her responsibility and desire to work give her the opportunity to obtain this credit.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Teresa es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Teresa junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería llamada Representaciones R. que se ubica en una avenida concurrida en un local alquilado, Teresa vende materiales de construcción como arena, ladrillos, cemento, fierros, algunos de sus productos los adquiere de los mayoristas y los agregados los transporta directamente de las canteras, para lo cual cuenta con un carro y también reparte a domicilio por menor y mayor.
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros y cemento.
Teresa sueña con tener otra sucursal, construir un local propio para abrir una sucursal y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the communal bank Claveles. She is a married 40-year-old, mother of 4 who, along with her husband, runs a hardware store called "Representaciones R." located on a busy street in a rented space. Teresa sells construction materials such as sand, bricks, cement, and rebar. She gets some of her stock from wholesalers and the rest she transports directly from the quarries, for which she has a vehicle and can make both wholesale and retail deliveries. Teresa needs a loan of 3200 soles which will be invested in the purchase of rebar and cement. Her dreams are to open another branch by building her own space to use as a second branch and that her children receive schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rebar and cement

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Marciana es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Marciana es viuda, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos,  Marciana tiene una tienda en su casa que se ubica en la Asoc. La Victoria, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Marciana tiene un molino en donde brinda servicios de molienda que esta en administración de su hijo, en algunas oportunidades Marciana viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales que luego los procesa en su molino.
Marciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo.
Los sueños de Marciana son construir el segundo piso de su casa, surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Marciana is a member of the communal bank Claveles. She is a 60-year-old widow with 4 kids and she has a store out of her home located in the Association La Victoria, where she sells sundries, fruits, and vegetables. She also has a mill so she sells milling services which her son administers. Sometimes Marciana travels to markets to buy cereals which she processes in her mill. Marciana needs a loan of 1000 soles which she'll invest in buying rice, oil, and pastas. Marciana's dreams are to build a second floor on her home and expand her stock of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock merchandise (rice, oil, and pastas)

loans.name: Ruth Victoria

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Ruth trabaja como técnica en enfermería en Essalud, Ruth vende cosméticos por catálogos de distintas líneas como Natura y Unique, también vende lencería fina, joyas que ofrece por catálogos, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a sus amigos familiares, compañeros de trabajo, además vende distintos productos dependiendo de la demanda, como útiles escolares, ropa, calzados y por fiestas navideñas venderá panetones, adornos.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, adornos navideños.
Los sueños de Ruth son comprar un terreno, implementar una cafetería cerca de su trabajo y que su hijos estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ruth is a partner of the Banco Comunal Claveles. She is 38 years old and is a single mother with two children. Ruth works as a technician at the Essalud hospital. In addition, she sells cosmetics through different catalog lines such as Natura and Unique. She also sells fancy lingerie and jewelery through the catalogs. Her customers, who include family friends and co-workers, buy on credit. She sells certain products according to demand, such as school supplies, clothing, underwear and Christmas items like fruitcake and decorations.

Ruth needs a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of fruitcake and Christmas decorations. Ruth's dream is to buy a plot of land, start a cafeteria close to her work and for her sons to study at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of fruitcake and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama 380, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hija de 18 años de edad, que ingreso  ala universidad su mama se la cuida ya que devido a su trabajo no le permite, doña Martha se desempeña como cajera desde hace tres años en una empresa privada, también alquila un cuarto para tener otros ingresos,  pues su deseo es obtener otro cargo que genere mejores ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a sus hija con los estudios ya que desea que su hija tenga un mejor nivel de vida. Con la solicitud de prestemos va a construir un porche en su casa para tener mas comodidad con su familia. Alargo  plazo es hacer mejoras a los cuarto que alquila para dar brindar mejor servicio a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Martha lives in a neighborhood in the capital that is called 380. She is 36 years old, and is a single mother with one 18-year-old daughter who has entered university. Her mother cares for her as per work permits. Martha has worked as a cashier for the past three years with a private business. She also rents a room in order to have another income. Her current desire is to obtain another activity that makes a better income in order to be able to continue helping her daughter with her studies, as she wants her daughter to have a better level of life. With this loan that she is asking for she would build a porch on her home in order to have better comfort for her family. In the long term, her plan is to improve the room that she rents in order to give better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Sumaq Ayllu (“Beautiful Family” in Quechua) Village Bank.  She is married and has three children who are 22, 14 and 5 years old.  Her husband works in the countryside, so Graciela takes care of her home and children.  Her oldest son is now a working professional, her second child is in school, and her youngest daughter will soon start primary school.

Graciela used to sell cereals, but switched businesses in May when she bought a membership for a local taxi association.  She now administers three cars, which she rents out to several drivers to use as fixed-route taxis in the city of Ayacucho.  This business has been going very well for her.  She earns at least 80 soles (about US$27) in profit per car each day after paying the drivers and covering fuel and maintenance costs.

Graciela is requesting a loan of 2000 soles.  She plans to use half of the money to renew her cars’ papers and will save the other half to buy another car.

In the future, Graciela would like to continue expanding her taxi business and acquire membership to drive other routes as well.  She hopes to take out larger loans from FINCA in order to help her achieve her goals.  Graciela is a long-time client of FINCA; she has been working with the organization for about eight years now and has always been a very responsible client.

loans.use: Renew taxi license and save to buy another car

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es: la Sra. Gertrudis tiene 44 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama 380, casada y con dos hijos que estudian la secundaria, su esposo trabaja como taxista, sus hijos la ayudan hacer parte de los quehaceres del hogar ya que ella sale desde horas muy tempranas a ofertar sus producto ya que vende ropa y prendas de plata al contado y al crédito desde hace diez años, pues inicio con ahorro que su esposo le dio,  vendiendo  ropa, luego comenzó hacer prestamos en Afodenic para invertir en el negocio de plata ya que se vende bastante y generan buena ganancias pues este seria su noveno préstamo que utilizara para hacer unas mejoras en las habitaciones como reparar el techo, a largo plazo es poder tener mas inventario de productos para poder captar mas clientes y obtener mejores ingreso, a si como ayudar a sus hijos que terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 44 years old, lives in the 380 neighborhood of the capital, is married and has two children in secondary school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Her children help her with the household chores as she leaves in the early morning hours to offer her products as she has been selling clothing and silver items accepting cash and credit for 10 years. She began with savings her husband gave her, selling clothing, then she began to take loans from Afodenic to invest in the silver business as she is selling quite a bit and generating good income. This will be her ninth loan and she will use it to make improvements on her home such as repairing the roof. Her long term goal is to be able to have more product inventory to be able to gain more clients and greater income, and in this way help her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and other materials to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana B. R. vive en la localidad de Santa Rita, ubicada a 3 km. de la Población de El Torno, en Santa Cruz, Bolivia, cuenta con domicilio propio de 3 cuartos, vive con su esposoy sus 5 hijos
La señora se dedica venta de comida y también cuenta con un acuerdo con una importante empresa, desde el año 2002, para poder cubrir con la alimentación diaria de los trabajadores de dicha empresa.
Se vio la necesidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo, ya que se esta incrementando el numero de clientes en la zona, por que en el lugar se esta estableciendo una nueva empresa, y tienen una buena referencia de la señora.
Este motivo la llevo a solicitar un financiamiento a nuestra institución, la Sra. ha demostrado satisfacción por la agilidad y atención personalizada de nuestra parte. Y además espera que el microcrédito le ayude a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms Juana B. R. lives in the locality of Santa Rita, 3 km from El Torno, in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She lives with her husband and five children in her own 3-room house. Ms B. R. sells food and has had an agreement in place since 2002 with a large company to supply the workers of the business with their daily meals. She has seen the need to increase her working capital as she is serving more and more clients, given that a new business is opening in the same area and that she has good references. This situation has prompted her to request a loan from our institution: we are satisfied that Ms B. R. has demonstrated her adaptability and personalized service. As well, she hopes that this loan will help her improve her lot in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Fidel Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Sumaq Ayllu (“Beautiful Family” in Quechua) Village Bank.  He is 44 years old and widowed. He lives with his four children who are 25, 23, 20 and 18 years old. 

Juan buys and sells dry goods (flour, sugar, rice, etc.) and condiments.  He travels to Lima (9 hours by bus) to buy dry goods in bulk, then resells them to local distributors in a market in Ayacucho.  He also owns a stand in the same market where he sells dry goods, as well as a small store in his home where he sells condiments.  He splits his time between the two businesses.

Juan is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more bulk dry goods in Lima.  He has been working with FINCA Peru for two years now, and says his quality of life has improved since he started working with the institution.

loans.use: Buy dry goods in bulk

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Jacinta Del Socorro T. tiene la edad de 51 años,  su estado civil es soltera, ella tiene una hija a su cargo con la edad de 20 años que cursa recientemente contaduría pública, los deseos son de seguir con vida para luchar con la situación económica en la que estamos y apórtale ayuda en sus estudios a su hija, ya que con lo que su hija gana no es suficiente para pagar sus propios estudios, razón que impulsa a Doña Jacinta a seguir apoyándola en lo que mas se pueda, otros de sus propósitos es salir adelante con este negocio ya que este le ha generado  ingresos a su familia por lo que desea mantenerlo siempre activo, además esta el darle mejoras a su vivienda para proporcionar  un mejor porvenir a sus hijos.


Ella se dedica a la  actividad económica de mercadería en general como: perfumes, cremas y talco, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y pensó en la idea de ofrecerle a sus compañeros de trabajo algunos productos es entonces que decide comercializar la venta de cosméticos ya que le resultaría fácil la distribución de los productos que lo realiza por encargo por que además de esto ella tiene la profesión de maestra  y es así como logra incursionar  en este negocio y su hija quien mas tarde  le brinda  el apoyo para este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para ampliar de forma mas segura en sus productos y así ofrecer una variedad de productos y hacer las compras en las diferentes casas comerciales una de ellas es Avon por lo que le resulta mas factible la compra en mayores cantidades de productos y así obtener ingresos  favorables.
texts.en:
Ms Jacinta Del Socorro T. is 51 years old, single, and has a 20-year old daughter still dependent on her, who has recently studied public accounting. She wants to improve her financial situation and help her daughter pay for her studies as her daughter does not earn enough to pay for them. For this reason, Ms Jacinta helps her daughter as much as she can. Ms Jacinta also proposes to continue with the business as it is generating income for her family and she wants to be active and this allows her to improve her quality of life and provide a better future for her children. She sells a variety of merchandise, such as perfumes, creams and talc. She started this business to improve her standard of living and thought of selling to her colleagues. She decided to sell cosmetics as it would be easy for her to distribute the products because she is also a teacher. That is how she started her business, which her daughter will later help her with. The financing will give her working capital to extend the range and variety of products she offers, as well as different name brands, such as Avon, which she would be able to purchase in greater quantities, to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.en:
Marisabel is a member of the Solidaridad ("Solidarity") Village Bank. She is 27 years old, lives with her husband, and does not yet have any children. She has a small store in her parents' house in the Asociación 16 de abril where she sells dry goods, vegetables, and meat. She works every day and her husband helps her out in his spare time. Marisabel wants to start selling anticuchos (beef heart kabobs) from her store as well.

Marisabel needs a loan of 800 soles to buy drinks and a grill for the anticuchos.

Marisabel's dreams are to expand her business, offer a wider variety of products, and have a child.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Marisabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.

Marisabel es conviviente, tiene 27 años y aun no tiene hijos, Marisabel tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres que se ubica en la Asoc. 16 de abril en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en sus tiempos libres. Marisabel tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de su tienda.

Marisabel necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una parrilla para preparar los anticuchos y gaseosas.

Los sueños de Marisabel son ampliar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y tener un hijo.

loans.use: Buy a grill and drinks

loans.name: Virginia Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Virginia tiene 23 años de edad, casada y con dos hermosos hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad, habita en un barrio de Memorial Sandino en capital de Managua, su esposo vende hamburguesa, hogdog, también vende chatarra pues todo venta de articulo le genera ingresos para su familia, la Sra. Virginia vende hamburguesa, helados, compra y vende productos reciclables, desde hace dos años, pues inicio solo vendiendo helados con ayuda de su esposo ya que ese es su negocio, pero decidió apoyarlo para obtener ingresos para los alimentos de la familia ya que todo esta caro. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para construir un cuarto lo cual requiere comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento y hierro, para estar cómodo y seguro con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Virginia is 23-years old, married, and has two lovely children aged 1 and 3. She lives in the neighbourhood of Memorial Sandino in the capital Managua. Her husband sells hamburgers, hotdogs, as well as scrap iron. All the sales generate income for the family. For the last two years Sra. Virginia has been selling hamburgers and ice cream, and she also buys and sells recyclable material. At first she was just selling ice cream with help from her husband, but then she decided to help him bring in more income to feed the family since everything is so expensive. The loan that she is seeking will be used to build a room for which building materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron will be needed. This will enable the family to live in greater comfort and safety.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to build a room

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is a member of the Solidaridad ("Solidarity") Village Bank.

Lorenzo is 45 years old and married with one son. He works in a metal-working shop located in his home in the 16 de abril Association. He works every day and also makes doors and windows by special order.

Lorenzo needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a compressor and materials.

Lorenzo dreams that his son will grow up to be a working professional. He would also like to switch businesses and open up a hardware store.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Lorenzo es socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.

Lorenzo es casado tiene 45 años y 1 hijo, Lorenzo tiene un taller en su casa ubicado en la Asoc. 16 de abril en donde se dedica a la carpintería metálica, fabrica puertas, ventanas, todos sus trabajos son a pedido, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Lorenzo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina compresora y materiales.

Lorenzo sueña con que su hijo sea profesional, cambiar de negocio y tener una ferretería.

loans.use: To buy a compressor and materials

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Solidaridad (“Solidarity”) Village Bank. She is 44 years old and a single mother with four children. She travels to different regional markets each week and buys grains, which she then processes. First, she toasts the grains, then she takes them to a mill near her house to grind them into flour. She sells the finished products at stores and markets in the city of Ayacucho. 

Cecilia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy wheat, corn and barley. 

Cecilia’s dreams are for her daughter to have a prosperous business and to open up a store in her home to sell a wide variety of merchandise. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Cecilia es madre soltera, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Cecilia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que realiza 3 veces por semana, en donde compra cereales que luego los procesa, inicia con el tostado de los cereales y luego lo lleva a un molino cerca de su casa en donde lo muele, sus productos los comercializa en las tiendas y mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz y cebada.
Los sueños de Cecilia son que su hija tenga un negocio prospero, tener una tienda surtida en su casa.

loans.use: Buy wheat, corn and barley

loans.name: Humberto Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a member of the Brisas (“Breezes”) Village Bank.  He is 28 years old and single. He studies Mine Engineering at the National University in Ayacucho, Peru.  He also owns a stand in the April 12th Market where he sells suitcases and backpacks that he buys in the city of Lima.  He opens his stand at different hours according to his school schedule. 

Sergio needs a loan of 1000 soles, which he will use to buy a variety of backpacks.

Sergio dreams of having his own investment capital, of owning his own business, of practicing his profession and of owning his own home.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Sergio es socio del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Sergio es soltero y tiene 28 años, Sergio estudia la carrera de Ingeniería de Minas en la Universidad Nacional de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Sergio tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende maletas, mochilas, los cuales son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima, el horario de atención es dependiendo de su horario de estudios.
Sergio necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas variadas.
Sergio sueña con tener un capital propio, tener una empresa y ejercer su carrera, tener un hogar.

loans.use: To buy a variety of backpacks

loans.name: Gloria Dolores

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Brisas (“Breezes”) Village Bank.  She is married and 42 years old with two children.  She owns a store in her home on Salazar Bondi Street where she sells dry goods, vegetables, and meats.  She works every day and her son helps out in his free time.  Gloria also gives knitting classes by request and also knits sweaters by special order. 

Gloria needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she will use to buy oil, rice and sugar.

Gloria dreams of owning a larger, mini-market style store, and for her children to grow up to be successful professionals.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Gloria es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Gloria tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el jr, Salazar Bondi en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo en sus tiempos libres. Además Gloria da clases particulares D. tejido a personas que le solicitan y también teje chompas a pedido.
Gloria necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. aceite, arroz y azúcar.
Gloria sueña con tener una tienda granD. minimarket y que sus hijos sean profesionales exitosos.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and sugar

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Solidaridad (“Solidarity”) Village Bank.  She is 60 years old, married and has nine children.  She has a business selling meat.  She buys the animals at the city’s Sunday livestock fair, slaughters them at her home, and sells the meat from house to house on credit.  She collects payment from her clients each week.  She also makes yarn from sheep’s wool, which she sells by the kilo. 

Hilda needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy pigs and sheep. 

Hilda’s dreams are to expand her business, to offer a wider variety of products, to open another business and to dedicate herself to agriculture.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Hilda es casada, tiene 60 años y 9 hijos, Hilda venD. carne, los animales los adquiere en la feria D. animales D. la ciudad los días domingos, luego lo beneficia en su casa y lo venD. D. casa en casa al crédito y cobra semanalmente. Además Hilda se dedica al hilado D. lana D. oveja que luego venD. por kilos.
Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdo, oveja.
Los sueños D. Hilda son ampliar su negocio, surtir mas, tener otro negocio y dedicarse a la agricultura.

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Solidaridad (“Solidarity”) Village Bank.  She is 53 years old, married and has seven children.  She sells children’s clothing on Mondays in the Nazareñas Market, both in bulk and individually.  On Sundays and Wednesdays she travels to the city of San Miguel to sell.  She also has a small workshop in her home from which she sews clothing to sell at the markets. 

Esperanza needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy children’s clothing and stockings. 

Esperanza’s dream is to help her children get ahead and grow up to be working professionals.  She would also like to buy more equipment for her workshop and open up a store. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Esperanza es casada, tiene 53 años y 7 hijos, Esperanza vende ropa de niños en la feria de las nazarenas al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza los días lunes, mientras que los días domingos y miércoles viaja a la ciudad de San Miguel en donde vende los mismos productos. Además Esperanza tiene un pequeño taller en su casa y confecciona prendas que luego vende en las ferias.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños, medias.
Los sueños de Esperanza son sacar adelante a sus hijos, que sean profesionales, equipar su taller y tener una tienda.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing and stockings

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Solidaridad (“Solidarity”) Village Bank.  She is a 27-year-old single mother of one son.  She has a store in her parents’ house in the Carmen Alto district where she sells vegetables, dry goods and meat.  On weekends, Rosa also sells traditional Peruvian meals from her store. 

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar and milk. 

Rosa dreams of expanding her store, starting another business, and providing her son with a good education and proper nutrition. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad
Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Rosa tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Carmen Alto, en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, carnes. Además Rosa los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica que vende en la misma tienda.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche.
Rosa sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener otro negocio mas y brindar una buena educación y alimentación a su hijo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Irma Victoria

texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Villa Huatatas Village Bank, named after the area where most of the group members live.

Irma is a 24-year-old single mother of one son.  She travels to different regional fairs to sell chicks, which she buys from local chicken farms.  She also buys grains at these markets to sell in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. 

Irma needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy wheat and corn.

Irma’s dreams are to improve her business, have a pretty home, and provide her son with a good education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Irma es madre soltera y tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Irma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende pollo para criar, los cuales los adquiere de las granjas de la zona y de las ferias compra cereales que luego los transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y los vende en los mercados de abastos.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz.
Los sueños de Irma son mejorar su negocio, tener una casa bonita y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy wheat and corn

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Villa Huatatas Village Bank, named for the area where most of the group members live. 

Marina is 36 years old and married with four children.  Marina sells food from a mobile cart on the highway en route to Huatatas.  She works from 4am to noon each day selling breakfast and lunch.  She also owns a car, which her husband drives as an inter-district taxi. 

Marina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and oil.

Marina dreams of owning a house near her business, buying another car, and seeing her children graduate from school. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Marina es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Marina vende comida de manera ambulatoria en la carretera  de repartición a Huatatas, actividad que realiza desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día, vende desayuno y almuerzo. Además Marina tiene un carro con el cual trabaja su esposo realizando trasporte interdistrital.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite por sacos.
Marina sueña con tener una casa cerca de su negocio, otro carro y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Muhammad Sediq

texts.en:
Muhammad Sediq O. has been involved in farming for more than three years. He lives in Nangrahar province and he is single. He couldn't support his family in Nangrahar and his brother helped them, so Muhammad went to Kabul to try to help his brother and family. Now, he would like to expand his business. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50,000AF with a term of 28 months to build his stock and further his business in order to make a better life in Nangrahar for all his family.

Muhammad is happy with this loan process. He plans to buy some seeds and insecticide for his land. He would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process of making small loans in this country. He would like to be a better farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticide for his land.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman was born in 1958 and is a mother of two children. She lives in Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Seven years ago she started a sheep-breeding business. She needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy sheep and a calf.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima was born in 1964 and is a widow with one child. She lives in Azerbaijan's Khachmaz region, in the village of Sayad. She has been in the farming business for six years. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her farm.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Maiya S. is a resident of Tikhidewal. She lives with one daughter and two sons. Her sons work in a private office. More than ten years ago Mrs. S. opened a grocery store near her house. She sells different types of groceries in her shop. The whole family helps uot in the shop.  Mrs. S. is requesting for a loan of $150 to fulfill the increasing demand for grocery items of her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en:
Tari Mai M. lives in Thecho, lalitpur. She has one son who attends in primary school. Both Mrs M. and her husband are make religious statues. They have almost 10 years of experience in this work. They make various types of religious statues according to the order of their customers. They also get orders from statue dealers. 
The statue making business is a profitable businesses if one has capital but due to lack of money, they cannot invest funds in their business. So Mrs. M. requests a $400 loan to invest in their business. With these amount they are going to buy raw materials like bronze plates, wax etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Deepa

texts.en:
Mrs. Deepa M., resident of Thecho, lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Radhay Shyam M. and he works in a printing press. Her son is now studying in pre-primary school. Mrs. Deepa opened her cosmetic shop two years ago to help her husband to increase their living standards. She sells different varieties of cosmetic goods in her shop, such as face-wash, creams, glass bangles, etc.

Now Mrs. Deepa is requesting a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods for her shop. Mrs. Deepa wants to save her income to provide better education for her child.

loans.use: To buys cosmetic goods

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira (her son is pictured) was born in 1958. She lives in Khachmaz town in Azerbaijan. She has one child, who has a consulting business. His son has been in this business for 4 years. Now they need a loan of 970 AZN to buy a printer and other supplies for improving the business.

loans.use: Purchase printer and supplies to improve a consulting business

loans.name: Aridjetou

texts.fr: Aridjetou T. est une commerçante de « gari », une farine obtenue à base des tubercules de manioc, depuis 7 ans au grand marché d’Atakpamé, une ville à 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle aimerait avec ce crédit, redonner de la teneur à son activité en faisant plus de stock pour éviter les ruptures.
texts.en:
Aridjetou T. is a merchant dealing in "gari", a flour obtained from cassava tubers. She has been in this business for seven years at the grand marketplace of Atakpamé, a city located 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Married, 51 years old, and the mother of five. She would like to use this loan to reinvigorate her business by having more inventory for avoiding shortages.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of "gari" for resale

loans.name: Kossiwa Edem

texts.fr:
Madame D. Kossiwa Edem est née le 21 novembre 1976 à Agou Gadzéfé, ville située à 110 Km de la ville d Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. 
Elle a pour activité la vente des produits de consommation courante dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 9 cartons de savons, 10 cartons spaghetti, 5 cartons de tomate, 6 cartons de lait et 6 sacs de riz. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwa Edem D. was born on November 21, 1978, in Agou Gadzéfé, a city situated 110 km from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Her business is the sale of general consumption products in the Agoé neighborhood in the north of Lomé. She began this business in 2005. The first credit that she is now seeking will permit her to buy 9 cartons of soap, 10 cartons of spaghetti, 5 cartons of tomatoes, 6 cartons of milk and 6 sacks of rice. With this new stock, she will be able to sell more products and realize more profit.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy general consumables

loans.name: Djobo

texts.fr:
Né le 31 décembre 1965 à Kolina dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo au nord du Togo, monsieur T. Djobo est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il exerce le commerce des pièces détachées dans son quartier. Avec trois ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, il a beaucoup de clients qui sont généralement des mécaniciens.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 60 amortisseurs, 20 pneus et 30 chambres à air afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Born the 31st of December, 1965, in Kolina, in the prefecture of Tchaoudjo in the north of Togo, Mr. Djobo T. is married and the father of three children. He sells spare motor parts in his neighborhood. With three years of experience in this business, he has many clients, who are generally mechanics. He is requesting his first loan to buy 60 shock absorbers, 20 tires and 30 inner tubes to replenish his stock so that he can sell more products.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Hodoallo

texts.fr:
Madame B. Hodoallo est née le 31 décembre 1963 à Anié, localité située à 175km au nord de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Depuis plus de 30 années, elle exerce le commerce de céréales (haricot, maïs, etc.) au marché d’Agoè.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs du haricot et 3 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hodoallo B. was born the 31st of December, 1963 in Anié, a town situated 175 km north of Lomé. She is married and the mother of five children. For over 30 years, she has been selling grains (beans, corn, etc.) at the market in Agoe. With the revenue from this activity, she helps her husband with the family’s expenses. Right now, her stock has been depleted and she would like to replenish it. For this purpose, she is seeking her first loan, to buy 15 sacks of beans and 3 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Moyoplouki

texts.fr:
Madame P. Moyoplouki est née en 1974 à Landjakadja dans la préfecture de la Koza au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle a pour activité, la vente de céréale dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1994 et est bien expérimenté.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter 6 sacs de sorgho et 7 sacs de haricot.
texts.en:
Mrs. Moyoplouki P. was born in 1974 in Landjakadja, in the prefecture of Koza, in northern Togo. She is married, and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Her business is the sale of grains in the Agoe neighborhood, in the north of the city of Lomé. She started this activity in 1994, and she is indeed experienced. This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 6 sacks of sorghum and 7 sacks of beans.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Messan Agbé

texts.fr:
Né le 03 décembre 1957 à Atti dans la préfecture de Zio au sud est du Togo, monsieur T. Messan Agbé est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Depuis l’année passé, il a crée un magasin de vente d’eau minérale dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. 
Il est la première personne a commencé cette activité dans son quartier donc il a beaucoup de clients qui viennent acheter chez  dans son magasin.
Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 15 cartons de bouteille d’eau minérale.
texts.en:
Born the 3rd of December, 1957 in Atti, in the prefecture of Zio in southwestern Togo, Mr. Messan Agbé T. is married and the father of three children. Last year, he created a small business selling bottled water in the Agbalépédo neighborhood of Lomé. He is the first person to begin this activity in his neighborhood, so he has a lot of clients who come to buy from his store. He has benefited from a loan once before from WAGES, which he repaid promptly. The second loan that he is now seeking will permit him to buy 15 cartons of bottled mineral water.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy Voltic and Vital brands of  bottled mineral water

loans.name: Dethie

texts.fr: Fort de ses 26 ans Dethie est un tailleur marié .Il a ouvert son propre atelier dans sa maison où il vit avec sa femme ses enfants et ses parents.Depuis six (06) ans il travaille dans cet atelier, il se fait aider par trois (03) jeunes apprentis en formation au metier de taiileur.son premier expérience de crédit avec la caisse date de douze (12) mois.Pour renforcer son parc de machines à coudre Dethie sollicite un pret .L ' acquisition de cette nouvelle machine lui permettra de moderniser son travail pour répondre d'avantage aux exgigeances de la clientelle.
texts.en:
Wiser than his 26 years, Dethie is married and a tailor. He opened his own workroom in his home, where he lives with his wife, their children and his parents, six years ago and is helped by three young apprentices who are learning the tailoring profession. His first experience of credit with this partner was 12 months ago. Dethie is now requesting a loan to increase his stock of sewing machines. Getting a new machine will enable him to modernize the way works so that he can better respond to customer demand.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aicha

texts.fr:
Madame B. Aicha est née le 3à juillet 1988 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ses principaux clients sont les boulangers et les restauratrices de pâtes de maïs à Agoè. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 fagots de bois. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aicha B. was born on July 3, 1988, in Sokodé, in the central region of Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. Her business is the sale of firewood and charcoal in the Agoè neighborhood. Her principal clients make and sell bread and pâte [a local dish made of corn flour] in Agoè. The first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 5 sacks of charcoal and 17 bundles of firewood. With this new stock, she will be able to sell more goods and realize more profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Aicha

texts.fr:
Madame B. Aicha est née le 3 juillet 1988 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ses principaux clients sont les boulangers et les restauratrices de pâtes de maïs à Agoè. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 fagots de bois. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aicha B. was born on July 3, 1988, in Sokodé, in the central region of Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. Her business is the sale of firewood and charcoal in the Agoé neighborhood. Her principal clients make and sell bread and pâte [a local dish made of corn flour] in Agoé. The first loan that she is now seeking will permit her to buy 5 sacks of charcoal and 17 logs of firewood. With this new stock, she will be able to sell more products and realize more profits. Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow Madame B. Aicha est née le 3à juillet 1988 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ses principaux clients sont les boulangers et les restauratrices de pâtes de maïs à Agoè. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 fagots de bois. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat du charbon et bois de chauffe / Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phone cards

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en: Mrs. Sumitra T. lives in Sainbu Bhashipati with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Raju T., is a land broker. Both sons are now in primary school. Mrs. Sumitra T. opened her vegetable shop two years ago. She specializes in potatoes, onions, and green vegetables of her own farm. Mrs. Sumitra T. requests a loand of $200 to buy different types of vegetables for her shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Miss Bhawani S. is a single woman who lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Miss Bhawani S. lives with her mother and sister.
