Miss Bhawani S. is engaged in a sweet shop. All her family members equally contribute to the same shop. They make different types of sweet foods in her shop. They opened their shop nearly 10 years ago. Now Miss S. is requesting for a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy food ingredients for making the sweet foods.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for her work

loans.name: Bijaya Laxmi

texts.en: Mrs. Bijaya Laxmi R. lives in Tangal with her husband and son. Her husband, Mr. Raj man R., is a compounder. Her son is in pre-primary school.  Mrs. Bijaya Laxmi opened her a gas cylinder and mineral water shop two years ago in her own home. She started this business to upgrade her family's living standards and to provide a quality education for her son.  Nowadays in Nepal, the cost of gas and fuel is increasing rapidly. So Mrs. Bijaya Laxmi requests a $200 loan to add a few more gas cylinders to her shop.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en: Mrs. Sarita M. lives in Tangal, Lalitpur with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Manish, is a plumber. Her older son is in grade 9 and younger son in grade 2.  Mrs. Shrestha is a grocery shopkeeper in Tangal. She opened her grocery store 6 years ago to improve her family's standard of living because her husband's income is not sufficient. Mrs. M. sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as maize, rice, and noodles. She requests a $400 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sambina

texts.en: Miss Sambina R. is a single woman living in Tangal, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. She lives with her father,mother, and two brothers. Her brothers are in grade 12 and 10.  Miss R. and her mother open their small hotel ten years ago. They sell different varieties of Nepali and Newari foods in their hotel. They especially love making Newari food because Newari food is very popular in that area. Due to lack of capital they cannot expand their business.  Miss R. requests a $200 loan to buy food materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy food materials

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba S., 51 ans, mariée, 07 enfants  en charge dont  04 scolarisés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Baghagha depuis 6 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des crevettes et de les  sécher à Baghagha pour aller les vendre à Dakar. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de crevette qu’elle pratique en toute saison. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à améliorer l’entretien de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Diénaba S., aged 51, is married with seven children in her care, four of whom are at school. She has been a member of the Baghagha village bank for six years. Her business consists of buying shrimp that she dries in Baghagha and takes to Dakar to sell. She wants to build up her shrimp business, which she runs all year round. Her earnings enable her to help take better care of her family. She is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shrimp and have them dried for resale

loans.name: Manju

texts.en: Mrs. Manju R. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. Manju R. lives with her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Binod R., works in a printing press. Her daughter is in primary school.  Mrs. R. opened her shoe shop in Lagankhel in the footpath market. She sells different types of shoes and sandals. The rent for shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent. She needs to purchase different varieties of shoes and sandals for her shop. So she requests a $275 loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, particularly children and ladies shoes.  She wants to provide good education to her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and sandles

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is a married mother with two children. She lives in Kamenka and owns a small business selling seeds and agrochemicals in the central city market. Yuliiya has many loyal clients who know her little business for having versatile merchandise and affordable prices. Yuliya has been in this trade for 5 years. Presently, she has about 50,000 Grivnas invested in her trade. Her monthly income is about 7,000 Grivnas. 

Yuliya would like to increase the merchandise in her kiosk and improve her sales as a result. Today she is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory for a new seeding season. She is hoping to obtain a stable source of income and continue developing her business. Yuliya has promptly repaid 6 loans to Nadiya Ukraine. We believe the agricultural specifics of the region, growing vegetables as primary activity and client’s integrity add to generally bright prospects of this small business.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase products and materials for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Balkhan

texts.en: Balkhan M. is 53 years old. Her main occupation is selling cotton carpet. Sometimes she sews them by herself but mostly she buys them at wholesale from her supplier and sells them at the market. Her customers usually come to her house to pick up their order. Balkhan’s husband works in construction. All her children are grown up and have their own families. Her income raises steadily. Today she would like to invest more into her business, buying more cotton carpet. For this reason she is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni for the term of 6 months. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing cotton carpet to increase the range of goods to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is widow who has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Comfort buys corn and beans in large quantities, dries them to avoid insect infestation and repackages them for sale at Kormantse near Cape Coast. She has been in this business since 1998. Comfort uses her income to pay school fees and other family expenses. 

Comfort will use the loan to buy bags of corn and beans for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest into her children's education and also plough her profits back into the business.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and beans for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling, but no formal education. Efua sells groceries, such as Milo (a chocolate drink) and milk, at Anomabo near Cape Coast, Ghana. She has been in business since 1997. Her husband trades in hardware. 

Efua uses her income to pay for food and for her children's school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase sugar, milk, Milo and other groceries to sell. 

Efua plans to use the new profits to reinvest in to her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, and Milo, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Roubatu

texts.fr:
Née à Bassila le 5 septembre 1975, madame A. Roubatou est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité, la vente de potasse  dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencée cette activité depuis l’année 2006. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et vend au détaillant dans les marchés d’Agoè. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 16 sacs de potasse afin de pouvoir mieux servir ses clients de pouvoir tirer un revenu.
texts.en:
Born on  the 5th of September, 1975 in Bassila,  Mrs. Roubatou A. is married and the mother of two children.  Her business is selling potash [used in cooking local cuisine] in the market of Agoé.  She began this activity in 2006. Her supplies come from the grand market of Lomé, and she sells her product retail in the market of Agoé.
The first loan that she is now seeking will permit her to buy 16 sacks of potash to better serve her clients and make an income.

Translated from French by Abby Gray.

loans.use: To buy potash

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
A hair dresser since 1998 in Kormantse near Cape Coast, Millicent T. was educated through junior high school. Now divorced with four dependents, she is responsible for paying her children's school fees and the utility bills. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of hair products to meet the demand of her numerous clients. Millicent hopes to use the new profits accruing from the loan to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of hair products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Charles Kojo

texts.en:
Charles Kojo E. is married and has 3 children. He has received education through primary school. Charles Kojo sells building materials and food items at Anomabo near Cape Coast, which he has done since 1998. His wife is a trader. 

Charles Kojo uses his income to pay his children's school fees and his utility bills. Charles Kojo will use the loan to purchase more building materials and food supplies to resell. Charles Kojo plans to use the profits to reinvest in his expanded business.

loans.use: To buy building materials and food to resell

loans.name: Senka

texts.en:
Senka Lišenović was born in 1974. She is married and lives with her husband and two children (ages 18 months and 15 years) in Kotorsko, a village in Bosnia.  Senka’s husband does seasonal construction work, but when he is between construction projects, her family survives solely from the income of Senka’s business. Senka grows vegetables and raises chickens and cows. She sells vegetables, milk, and chicken meat in the local market.

Senka requests a 1,500KM loan from Women for Women, International. She will use the loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed.  She has four years of experience with raising chickens and selling their products. This is her third loan.  Her first loan was used to buy chickens and her second loan was used to buy a cow. She repaid both loans successfully.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medical equipment and make clinic renovations.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif was born in 1984. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. This man has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Villa Huatatas Village Bank, named for the area where most of the group members live.  She is 56 years old and married with six children.  Paulina owns a bakery where she and her employees make different kinds of traditional breads like chapla.  Paulina has two handmaD. wood-fired ovens, as well as several more modern machines.  She sells her bread to stores as well as on the highway en route to Huatatas.  She also sells fruit. 

Paulina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy flour and lard.

Paulina dreams that her youngest son will grow up to be a working professional, of expanding her business and, of buying all of the necessary machinery for her business. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Paulina es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Paulina tiene una panadería en la cual elabora panes variados y típicos como la chapla, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. empleados, Paulina tiene dos hornos artesanales a leña y cuenta con algunas maquinarias modernas, sus ventas los realiza a las tiendas y también en la carretera D. repartición a Huatatas. Además Paulina venD. frutas.
Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina, manteca.
Paulina sueña con que su hijo menor sea profesional, ampliar su negocio, implementar con todas las maquinarias necesarias.

loans.use: To buy flour and lard

loans.name: Nyanama Twegatte Group

texts.en:
Immaculate N. is the leader of Nyanama Twegatte group. This is the second time she is seeking a loan from Kiva to boost her business selling matooke. She is very grateful for the help rendered to her group.

With time, Immaculate has been able to expand her business to sell a variety of produce to her stall. She plans to use this loan to buy more bunches of matooke, sweet potatoes, cassava, and Irish potatoes for her business in order to earn more profits.

As a widow, she is the bread-winner of the family. But with the profits from her business and part of her savings, she's been able to cater for her children and caretakers.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Katebo Business Group2

texts.en:
Juliet N. is the chairperson of the Katebo business group in Buwama. She is 52 years old with nine children, four of whom are still at home. She also caters for six grandchildren.

Juliet is a farmer of bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. She mostly sells them to customers in and around her village, in addition to using them for home consumption. On top of farming, she also keeps animals like goats, pigs, and two cows for milk. She is proud of where she is right now because she started from zero after divorcing with her husband.

This being a rainy season, Juliet plans to use her share of the loan to employ helpers on her farm to clear the bushes for fresh plantations. The profits from the high quality yields will help her pay school fees for her children come next term, as well as catering for her family upkeep.

loans.use: To employ labour on her farm to clear the bushes.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor  es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a la empresa acopiadora  PIL Andina para la transformación en productos derivados como ser yogurt, mantequilla y otros productos; la esposa ayuda con la crianza de las vacas y la alimentación de las mismas. Esta actividad constituye su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Vive en la comunidad Irama belen – Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyo (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para que incremente su producción leche.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Víctor is a dairy farmer, supplying PIL Andina, a company that makes dairy products such as yogurt and butter. His wife helps to care for and feed the cows. Dairy farming is their principle source of income and helps them cover the costs of supporting their three children. He lives in the community of Irama belen in Achacachi, located in the province of Omasuyo (three hours from the city of La Paz). The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality so he can increase overall milk production. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation conducted by Impro qualifies him to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a medium quality dairy cow to increase overall milk production

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Diana de 4 y Jhon de 3. Es una madre luchadora, que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio, es así que hace cuatro años decidió incursionar en la compra y venta de objetos usados, los cuales vende en la feria de los días jueves en la ciudad de Puno. Aproximadamente comienza su labor a las 6 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 5 o 6 de la tarde. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es adquirir las cosas que ofrece, ya que la gente quiere vender sus cosas a más precio de lo que valen, pero aún asÍ, Herminia persistente, trata de refaccionarlas para aumentar el precio en su venta. Este es el primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y comprar algunas cosas para refaccionarlas y venderlas a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Herminia is 30 years old. She is a single mother with two kids - Diana, 4, and Jhon, 3. She is a hardworking mother. From a very young age, she has worked in business. Four years ago, she decided to enter into the secondhand goods trade, selling used objects at the market on Thursdays in the city of Puno. She starts working at around 6 in the morning and finishes at around 5 or 6 in the evening. The hardest part of her job is obtaining the secondhand items, since people want to sell their items for more than what they are worth. Even so, Herminia persists and tries to fix her merchandise to increase its sale value. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will be very punctual with her payments. With this money, she can obtain more merchandise and buy some pieces to repair and sell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products to sell

loans.name: Ajka

texts.en:
Ajka was born in 1955 and she lives in Banović - a village in Bosnia.  She lives with her husband who works to repair car engines.  When Ajka was younger, her passion was embroidery.  She has recently started selling her embroidery work to people who live outside of Bosnia through catalog orders.  While she enjoys this job, it does not generate significant income for her family. 

Ajka requests a $1,200 loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy firewood to heat her house for the winter.  Buying the wood requires a significant down-payment, which she and her husband do not have upfront. Ajka is confident that she will be able to repay the loan over a twelve month period using income from her embroidery sales.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, es madre soltera, de un pequeño niño llamado Jean Carlos, de 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica íntegramente a su trabajo en la tienda que abrió hace un año, en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para poder educar y criar a su hijo. El trabajo de María empieza aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana y se prolonga hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que su tienda es muy solicitada por la clientela que asiste diariamente, haciendo que su negocio sea muy rentable, pero el tener que atender durante todo el día se le hace muy agotador, ya que al mismo tiempo debe atender a su pequeño hijo.Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para equipar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old. She is a single mother with a young son named Jean Carlos, who is 6 years old. She devotes herself completely to working in the store that she opened a year ago. With much effort and dedication, she can afford to educate and raise her son. María's workday begins at around 6 in the morning and lasts until late at night. Now that her store is frequented by customers everyday, it is becoming a very profitable business. However, having to work in the store all day is very tiring, especially since she must care for her son at the same time. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will buy a greater quantity of products to equip her store.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to supply her store

loans.name: Kisimba Women's Group

texts.en:
Mariam N. is a member of the Kisimba women’s group in Lugazi. She is a married businesswoman with a retail shop that she has owned for six years. Her husband helps her out with the shop at times, as well as providing the family with food and a decent shelter.

Before joining her lending group, Mariam says that her shop was so small that a time came when she was selling almost nothing. But with the coming of loans, her shop is now self-sustaining and will need a few pushes every time she gets a loan.

Thanks to the loans she has received, all the products in her shop are now in large quantities and, as a result, her family is better off. She is now able to pay school fees for her children. Mariam also plans to build commercial houses for rent in her trading centre and transform her shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es:
Meliton tiene 20 años, es soltero y vive solo en casa de unos familiares. Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en triciclo por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 3 años, cuando a base de mucho esfuerzo y sudor pudo comprar su triciclo, el cual hoy en día es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos para cubrir sus gastos.
Meliton trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 6 o 7 de la noche, siendo muy solicitado por la gente que transita por la ciudad obteniendo buenas ganancias. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el esfuerzo físico que deber realizar al manejar el triciclo, el cual requiere de mucha fuerza para manejarlo, durante todo el día. Meliton se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará dos llantas nuevas para su triciclo, ya que las que tiene ahora están muy desgastadas.
texts.en:
Meliton is 20 years old. He is single and lives alone in a house belonging to some friends. With his cycle rickshaw, he provides a passenger transportation service through the streets of the city of Juliaca. He started providing this service 3 years ago, when through significant effort and sweat, he was able to buy his cycle. Presently, this business is his principle source of economic income to cover his expenses.

Meliton works from 8 in the morning until about 6 or 7 at night. He is very sought after by the high-income people who travel through the city. The most difficult part of his job is the physical effort required to move the cycle. It takes a great deal of strength to operate it for the whole day. This is Meliton's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan money, he will buy two new tires for his cycle rickshaw, since the ones that he has are worn out.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires for his cycle rickshaw

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 24 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Erika de 5 y Kevin de 2. Es una madre trabajadora, que a favor del bienestar de sus dos pequeños hijos, se ha desenvuelto en diferentes trabajos para poder mantenerlos, hace un año, gracias a su duro esfuerzo pudo implementar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, donde atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 u 9 de la noche.
Lo que le gusta a Nancy de su trabajo, es que puede realizarlo desde su propia casa, aunque se le hace cansado tener que estar ahí durante todo el día, pero los resultados son favorables, ya que en este corto tiempo ha logrado obtener la preferencia del público que frecuenta su tienda. Es el primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con en dinero implementará su tienda con mejores y más variados productos, para seguir complaciendo a su fiel clientela.
texts.en:
Nancy is 24 years old. She is a single mother with two children - Erika, 5, and Kevin, 2. She is a hardworking mother. For the sake of her two small children, she has managed to hold multiple jobs. In this way, she could afford to support them. One year ago, as a result of her hard work, she was able to open a small grocery store in her home. She works in the store from 6 in the morning until 8 or 9 at night. Nancy enjoys that she can now work from her own home. Although it is tiring to be in the store all day, she has achieved favorable results and in a short time has managed to earn the preference of many of her customers. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will be punctual with her repayments. With the money from the loan, she will stock her store with products of a higher quality and wider variety to continue to satisfy her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her grocery store with more products

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es comerciante viajera y tiene un puesto de venta de comida rápida (hamburguesas y salchipapas) tiene su casa propia y vive con su hijo, quien  trabaja en una empresa y ayuda con los gastos familiares, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 1ro de mayo de la ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito que ahora solicita será  destinado a la compra de material de construcción porque la vivienda necesita refacciones en la fachada principal de su casa.
 
Es el sexto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Candelaria.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a traveling merchant who has a fast food business selling hamburgers and salchipapas (a serving of bite-size hotdogs mixed with fried potatoes). She has her own home where she lives with her son who works in a business and helps with the household expenses. Her home is located in the "Zona Primero de Mayo", in the city of El Alto. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials for repairs to the front of her house. This is her sixth loan with Impro – Candelaria’s loan was approved on the basis of her good payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and stone for repairs to the front of the house

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Women's Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is the leader of the Zibula Atudde women’s group in Lugazi. She has been in the group as an active member for ten years. She is grateful for the group as it has helped her so much with her business.

Joyce is married with five children and also helps to care for ten dependents, both young and old. She has a tailoring business in which she he makes clothes for women, men, and children. She sells the clothing herself on her business premises.

Using her loans, Joyce has always been able to buy sewing material as well as ready-made clothes to sell. She now needs a loan to help buy more material for tailoring jobs (though some of her clients bring her their own material).

loans.use: To buy more clothing material for tailoring.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: Timotea tiene 51 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la artesanía desde hace 15 años, cuando en su tierra natal, la ciudad de Ilave, su madre le enseñara este bonito arte. Hoy en día los principales ingresos económicos se los da el arte del bordado en tela, prendas que son muy cotizadas por el turismo en esta zona. Timotea trabaja por pedidos, los cuales distribuye a las tiendas que comercializan artesanías para los turistas que frecuentan la ciudad de Puno, elaborándolos durante casi todo el día en su casa, que es la mayor ventaja que le da su trabajo. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero adquirirá mayor cantidad de material (lana, hilos tela, etc.) para continuar con su labor.
texts.en:
51-year old Timotea lives alone as she is single with no children. For the past 15 years she has worked as an artisan, ever since her mother taught her this wonderful craft in their hometown, the city of Ilave. Nowadays the art of embroidery on cloth is her principal source of revenue. The garments that she embroiders are much sought after in the local tourism industry. Timotea takes orders for her work and then takes the finished items to the stores that sell crafts to the tourists visiting Puno. She is able to work almost the whole day from her home, the biggest advantage that this kind of work gives her. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to use the money to buy more materials (wool, threads, cloth etc) so that she can continue in this line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials such as wool and thread for embroidery

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es rentista  y confecciona mantas para señoras de pollera; tiene su casa propia y tres hijos de los cuales una depende de ella que es estudiante de enfermería, vive en la Zona Villa Huayna Potosí  de la ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción para reparar el muro frontal de su casa que está en estado muy inconveniente y como se avecina las lluvias necesita urgentemente cambiar de muralla de adobe a ladrillo.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Carmela.
texts.en:
Carmela is a landlord and makes shawls for women who wear polleras, traditional multi-layered Bolivian skirts. She has her own home and three children, one of whom is a dependant and is in nursing school. She lives in the Villa Huayna Potosí neighborhood of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy construction material to repair the wall in front of her house, which is in a very poor state. As the rains will be coming soon, she urgently needs to replace the adobe wall with a brick one. This is her third loan from Impro, and her good payment history allows her to be approved for this loan that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks and cement to rebuild the wall in front of her home

loans.name: Katebo Business Group1

texts.en:
A. Martin, a member of Katebo group in Buwama and a married man caring for his immediate family, is a fisherman at the landing site in Katebo. He owns a boat and a variety of other fishing materials including nets and hooks for use in his business. Martin is also a farmer with various plantations that are mostly in the care of his wife, children and helpers who are paid for their duties.

Martin has a plan to buy more boats to hire out to fellow fishermen, hoping to thereby increase revenue and savings. He is happy that with previous loans he was able to buy standard fishing nets and hooks that trap good quality fish, thus attracting a large number of customers. Martin is now requesting a loan in order to buy another fishing net for his business.

loans.use: To buy another fishing net for his business.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #74292

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
Marco junto con su hermano son productores de queso de vaca, los cuales son comercializados al por mayor en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de La Paz y Viacha; la producción de leche que ellos generan es insuficiente entonces tiene que acopiar leche de la comunidad donde ellos habitan; de esa forma también ellos generan empleo indirecto a los productores de leche de su comunidad.

Viven con sus padres que son de la tercera edad y una hermana que esta estudiando en la universidad estatal en la Ciudad de El Alto UPEA. Viven en la comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para que incremente su producción leche y de esta manera también incrementar su producción de queso.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Marco and his brother produce cow’s milk cheese, which they sell at wholesale quantities in the local markets of the cities of La Paz and Viacha, in Bolivia. The amount of milk that they produce is insufficient and therefore they have to stockpile milk from the community where they live. In this way they also create jobs indirectly for the milk producers of their community. They live with their parents who are retired and their sister who is studying at the state university UPEA, in the city of El Alto. The family lives in the Achica Baja community, located in the Ingavi province, 3 hours away from the city of La Paz. They will use the loan to buy a dairy cow of medium quality so that they can increase the amount of milk and therefore cheese they produce. This is their first Impro loan and our evaluation has determined that they are eligible for it.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase their milk production to levels sufficient enough for them to produce cheese.

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Groupa

texts.en:
Madinah T., a married woman with five children and the care of two dependent relatives, is an executive member of Tusooka Kwavula group in Lugazi. A long-time owner of a hotel / restaurant business, Madinah has been able to buy more equipment such as sauce pans, plates, spoons, forks, tables and seats for her restaurant through the help of previous loans. She has also been able to include a greater variety of foods on her restaurant menu, something that seemed impossible when she first joined her lending group.

Now requesting another loan to purchase more plates and foodstuffs for her business, Madinah is grateful that through her various meetings with her group members, she has learned to manage her loans with prompt repayments.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs and more plates for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lucía Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia H. se dedica a la venta de desayunos y bebidas en un mercado de la cuidad de La Paz, Bolivia, todas las mañanas se traslada desde su domicilio ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia hasta la ciudad de La Paz acompañada de sus hijos, quienes le ayudan en el negocio por las mañanas, porque por las tardes asisten a la escuela, cercana al mercado, la hija mayor se encarga por las mañanas de colaborar a doña Lucía en la venta de cafe y por la tarde asiste a la escuela, al finalizar el dia toda la familia retorna a descansar a su domicilio. Es madre soltera y su trabajo representa el único sustento del hogar, espera que con el microcrédito su negocio pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs Lucia H. sells breakfasts and drinks for a living, in a market located in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Every morning she and her children commute from their home in the city of El Alto, also in Bolivia, to La Paz. Her children only help her with the business in the morning because in the afternoons they go to school, which is near the market. In the mornings, the eldest daughter helps Mrs Lucia sell coffee and in the afternoons, she goes to school. When the day draws to an end, the whole family returns home to rest. Mrs Lucia is a single mother and so her job alone supports the family. She hopes that the micro-loan will allow her business to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo vive en anticrético con su esposa en la calle Luís Nardin Rivas de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz; Alfredo alquiló un local en la zona Sur   donde su actividad es la venta de Choripanes, milanesas, sándwiches y refrescos.

El crédito que solicita es para equipar el negocio comprando nuevas sillas y mesas y poder dar comodidad a sus clientes, aumentar sus clientela, mejorar sus ingresos los que hasta la fecha le alcanzan para su sustento personal.

Es cliente de Impro y por la actividad puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, además que su historial es bueno.
texts.en:
Alfredo lives with his wife in a leased property on Luís Nardin Rivas street in the September 14th section of the city of La Paz. Alfredo rented premises in the southern section of town, where his business is the sale of choripán (sausage) sandwiches, milanesa (breaded) cutlets, other sandwiches and soft drinks. The loan he is requesting will go towards purchasing chairs and tables to make his customers comfortable, to increase both his customer base and his income, which thus far has met their needs. He is a client of Impro and his business qualifies him for a new loan, as his sales history is good.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chairs and tables to make his clients comfortable

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Groupb

texts.en:
N. Regina, an executive member of the Tusooka Kwavula women’s group in Lugazi, is a married lady who has owned and operated a bar for over 10 years. She sells a variety of beverages ranging from a local brew with malwa, waragi, and tonto to bottled beers and wines.

Regina says that before the loans, she used to sell only local brew, but joining her lending group has helped her to transform the business. She now has a plan to make the brew herself for increased profits, but its feasibility depends on the availability of time, since she has only one person to help her out in the bar.

She is now requesting a loan to help purchase more beer and local brew in order to accrue more profits and savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer, spirits and local brew for her business.

loans.name: Maria Tarcila

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. 

She is 38 years old and married with six children.  Maria buys junk cars, which she then sends to repair, fix dents, paint and resell.  Her husband has a bodywork and paint shop where the couple works fixing up cars.  Maria also works as a seamstress from a small workshop in her home. 

Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles to help her buy junk cars. 

Maria’s dreams are to expand her workshop, launch a clothing manufacturing business, and guarantee a good future for her children.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Maria Es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Maria se dedica a la compra de carros chatarra que luego hace reparar, planchar, pintar, luego los comercializa. Su esposo tiene un taller de Planchado y Pintura con el cual trabajan para los arreglos de los carros. Además Maria tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la como parte de pago de carros.
Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su taller, implementar una fabrica de ropa y estabilizar el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy junk cars

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Group C

texts.en:
Sharifa N., a hard-working lady with a business selling used clothes in Lugazi, has customers ranging from those around her home to patrons of the daily markets in and around Lugazi. She sells a variety of clothes including lady’s blouses, skirts, shorts, and children’s wear, all made possible with the help of the loans she has thus far received.

Depending upon how much she has in stock and the season in which she is operating, once or twice a week Sharifa goes to Kampala to buy a bale or two of clothing. She now needs a loan as an addition to her savings in order to buy another bale of clothes for the impending Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Guido  Ruiz Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del g/s LOS SANTOS viven en la periferia del barrio monimbo de Masaya a unas 10 cuadras de la sucursal de adim. Por vivir en la ciudad les ha permitido tener aprobado sus estudios primarios, por tal motivo son bien expresivas y de trato muy amable.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado mantener su negocio, manifiestan que con la ayuda de adim han mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda, negocio y de su familia, en la actualidad están en su octavo ciclo.
 Doña Gladis es la coordinadora del g/s,  desde pequeña ayudaba a su mama en la preparación de refrescos lo que le sirvió para ahora ella tener su propio negocio, han tenido  8 créditos con adim, los cuales le han ayudado ya que compro una mantenedora para la conservación de los refrescos y además  vende hielo y gaseosas.  Este g/s ha participado en los talleres que desarrollo empresarial ha impartido,  el éxito de este g/s es la comunicación y solidaridad que ellas mantienen.
Dicen estar agradecida por que adim además de crédito las ha capacitado, lo que han aprovechado para el manejo exitoso de sus negocios
texts.en:
The members of g/s LOS SANTOS live in the periphery of the minumbo neighborhood of Masaya, ten blocks from the adim office. Because they live in the city they've been able to complete primary school, so they are expressive and nice. With a lot of effort and dedication they've achieved the creation of their businesses. With the help of adim they have been able to improve their living conditions, businesses, and family. They're now in their eighth loan cycle. Mrs. Gladis is the g/s coordinator. When Gladis was a young girl she helped her mother prepare refreshments. She now has her own business and has had eight loans with admin. These loans have helped her buy a fridge to preserve the refreshments, and she also sells ice and sodas. This g/s has participated in business development workshops, and it's success is in the communication and solidarity that the members maintain. They say that they are grateful for admin and the loans and training, which has enabled them to successfully manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to offer a greater variety of products to their clients

loans.name: Paulina Lidia

texts.es:
Paulina is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She studied to be a nurse technician, but currently sells clothing and shoes to family members and friends as well as door-to-door. She also sells at the city penitentiary on Wednesdays and Sundays. 

Paulina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy children’s clothing and shoes.

Paulina’s dreams are to open her own shoe store, expand her business, and for her children to grow up to be working professionals. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Paulina es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Paulina estudio enfermería técnica, actualmente vende ropa, zapatos, productos que vende a sus amigos familiares y de casa en casa, sus ventas son al crédito, también vende en el penal de la ciudad a donde va los días miércoles y sábados. 
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños y zapatos.
Los sueños de Paulina son tener una tienda de zapatos, ampliar mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She studied to be a nurse technician, but currently sells clothing and shoes to family members and friends as well as door-to-door. She also sells at the city penitentiary on Wednesdays and Sundays. Paulina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy children’s clothing and shoes. Paulina’s dreams are to open her own shoe store, expand her business, and for her children to grow up to be working professionals. Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: La Purisima Group

texts.es:
Pertenece al g/s LA PURISIMA este grupo vive en el barrio quebrada honda una zona rural del municipio  de Masaya, por ser de escasos recursos económicos no tuvieron la oportunidad   de asistir al colegio ya que desde temprana edad comenzaron a generar ingresos para su familia.
Doña Elena comenzó vendiendo todo tipo de cereales tales como: pinol, pinolillo, cereal de trigo, esto de forma ambulante  en el mercado de Masaya, en la actualidad además de vender cereales también tiene un negocio de venta de perecederos en un lugar fijo que le asigno la intendencia del mercado, donde ahora cuenta con una inversión de mas c$4,000.00 los cuales los administra de una manera muy eficiente.
Este g/s esta en su octavo ciclo y su crédito lo van a invertir en la compra de productos para aumentar sus inventarios
Doña Elena vive con su mama la que le ayuda con la crianza de sus hijos ya que es madre soltera, para el futuro quiere tener un local más grande y mejor ubicación en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The ladies belong to the group called LA PURISIMA. This group lives in a broken-down neighborhood a rural zone of the municipality of Masaya. Because there were such scarce economic resources, they did not have the opportunity to attend school since children must begin to generate income for their family from an early age. Doña Elena began selling all kinds of cereals such as pinol (a corn meal), pinolillo (corn meal with cacao), and wheat cereal, selling on foot in the market of Masaya. Currently, besides selling cereals, she also has a business selling perishables in a fixed location that was assigned to her by the commissariat of the market, where she now relies on an income of over 4,000 cordoba (Nicarauguan currency) which she administers in a very efficient manner. This group is in its eighth loan cycle. They are going to invest the loan in the purchase of products to enlarge their inventories. Doña Elena lives with her mother, who helps her with raising her children since she is a single mother. In the future she wants to have a larger and better location in the market of Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables and cereals for sale in her market stall.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: N. Jane is a 36-year-old lady and the chairperson of Bisoboka Women’s Group in Lugazi. She is married with 6 children as she cares for 2 children belonging to her late brother. Jane has a drug shop/clinic that offers over-the-counter medicine as well as providing delivery services to her local community of Buwundo in Lugazi. In fact Jane is so common and well common in her community as ‘musawo’ meaning ‘doctor’ because of the life saving services she offers. In addition to the clinic, Jane keeps animals like cows, goats and pigs at her home and these help her so much in times of need like paying school fees and home upkeep. Jane has been able to buy plots of land for her family and she has started farming on them.

loans.use: Jane needs a loan to buy more medicines for her drug shop.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma tiene 58 años, es soltera, vive sola, ya que no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace ya 11 años, usualmente vende su mercadería a Instituciones, recorriendo cada una de ellas, ofreciendo la variedad de ropa que adquiere en los viajes que realiza a otras ciudades. Emma es muy querida y solicitada, por su gentil trato y la variedad y calidad de prendas que ofrece, es por eso que siempre consigue buenos ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tener que caminar por casi todo el día, pero la ventaja más grande que posee, es que ella decide cuándo y a qué horas trabajar. Emma se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la cantidad y variedad de mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y forjarse un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Emma is 58 years sold, single, and lives alone since she never had children. She has dedicated herself to clothing sales for 11 years now, usually selling her merchandise to institutions by visiting each one offering the variety of garments that she acquires on her trips to other cities. Emma is very well-liked and requested for her gentle manner and the different quality of clothes she sells and, as a result, she always manages to achieve a good profit from her products. The biggest difficulty of her job is having to walk nearly all day long, however, the biggest advantage she has is that she can decide when and what hours to work. Emma is in the first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very timely with her payments. With the funds she requests, she will augment the quantity and variety of her merchandise to increase her income and forge a better future for herself.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity and variety of the garments she sells.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 39 años, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, Diana de 18, Maribel de 14 y Clara de 9. Es una trabajadora madre que desde hace 5 años, ha incursionado en el negocio de la artesanía para apoyar a los gastos del hogar. Faustina elabora los muy conocidos “deditos”, especie de pequeños títeres con figuras de animales elaborados a base de lana, que se colocan en los dedos, para venderlos a los turistas. Estos pequeños tejidos son muy solicitados por los turistas, haciendo que las ventas sean buenas, lo difícil es el tener que terminar grandes cantidades para su venta, pero la práctica ha hecho que Faustina elabore estos en menor tiempo, logrando así mejorar sus ingresos. Faustina se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará lana de diversos colores para realizar nuevos modelos de deditos.
texts.en:
Faustina is 39 years old, and lives with her partner and three children: Diana, 18 years old, Maribel, 14, and Clara, who is 9. She has been a working mother for five years, carrying out the business of handmade crafts in order to help with the household expenses. Faustina makes the well-known “deditos”, a type of small finger puppets that are usually in the form of an animal and made from a yarn base. These small knitted items are very much in demand by tourists, causing her sales to grow. What is difficult is being able to finish a large quantity of these items, but practice has helped her be able to knit them in less time making her earnings grow. Faustina is in her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very timely with her payments. With the funds requested, she will buy different colored yarns to make her new styles of deditos.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn of different colors.

loans.name: Namulesa Twekembe Women's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N., the chairperson of Namulesa Twekembe women’s group in Lugazi, is a married woman who has owned a salon business for five years now. Selling braids, weaves and chemicals, her business is thriving because all women like to make themselves look good. As well, just like most rural women, she is a farmer growing matooke, beans, maize and cassava with her husband.

Sarah is so grateful for previous loans that enabled her to start up her salon and now manage her family’s needs and children’s school fees. She is now requesting a loan to buy additional salon stock since it’s the start of the festive season

loans.use: To buy  more weaves, braids and chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, cliente de Emprender desde hace varios añosa, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, desarrolla su actividad de forma ambulante, ya tiene su clientela asegurada y son personas con quienes trabaja hace bastante tiempo, vende productos a crédito con cierta facilidad de pago en cuotas ya sean estas diarias o semanales, con las ganancias ella llega a cubrir los gastos familiares, hace estudiar a su hija, quien aun esta a su cargo. Vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad de La Paz y es muy sacrificada en su trabajo. Actualmente solicita el sexto credito teniendo un historial de credito impecable.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa, who has been receiving loans from Emprender for various years now, is a peddler selling clothes and accessories for a living. She now has regular customers with whom she has been working for quite a while. She sells her products in credit with certain easy payment terms, which are in either daily or weekly instalments. With her earnings she is able to cover the family’s expenses and pay for her daughter's education, who is also her responsibility. She lives in a remote part of the city of La Paz and she is extremely selfless when it comes to her job. She now requests her sixth loan with a history of always repaying them on time.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Joseph Ekow

texts.en: Joseph Ekow G. sells hardware and electrical products at Kormantse near Cape Coast. Joseph Ekow has received a junior high education.  He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. Joseph Ekow has been selling hardware and electrical products since 2004. He is responsible for paying utility bills and school fees. His loan will be used to buy more hardware and electrical products for resale to his ever increasing customer base. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to plough back into the growing business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more hardware and electrical products for resale to his ever increasing costumers.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank.  She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their two children.  Giovanna studied to be a nurse technician and spent three months working in a local public hospital.  She was never paid for this time, which caused her serious economic problems.  Prior to working for the hospital, she sold clothing, and she had abandoned this business when she was given the opportunity to work at the hospital.  Giovanna wants to restart her business and sell clothing and bread.  

She needs a loan of 450 soles to buy bread and clothing. 

Giovanna dreams of opening a grocery store in her home and of getting ahead in life, along with her husband and children. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Giovanna es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Giovanna es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Giovanna estudio enfermería técnica y estuvo trabajando 3 meses en el seguro de los cuales no le pagaron y tuvo serios problemas económicos, Giovanna vendía ropa en ferias y había dejado el negocio por trabajar, Giovanna tiene proyectado iniciar nuevamente con sus negocios venderá ropa y panes.
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes y ropa.
Giovanna sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y salir adelante junto a sus hijos y esposo.

loans.use: To buy clothing and bread

loans.name: Giuliana

texts.es: Giuliana tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Su juventud no la detuvo para emprender su propio negocio y sacarlo adelante, su arduo trabajo de 9 años está arrojando buenos resultados. Giuliana empezó apoyando en el negocio de sus padres, pero éstos ya cansados y viendo en su hija todas las ganas de sacarlo adelante, decidieron dejarle el negocio a ella, es así que desde entonces Giuliana se encarga de su negocio de venta de calzado. Lo más difícil para ella, es tener que realizar viajes a las ciudades de Arequipa y Tacna a comprar la mercadería. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará una mayor cantidad de zapatos para poder vender en su tienda.
texts.en:
Giuliana is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her youth did not stop her from starting her own business and making it get ahead, and her hard work of nine years is yielding good results. Giuliana started by helping out in her parents’ business, however, they were tired and after seeing all the eagerness she had to progress they decided to give her the business. In this manner, Giuliana became in charge of their enterprise selling footwear. The most difficult part for her is the need to travel to the cities of Arequipa and Tacna to purchase her merchandise. This is the first loan she requests with MFP. With the funds, she will buy a greater quantity of shoes to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of shoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María se dedica a la venta de joyería desde hace ya más de 3 años;  esté negocio y su empleo de enfermera son su ingreso familiar ya que ella es madre soltera. Bajo su responsabilidad tiene un hijo que aún está estudiando.
Al negocio de la joyería de la señora María le está haciendo falta mercancía, ya que como ella trabaja sobre pedido, tiene varias clientes que le han solicitado artículos de joyería y debe comprarlos para revenderlos y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother whose son is still in school. She is solely responsible for bringing in the household income, so for more than three years now, in addition to her job as a nurse, she has also dedicated herself to the sale of jewelery. Her enterprise, however, is lacking supplies. Many clients have ordered jewelery from her, but she lacks the materials to fill these orders and thus, turn a profit.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of jewelry supplies

loans.name: Goya

texts.es: Goya tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos, Judith de 15 Diego de 12 y Natalia de 10. Se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía hace 10 años, elabora chompas, gorritos, pantalones y todo lo que se le ocurra para poder comercializar en la ciudad de Puno. Su trabajo es durante casi todo el día, ya que vaya a donde vaya, Goya siempre tiene las agujas de tejer en sus manos, avanzando alguna prenda, labor que ya no se le hace difícil, ya que la práctica hace al maestro, como ella refiere. La venta es buena, es por eso que Goya quiere incrementar la producción. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará más cantidad de lana para tejer sus hermosas prendas.
texts.en:
Goya is 32 years old and a single mother of three. Her daughter Judith is 15, her son Diego is 12, and her daughter Natalia is 10. Goya has been making handicrafts, such as sweaters, hats, and pants for 10 years. She sells these items in the city of Puno. Goya works nearly all day, no matter where she is she always has her knitting needles in her hands. She doesn't find knitting difficult and she's now a master at it. Goya's sales are good, and she wants to increase production. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money she'll buy more wool to knit her beautiful clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy large quantities of wool

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es: Hipólita tiene 59 años, vive sola, ya que no tuvo familia. La venta de carne es el negocio con el cual se mantiene Hipólita, desde ya treinta años, ella tiene un puesto en el Mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Puno, donde ofrece sus diversos tipos de carne. Para Hipólita su trabajo es su razón de ser, ya que al no tener familia se dedica íntegramente a él, poniéndole mucho empeño para lograr las ganancias requeridas, pero el constante viaje que realiza a las provincias para traer la carne hace que se le haga trabajoso, teniendo que cargar grandes cantidades en su espalda. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita viajará a traer más carne a las provincias de la ciudad de Puno para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Hipólita is 59 years old and lives alone since she never had a family. Selling meat is the business by which she has supported herself for the past 30 years. She has a stand in the Bellavista market in the city of Puno where she offers different cuts of meat. Her work is Hipólita´s reason for living and because she has no family she devotes herself completely to it. She makes a big effort to earn a living, but the constant travel she does to the provinces to bring back meat is hard because she has to carry huge quantities on her back. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has been on time with her payments. With the money she requests she will travel to bring back more meat from the provinces to Puno, so that she can increase her income and secure her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cover travel expenses to purchase goods for her business.

loans.name: Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario JOSE  esta conformado de  4 integrantes que viven en el Km. 35 carretera a granada mas o menos a unos 10 Km. de la sucursal, pero sus negocios están ubicados en el  mercado municipal de masaya.
Son de procedencia humilde, no tuvieron la oportunidad de asistir al colegio, aprendieron primeramente las actividades  del campo como, la agricultura y la crianza de animales caseros.
 Doña Reina inició su negocio de venta de verduras hace 5 años en su casa, de lo que cosechaba lo vendía ella vio que si obtenía un préstamo de ADIM,  invertiría mas en su negocio por tal motivo    formo el g/s José y obtuvo un crédito el cual le permitió  ubicarse en una acera del mercado municipal de masaya y así de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos,  comenzó con un capital de C$1,500.00  en la actualidad maneja 2 crédito uno de capital de trabajo y otro de auto estima. 
 Junto con el crédito ADIM al g/s lo han capacitados  lo que les ha servido para superar sus temores e inseguridades y a sentirse capaz de enfrentar la vida. 
Reina cuenta en un futuro  con ampliar su  negocio y de poseer su propio local con mayor seguridad. Para alcanzar su sueño se propone continuar cumpliendo con sus cuotas y tratar de ahorrar  de sus ganancias para ir mejorando su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group JOSE is made up of 4 members who live by the km. 35 highway in Granada, which is more or less 10km away from the group’s office. However, their businesses are located in the main market of Masaya. They are from a humble background. They were not given the opportunity to attend school and they first learnt how to carry out rural activities, such as agriculture and the rearing of domestic animals. 5 years ago, Mrs Reina started her business selling vegetables from home, selling what she grew. She then realised that by obtaining a loan from ADIM, she could invest more money into her business. As a result, she formed the solidarity group JOSE and obtained a loan, which allowed her to set up a pitch in the main market of Masaya and which therefore enabled her to increase her profits. She began with a capital of $1,500.00 and now she manages 2 loans. One is a working capital loan and the other relates to her self-esteem. Both the loan from ADIM and the solidarity group JOSE have together helped Mrs Reina to overcome her fears and insecurities and have helped her to feel capable of confronting life. Her vision for the future is to expand her business and to obtain her own premises with better security. With the aim of fulfilling her dream, she proposes to continue repaying her instalments and intends to try and save money, so that she can improve her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital loan; To improve the conditions of her business and increase product variety

loans.name: Ibelia

texts.es: Ibelia tiene 30 años, es soltera, vive alquilada en un cuarto con su hermano de 15 años en la ciudad de Puno. Se dedica a la venta y elaboración de artesanías, borda tapetes por pedido, para la venta a los turistas. El trabajo de Ibelia es durante todo el día, disponiendo de su tiempo para elaborar sus bonitos bordados, ya que trabaja por pedidos dándole esto el dinero necesario para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hermano que se encuentra cursando sus estudios. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la elaboración de sus bordados, los cuales requieren de su tiempo para quedar con el acabado deseado. Es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero comprará material, como tela, lana, agujas para aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Ibelia is 30 years old, single and lives in a rented room with her 15-year-old brother in the city of Puno. She makes and sells crafts, embroidering wall-hangings for sale to tourists. Ibelia works all day, using her time to make beautiful embroidery. She works on the orders she has and this gives her the money she needs to cover her expenses and those of her brother, who is studying. The most difficult part of her work is the actual embroidering, which requires time in order to come out right. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has been on time with her payments. With the money she will buy materials such as fabric, wool and needles so that she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her work, such as wool, fabric, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank.  She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  She has a store in her home in the Covandonga Association (a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho) where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat and firewood.  She works every day.  She also sells anticuchos (cow-heart kabobs) and tripe from a mobile cart on the Enace Bridge at night. 

Gaudencia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar. 

Gaudencia dreams of outfitting her business, building a second floor onto her home, and leaving a good business for her children to take over someday.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Gaudencia es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Gaudencia es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Gaudencia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asociación Covandonga en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, leña, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además por las noches vende anticuchos, tripas de manera ambulatoria en el puente enace.
Gaudencia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gaudencia son implementar su negocio, construir el segundo piso de su casa y dejar un buen negocio a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A., a widow with five dependents, received schooling through Junior High and has sold gari, beans and corn at Kormantse near Cape Coast since early 2008. Theresa uses her income to pay for food, utility bills and the children's school fees.

Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more food items for resale. She plans to reinvest the new profits into her growing business and her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for resale.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: La señora F. es una buena cliente D. la institución, desD. hace ya varios años se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, labor que realiza con la ayuda D. su marido, con el ingreso D. ambos apenas les alcanza para cubrir los gastos familiares la educacion D. sus pequeños hijos, quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, Esta pareja desarrolla su actividad desD. muy tempranas horas del día hasta muy tarD. por la noche, y con mucho esferzo estan logrando ampliar la pequeña habitaion en la que viven, para brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs F. is a good customer of the institution. For various years now she and her husband have been selling sweets for a living. Both their incomes only just cover the family’s expenses, which incluD. the schooling of their young children. The couple work from very early in the morning until very late at night and much effort is needed in order for them to be able to improve and therefore make more comfortable for their children, the small room in which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Xiomara Agustina

texts.es: Xiomara Agustina de 44 años, soltera con 2 hijos mayores de edad (19 y 22 años) los cuales son independientes pero habitan con ella; está solicitando su 4to credito el que utilizara para construccion de 3 cuatos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos que trabajan.  Doña Xiomara tiene 5 años de laborar para la Miscelanea El CArmen con un horario de 8:00 am. a 10:00 pm..  La Sra. L. ha pagado con mucha responsabilidad sus 3 creditos anteriores y plantea que con la ayuda de sus hijos este credito lo cancelara antes del vencimiento, pues necesita solicitar otro para reparar la sala de su casa.  El sueño de doña Xiomara es poder tener su casa con las condiciones necesarias ya que es el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara Agustina is 44 years old and single. She has 2 older children, aged 19 and 20, who are working but still live with her. For 5 years, she herself has worked from 8 am. to 10 pm. This loan will be her 4th and with it, she plans to build three rooms in her home. She was very responsible about her payments on her first 3 loans, and even expects that she will be able to pay this next one off, with the help of her children, before it is due. When she does, she will ask for a 5th loan so she can make some repairs to her living room. Xiomara's dream is to have a comfortable home in good condition, especially because her children will inherit it

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the construction of rooms

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro Chalí tiene 29 años de edad casado,  varios años atrás se dedicaba de jornalero, el trabajaba para otras personas en el campo y le pagaban por día de trabajo lo que no era suficiente para mantener a su familia.  Por esa razón el decidió trabajar en un Banco de Confianza con un crédito el cual lo invirtió en la crianza de pollos, su trabajo fue de éxito, por lo que sus ganancias las utilizo para sembrar papa y fresa en un terreno de su propiedad que tenia sin utilizarlo.  Cuenta que con la ayuda de Dios logro una buena cosecha de fresas y también de papa.  El préstamo que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la siembra de tomate, por lo que necesita bastante capital para la compra de pilones de tomate, abono, y fungicidas.
Actualmente Mauro Tiene 4 hijos pequeños que le ayudan en su tiempo libre, y también quiere aprovechar sus recursos desde ahora para poder darles la educación adecuada a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y ellos puedan apoyarlo cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Mauro C. is 29 years old and married. A few years ago, he became a day laborer - working for others in their fields and being paid by the day. Unfortunately, this was not enough to support his family, so he turned to the Banco de Confianza for a loan. He invested that loan into raising chickens and did well for himself, using his profits to plant potatoes and strawberries in an unused portion of his property. With God's grace, he was able to harvest a healthy amount of both potatoes and strawberries. With this next loan, he will plant tomatoes, for which he will need to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Mauro's 4 little children help him in their spare time, and he hopes to be able to give them an education with the earnings from his garden. He would like to see them become professionals and he hopes they will be able to help support him when they are older.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes Q. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey', which is made out of corn.  It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast.  Agnes has received no formal education.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Agnes has been selling 'Kenkey' since 2006.  She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and feeding her family.  Her loan will be used to buy more maize as the raw ingredient, firewood as the fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize as the raw ingredient, firewood as the fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Julia tiene tres hermosos hijos de 13,16 y 19 años de edad, tiene 38 años de edad es separada de su esposo lo cual trabaja en la costura y también alquila cuartos para tener mejores ingresos, y poder darle estudios a sus hijos ya que los tres están estudiando, su papa también le da una ayuda para que estudien, pero son muchos gastos lo cual desde horas muy temprano se levanta para comenzar a trabajar por que tiene que hacer el aseo de la casa y eso le quita tiempo para avanzar, comenzó a coser desde hace diez años con iniciativa propia y con fondos propios, para comprar mas telas y materiales de la costura inicio con prestamos en Afodenic lo cual este es su sexto préstamo en la institución que ha sido de gran beneficios ya que ha podido mantener su oficio y ha hecho reparación a su casa, con esta solicitud quiere hacer un cuarto con las condiciones para poder alquilarlo y así obtener mas ingresos.  A largo plazo es tener las condiciones para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes de alquiler y poder seguir dando estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Julia has three beautiful children, 13, 16, and 19 years old. She is 38 and separated from her husband. She works as a dressmaker and she also rents out rooms to obtain more income and, together with her husband's support, provide her children with schooling. There are many expenses and she gets up very early to start work but as she also has to do the chores, that reduces her time to sew. She has been sewing for the last ten years, on her own initiative and with her own funds. In order to buy more fabric and materials for sewing, she started with loans from Afodenic. This is her sixth loan with the institution, and she has benefitted a lot as she has been able to maintain her trade and to make repairs on her house. With this loan she wants to build a room fit for rent and thus obtain further income. In the far future she wishes to have conditions that will allow her to offer good service to he clients and to keep her children in school.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to build a room for rent.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Marjorie tiene 27 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, que estudian la primaria en el colegio del barrio habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Naciones Unida desde su niñez, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como técnico industrial, la Sra. Marjorie trabaja de lavado y planchado en casa particulares desde hace cinco años para ayudar a la familia ya que todo esta caro y así poder balancear los gastos, con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras de vivienda, en la compra de bloques, arena, cemento, y hierro para comenzar a construir su casa de concreto ya que es muy humilde e insegura lo cual desea una vivienda digna para su familia, también desea poder tener salud para apoyar a sus hijos a que estudien.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 27 years old and married with 2 children aged 7 and 10 who study at the local school. Their neighbourhood has always been known as 'United Nations', and Marjorie has lived there since childhood. Her husband works as an industrial technician and for five years now, Marjorie has worked as a maid in various houses, washing and ironing clothes. She began this work because everything was getting expensive and the family needed extra income to pay their bills. She is requesting a loan so that she can improve her family's quality of life. Her current home is humble and its structure is unstable so she will buy bricks, sand, cement and iron to begin construction of a concrete house. Not only would she like her family's home to be dignified, but she believes that a new home would be much better for her children health and thus, make it easier for them to concentrate on their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the puchase of construction materials

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She is 25 years old and is married with three children. She used to sell anticuchos (beef-heart kabobs) from a mobile cart at night, but she stopped because she has small children.

Maritza and her husband operate a locksmith shop in a rented space. Maritza needs a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy iron rods for her husband to work with. She dreams of owning her own home, of expanding her workshop, and of buying all of the necessary equipment for her business. Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita. Maritza es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 3 hijos, Maritza vendía anticuchos por las noches de manera ambulatoria en las nazarenas, actualmente dejo de realizar su negocio por que sus hijos son pequeños. Maritza junto a su esposo tienen un taller de cerrajería en un local alquilado. Maritza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros. Maritza sueña con tener una casa propia, ampliar su taller y equipar con todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Buy iron rods for locksmith workshop

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El joven juan de la Cruz A., soltero, de 25 años de edad, trabajador de la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa, esta solicitando su primer credito para reconstruir su cuarto que esta hecho de tabla y con la oportunidad que brinda AFODENIC desea construirlo de concreto y techo de zinc.  Habita en casa de su mamá, ella es pensionada del INSS por un hijo caido, solo el trabaja y le brinda apoyo; espera que una vez cancelado este credito continuar trabajando con esta financiera para darle todas las condiciones a su dormitorio; es muy responsable y la administracion de la Alcaldia para que se le atienda el con el credito.
texts.en:
Juan de la Cruz A. is single, 25 years old and a worker at the town hall of the municipality of Juigalpa. He is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC to rebuild his bedroom, which is made of wood and to be replaced with concrete walls and a zinc roof. He lives in his mother's house; she is on a pension from the Nicaraguan Social Security Institution due to a deceased son. He the only one working in the household and provides support for his mother; he hopes that once this loan is repaid he will be able to continue working with AFODENIC to provide all the amenities for his bedroom. He is very responsible so he should be afforded with the opportunity to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Sabana Grande desde su infancia, tiene 63 años de edad, en su matrimonio procreo once hijos cinco mujeres y seis varones lo cuales son independiente y trabajan, su esposo es comerciante, la Sra. Maria vende ropa, cosmético en su casa desde hace veintiocho años trabaja en las venta que vende al contado y al crédito, ella inicio con dinero propio que su esposo le dio y ahora trabaja con préstamo que Afodenic le atorgado para hacer mejoras a su negocio para seguir invirtiendo, con esta solicitud es la séptima y desea invertir en comprar ropa para niños y adultos para ofertar a sus clientes ya que para estos meses la demanda es bastante buena debido al periodo de la navidad que la personas alistan sus estreno que es la tradición de cada año, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos. A futuro es poder tener un local grande donde pueda tener bastante inventario.
texts.en:
Maria has lived in a neighborhood of the capital city called Sabana Grande since she was an child. She is 63 years old, married with 11 children, five daughter and six sons, all of whom are independent and working. Her husband is a merchant.
