Maria has been selling clothing and cosmetics in her house for 28 years, to customers paying in full with cash and on credit. She started out with money given to her by her husband and now is working with loans provided to her by AFODENIC to make improvements in her business. With this loan, which is the seventh, she would like to purchase adult and children's clothing to offer to her clients, since during the Christmas season her demand is quite high, during which she earns good income. In the future she would like to open a large location where she will be able to maintain a larger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's and adult clothing

loans.name: Teresa Petrona

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa Petrona trabaja desD. los cinco años D. edad, en un principio se dedicaba a la
venta D. verduras en un mercado D. la zona Sur, una zona residencial D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia, DesD. hace 2 años que trabaja en el rubro D. la venta D. alimenbtos en un comedor popular D. la ciudad y es D. esa manera que genera ingresos para su alimentacion diaria, felizmente, como refiere, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es chofer asalariado y entre los dos tratan D. sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs Teresa Petrona has been working since the age of five. At first, she maD. her living selling vegetables in a market in "la zona Sur”, a residential area of south La Paz, in Bolivia. For 2 years now, she has been selling food in one of the city’s well-known restaurants and in this way she has been earning enough money to happily feed her family on a daily basis. However, she also relies on the support from her husband who earns his salary as a chauffeur. Together they are trying to proviD. their children with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. H. es soltero de 41 años de edad, con una hija la cual esta casada y con una nieta, habita en casa de los padres.  Trabaja en el Sistema Penitenciario como oficial de administracion desde hace 12 años, con un pequeño salario que no es suficiente para la mejora que desea en su vivienda, es por esa razon que esta solicitand o su 6to credito y lo utilizara para repellar el frente de su casa y los dormitorios, ademas embaldozar si el credito le cubre.  Su compañera Juana Elisa Espinoza trabaja como domestica, la que aporta para las necesidades del hogar, ella es muy querida por su patrona ya que tiene muchos años de trabajo.  Sus creditos anteriores los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma y espera no tener ninguna complicacion para cancelar este credito sin dificultad, plantea que gracias a AFODENIC  ha podido construir su vivienda y poco a poco ira mejorandola a traves de los creditos que se le otorguen.
texts.en:
Mr. H. is single, 41 years old, and has a daughter that is married with a daughter of her own. He lives in his parent's house. He has worked in the penitentiary system as an administration official for 12 years. With his low salary he is unable to complete the improvements to his house that he would like; for this reason his is requesting this loan, which is his sixth and will be used to plaster the front of his house and the bedrooms, as well as tiling the floors, if he has enough money. His companion Juana Elisa Espinoza works as a maid, which contributes to the household expenses. She is well regarded by her employer since she has been working there for many years. His previous loans have been repaid on time and he expects not to have any difficulties repaying this loan. He adds that thanks to AFODENIC he has been able to build his house and little by little will go about improving it with the loans that they provide.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster and tile his house

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijas Catiuska de 13 y Zait de 04. Vende ropa de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Puno, desde hace 5 años, ya que al terminar la secundaria y no tener las posibilidades de cursar estudios superiores, se dedicó de enteramente al negocio. La venta es buena, usualmente los sábados que es cuando hay feria en la ciudad de Puno, lo único complicado en su trabajo es el no poder estar todo el tiempo que ella quisiera con sus hijas, las cuales son su fuente de motivación y por las cuales trabaja día a día en busca de brindarles lo mejor. Este es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero viajará a las ciudades de Lima y Tacna a adquirir mayor cantidad de ropa para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and lives with her partner and their two daughters, Catiuska and Zait, respectively 13 and 4 years old. Janet is a street vendor and since five years she sells clothes in the city of Puno. She started selling clothes when she finished junior high school because she could not continue attending school. In general, business is good and Saturday's is the best day of the week, due to the Puno's weekly fair. The only complicated thing about her work, is that she can not be with her daughters as much time as she wanted. Her daughters are Janet's source of motivation and she works in order go give them better opportunities. This is Janet's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she will be very punctual with the payments. With the money she obtains from the loan, she will travel to the cities of Lima and Tacna to buy more clothing and increase her revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To travel to the cities of Lima and Tacna to buy more clothing and increase her revenues

loans.name: Eva Beatriz

texts.es: La sra, Eva M. trabaja en esa actividad desde hace 16 años, es muy trabajadora y ello le ayudo para poder progresar, actualmente cuenta con negocio propio y considera que le va muy bien, para poder mantener a su familia cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien es transportista desde hace varios años y entre ambos mantienen a sus dos hijos pequeños. La señora es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002, comenzó con un grupo solidario, pero ahora decidió independizarse para solicitar un crédito individual, actrualmente se encuentra en la 9na secuencia, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eva M. has been working for the past 16 years, she is very hard working and her work has been helping her advance. Currently she runs her own business and she feels that it's going very well, enough to be able to support hr family. She can also depend on the support of her husband who is a driver for many years, and together they support their two small children. She is a client of Emprender since 2002, starting out with a group loan. But since then she had decided to go on her own and seek a loan by herself. She is currenlty on the 9th cycle, having demonstrated to be responsible with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 55 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años llamado Juan José. Se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos, como cigarros, juguetes, golosinas, hojas de coca, etc. Ella realiza este trabajo desde hace 27 años, para cubrir los gastos de su único hijo, el cual está estudiando y requiere de más gastos. Lo bueno del trabajo de Judith es la tranquilidad que posee, ya que no requiere de estar caminando, ni cargando paquetes, haciéndole muy satisfactorio el salir a trabajar. Este es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero adquirirá más productos y más variados para vender en su pequeño puesto.
texts.en:
55-year old Judith is a single mother with a 16-year old son called Juan José. Her job is selling different types of products such as cigarettes, toys, candy, coca leaves etc. She has been doing this for the last 27 years so that she can provide for her only son who is a student. This necessitates many expenses. The good thing about Judith’s work is that she can work in comfort from one place, without having to walk far or carry heavy packages. Working in conditions like these is very satisfactory. This is her first loan with Micro Finanzas Prisma, and she is planning to be very punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy more and a wider variety of products to sell from her small stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the range of products that she sells

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 38 años, es soltero y vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a  la construcción de muebles en su taller de carpintería desde hace ya 20 años, negocio por el que optó gracias a las habilidades que descubrió desde muy joven en este campo, que siempre le gustó. Al ser soltero trabaja mucho por su futuro, para conformar una familia y poder brindarles lo mejor, lo bueno de su negocio es que es muy solicitado por la clientela que ya conoce su trabajo. Lo más difícil es el esfuerzo físico que amerita, terminado agotado al final del día. Este es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero adquirirá madera para elaborar sus muebles y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
38-year old Marcos is single and lives in the house that was left to him by his parents. He has been working as a carpenter, making furniture in his workshop, for the last 20 years. He chose this line of work based on the skills that he realised he possessed when he was a young man. He has always enjoyed his work. Because he is a bachelor, he is always looking towards the future so that he can have a family one day and be able to offer them a good standard of living. The best thing about his business is that his work is very sought after by his customers. The most difficult thing is the physical strength that it requires—by the end of the day Marcos is exhausted. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he plans to be very punctual with his payments. With the money he will buy wood to make furniture and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Beatriz Lucy

texts.es: La Sra Beatriz D., se dedica a la venta de flores y plantas, su esposo es artesano en macetas, y ambos se complementan en el trabajo, ambos viven de manera humilde, en una pequeña casita, sus dos hijos ya se independizaron para formar sus propias familias. Comenzó a trabajar en Emprender el año 2004 con el grupo Solidario Orquideas, posteriormente se individuializó. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de plantas y flores en diversas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, además tiene su propio puesto de ventas en la zona sur de la ciudad, donde vende todos los días, actualmente se encuentra en su 5ta secuencia de crédito, al que accedió por ser buena cliente.
texts.en:
Sra. Beatriz D. sells flowers and plants. Her husband is an artisan who makes flowerpots. They work together, and live in a humble manner in a small home. Their two children are now grown and have their own families. She began to work with Emprender in 2004 with the group “Solidario Orquideas,” then she became independent. Her work consists of selling plants and flowers in various La Paz city markets in Bolivia. In addition she has her own stand in the southern zone of the city where she sells every day. This is her 5th loan that she can access as she is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her flower business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 36 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus hijos Laura de 15 y Joel Marcos de 13. Se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos, como utensilios de cocina, pilas, cepillos de dientes, detergentes, etc., en uno de los mercados más frecuentados y conocidos de la ciudad de Puno. Las ventas son buenas, haciendo que Maritza quiera seguir creciendo cada vez más, es por eso que le pone tanta dedicación a su trabajo, ayudándole muchas veces sus hijos por los cuales lucha todos los días. Este es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá más cantidad de mercadería para  aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her children, Laura, who is 15 years old, and Joel Marcos, who is 13. She sells a variety of products, such as kitchen utensils, batteries, toothbrushes, detergents, etc. in one of the busiest and most well-known markets of the city of Puno. Sales are good, which makes Maritza want to keep growing. This is why she works so hard in her job and helps her children, for whom she struggles each day. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money she will buy a greater quantity of merchandise, to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Lébenssao

texts.fr:
Née le 03 mars 1981 à Bombouaka, madame K. Lébenssao est une jeune commerçante qui n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle vit actuellement à Adétikopé ou elle mène ses activités de commerce d'alimentation générale qu’elle gère bien. Honnête, elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son activité. 

Pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat de cartons de laits et de sucres, spaghettis, boites de tomates et autres produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born on March 3, 1981 in Bombouaka, Ms. Lébenssao K. is a young merchant who still does not have any children. She currently lives in Adétikopé where she does commerce in groceries, a business she manages well. An honest woman, she has perfect command of her work. To bolster her business and to make it profitable, she is requesting a loan for buying boxes of milk, sugar, spaghetti, canned tomatoes, and other food provisions. This will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in groceries

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia es una buena cliente, vive en casa muy sencilla en El Alto, Bolivia; mantiene por su cuenta a sus cinco hijos quienes aun estan en edad escolar. Se dedica a la producciòn de chompas de lana. Además por temporadas ella elabora colchas y cubrecamas para la epoca de lluvias y para el invierno. No tiene esposo que le ayude con gastos del hogar, la señora es muy trabajadora y le colabora toda la familia en la venta de sus productos. Su sueño es poder ahorrar lo suficiente para de esa manera poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is a good client, she lives in a very plain house in El Alto, Bolivia. She alone supports her five children who are still attendikng school. She makes wool sweaters for a living and eventuallly she also makes blankets and bedspreads for the rainy season and winter. She has no husband to help out with house expenses, she is a hardworking lady and the entire family helps selling her products. It is her dream to be able to save enough money to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Dayovo

texts.fr:
Madame K. Dayovo est née en 1970 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle est tresseuse de formation. Installée depuis à Adétikopé, elle tient un atelier de coiffure et de tresse qu’elle gère bien. Dynamique, elle pourra s’en sortir si elle est appuyée financièrement. 

Pour cette raison, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter différentes sortes de mèches et les instruments de travail pour servir à temps les clientes. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dayovo K. was born in Lomé in 1970. Married and the mother of four children, she is trained as a hair braider. Now living in Adétikopé, she has a hairdressing/braiding salon that she runs very efficiently. Being so dynamic, she will do extremely well if she is able to obtain financial support. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to buy various types of hair extensions and hairdressing instruments so that she can provide her clients with better service. She will thus be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hairdressing instruments and hair extensions

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, madame A. Edith est née en 1978 à Lomé. Elle gère à Adétikopé une boutique de vente de savons, sucres et autres produits de première nécessité. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, elle participe aux dépenses familiales. Par son dynamisme et son abnégation, elle a su bien gérer son premier crédit qu’elle a remboursé sans incidence. 

Pour accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat en gros de savons, sucres, bougies et autres produits recherchés par les habitants de cette localité. Ainsi elle pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et avoir une autonomie financière pour plus investir dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of four children, Mrs. Edith A. was born in 1978 in Lomé. She runs a small store in Adétikopé that sells soap, sugar and other staples. With the income from this business, she is able to contribute towards the family expenses. As a result of her dynamism and personal sacrifice, she was able to repay her first loan without any problem. To increase her income, she is requesting a loan to buy bulk quantities of soap, sugar, candles and other products required by local residents. She will thus be able to turn a profit and have the financial independence to pay more into the family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions for her store

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Né à Djagblé, le 31 décembre 1980, monsieur B. Kokou vit depuis plus de 3 ans à Adétikopé. Soudeur de formation, il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de portes et autres objets métalliques. Père d’un enfant, il sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des tôles et barres de fer pour la fabrication des objets métalliques. Ainsi il pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et prendre correctement en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Djagblé on December 31, 1980, Mr. Kokou B. has been living in Adétikopé for more than 3 years. A trained welder, he specializes in making doors and other metallic objects. Father of one child, he's seeking this loan that will enable him to buy sheet metal and bars of iron to manufacture metallic objects. He will thus be able to turn a profit and adequately support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrication et vente portes et d'obejts métalliques To manufacture and sell doors and other metallic objects

loans.name: Natalia Eleuteria

texts.es: La Sra Natalia es muy trabajadora, hace poco tiempo que se ha divorciado de su esposo, y ahora mantiene sola a sus tres hijos y tambièn a su madre, toda la familia se dedica a la atenciòn de un pequeño restaurante que tienen, durante todo el día, trabaja mucho con el sueño de poder construir su casa propia. El crédito que solicitó servirá para la compra de insumos de cocina, asi como para la compra de arroz, fideo, papa, sal, etc. Actualmente solicita el sexto credito teniendo un historial de credito impecable.
texts.en:
Natalia is a very hard worker. A short while ago, she divorced her husband and she is currently responsible for supporting her three children and her mother. The whole family dedicates itself to running a small restaurant. All day, Natalia works in the hopes of being able to build her own house. The loan she is requesting will go towards the purchase of ingredients for the restaurant, such as rice, pasta, potatoes, salt, etc. This will be her sixth loan and she has a perfect credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Memounatou

texts.fr: Madame A. Memounatou est née le 12 novembre 1972 à Mango dans le nord du Togo. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Revendeuse de jus et de glaçons à Adétikopé. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acquérir un nouveau congélateur et des glacières. Entreprenante, ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer et de rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Memounatou A. was born on November 12, 1972 in Mango, northern Togo. She is married with six children. She sells juice and ice in Adétikopé. She is requesting a loan to buy a new freezer and some iceboxes. She is an enterprising woman and this loan will enable her to strengthen her business and make it more profitable.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer for the sale of juice and ice

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Koffi est né le 12 décembre 1980 à Adétikopé, dans la préfecture de Zio. Après sa formation en couture, il a ouvert son propre atelier. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Sa femme, grâce à son petit commerce contribue aux dépenses familiales. Excellent couturier, il est très estimé par les clients à cause de sa compétence. 
Dynamique dans ses activités, il sollicite un crédit pour acquérir d’autres machines afin de rendre le travail plus efficace et plus rapide. Par le présent crédit, il pense rentabiliser plus ses activités afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi G. was born on December 12, 1980 in Adétikopé, in the Zio prefecture. After leaning sewing, he opened his own workshop. Married, he's the father of 2 children. His wife helps him with the family expenses, thanks to her own little business. An excellent tailor, he's very well respected by his customers due to his competence. Energetic in his business, he's seeking a loan to purchase additional machines to render his work faster and more efficient. With this loan, he thinks he will increase his revenue to better contribute to improving the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines for his workshop

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Madame A. Améyo est née le 04 février 1875 à Attitogon, dans la Préfecture des Lacs. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vend des tapettes et sandalettes et des habits pour enfants au marché d’Adétikopé, village dans lequel il vit actuellement. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle contribue aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure ses activités qu’elle gère bien

Elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat d’autres modèles d’habits, des chaussures et autres pour renforcer son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Améyo A. was born on February 4, 1975 in Attitogon, in the Lakes Prefecture. Married and the mother of two children, she sells flip-flops and sandals as well as clothing for children in the open-air market of Adétikopé, the village where she presently resides. Dynamic and business-minded, she helps support her family, thanks to the income that her business brings in.

She is asking for a loan to purchase other styles of clothing, shoes, etc. to bolster her business and increase her earnings. In that way, she will be able to do more to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of children's shoes and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia G. vive en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada (el marido tiene el oficio de policía) y tiene 4 hijos. La pareja tiene domicilio propio, necesita crédito para la construcción de un muro perimetral. Este es el primer crédito de Virginia pero dados los resultados de nuestra evaluación, estamos seguros de que no tendrá problemas para hacer los pagos correspondientes
texts.en:
Virginia G. lives in the Bajo Llojeta Zone of La Paz. She is married to a police officer and they have four children. The couple own their own home, and are requesting this loan so that they can build a wall around it. This is Virginia's first loan, but our evaluation shows that she will have no problem making the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the construction of a wall

loans.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia Evelyn R. es una persona dedicada al negocio de la producción y venta de embutidos y además con su esfuerzo y sacrificio sustenta sus estudios universitarios y al mismo tiempo sus deseos de superación hacen que se motive mucho más. Vive con sus padres, con lo que gana en el negocio ayda a pagar las cuentas del hogar. Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora.
Ingresó a la institución este año y actualmente paga al día sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Patricia Evelyn R. is a person dedicated to the business of the production and sale of cold meat and also with her effort and sacrifice she continues her university studies and at the same time her dreams of bettering herself motivate her a lot. She lives with her parents, with whom she works in the business, helping to pay the expenses of the household. They are a humble family, but very hardworking. She entered our institution this year and currently pays her installments to the day.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome M. M. es cliente de la institución desde el año 2004, se dedica a la venta de carne y actualmente tiene un puesto propio en uno de los mercados más grandes de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, la Sra. se esta diversificando con la venta otros productos para el hogar. Es una persona dedicada al negocio y a la crianza de sus hijos que actualmente están estudiando, razón por la cual ingresa al programa KIVA, la Sra. tiene una vision emprendedora y paga sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Salome Mamami M. has been a client of this institution since 2004. She works selling meat and currently she has her own stall in one of the larger markets in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Salome is diversifying by selling other products for the home. She is a person who is dedicated to the business and the care of her children who are currently in school. This is the reason why she entered into the KIVA program. She has a vision of working and paying her installments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina R. Q. es una persona dedicada a la  venta de papelería y otros artículos de escritorio, asi como productos para el hogar tiene su propia librería bazar y venta de abarrotes, con su esfuerzo y sacrificio sustenta a sus tres hijos a los cuales quiere ver profesionales. Es una persona emprendedora que afronta los retos con entereza. Ingresó a la institución el año 2004 y es una persona muy conocida por nosotros, caracterizada por su responsabilidad y por ser trabajadora.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina R. Q. is dedicated to selling paper and other office supplies as well as products for the home. She has her own bookstore, bazaar, and also sells groceries. With her effort and sacrifice, she supports three children, whom she wants to see become professionals. She is a very enterprising person who faces challenges with determination. She joined this institution in 2004 and she is well-known by us. She is characterized by her responsibility and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her business

loans.name: Casani Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes M. Calisaya ingresó a la institución el año 2004, su actividad es la venta D. articulos para el hogar en su pequeña tienda, es viuda, por lo que su negocio es el único ingreso económico que percibe, en esta ocación destinará el crédito para refaccionar su casa.
La Sra. Gertrudis se dedica a la venta D. comida  en un comedor popular dela zona El Tejar, una populosa zona D. La Paz, Bolivia, como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta en su tienda D. abarrotes, la señora es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos, la señora es muy antigua en la institución por lo cual es seleccionada para ingresar al programa Kiva.
La señoras son personas emprendedoras que tienen una visión a futuro muy amplia.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. Calisaya joined the community bank in 2004. Her activity is selling products for the home in her her small store. She is a widower, thus her business is her only source of income. With this loan she will refurbish her house. Gertrudis works selling food in a popular diner in the El Tejar zone, a busy zone in La Paz, Bolivia. As a secondary activity she sells groceries. She is a responsible person and punctual with her payments. She is a long time member of the institution which is why she was selected to participate in the Kiva program. The women are entrepreneurial women that have a vision of a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and reburbishment of home

loans.name: Jhon Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. He is 40 years old and is the single father of a seven-year-old boy. He has been working as a photographer for 20 years and now works independently at different events in the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Most of his business consists of taking photos and filming weddings, baptisms, quinceañeras and bachelor parties. These celebrations are mainly on the weekends, and on a good weekend he earns between 300 and 400 soles.  

Wilfredo is requesting a loan of 2000 soles (US$650) to buy a new video camera, since the equipment he currently uses is old and outdated. He will add this loan to his savings to buy the camera (which costs more than 2000 soles).

Wilfredo has been working with FINCA for the past two years, and has been a very reliable client. He says FINCA helps him pay for his son’s education, for which he is grateful. His dream for the future is to buy a home for himself and his son.

loans.use: Buy a new video camera

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 57 years old and married with six children and six grandchildren. At her home, she bakes chapla, a traditional Peruvian bread, and then sells it in a local market each day. She starts baking at 12AM each morning and by 5AM is at the market. She stays at the market until 8 or 9AM, and if she doesn’t sell all of her bread, she returns in the afternoon. She sleeps for a few hours each day after lunch. 

Filomena sells each roll for 10 or 20 centimos, depending on the size. On a good day, she earns 50 to 60 soles. Filomena is requesting a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy flour to make bread. Her dreams for the future are to keep working and to buy an automatic mixer for bread dough, which costs 1500 soles.

loans.use: Buy flour for bread

loans.name: Gianina Lucy

texts.en:
Gianina is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells clothing in different local markets in the Ayacucho area. She travels to Lima (a 9-hour bus ride) once per month to buy clothing to bring back and sell. She has been in this business since she was very young; most of her family members are also vendors. 

In a good week, Gianina can sell 5000 soles worth of clothing, of which about 1500 soles is profit. These are her best weeks however, and she usually only has one or two of these per year - during end-of-year celebrations or national holidays, when people tend to buy more. 

Gianina also works part-time as a substitute teacher for young children, for which she is paid by the hour. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy more clothing in Lima. Her dream is to open a store so that she doesn’t have to travel so much for her work.

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria Isabel Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s MARIA ISABEL viven en el barrio camilo ortega es en la zona urbana de Masaya, cerca del mercado municipal, a pesar de ser humilde y de escasos recursos este grupo ha salido adelante por estar ubicado cerca del mercado municipal, lugar que el g/s ha explotado para hacer crecer sus negocios, ya que el vivir cerca les evita el pago de piso.
Doña carla elabora colchones y almohadas es un taller familiar ya que su esposo e hijos le colaboran con la producción, una vez elaborados ella los comercializa en su casa y en los departamentos del país de forma ambulantes, ella tiene garantizada la comercialización ya que tiene mucha demanda y es un producto que esta dirigido a abastecer al sector pobre.  Los créditos de adim les  han servido para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que el g/s los invierte en la compra de materia prima. Sus mayores sueños es poder preparar a sus hijos, lo cual dicen lograrlo con mucho esfuerzo y tenacidad.
Este g/s ha sido capacitado por desarrollo empresarial en los temas de autoestima y manejo del negocio, para lo cual se siente bien agradecidas con adim, y prometen no quedar mal para gozar de sus beneficios.
texts.en:
The members of the group MARIA ISABEL live in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood, in the urban zone of Masay, near the municipal market. Despite being humble and of few resources, this group has taken advantage of being situated near the market, a place they have exploited to help their businesses grow. Being near the market lets them avoid having to spend a lot of time traveling back and forth. Carla makes bedspreads and pillows in a family workshop, given that her husband and children collaborate with production. Once made, she sells them in her house and throughout various areas of the country on foot. She has guaranteed sales since there is a great demand and it’s a product that is directed to supply the poor sector. The loans from ADIM have helped grow her business, since the group invests the funds into purchasing raw materials. Her greatest dreams include preparing her children, which she hopes to accomplish with much effort and tenacity. This group has received business development training in areas such as self-esteem and management, for which they are very grateful to ADIM, and they promise to not end up badly so they can enjoy the benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital; purchase of raw materials to increase production.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their two daughters, who are 11 and 12 years old. She sells underwear and fruit from a mobile cart in the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Her husband also sells fruit but has his own tricycle cart, and the couple’s daughters help them in their free time. The couple buys fruit in bulk at a local market, and Isabel buys underwear in Lima. She works every day, and in a good week she earns between 100 and 150 soles. She has been in this business since she was young. 

Isabel is requesting a loan of 1250 soles (US$425) which she will use to buy more underwear in Lima to bring back to Ayacucho to sell. Her dream for the future is for her daughters to get a good education and for her family to always stay together.

loans.use: Buy underwear in bulk for resale

loans.name: Roman Andres

texts.es: El señor Roman C. Trabaja actualmente como mecánico en la zona de Villa Victoria, una populosa zona de la ciudad de La Paz, actividad que le permite mantener a su familia, que está compuesta por 6 miembros,él es el único quien aporta para cubrir los gastos familiares y podemos decir también que el cliente es muy trabajador y responsable en sus obligaciones, a la fecha ha demostrado ser muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Mr. Roman C. current works as a mechanic in Villa Victoria, a populous area in La Paz. This business allows him to support his family, which is made up of six family members. He is the only one that helps cover the family’s costs. Also, he is a hard worker and very responsible for his obligations. To date, he has shown to be a hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Roger Augusto

texts.es: El señor Roger Mújica es productor joven ya que a su corta edad mantiene solo a toda su familia. Trabaja en un pequeño taller en el cual fabrica blue jeans es el propietario del taller, es por ello que lo consideR. un verdadero emprendedor, trabajando arduamente durante todo el día con el sueño de que su negocio prospere.Ingreso a  la institución  el año 2005 por referencia de un familiar quien también es cliente antiguo de la institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Mújica is a young producer. At his young age, he alone maintains his entire family. He works and is the owner of a small workshop that makes blue jeans. It is for this reason we consider him a true entrepreneur, working hard every day with the hope that his store will prosper. He began working with this institution in 2005 when he was referenced by one of his family members, whom is also a client of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Sonrisa (“Smile”) Village Bank. She is married and has four children. She and her husband are artisans and make sculptures of landscapes, churches, traditional customs and birth commemorations out of Huamanga rock (alabaster). Her workshop is located in her house in Santa Ana, a local artisans’ neighborhood. She sells her pieces to vendors and also does custom orders. 

Teresa needs a loan of 2400 soles (US$800) to buy more alabaster for her sculptures. Her dreams are to help her children finish school, to get ahead in life, and to improve her workshop. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.

Teresa es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Teresa junto a su esposo son artesanos y realizan esculturas en piedra de Huamanga (alabastro), como nacimientos, paisajes, iglesias, costumbres típicas, su taller esta ubicado en su casa en el barrio artesanal de Santa Ana, sus ventas los realiza a los comerciantes y también a pedidos. 

Teresa necesita un préstamo de 2400 dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra de Huamanga.

Los sueños de Teresa son ayudar a sus hijos para culminar sus estudios, salir adelante y mejorar su taller.

loans.use: Buy alabaster

loans.name: Doris Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s  DORIS viven en el barrio magdalena uno de los barrios mas populosos de la ciudad de Masaya tuvieron la oportunidad de aprobar la primaria lo que les permite ser unas  personas bien comunicativas y accesibles en la sociedad. Iniciaron sus negocios ambulantes, comprando cosechas y vendiendo en el mercado, actualmente comparten un tramo para almacenar sus productos y que el costo del alquiler salga mas barato.
 Doris pertenece al g/s DORIS y  siente que el aprendizaje mas importante que ha obtenido al trabajar con ADIM ha sido reconocer cuanto vale ella como mujer honrada y trabajadora. Hace 1 años obtuvo su primer crédito con ADIM por un monto mucho menor que el que tiene ahora.  Hoy es una vendedora de frutas por mayor con lo que obtiene más ganancias y sufre menos pérdidas.
Sus créditos lo utilizan en la compra de frutas por cosecha para obtener precios más bajos y poder aumentar sus ganancias.
El g/s esta motivo a trabajar con adim, esperan en un futuro obtener créditos de vivienda para mejorar y ampliar su casa. También espera poder participar en las capacitaciones de desarrollo empresarial. Quiere además seguir siendo cumplida en sus pagos como hasta ahora lo ha sido.
texts.en:
The members of the group named Doris live in the region of Magdalena, one of the most populous regions of the city of Masay. They had the opportunity to finish primary school which grants them the ability to be individuals who are communicative and successful members of society. They started their door-to-door business, purchasing harvests and reselling them in the markets. Currently they share a stand to display their products and so that their rental costs would be cheaper.

Doris belongs to the group Doris and she says that her greatest learing experience while working with Adim has been that she now recognizes how valuable she is as an honest and hard working woman. It has been one year since her first loan with Adim, a loan that is substantially smaller than the one she has now. Currently she is sells fruits wholesale, generating a greater income and permitting fewer losses.

The loan is used to purchase harvests of fruit at better prices augmenting the earnings. The group is motivated to continue working with Adim and hope to obtain future home improvement loans to improve and expand their homes. They also hope to be able to contribute towards the growth of their business. They want to keep up with their regular scheduled repayments as they have been up to date.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: Purchase of harvests to cover client demands.

loans.name: Maritza Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza Zacarias es cliente nuestra desde el año 2007, se dedica a la producción de chompas de hilo las cuales vende por docena a las comerciantes de la calle Tumusla, un mercado de ropa muy conocido en la ciudad. Es cliente muy responsable en sus pagos y tiene un buen historial crediticio,los creditos que sacó anteriormente fueron para equipar su taller comprando mas maquinaria.La señora Maritza es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad y además mantiene a sus padres quienes son mayores de edad, su actividad le brinda los recursos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Zacarias has been a client since 2007. She makes linen sweaters, which she sells by the dozen to vendors on the street Tumusla, where a well-known clothing market is located. She is a very responsible client in terms of her repayments and has a good credit history. Her previous loans were used to stock her workshop by purchasing more machinery. Mrs. Maritza is a single mother of a 10 year old boy. She also supports her parents, who are elderly. Her business allows her to bring in all the necessary resources to pull her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina B. trabaja con la institución desD. el año 2004, se dedica a la venta D. ropa interior en un mercado D. ropa, muy conocido en la ciudad D. La Paz, bolivia. Es cliente antigua que trabajó anteriormente en grupos solidarios, y en esta ocasión se independiza por que las cuotas grupales le resultaban insuficientes su cumplimiento, siempre fué puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Podemos indicar que la señora Cristina B. tiene 5 hijos pequeños para quienes trabaja con mucho esfuerzo, con el fin D. costear su educación y alimentación, por lo cual podemos indicar que la señora es pìlar fundamental en el sustento diario D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina B. has worked with our institution since 2004. She sells underwear in a clothing market that is very well-known in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is an old client who previously received loans as part of a group. She became independent from these groups because they weren't satisfactory with their commitments. She was always punctual with her payments. We can point out that Cristina B. has five children for whom she works with a lot of effort, with the goal of paying for their education and food. We can tell you that Cristina is a fundamental pillar in the daily support of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice, oil and vegetables

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Santos Matamoros, tengo 66 años de edad. toda mi vida me he dedicado a la sastreria con lo cual he sacado adelante mi hogar y mi familia, en mi barrio me conocen muy bien y la gente dice que yo me esmero en mi trabajo, por eso es que a la gente les gusta que yo les costure, soy una mujer luchadora y siempre estoy a la orden para cualquier trabajo que me pidan, en estos momentos necesito comprar repuestos y varios materiales para mi maquina de costurar tambien necesito comprar telas, hilos, etc, ya que vienen las epocas de navidad y la gente compra bastante ropa. necesito el credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Santos Matamoros. I am 66 years old. For all of my life I have been a tailor, which is how I have helped my household and family to get ahead. I am very well known in my neighborhood and everyone says that I go to great pains to do a good job. That's why people like what I sew for them. I am a determined woman and am always at my clients' disposal for whatever work they order. I currently need to purchase spare parts and various materials for my sewing machine. I also need to purchase fabric, thread, etc., seeing the Christmas season is coming up and people buy a lot of clothes. I need this loan to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for sewing machine and materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Elena representado por la señora Wilma es un grupo bastante emprendedor que se dedican en una mayoría al comercio y venta de comida, legumbres, bebidas, joyería algunos son transportistas, todos con muchas ganas de trabajar y de prosperar en su negocio. Ellas saben lo que es el trabajar con grupos solidarios ya que es su segundo ciclo trabajando con nuestra Fundación, son gente dinámica y con experiencia en sus diferentes rubros, a pesar de la oferta y la demanda en el M. saben como trabajar para salir adelante. 
El financiamiento esta destinado a hacer crecer su negocio y al incremento de insumos para sus negocios.
En la foto se encuentras dos señores en representacion de sus esposas las cuales se encuentran en su negocio y no pudieron asistir a la reunion semanal realizada por el grupo.
texts.en:
The "Santa Elena" group, represented by Mrs. Wilma, is a very enterprising group whose members work primarily in the buying/selling of food, legumes, drinks, jewelry, and some are in transportation. They all have a great willingness to work and prosper in their businesses. These women know what it is like to work within solidarity groups as this is their second time around working with our Foundation. They are a dynamic group with experience in their various businesses; they know how to work in the market of supply and demand in order to get ahead. The financing will be used to grow their business and acquire materials. The two men shown in the photograph were attending the group's weekly meeting as representatives for their wives, who had to work.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a member of the Sonriza (“Smile”) Village Bank. She lives in a village just outside of the city of Ayacuco with her husband and their four children. There she makes bricks by hand with the help of several workers. She sells the bricks in the same community, and also makes home deliveries in the city of Ayacucho.

As another source of income, she buys fruits and plants from local producers and brings them to Ayacucho to sell to distibutors. These plants include cochinilla, which is used to color makeup; tara, a plant with medicinal properties; and prickly pear. Erlinda needs a loan of 2000 soles (US$650) to buy tara and cochinilla. Her dreams are to expand her businesses and to continue to grow with them. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Erlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa. Erlinda es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Erlinda se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza diariamente en un pueblo cercano a la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad y también reparte a domicilio en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Erlinda compra cochinilla, tara, tuna en su comunidad y luego de acopiar lo vende a los intermediarios. Erlinda necesita un préstamo de 2000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla. Los sueños de Erlinda son ampliar sus negocios, seguir creciendo con sus negocios.

loans.use: Buy Peruvian plants (tara, cochinilla) to resell to distributors

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotras somos el grupo de las mujeres emprendedoras estamos formadas por 5 integrantes, Bertha S. soy la coordinadora del grupo, tengo 49 años, La Sra. Sara Patricia H. tiene 29 años de edad, la Sra. Dina Luz O. tiene 37 años de edad, la Sra. Maria V. de 40 años de edad y la Sra Edis N. de 35 años de edad, todas contamos con el apoyo de nuestros esposos para el sustento de nuestros hogares, tambien nos ayudan nuestros hijos en el trabajo, tenemos 5 años de concernos y nos llevamos muy bien, creo que hemos formado un laso amistoso muy fuerte como si fueramos una familia, todas vivimos en la colonia Fraternidad Ismael Acosta en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, nuestro rubro de ventas son las golosinas, venta de ropa, perfumes y achinerias, todas tenemos una fiel clientela ya que estos tipos de productos son de mucha demanda en el mercado, nosotras hemos buscado solicitar un credito para invertir mas en nuestros negocios para que nos queden mayores ganancias.
nuestro proposito es invertir en nuestros negocios para mejorar la atencion a sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos y darles mejor futuro a nuestros hijos.
texts.en:
We are a group of businesswomen made up of five core members: Bertha S., 49 years old (I am the coordinator for the group); Mrs. Sara Patricia H., 29 years old; Mrs. Dina Luz O., 37 years old; Mrs. Maria V., 40 years old; and Mrs. Edis N., 35 years old. Our husbands support us by helping out at home and with the kids. We have known one another for five years and we all get along very well, having created a strong bond of friendship akin to family. We all live in the Fraternidad Ismael Acosta neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. We sell sweets, clothing, perfumes, and sundries. Our client base is very loyal and our products are in high demand in the market. We are applying for a loan which we will invest in our businesses in order to improve our customer service to increase our profits so we may provide a better future for our children.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce foodstuffs and buy clothing, perfumes, and sundries

loans.name: Torres Group

texts.es:
El g/s TORRES  este grupo se formo en la comunidad de llano grande una comarca del municipio de masaya  vienen de un sector bien pobre y humilde donde el acceso al colegio es un privilegio son de carácter muy pasivo y calladas, Cuando adim las visito y les otorgo su primer crédito y las capacito el g/s se dio cuenta de lo útil que son para la sociedad y de esta manera decidieron salir del campo para poner su negocio en la ciudad 
Comenzaron su negocio con un capital no mayor de C$1000.00 con adim llevan 3 créditos y con montos mayores a los C$2300.00, sus créditos los invierten en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.
 Doña Maria Elena  pertenece al g/s TORRES  es  casada su  familia es pequeña. A su edad se siente una persona útil y piensa seguir trabajando y ampliando cada vez más su oferta de productos. Es beneficiaria de un tercer ciclo de crédito y se siente orgullosa de no haber quedado mal con ADIM que le ha venido financiando desde hace varios años. 
El g/s  ha recibido capacitaciones  de autoestima y administración del negocio. Su mayor aprendizaje ha sido que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, pues así se queda bien, se puede tener un nuevo crédito y progresar.
texts.en:
The communal bank Torres was formed in the community of Llano Grande, a municipal region in Masaya. The members come from a poor and humble area, where going to school is a privilege. They are very passive and shy people. When ADIM visited them and disbursed the first loan, coupled with training, the group realized the usefulness of the loans for society. They decided to leave the countryside to start a business in the city. They began their store with no more than C$1000.00. The group now has had three loans with ADIM of more than C$2300.00. Their loans have been invested in the purchase of essential products. Mrs. Maria Elena is part of the communal bank Torres, is married, and has a small family. At her age, she feels useful and plans to keep working and expanding her product offering. She will be receiving a third loan, and she feels proud that she has not hurt her relationship with ADIM, which has been financing her for several years. The communal bank has received trainings on self-esteem and business administration. The most impactful lesson has been that in order to make progress, she must save. In this way, she can take out a new loan and make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital; improve the conditions of the store

loans.name: Lidia Susana

texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Los Claveles (“The Carnations”) Village Bank. She is married and has four children; two are in school and two work. Lidia has a hardware store where she sells construction materials like cement, iron rods, bricks, and tubes. She works every day and her children also help out. 

Lidia needs a loan of 3000 soles (US$975) which she will use to buy cement. Her dreams are for her children to finish school, to open up another hardware store for her children to run, and for her business to prosper. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.

Lidia es casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 estudian y 2 trabajan, Lidia tiene una ferretería en donde vende materiales de construcción como cemento, fierros, ladrillos, tubos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cemento.

Lidia sueña que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener otra ferretería para sus hijos y que prospere su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Anel Giovanna

texts.es: Anel es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles. Anel es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudio administración de empresas en la universidad nacional de la ciudad, Anel junto a su mama tienen una ferretería donde vende materiales de construcción como fierros, cemento, agregados, sus ventas son en la misma tienda y también reparten a domicilio. Anel necesita un préstamo de 3000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción. Anel sueña con estudiar una maestría en Administración de Empresas y aperturar otras tiendas sucursales.
texts.en:
Anel is a member of the Los Claveles (“The Carnations”) Village Bank. Anel is single and lives with her parents. She studies Business Administration in Ayacucho’s National University. She and her mother have a hardware store where they sell construction materials like iron rods, cement and aggregates. They sell from their store and also make home deliveries. Anel needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use to buy construction materials. Anel dreams of getting a Master’s degree in Business Administration and of opening up more branches of her hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
Con cinco ciclos de crédito cancelados el grupo solidario FUERZA esta compuesta por 3 miembros que habitan en el barrio monimbo de masaya, estas clientas son bien emprendedoras ya que las tres trabajan a la par de sus esposos  y  entre los dos mantiene a su familia. 
Sus negocios están ubicados en el mercado de masaya su tramo no tiene techo venden a la intemperie, aun así ellas sienten que han crecido a la par de sus negocios, ya que ahora cuentan con mayor inversión.
Doña Maria es coordinadora del g/s FUERZA su negocio lo tiene ubicado por la maya sur del mercado, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor, su esposo también es comerciante y entre los dos se ayudan mutuamente. .de ADIM se siente agradecida  tanto de los créditos como de las capacitaciones que ha recibido a lo largo de cuatro años, en los que ha visto crecer y florecer su negocio. Ellas sueña con comprar mas mercadería sobre todo al acercarse navidad  y poder en el futuro llegar a tener un tramo muy grande y surtido que produzca los suficientes para que sus hijos  vivan en  buenas condiciones 
Están mas que  clara que para lograr su sueño necesita ser puntual con sus créditos tanto con ADIM como con los proveedores.
texts.en:
Having already participated in five loan cycles, the communal bank Fuerza is made up of three members that live in the Monimbo neighborhood of Masaya. These clients are very entrepreneurial, as all three work. Their husbands work as well, and between each other, they support their families. Their businesses are located in the Masaya market. They sell in the open, as their market area does not have a roof. They feel that they have grown along with their businesses, as they now depend on larger investments. Mrs. Maria is the coordinator of Fuerza. Her business is located in the southern portion of the market. She counts on the support of her eldest daughter. Her husband is also a shopkeeper; they mutually help each other out. She feels grateful for ADIM, not only because of the loans, but also because of the trainings she has received these past four years, which have allowed her store to grow and flourish. She hopes to purchase more merchandise, especially now that we are approaching Christmas. She also hopes to own a large, assorted stretch to produce enough to provide her children with good living conditions. It is very clear to her that in order to succeed she must repay her loans on time, both to ADIM and to her suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital; Investing in more products since the time for high sales is approaching

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
El g/s  LOS JARDINES ellos están en su noveno ciclo son de la comunidad del capulín carretera agranada, son personas humildes pero emprendedoras, tiene la primaria aprobada y eso les permites ser bien expresivas y han logrado que la intendencia del mercado les asigne un tramo de madera para la venta de sus productos ellos  compran cosechas de temporadas y las venden al detalle en el mercado de Masaya. Sus créditos los han invertidos en la compra de cosechas de frutas y vegetales de temporada.
Con el crédito de adim han tenido la oportunidad de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, ya que con las ganancias además de invertir en sus negocios también han realizado mejoras en sus hogares. Doña Lissette  es madre de dos hijos y no cuenta con ningún tipo de apoyo del padre de los mismos. Considera que gracias a ADIM ha podido enfrentar la vida y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y le ha permitido a sus hijos asistir a la escuela. Ella sueña con que a ellos no les toque la misma suerte por lo que su mayor empeño está puesto en que avancen en sus estudios. Este g/s ha sido capacitado por ADIM en la administración de su negocio lo que le ha permitido ser exitosos en el mismo pues cumple con sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Su sueño es de llegar a obtener una finca para poder ellos sembrar las frutas y obtener mayores ganancias,  para lograrlo se han  propuesto ahorrar y administrar bien el dinero.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Jardines is in its ninth loan cycle. They are from the Capulín community on the highway to Granada. They are humble people, yet entrepreneurial. They have a primary school education, which allows them to be very expressive. They have convinced the superintendence of the market to assign them a wooden stretch to sell their products, which they purchase for each season and sell retail at the Masaya market. Their loans have been invested in the purchase of seasonal fruits and vegetables. The loan with ADIM has given the group the opportunity of improving their standard of living, as on top of investing in their businesses, they have been able to use their profits to improve their houses. Mrs. Lissette is the mother of two children and does not count on support from their father. She believes that thanks to ADIM, she has been able to face life and cover the basic, necessary costs for her family. Also, it has permitted her children to go to school. She hopes that her children will not be touched by her same fortune, and therefore she is most determined to further her children’s studies. This communal bank has been trained by ADIM in business administration, which has allowed them to be successful in the repayment of their loans. Their dream is to obtain a farm for them to plant fruits and improve their profits. In order to do that, they have decided to save and manage their money.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital; Greater investment in products to generate more profit

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El Sr. Orlando R., pequeño productor y socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza junto a su esposa se dedican a la produccion de arroz por esfuerzo propio con 4 Mzs establecidos en el ciclo secano; diariamente a tempranas horas el Sr. R. atiende el manejo agronomico de su cultivo acompañado de su esposa en estas actividades.  A traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de acceder como socio de la construccion de 1 trillo arrozero, lo que le permitira reducir sus costos y llevar su cosecha hasta el final y asi obtener mejores beneficios de su cultivo; su vision del futuro es ser socio de este trillo y contar con mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar y formar un mejor futuro a su familia, para lo cual solicita financiamiento de C$.15,000.00 a AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Orlando R., a small producer and a member of the cooperative La Esperanza. Along with his spouse, he works growing rice. By his own effort with 4 Mzs established in the dry season. Daily in the early hours Orlando attends to the agricultural work of his fields, accompanied by his wife in these activities. Through the cooperative he has had the opportunity to join as a member in the construction of a rice thresher. This allows him to reduce his costs and carry his harvest through the end, and so obtain benefits to his crop. His vision of the future is to be a member of this thresher and to have better incomes that would allow him to improve the conditions of his family’s life, and to make a better future for his family. For this he is asking for a loan of CS.15,000.00 from AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% of the construction of the thresher La Peña

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Ccori Soncco (“Heart of Gold” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is married and has ten children. She has a store in her house in the Enace neighborhood where she sells general dry goods, vegetables, meats, and grains with the help of her husband. She also caters meals for various occasions. 

Maura needs a loan of 2000 soles (US$325) which she will use to buy grains, sugar, pasta and oil. Maura’s dreams are for her children to grow up to be professionals, to expand her store and to equip it with all of the necessities. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa Corazon de Oro en quechua. 

Maura es casada y tiene 10 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Urbanización Enace en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, cereales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Maura realiza el servicio de preparación de comidas para diversos compromisos.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 2000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, azúcar, fideo, aceite.

Los sueños de Maura son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar, equipar su tienda con todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Buy grains, sugar, pasta and oil

loans.name: Alexa Group

texts.es:
El g/s ALEXA esta conformado de tres mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras las que viven en la zona periférica de la ciudad de Masaya, sus negocios lo tienen ubicados en sus casas de habitación, esto les permite a la vez atender los quehaceres de su casa y atender a sus hijos.
Los productos que ofrecen los compran en el mercado de Masaya, abastecen dos veces a la semana ya que los productos son de primera necesidad y la demanda es constante, esto les permite obtener mayores ganancias de sus productos. 
El g/s se ha caracterizado por tener una buena comunicación y solidaridad, esto les permite ser clientes A de adim  y gozan de los beneficios de capacitación y la participación en ferias locales Doña Jamilett es dueña de la pulpería Alexa dice estar realizada como microempresaria por que ha aprovechado los créditos que adim les ha otorgado, van por el 7mo ciclo, esta seguras que el buen comportamiento de pago les mantiene vivo su crédito.Ella espera poder obtener créditos mayores que le permitan hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
ALEXA group was founded by three enterprising and fighting women who live in the suburbs of the town of Masaya. Their businesses are located in their houses, which allows them to carry out household tasks and watch their children at the same time. The products they offer they buy in Masaya market and restock twice a week as the products are all essential goods and the demand is constant: this allows them to obtain better profits for their products. This group is characterized by its good communication and unity, which has made them A-list clients of Adim and allowed them to enjoy the benefits of training and partiipacion in local trade fairs. Doña Jamilett is the proprietor of Alexa grocery store and she says the buisness has become a true micro-business because she has taken advantage of the credits which Adim have authorised. She's now in the 7th cycle, and she's certain that her timely repayments to them have kept her credit active. She hopes to be able to obtain greater credits which will permit her business to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of products in order to offer their customers variety and increase their profits

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es: El Sr. R. L., pequeño productor de arroz y socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria actualmente tiene establecido por esfuerzo propio 4 mzs de arroz, el que atiende personalemente y en el manejo agronomico del cultivo, siendo su principal problema la trillada de la produccion, lo que reduce sus ingresos para el sustento familiar.  A traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio para el montaje de un trillo de arroz en su comunidad, su sueño es ser socio de este trillo y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida familiar ya que obtendria mejores precios y mayores ingresos para el futuro familiar.
texts.en:
R. L. is a producer of rice and is a member of the farming cooperative. He has established through his own efforts 4 plantations of rice, attending to them personnally including cultivation, this being his greatest problem in production and the factor that most reduces his family's income. Through his cooperative he has the opportunity to participate in the store of rice for the community. His dream is to be a partner of this cooperative so that he may provide better living conditions for his family. He would obtain better prices and yield a greater income for the future of his family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% portion towards the construction in La Pena.

loans.name: Clon Group

texts.es:
El  g/s CLON  esta conformado por 3 integrante mujeres que viven en la zona semi urbana de la ciudad de Masaya todas son madres solteras han pasado por la mala experiencia de no poder contar con el apoyo del papa de sus hijos. Ellas han iniciado su negocio con capital pequeño  solicitaron su primer crédito con adim y se dieron cuneta de los beneficios que se obtienen cuando invierten bien en su negocio y pagan a tiempo su crédito.
Doña  Alba es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella nos manifiesta que su g/s tiene éxito por la buena comunicación y solidaridad de sus integrantes  piensan seguir trabajando y ampliando cada vez más  productos. Son beneficiadas de Es beneficiaria de un tercer ciclo de crédito y se siente orgullosa de no haber quedado mal con ADIM que le ha venido financiando desde hace varios años. 
El g/s ha recibido capacitaciones  en economía y administración del negocio. Su mayor aprendizaje ha sido que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, pues así se queda bien, se pude tener un nuevo crédito y progresar. 
Uno de sus mayores deseos de los miembros del g/s es   poder ampliar y mejorar su casa, para tal propósito ellas de las ganancias del préstamo está ahorrando para que a final de año poder invertir en su casa
texts.en:
The group CLON is made up of 3 women members that live in the outskirts of the city of Masaya. They are all single mother that has been through the terrible experience of not being able to count on the support of the father of their children. They have started a business with a small capital they obtained from their first loan with Adim and they noted the benefits of investment into their business, always making sure to repay their loan on time.

Alba is the coordinator of the gruop. She says that their group is successful due to their good communication habits and the loyatly of the members. They are plan on continuing their work and expanding their selection of products each time. She has benefitted from 3 past loans and she feels prouble that she has remained on good terms with Adim, the organization that has been financing her efforts for many years.

The group has received support financially and in the administration of their business. Their greatest experience has been learning how to save money, and therefore remain on good terms and then be eligible for future loans.

One of their greatest dreams is to make improvements and expansions to their houses. To this end they are saving their earnings made possible through the loan to be able to invest into their homes at year's end.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: to increase the selection of their products.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. A. es un pequeño productor de arroz de secano en la comunidad de Belen, habita junto a su familia, 2 niños en edad escolar  (5to y 6to grado de primaria) y 1 que se dedica al trabajo en las areas de cultivo junto al padre; actualmente realizan manejo a 6 mzs de arroz por esfuerzo propio, historicamente han presentado problemas para el proceso de trillado de arroz, teniendo que vender en granza la cosecha y reducia sus ingresos, a traves de su cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio en la construccion de un trillo tecnificado, lo que le permitria mejorar su nivel de ingreso familiar y asi cambiar sus condiciones de vida que siempre ha sido su mayor ilusion pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
A. is a producer of rice in the community of Belen. He lives with his family, including 2 children that are school aged (in grade 5 and grade 6) and another child that works in farming along his side. Currently they are farming 6 plantations of rice through their own efforts. In the past they have had problems in harvesting the rice, having to sell their rice in advance and see reduced earnings. Through their cooperative La Esperanza, he has the opportunity to participate as a member in the construction of a storage facility. This will allow their family income to increase and therefore change their quality of life. It has always been a dream to seek the best for his family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute a 30% portion towards the construction of a storage facility in La Pena.

loans.name: Palmeras Amarillas Group

texts.es:
G/S PALMERAS AMARILLAS, nace por la necesidad de hacer crecer su negocio, esta miembros del g/s son vecinas  viven en la villa 26 de febrero un barrio de la ciudad de Masaya, son de condición humildes, a veces expresivas otras muy calladas, son respetuosas y de trato muy amable. Iniciaron su negocio por la necesidad de obtener ingresos que les ayuden a soportar la carga económica de sus compañeros, por vivir cerca de un colegio, esto les permita tener el negocio en sus casas ya que sus productos los ofertan a los estudiantes, que además de ser baratos son atractivos para la edad escolar.
   Doña Angélica  ha ido ofertando mas productos  entre los cuales están los helados puestos que con el crédito de Adim compro una refrigeradora, la que le permite ofrecer a los estudiantes y vecinos  gaseosa, hielo y helados 
Las miembros de este g/s sueñan con llegar a tener una pulpería, debido a su tenacidad ellas saben que lo va a   lograr, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposos e hijos mayores el  cual han sido muy colaboradores en los proyectos que emprenden su mama.
texts.en:
The group “Palmeras amarillas” began out of the necessity to grow their businesses. These members are neighbors that live in the Villa 26 of February neighborhood of Masaya city. They are humble, at times expressive and other times quiet, they are respectful and friendly. They began their business out of the necessity of obtaining additional income to support their homes. As they live close to a school, this enables them to have the business in their homes as their products are offered to students, in addition to being in expensive and attractive to school age customers. Doña Angélica has been offering many products including ice cream because with the loan from Adim she bought a refrigerator that allows her to offer the students and neighbors soda pop, ice and ice cream. The members of this group dream of having a convenience store. With their tenacity they know that they are going to achieve it, as they have the support of their spouses and older children in supporting the projects that their wives and mothers have undertaken.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Praderas Group

texts.es:
Las clientas del g/s  PRADERAS viene del barrio german pomares es una zona semi rural  de la ciudad de Masaya son de condición humildes y modesta, todas tuvieron la oportunidad de aprobar  primaria, esto las hace un poco expresivas en cuanto a lo que pretenden conseguir. 2 Miembros tiene negocio de elaboración de calzado y la coordinadora es dueña de una abarrotería, sus créditos los usan en la compra de inventarios para hacer crecer sus negocios, las clientas están confiadas en el éxito de sus negocios por que tiene buena ubicación y demanda de  sus productos. De aspecto muy humilde esta microempresarias nos han demostrado que se puede salir adelante cuando se tiene la disponibilidad, valor y tenacidad para salir de la pobreza, 
 Doña Thania le gustaría que su negocio se expandiera para obtener mayor ganancias y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, Eugenia, es otra de las integrantes dice que ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio, necesita mas materia prima  ya que sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración de sandalias, y de esta manera asegurarle la educación a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
The members of the PRADERAS communal bank come from the German Pomares neighborhood, which is located in a semi-rural zone in the city of Masaya. They come from modest backgrounds, although they have had the opportunity to complete primary school, which makes them ambicious in terms of what they set out to achieve. Two of the members have a business making shoes and the other is the owner of a grocery store. They use their loans to buy inventory to increase the size of their businesses. The women are confident in the continued success of their businesses due to their good locations and the customer demand for their products. In a very humble way, these microenterpeneurs have demostrated that it is possible to get ahead when one has the willingness, courage and tenacity to get out of poverty. Thania would like her business to expand in order to gain more income and to be able improve the living conditions of her family. Eugenia, another member of the group, says that she wants to grow her business and needs more raw materials since her children can help her making the sandals, and thus secure an education for her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and supply their businesses

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 45 años esta divorciada de su pareja y vive con su hija Jazmín de 9 años de edad. Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina,(lencería), desde hace 25 años tiempo en el cual ha recavado mucha experiencia para abrirse campo en este rubro. Nelly suele empezar su trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la noche realizando la venta de forma ambulatoria. La venta es buena ya que Nelly se esfuerza por adquirir mercadería novedosa y de buena calidad para ofrecer a su clientela, siendo lo más difícil el viaje para conseguir la mercadería. Es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero del préstamo viajara a otras ciudades a adquirir mayor mercadería y así espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old. She is divorced from her husband and lives with her daughter Jazmín, who is 9 years old. Nelly has been selling lingerie for 25 years, time during which she has gotten a lot of experience so that she can make headway in this field. Nelly usually begins work at 8 in the morning until 5 or 6 at night, working as a street vendor. Sales are good and Nelly works hard to obtain new and interesting merchandise of good quality to offer to her customers. The most difficult part is traveling to get the merchandise. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual in her payments. With the money from the loan she will travel to other cities to obtain more merchandise and thereby increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover expenses for traveling to the city and buying more merchandise.

loans.name: Ariel Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. G.
