S. habita en la comunidad de La Peña-Tecolostote junto a su mamá y 3 hermanos , como hijo mayor asume la responsabilidad de la familia, ya que su papá por su edad se ve incapacitado, sus hermanos y el se dedican a la siembra de arroz, por esfuerzo propio tienen establecidas 6 mzs de arroz secano; durante su cosecha se ven obligados a vender su produccion en granza a bajo precio. El Sr. G. es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza a traves de la cual tiene la oportunidad de participar en la construccion de un trillo de propiedad asociativa, para lo cual requiere de un financiamiento de C$.15,000.00, de esta manera considera que estara realizando su sueño de ser socio de esta futura empresa productiva en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. G. S. lives in the La Peña-Tecolostote community with his mother and 3 siblings. As the oldest son he assumes the responsibility for the family, as his father is incapacitated due to his age. His siblings and he grow rice, and through their efforts have established 6 blocks of rice for drying. During the harvest they are obligated to sell their harvest at low prices. Mr. Gonzales is a member of the agricultural cooperative “La Esperanza” (Hope) through which he has the opportunity to participate in the construction of a threshing machine owned by the cooperative, and requires a financing of C$.15,000.00 and in this way realize the dream of being a member of this productive business in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Support 30% of the construction of a rice thrushing machine

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 41 años vive con su esposo Rubén de 43 años, que es abogado y sus cuatro hijos  Abel de 18, Luis de 17, Edith de 14 y Ruth de 3. Raquel se dedica a la venta de ropa de 2da mano para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, ella suele comprar grandes fardos de ropa que llegan usualmente los días jueves traídas desde estados unidos. Lo que le gusta a Raquel de su trabajo es la independencia que le da el contar con su  propio dinero para los gastos del hogar y no depender del trabajo de su esposo. Las ventas usualmente son buenas ya que la gente suele comprar mucho estas prendas por su calidad y bajo precio, mayormente los días jueves que salen en feria. Raquel con el préstamo que viene solicitando comprara más fardos de ropa americana para vender.
texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, Ruben, 43 years old, who is a lawyer, and their four children: Abel, 18 years old, Luis, 17 years old, Edith, 14 years old, and Ruth, 3 years old. Raquel sells 2nd-hand clothes to help with the household expenses. She buys large bales of clothing that usually arrive on Thursdays, brought from the United States. What Raquel likes about her job is the independence that having her own money gives her for household expenses and not having to depend on her husband’s job. Sales are usually good, since people generally buy a lot of these clothes because of their quality and low price, usually on Thursdays which are market days. With the money from the loan that Raquel is requesting, she will buy more bales of American clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años es madre soltera  de una hija de 14 años llamada Juana. Rosa se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de productos comestibles en su tienda la cual puso tras varios años de duro esfuerzo.
Ella siempre quiso tener un negocio propio el cual poder administrar de manera independiente y que le permita tener cierta libertad para poder pasar más tiempo con su hija de 14 años, que se encuentra en una edad de muchos cambios. La  venta mejora cada vez más y es por eso que Rosa quiere expandirse y comprar más mercadería. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero del préstamo Rosa abastecerá su tienda de mejores productos para si mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and is a single mother of a 14-year-old daughter named Juana. For four years Rosa had dedicated herself to selling groceries in her store, which she got after several years of hard work. She always wanted to have her own business that she could manage independently and that would allow her to have some freedom to spend more time with her 14 year-old daughter, who is now in an age of many changes. Her sales improve all the time and that is why Rosa wants to expand and purchase more merchandise. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance and she is very punctual in her payments. With the money from the loan Rosa will supply her store with better products, which will improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her store with better products

loans.name: Severa

texts.es: Severa tiene 52 años es divorciada vive con su hijo pedro de 16 años de edad. Severa es una mujer muy emprendedora, y siempre le ha gustado las artes culinarias, haciendo que hace 02 años decida poner un restaurante para deleitar a la clientela con sus ricos potajes. La venta de desayunos, almuerzos y cenas es muy buena, motivando a Severa a poner una sucursal de su restaurante, pero ella sabe que para eso aún debe trabajar mucho más para cumplir todas sus metas. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita Severa ella comprara algunas cosas para implementar su nuevo restaurante.
texts.en:
Severa is 52 years old, divorced, and lives with her son Pedro, who is 16 years old. Severa is a very enterprising woman and she has always liked culinary arts. Two years ago she decided to open a restaurant to delight her clientele with her delicious dishes. The sale of breakfasts, lunches and dinners is very good and motivates Severa to open a branch of her restaurant, but she knows that to do this she needs to work much harder to accomplish all of her goals. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance. With the money that Severa is asking for, she will buy various items to open her new restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open her restaurant with various furniture and utensels

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica tiene 22 años es soltera vive en casa de su familia. Yessica es una joven trabajadora que en busca de un futuro mejor y lograr independencia económica de su familia decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que le permite cubrir todas sus necesidades. Lo más difícil del trabajo de Yessica es el frió que hace en su tienda teniendo ella que atender todo el día, pero ella piensa que es una molestia mínima a comparación de todos los beneficios que su negocio le arroja. Las ventas han mejorado gracias a la voluntad de salir adelante haciendo que Yessica se sienta muy esperanzada en expandir su negocio. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual. Con el dinero del préstamo Yessica comprara un mostrador para mejorar la exposición de sus productos y que se vendan  mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Yessica is 22 years old, single, and lives at home with her family. Yessica is a hard-working youth in search of a better future and to achieve economic independence from her family she decided to open a grocery store, a business that allows her to cover all of her necessities. The most difficult part of Yessica's work is the cold in her store that she has to attend all day long, but she thinks this a minor hassle compared to all of the benefits that her business gives her. Sales have improved thanks to the spirit of moving forward and Yessica feels very hopeful about expanding her business. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance, being very punctual. With the money from the loan Yessica will buy a display case to improve the exposure of her products so they will sell better.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case for her store

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es: El Sr. A. R., pequeño productor agropecuario, socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza localizada en Tecolostote, junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 hijos en edad escolar (3ero y 4to grado de primaria); por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 3 mzs de arroz, durante la cosecha se le presenta un problema con la trillada del grano, lo que le altera los costos y reduce sus ingresos que le permiten el sustento de la familia; a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar en la construccion de 1 trillo, para lo que requiere un financiamiento de C$,15,000.00 y asi alcanzar cumplir con su sueño de ser socio de este trillo.
texts.en:
Mr. A. R. owns a small farm and is a member of the “La Esperanza” (Hope) cooperative located in Tecolostote. His family consists of his spouse and 2 school age children (in 3rd and 4th year of primary school). Through his own effort he has established 3 blocks of rice, during the harvest he has a problem with threshing the grain, which impacts his costs and reduces his income that he uses to support his family. Through the cooperative he has the opportunity to participate in the construction of a rice thresher, for which he needs financing of C$, 15,000.00 and in this way make is dream of being a member of this cooperative’s thresher reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide 30% of the funding to build a rice thresher

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 33 años es soltera vive con su hermana en una casa alquilada. Yolanda se dedica a atender su pequeña tienda de comestibles, hace ya dos años creciendo poco a poco gracias al duro esfuerzo de Yolanda.  Su pequeña tienda esta siendo preferida por los clientes gracias a la variedad de productos que Yolanda ofrece, pero ella quiere implementar aún más su pequeño negocio para no tener competencia. Lo tedioso de su trabajo es el tiempo que Yolanda  pasa en su trabajo ya que abre desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, pero Yolanda sabe que se debe a sus clientes y la esperanza de un futuro mejor hace que ella siga trabajando con mucho empeño y alegría. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero del préstamo Yolanda implementara con productos más variados su pequeña tienda para así obtener su preferencia.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 33 years old, single, and lives with her sister in a rented house. Yolanda is dedicated to tending her small grocery store. For two years it has grown little by little thanks to the hard work of Yolanda. Her small store is preferred by customers thanks to the variety of products that Yolanda offers, but she wants to do even more so she won't have competition. The tedious part of her job is the time that Yolanda spends at work, which is open from 6 in the morning until 9 or 10 at night, but Yolanda knows that she owes her customers and she hopes in the future that she will continue working hard with joy. This is her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money from the loan Yolanda will add a greater variety of products to her small store to be able to obtain her preference.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Cléber

texts.es: Clever tiene 29 años  es soltero vive en casa de su familia. Clever se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chompas tejidas a lana, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años, aprendiendo de su madre quien era muy diestra en este arte. A Cléber siempre le ha llamado la atención el tejido ya que veía desde muy pequeño a su madre confeccionar diversos tipos de prendas, además que le permite crear y desarrollar toda su creatividad. Lo más difícil del tejido es el  utilizar la máquina ya que el tiene que realizar diversos tipos de puntos para elaborar las chompas que posteriormente vende en los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita Clever, comprara más lana para aumentar la producción de chompas de su pequeño taller.
texts.en:
Cléber is a 29-year-old bachelor who lives at home with his family. He makes and sells knitted wool sweaters, a business in which he has been engaged for six years, having learned it from his mother who was a very skilled artisan. Cléber has been interested in knitting since he saw his mother making various types of garments when he was young, and it lets him create and develop the whole range of his creativity. The greatest difficulty in knitting is using the machine as he has to choose all sorts of settings in order to make the sweaters he will later sell in the city’s busiest marketplaces. Cléber made all the payments on his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma on time. With the money that he is requesting, Cléber will buy more wool to increase the output of sweaters from his small workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool to produce more sweaters

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 21 años es  soltera, natural de la ciudad de Lima vive sola en un cuarto que alquilo. Delia al migrar de la capital hace dos años decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de chompas de lana, ya que siempre le gusto tejer y es lo que mejor sabe hacer. Delia vende Chompas por pedidos los cuales vende en la ciudad de Juliaca los días de feria y  también lleva a la ciudad de Cuzco. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tiempo que le demora tejer las chompas ya que los pedidos son abundantes y a veces ella no se abastece en terminar todos los pedidos. Es su primer préstamo en microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que Delia esta solicitando quiere comprar algunos repuestos de su máquina para hacerla trabajar al máximo y también  comprar material en lana, hilos, etc.
texts.en:
Delia is 21 years old and single. She is from Lima and she lives alone in a rented room. Delia left the capital two years ago and decided to start a business making and selling wool sweaters. She's always liked to weave and she knows how to do it well. Delia sells sweaters by request, and also on market days in the cities of Juliaca and Cuzco. The most difficult part of her job is that it takes a long time to sew the sweaters and sometimes she isn't able to fill all of her orders. This is Delia's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She'll use the money to buy some replacement parts for her loom so that it can work at maximum efficiency. She'll also buy materials like wool, thread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for her loom

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela tiene 23 años es soltera y vive sola ya que no tuvo familia aun. Gracias al arduo esfuerzo de Graciela hace cuatro meses pudo abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, ella siempre ha trabajado siempre muy duro y ahora que tiene su propio negocio quiere que este salga adelante, en busca de un mejor porvenir. Las ventas están subiendo y Graciela quiere abastecer la gran demanda de su clientela abasteciendo su tienda de más productos. A ella no se le hace difícil su trabajo ya que sabe que el trabajo dignifica y que mejor sabiendo que le traerá gratificaciones futuras. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero del préstamo Graciela comprara mas productos para implementar su tienda y lograr mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Graciela is 23 years old; she is single and lives alone, she still has no children. Thanks to Graciela's strong efforts as of four months ago, she was able to open a store where she sells food. She has always worked very had and now has her own business and would like for it to be successful as she strives for a better living. Her sales are increasing and Graciela wants to restock to meet the needs of her growing customer base, and also would like to have more products. She does not consider her work hard since she believes that work dignifies a person and knows that it will bring her gratification in the future. It is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money of the loan, Graciela will purchase more products to sell at her store and to achieve more income.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to stock her store

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 39 años es madre soltera de una hija de 13 años llamada Anacecilia. Las ganas de progresar de Felicia han hecho que ella incursione en el negocio de la venta de Ropa para mantener a su hija la cual es el motor que impulsa su vida. A Felicia le gusta trabajar en la venta de ropa ya que es un trabajo que no requiere mucho esfuerzo y le da la libertad de apoyar a su hija con sus estudios, además la venta es buena y cada vez va mejorando. Felicia vende mantas, pantalones, poleras, etc las cuales son vendidas muy rápido por la calidad y los bonitos diseños, haciendo que su negocio crezca cada vez mas y dando a Felicia las esperanzas de progreso y un futuro mejor. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero con que apoyes a Felicia comprara mas cantidad de mantas que es lo que se vende mejor.
texts.en:
Felicia is 39 years old, and the single mother of one 13-year old daughter named Anacecilia. Her desire to get ahead led her to start a business selling clothing in order to support her daughter who is the sole motivation in her life. Felicia likes to work selling clothing since it is work that doesn’t require much effort, and gives her the freedom to help her daughter with her studies. In addition, sales are good and continue to improve. Felicia sells blankets, pants, t-shirts, etc., that sell quickly because of their quality and lovely designs. This makes her business grow each day and gives Felicia hope for progress and a brighter future. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds with which you support Felicia, she will buy more blankets as these are what sell best.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of blankets to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 34 años es  madre soltera de dos hijos Alexis de 15 y Henry de 12. Mariluz se dedica a la venta de artículos varios como detergentes, cepillos, artesanías, etc en el pueblo de acora, que esta a 30 minutos de donde ella vive, para  poder cubrir con los gastos de su hogar. Mariluz trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana cuando ha despachado a sus hijos al colegio, terminando a las 5 o 6 de la tarde siendo apoyada por sus hijos a su llegada. A Mari luz le parece un trabajo honrado que le permite brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación y cubrir son sus gastos de salud así que esta contenta al realizarlo. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero con que apoyes a Mariluz ella podrá comprar más de sus productos para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 34 years old and a single mother of two children, Alexis,15, and Henry,12. Mariluz is dedicated to selling various items such as detergents, brushes, handicrafts, etc. in the village of Acora, which is 30 minutes away from where she lives, in order to cover the household expenses. Mariluz works from 8 in the morning when she sends her children off to school, finishing at 5 or 6 in the afternoon to help her children when they arrive. For Mariluz this is honest work because it allows her to provide her children a good education and cover their health costs.This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance. With the money provided to Mariluz she will purchase more products to increase her economic earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank, which means “Heart of Gold” in Quechua. Ana is a widow and the mother of two children. She travels to different regional fairs to buy different animals, which she then sells for meat from her home with the help of her daughter. Ana needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to buy sheep and pigs. Ana dreams of educating her children so that they grow up to be working professionals, and of having her own investment capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua. Ana es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, Ana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales diversos que luego beneficia y vende de casa en casa para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de hija. Ana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oveja, cerdos. Ana sueña con educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y mejora su negocio, tener capital propio.

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank, which means “Heart of Gold” in Quechua. Paulina lives with her husband and their four children. She travels to different regional fairs three times per week to sell clothing. She travels to Lima twice per month to buy her wares.
 
Paulina needs a loan of 2000 soles (US$650) to buy sweaters, blankets and jackets. She dreams of expanding her business bit by bit, of opening a clothing store in the city of Ayacucho, and of educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.

Paulina es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Paulina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región tres veces por semana en donde vende ropa, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja 2 veces al mes. 

Paulina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, mantas, casacas.

Paulina sueña con ampliar poco a poco su negocios, abrir una tienda de ropa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy sweaters, blankets and jackets

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy C. is a villager in Trapeang Svay village, Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a 34-year-old farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nget Torn, is a rice mill owner. Their income is not sufficient to support the many members in their family, including their six children. Two of the children attend the local school while three others are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Phy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She plans to sell the calf and thereby start a new business to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions. She is and the mother of six children, Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a breeding cow

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en: Mrs. Sakun S. is a villager in Bakuong Kang Keurt village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a 37-year-old  farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mau Phuon, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Their combined incomes are not enough to support their family, which includes three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Therefore, Mrs. Sakun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a breeding cow

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn P. is a villager in Ang Tapouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sokhorn P. works as a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Eim Vuth, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Unfortunately, the fertility of his fields is low and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to fertilize and work his fields to improve his crops.

In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Sokhorn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire labors to support her husband’s fields and make them more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Sochany

texts.en: Mrs. Sochany Y. is a 33-year-old mother of four children in Thjea village, Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Pen Ny, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Three of the children attend the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sochany Y. purchases brooms and then resells them. She asks for a loan to buy more brooms to continue her business.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Y. was born in 1950 and now lives in Doem Romduol village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Hang Neou, a worker, and has a son who is a construction worker. Mrs. Koem Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her field is infertile and is plagued with pests that adversely affect to her crops. Also, she does not have enough money to hire help to plow her field.

In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Koem Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and farm labor

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun N. is a villager in Damnak Rovang village in Takeo Province. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. 

Mrs. Aun N. buys hens from other people and resells them. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to continue her business. In order to deal with this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy some hens to add  to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. En Sam Oeurn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Her husband appears to her right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy hens

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Rorn N. is a 36-year-old villager who lives with her husband, Mr. Chhoem Chantha, in Pak Bang Ong village, Takeo Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Sa Rorn N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice, while her husband is a layman who arranges ceremonies in the Buddhist monastery. They have five children, one of whom is a construction worker; the others attend the local school. 

The family income is not enough to support them, and so Mrs. Sa Rorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow to start new business.

loans.use: To buy cow for breeding.

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en:
Mr. Phoen P. is a 33-year-old construction worker in Puot Sam village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Neou Yorn, is a duck breeder. They have two children,one of whom attends the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study.

Now Mrs. Neou Yorn faces some problems because she does not have enough money to support her duck breeding business. In order to solve these problems, Mr. Phoen P. decided to request a loan to buy duck feed and ducklings to add his wife’s business. He hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy duck feed and ducklings

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthea L. is a 30-year-old mother of two school-age children in Damnak Rovang village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a chicken breeder who usually buys chicken from the villagers for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Som Samet, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Now she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her business. In order to deal this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy some hens for her business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy some hens to add her business to going well.

loans.name: 01-Xuân Lộc Group

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Kỳ sinh năm 1960 có chồng là Lê Văn Cần. Gia đình chị có năm người con. Hai con đầu đã có gia đình riêng. Ngoài làm ruộng ra anh chị còn làm thêm cả nghề đấnh bắt cá nhỏ ở ven biển. Chị mới tham gia vay vốn được một chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả. Kỳ này chị đăng ký vay 1.626.900 VND. các thành viên khác trong nhóm:
Chị Ngô Thị đông vay 1.626.900 VND để mua lưới đánh bắt cá, ngoài ra chị còn nuôi gà, vịt.
Chị Ngô Thị Tính vay 1.626.900 VND để bán hàng khô ở chợ
Chị T. Thị Thơm vay 1.626.900 VND để chăn nuôi gà , lợn
Chị N. Thị Lý vay 1.626.900 VND để chăn nuôi gà, vịt ...
Chị Ngô Thị Sâm vay 1.626.900 VND mua sắm dụng cụ đánh bắt cá
Chị Lê Thị Lý vay 1.626.900 VND để bán bánh mì rong ngoài ra chị cong chăn nuôi gà, vịt.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Kỳ was born in 1960. She is married to Lê Văn Cần. They have 5 children, the oldest 2 are married. They cultivate their paddy field. They also fish at sea. Mrs Kỳ has already paid back her first loan. This time she is seeking a loan of 1.626.900 VND, the same for other members in her group.
  • Mrs Ngô Thị đông, she needs a loan to buy fishing gear. She also raises poultry
  • Mrs Ngô Thị Tính, she sells dry food at the market
  • Mrs T. Thị Thơm, she raises chickens and pigs
  • Mrs N. Thị Lý , she raises chickens and ducks
  • Mrs Ngô Thị Sâm, she needs a loan to buy fishing gear
  • Mrs Lê Thị Lý, she sells bánh mì and raises poultry

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan O. is a 50-year-old mother of four children in Doem Romdeng village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Mam, is a construction worker. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory and the youngest attends the local school. Mrs. Phan O. is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Because her field is infertile and infested with pests, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow and to make her field more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and hire a laborer.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem P. is a 28-year-old mother of three children in Damnak Rovang village in Takeo Province, Cambodia.
Two of her children attend the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study.  Mrs. Yem P. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Phan Moeun, is a motorbike driver. Even though they have different businesses they do not earn enough money to support themselves. Thus, Mrs. Yem P. decided to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mr. Ban V. is a villager in Trapeang Som village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn his living. His wife, Mrs. Long Sreytouch, is a pig breeder. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her business.

In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Ban V. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig feed to support his wife’s business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 26 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa S. is a 25-year-old mother of a small child in Trapeang Chouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nup SoKum, is a construction worker who earns a small salary.  Their rice paddy is infertile and yields a poor crop. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her soil more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann C. is 18 years old and lives with her husband, Mr. Prum Lakna, in Trapeang Kok village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a pig breeder and he is a motorbike driver.  Mrs. Sarann C. faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to expand her business. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To buy five piglets

loans.name: Hach

texts.en: Mrs. Hach N. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and young child in Thom village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Thach Pengluy, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Even though they have different businesses they do not have enough money to support themselves. Thus, Mrs. Hach N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Seiha

texts.en: Mrs. Seiha P. is a 26-year-old mother of two young children in Trapeang Kok village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Nget Sarun, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Mrs. Seiha P. breeds hens and pigs for sale. She faces a problem because she does not have much money to support her business. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to request a loan to buy five piglets and 100 baby chickens. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To expand a poultry and pig business

loans.name: Khmao

texts.en: Mrs. Khmao N. is a 28-year-old villager who lives with her husband and her three young children in Damnak Rovang village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for sale. Her husband, Mr. Chea San, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Even though they have different businesses, they do not have enough money to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Khmao N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start new business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions as a result pf this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Mrs. Lin K. was born in 1975 and now she lives in Trapeang Kok village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Prum Teth, are sellers who make ice cream by themselves for selling. They face an obstacle because they do not have much money to support themselves. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Lin K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ice cream box for her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living condition with this loan. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy an ice cream box for her business.

loans.name: Reurn

texts.en: Mr. Reurn N. is a villager in Moeun Tomrang village in Takeo Province. He is a policeman. His wife, Mrs. Svay Sambath, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Even though they each have a business, they do not have much money to pay for living expenses. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Reurn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to go to work and so that  he can be a motorbike driver after work. He is 39 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is appears on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to go to work so that he can be a motorbike driver after  work.

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeung M. is a villager in Bravong village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ros Rom, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice for a living. They face an obstacle because they do not have much money to support themselves. Thus, Mrs. Thoeung M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to start a new business. She hopes to increase the family income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs Thoeung M. is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to start a new business.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhy Sorung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people is located in Pou Khvet Village in Takeo Province and Mrs. Nhy S. is a village bank president. She is a fish seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Mrs. Nhy S. is a 52-year-old widow with two children who are all attending the local school. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% to Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Dorn Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which is located in Putthi Sam Village in Takeo Province consists of nineteen people and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Dorn H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Luy Pheng, have a 1-hectar field on which they cultivate rice. On this plantation, they now face a small problem because their field now has infertile soil which has a bad effect on their crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Dorn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and to make their crop more productive. Mrs. Dorn H. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan which consists of six people is located in Putthi Sam Village Takeo Province. Mrs. Rin S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she now has an obstacle because her rice field has infertile soil. In order to deal wI. this problem, Mrs. Rin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field. Mrs. Rin S. is 41 years old and the mother of two children who are working in a garment factory.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Phoem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. PhoE. E. is a village bank president who has been selected by nine people. They are all in Preak Slaeng Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. PhoE. E. is a farmer who can gather a little rice revenue because she owns a small rice field. She now wants to expand her rice revenue so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to plant rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Mrs. PhoE. E. is a 53-year-old widow with four children two of whom are employed in a garment factoR. while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to plant rice.

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Davy K. is the group leader of five all of whom are living in Skab Ta Aon Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Davy K. is a chicken breeder and seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Meng Chhuy, helps her in the  business. Mrs. Davy K. is 23 years old and the mother of a two year old child.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to re-sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Reaksmey Sar Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan which consists of twelve people is located in Ta Reab Doun S. village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Reaksmey S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a 43 year old housewife and the mother of four children, all of whom are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Koem Muny, repairs bicycles. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy bike equipment for his customers. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Reaksmey S., decided to ask for a loan to buy more bike equipment for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more bike equipment for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhum C. is a group leader of four who are all living in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectar plot of land where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Srey Vin, is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it and he is asking  for a loan to buy one more pig for  breeding. Mrs. Sokhum C. is 43 years old and the mother of six children. Two of her children are construction workers while the remaining four are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy one more pig for breeding.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mrs. Asha M. resident of Tangal lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one child. Her husband's name is Shyam M. and he is a house painter. Her daughter is studying in grade 1.

Mrs. M.'s family's living conditions are miserable as her husband’s work is not permanent. Sometimes he may not get a job for a month. So they can hardly fulfill their basic needs. They can’t send their child to boarding school.

So to over come this problem, Mrs. M. decided to open a momo (meat dumplings) shop. But due to lack of money, she is unable to open her shop. So Mrs. M. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to open the momo shop.

loans.use: To open a meat dumplings shop

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Miss Hasina R. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses. Miss R. lives in a single family with her mother and one brother.

Two years ago, Miss R. opened her grocery shop near her own house to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop, like rice, maize, paddy, noodles, and so on. Now, she is requesting Rs. 20000.00 to buy stock of grocery goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Milica

texts.en:
Milica is 24 years old and lives in Kalenderovci, a village in Bosnia.  She lives with her husband, her parents-in-law, and her two children, ages 3 years and 15 months.  Her husband’s work is seasonal, and they struggle to support their family when he is between projects.  Milica grows vegetables and sells them in the local market, but she does not generate enough income to sustain 4 people over the periods that her husband is between work.  She relies heavily on her parents-in-law for financial support.

Milica wants to become financially independent and create a better life for her family.  She requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to purchase a cow.  She will sell the milk and milk products in the local market, and hopes that the income will help her family survive.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Chan Tha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Tha S. is a group leader of four who are all living in Chres Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sao Pharin, is a blacksmith who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Chan Tha S. is 24 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is five months old.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans where they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sokhean's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhean N. is a group leader of four living in Tumnob village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sokhean N. owns a rice mill. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder who raises two pigs. Since this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Un Hong Eng, is a teacher who can make a small salary to support the household. Mrs. Sokhean N. is 44 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Salorn Meak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of seventeen people is located in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Salorn M. is the  village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.3-hectar plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Morn Samoeurn, uses his motorbike as a carry cart in order to transport goods and passengers for an income. The business is not going well because his cart is too old. This makes his passengers feel uncomfortable. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Salorn M. decided to ask for a loan to fix her husband’s cart to enable him to re-start his business. Mrs. Salorn M. is 28 years old and the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is  five years old. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% to Kiva.

loans.use: To fix her husband’s cart to re-start his business.

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun V., 46, is a widow with one son who helps her with her silk weaving business. She has two siblings; one brother and her. Her brother has full-time employment. Besides her child she also has her elderly mother living with her as well. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chanthoeun has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her parents when she was eighteen years old. Her mother has been a silk weaver since 1955, a skill she learned from her parents when she was fourteen years old as well. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Chanthoeun is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase construction materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 03 enfants, madame A. Mama est née en 1978 à Lomé. Elle fait à Adétikopé le commerce de légumes (tomates, gombo, piments) et autres. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, elle participe aux dépenses familiales. Dynamique, elle gère son activité. 

Pour accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement qui servira à s'approvisionner. Ainsi elle pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et investir dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mama A. was born in 1978 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of three. In Adétikopé, she trades in vegetables (tomatoes, okra, chili peppers) and other goods. Thanks to the income from her business, she is helping to cover family expenses. She manages her work with verve.

To increase her income, she is requesting financing for acquiring supplies. She will thus be able to make her business profitable and to invest in family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en: Gulustan (her son is pictured) was born in 1968. She is the mother of three children. She lives in Khachmaz region, in the Gusarchay village. Eight years ago, she started a cattle breeding business. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy a cow and a calf for improving her cattle breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov K., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Ny, 26, live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have two sons, who study at the local school.

Pov has been a motor taxi driver for seven years. He carries goods and people from his village to the market. His wife has been a tailor for three years. Pov needs money to buy a trailer for his motorbike, so that he can drive a tuk tuk. This will give him an opportunity to earn more money than driving a motor taxi. So he is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a trailer for driving a tuk tuk.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike trailer for driving a tuk tuk

loans.name: Mrs. Shinat Sat Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal Province have formed a village bank and all the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Shinat S. is the village bank president. She is a breeder who is raising  thirteen pigs. Since her pigs are growing bigger, she does not have enough money to purchase pig feed. She asking  for a loan to buy pig feed for her pigs. She wants to sell her pigs at a reasonable price to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Shinat S. is 49 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Mrs. Yom T., 50, is a widow and she has five children; three sons and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. One son is a garment factory worker, one daughter is a silk weaver (pictured here), and the other two children study in the local school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yom has been a silk weaver for 28 years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Née en 1985 à Agoè, madame L. Adjovi est une jeune commerçante qui a en charge 03 enfants. Résidant à Adétikopé avec son mari, où elle vend de l’arachide, activités qu’elle gère bien. Honnête, elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son activité. 

Pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter en quantité suffisante de l’arachide qu’elle pourra vendre en temps de rareté. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Agoè, Ms. Adjovi L. is a young merchant who has three children in her care. She lives with her husband in Adétikopé, where she sells peanuts, a business she manages well. An honest woman, she has perfect command of her work.

To bolster her business and to make it profitable, she is requesting a loan for buying enough peanuts to sell whenever they are rare. This will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and sale of peanuts

loans.name: Mrs. Oun Chhoen Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consisting of sixteen people is located in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Oun C.  has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Ly C., are farmers who have a 1-hectar plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. They have three children. One of their children sews shoes in the local village while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Oun C.'s family income is not enough to allow them to fix their house so Mrs. Oun C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to repair her house. Mrs. P. Leang who is a group guarantor is also presented in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to repair her house.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr:
Né en 1985 Davié, monsieur A. Mawussi vit à Adétikopé. Soudeur de formation, il fabrique différentes sortes d’objets métalliques. Célibataire, il exerce efficacement son activité. 
Pour accroître ses revenus, il sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des tôles et barres de fer pour la fabrication et la vente d'objets métalliques. Ainsi il pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et prendre correctement en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Mawussi A. was born in 1985 in Davié, Togo, and lives in Adétikopé. As a trained welder, he makes a variety of metallic objects. He is single and an efficient worker. In order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase sheet metal and iron rods to make and sell metallic objects. This will enable Monsieur A. to make his business profitable and properly take care of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell metallic objects

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Met P. is the group leader of six who all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor in the local village. In this business, she can make a small income to support her family. She is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a teacher while the youngest one is a 29-year-old university student.  Mrs. Met P. does not have enough money to pay for the school fees for her youngest child so she is asking for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Srea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of six people, is located in Preak Reussei Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Srea S. was selected by the members as the group leader.

She is a farmer who owns 0.8-hectare of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Since her plantation field is far from irrigation, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water her field and make her crops more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Cheng Chheang, is a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Srea S. is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are ages 1 and 4, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a pump to generate water for her field to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Améria

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, Madame K. Améria est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce d’alimentation générale et des sandales. Très dévouée pour son activité elle est souvent confrontée à de fréquentes ruptures de stock ce qui ne l’avantage pas. Pour ce faire elle sollicite un financement pour aménager son hangar et augmenter le stock de ses marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Améria K., 52, is married and the mother of 3 children. Her primary business is selling foodstuffs and sandals. Very serious about her work, she often faces the problem of running out of certain items which is not good for business. To cope with this problem, she is requesting a loan to spruce up her shed and buy more merchandise so that she can satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair her shed and increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a boat and fish net to support her children’s business.

loans.name: Dzouéra

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Takoura, Madame A. Dzouéra est mère d’un enfant. Très tôt elle entre en apprentissage pour vite subvenir à ses besoins. Couturière de profession, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour s’acheter des machines à coudre ce qui fait que sa seule machine ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les commandes de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50.000 F pour acquérir une nouvelle machine et mieux être à la hauteur de son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Takoura, Mrs. Dzouéra A. is the mother of one child. Early on, she learned a job to provide for herself. A trained seamstress, she lacks financial means to buy sewing machines, and her only machine does not enable her to meet customer demand. She's seeking a loan of XOF 50'000 to purchase a new machine and to improve her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair their house

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en: Nurali is 48 years old and lives in Khachmaz town. He is married with two children. He has been in the taxi business for seven years. He would like a loan of 800 AZN in order to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Thi Yen's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Yến năm nay 37 tuổi Ms 01050021 là một phụ nữ năng động và biết học hỏi mô hình chăn nuôi ở địa phương để vận dụng vào mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình mình. Hàng ngày ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn, chị còn đi làm công nhân của nhà máy gạch, công việc tuy bận rộn nhưng chị luôn giành thì gian chăm sóc và dạy 2 con học bài. Còn chồng chị đi làm thuê nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng khá ổn định từ 160.000đ đến 180.000đ/ ngày. Chị và nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc chăn nuôi lợn.
Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích Ms 01050014 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh sắt.
 Chị Lê Thị Mến Ms 01050019 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh thóc, gạo.
 Chị Trần Thị Hải Ms 01050020 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đi chợ bán hàng hoa quả và mua gạo nấu rượu.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Ms 01050022 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng kính mắt thời trang.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Hậu Ms 01050023 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để đi chợ buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Yen (ID Number 01050021), 37 years old, is an active woman. She is abL. to learn from the local pig rearing model and apply it at home. Besides rearing pigs, she also works in a brick factory. Even though she is very busy, she still sets aside time to take care of and help her children with their school work. Her husband is a hired worker, so her family's daily income is quite stabL. at 160,000VND to 180,0000VND. Her group has borrowed twice and repaid successfully. This time, she would like to borrow 4,704,000VND to invest in rearing pigs. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Bich (ID Number 01050014), borrows 4,704,000VND to buy and sell iron.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Men (ID Number 01050019), borrows 4,704,000VND to buy and sell rice.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Hai (ID Number 01050020), borrows 4,704,000VND to buy and sell fruits, as well as to purchase rice to make wine.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Ngoc (ID Number 01050022), borrows 4,256,000VND to buy and sell fashion sunglasses.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hau (D Number 01050023), borrows 4,256,000VND to buy and sell pork.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is a 28 year old woman engaged in dressmaking, specializing in making school uniforms and gowns. Her skills in sewing came from her previous employment as well as from formal training in a related course. She had just given birth to a baby girl named Crisanta Nicole. She has been married to a booking officer in a bus company for almost a year.

At present, she has three employed sewers and has engaged in a private school providing on-the-job training for its students. She earns a daily net income of Php 450.00 (approximately US$9.00) that she uses to sustain their needs. Her vision is to expand her business in order to provide more employment opportunities in the community. Aside from the quality products she manufactures, she also offers minimal and affordable costs that attract plenty of customers. With the increasing demand of her sewing services she needs an additional piping machine, fabrics and accessories for mass production of t-shirts.

She had been an active leader and member of ASHI for five years. The experiences she has had have helped develop her confidence in managing her business. When she first joined ASHI, she just used a manual machine without any employed help. Using the successive loans from ASHI, she was able to accumulate several more machines, like high speed machines and an edging machine.

Adora dreams that three years from now, she will own a well-equipped dress shop to be able to cope with orders for school uniforms in state colleges around the bustling capital town of San Jose de Buenavista, Antique.

loans.use: Purchase of a piping machine, fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy S. is 22 years old, married, and has one young child. She started farming in her village more than 3 years ago. Her husband, Mr. Thy Shorn is 26 years old, and he operates a music service. He provides music in customers’s homes for ceremonies or wedding parties. Thavy requests a loan of 800,000 Riel ($200) to purchase a generator for her husband’s business.

This group includes four other entrepeneurs. They all live in Tongrong Commune, Kompong Cham Province, in Cambodia. Mrs. Sras D., 20, is a farmer. She requests a loan of 600,000 Riel ($150) to buy a generator. Mrs. Yath S. is 46 years old, and also is a farmer. She requests a loan of 600,000 Riel ($150) to purchase fertilizer for the rice crop. Mrs. Nath U., 49, is a local farmer. She requests a loan of 400,000 Riel ($100) to purchase fish to sell. Mrs. HoeU. S. is 43 years old, and grows beans. HoeU. requests a loan of 500,000 Riel ($125) to buy more seeds to plant more beans.

loans.use: Purchase a generator for in-home music service

loans.name: Adiza

texts.fr: Mlle B. Adiza est née en 1984 à Agoè-Zongo. Très tôt, elle entre en apprentissage de coiffure afin de mieux subvenir à ses besoins. Vu que la seule activité ne l’avantage pas, elle associe à cette dernière la vente des produits de beauté. Ce qui lui réussi bien. Mais devant ses maigres moyens, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement pour s’acheter des produits de beauté et augmenter son étalage aussi pour  aménager son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Miss Adiza B. was born in 1984 in Agoè-Zongo. Very early in life, she joins a hairstyling apprenticeship in order to better provide for her needs. Since this activity alone does not benefit her, she also sells beauty products as part of the business. This has brought her success. However, due to a lack of means, she does not manage to satisfy her customers' requests. She is thus asking for financing to buy beauty products, to grow her display, and also to arrange her hairdressing salon.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products, grow window display and arrange hairdressing salon

loans.name: Davy

texts.en:
Mrs. Davy N. is a villager in Kor village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder for a living. 

She faces some problems because she does not have much money to support her business. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and six piglets for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition by raising and selling them. 

Her husband, Mr. Man Saravuth, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Mrs. Davy N. is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and six piglets for her business.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin U. is a villager in Treuy Troeng village in Kandal Province. She sells homemade Khmer noodles. 

Her husband, Mr. Nhouk Bunthoun, is an ice cream seller. He faces an obstacle because he cannot sell in other villages or far from his house, which means he earns little money. 

In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Sarin U. decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike to sell ice cream door-to-door in order to make a better living. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice cream door-to-door

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroen P. was born in 1962 and now lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a fruit seller. 

She is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. With the revenue from her fruit sales, she does not have much money to support her family's needs.

Thus, Mrs. Saroen P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her children to go to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to go to work.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Né le 11 avril 1978, Monsieur M. Komi est marié et père de 2 enfants. Tapissier de formation, il arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter des matériels de travail afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on April 11, 1978, Mr. Komi M. is married and the father of two. An upholsterer by training, he is managing with difficulty to provide for his family. He is applying for financing to buy work materials in order to satisfy his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials to make furniture

loans.name: Sinoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinoem P. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

On her plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests which hurt her crop. Moreover, she does not have much money to support production. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Soy Choun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sinoem P. is 31 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled at the school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her house to be better than before.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch T. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Long Nouy, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

On their plantation, they face some problems because their field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests which hurt their crops. They cannot afford the expenses for their field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Touch T. decided to request for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. 

She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.fr: Née le 15 septembre 1985 à Lomé, Mlle S. Adiza est revendeuse de pains. Très dynamique et travailleuse, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans ce commerce pour vite se prendre en charge. C’est une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite de moyens financiers ce qui lui manque cruellement. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter en grande quantité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et dégager plus de profit.
texts.en:
Born on September 15, 1985 in Lomé, Miss S. Adiza is a bread saleswoman. Very dynamic and hard working, she started out in this trade very early on in order to be able to quickly take care of herself. It is a very profitable activity, but one that requires financial means which she painfully lacks. She is requesting financing to buy large quantities of supplies in order to better satisfy her customers and to bring in more profit.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bags of wheat flour for bread manufacture

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanty Y. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder for a living. 

She faces an obstacle because she does not have much money to support and grow her business. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and six piglets to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. Keov Sokeoun, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Mrs. Chanty Y. is 20 years old and she does not have a child yet. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and six piglets to add to her business.

loans.name: Chan Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Thoeun V. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer. 

Her husband, Mr. Chuon Ra, is a farmer and owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 
On his plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests which hurt his crop, and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to support his field. 

Thus, Mrs. Chan Thoeun V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her living conditions with this loan. 

She is a 27-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Mala Adèle

texts.fr: Mlle M. A. est née le 15 avril 1981 à Kara. Très tôt elle abandonne ses études pour entrer en apprentissage. Nantie d’un diplôme de fin d’apprentissage elle est devenue maîtresse d’un salon de coiffure. Une activité qui lui réussi très bien. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle sollicite un financement pour aménager son salon et acheter des mèches à vendre.
texts.en:
Ms. A. M. was born on April 15, 1981 in Kara. Very early on, she abandoned school to enter into an apprenticeship. Bestowed with the certificate of completion, she became the owner of a hair salon, a business that has been very successful for her. As the year-end holidays approach, she is requesting financing to fix up her salon and to buy hair extensions to sell.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her salon and to buy hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret H., 22, and her husband, Mr. Ret Touch, 23, live in a small village off the national road two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 2006 and have a seven-month old son.

Mrs. Saret has been selling vegetables for one year. She buys them from the Sa-ang district and resells them at the Takmao market. Her husband has been a mason for eight years. Saret requests a loan of $300 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat Y. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. 

Her husband, Mr. Peim Chanthy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Away from his plantation, he is a construction worker who earns a small amount of money. 

In their businesses, they face some problems because their field is infertile soil which hurts their crop and they do not have enough money to support breeding the pigs. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Sinat Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pig food and piglets to add to her business. 

She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 27-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled at the school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pig food and piglets to add to her business.

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha C., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Sor, 31, live in a small village off national road two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 1993 and have two sons, who attend the local school.

Mr. Vutha has been a truck driver for 5 years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for 4 years. He is a driver for a company about 10 kilometers from his home. He usually goes to work by motor taxi and the cost is a bit high, so he decided to buy one second-hand motorcycle for traveling to work. Vutha requests a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom P. was born in 1957 and now lives in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. 

Her husband, Mr. Nuo Choub, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On his plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests, which hurt his crop. He does not have enough money to hire laborers to support his field. 

In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sokhom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her life with this loan. 

She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr: Née en 1987, Mlle A. Séna est revendeuse de légumes (gombo, tomate, piment) au marché de sa localité. Très courageuse, elle a une gestion parfaite de son activité et se débrouille bien. Devant ses moyens limités, elle n’arrive pas à être à la hauteur de son activité ce qui lui fait perdre sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un financement  pour acheter plus de légumes et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1987, Miss Séna A. sells vegetables (okra, tomatoes and peppers) at her local market. She is a hard worker, manages her business perfectly and does well for herself. Given her limited means, she is unable to run the business as she would like, which causes her to lose customers. To remedy this, she is requesting funding to buy more vegetables to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of vegetables

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy P. is a villager in Chrey village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Though her business is going well, she faces an obstacle because she does not have much money to grow her business. 

Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her life with this loan. Her husband, Mr. P. Phon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. 

Mrs. Savy P. is 44 years old and the mother of six children: two are employed in a garment factory; one is a construction worker; two are attending the local school; and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Mrs. Hok P. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

She faces some problems because her field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests, which hurt her crop, and she does not have much money to cover the expense. 

In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field and make her crop more productive, and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. Mrs. Hok P. is a 57-year-old widow and the mother of a child who is a grocer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Menssan

texts.fr: Agé de 61 ans, Monsieur K. Menssan est marié et père de 4 enfants. Revendeur de produits alimentaires et autres produits de premières nécessités au marché de sa localité. Très battant et dynamique, il arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. N’ayant pas assez de moyens, il sollicite un financement pour acheter plus de marchandises et agrandir son étalage.
texts.en:
