Mr. Menssan K. is 61 years old, married, and the father of four. He is a retailer of groceries and other staple goods at his local marketplace. A very driving and energetic man, he manages with difficulty to provide for his family. Lacking sufficient means, he is requesting financing to buy more merchandise and to expand his display of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Klakpasso

texts.fr: Klakpasso A. est un éleveur à Kpalimé, une ville à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 42 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants et exerce cette activité depuis 2002. Monsieur Klakpasso désire améliorer son activité en achetant de nouvelles races de caprins et de porcins qui sont de plus en plus demandés sur le marché. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’augmenter gagner plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Klakpasso A. has been raising goats and pigs since 2002 in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He's 42 years old and the father of 3 children. Mr. Klakpasso wishes to bolster his business by buying new breeds that are more in demand on the market. This opportunity will enable him to make more money to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new breeds of goats and pigs

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha P. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In her plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and has a lot of pests which affect her crop. In addition, she does not have enough money to deal with her problems.

In order to solve these problems, she decided to request for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive, and hire laborers to plant seedlings and to harvest rice. Her husband, Mr. Sem Mao, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chantha P. is 40 years old and the mother of five children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest the rice

loans.name: Mata

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Madame N. Mata est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des légumes et c’est grâce à ces revenus qu’elle arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer. Avec une gestion rigoureuse de son activité elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage en achetant plus de légumes et satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mata N. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four. Her main work involves selling vegetables, and thanks to the income from it, she manages to help cover household needs. Although managing her business rigorously, she isn't meeting customer demands. To do so, she is requesting financing to expand her display of goods by buying more vegetables. This will enable her to do better providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get supplies of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine E. est une commerçante de produits génériques au grand marché de Kpalime, une ville à 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 39 ans, Célestine est mariée et mère de 2 enfants et exerce ce commerce depuis 2003. Elle souhaite par ce crédit augmente la taille de son commerce en louant un magasin pour l’étalage de ses marchandises et aussi en achetant d’autres produits qui, jusqu’ici font objet des exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Célestine E. sells generic products in the big open-air market in Kpalime, a town 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Célestine, 39, is married and the mother of 2 children; she has been working at this business since 2003. She hopes to use this loan to expand the size of her business by renting a shop where she can display her merchandise and also by buying other products which her clientele has been asking for.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing generic products for re-sale

loans.name: Sovanna Roath

texts.en: Mrs. Sovanna Roath K. is a villager in Prasat village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bun Korn, is a motorbike driver. With their revenue, they cannot sustain their expenses and living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Sovanna Roath K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed to start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 25 years old and the mother of child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed to start a new business.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im M. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Nam Hong, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. With the revenue, they do not have much money to support their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Im M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse and cart for her husband to transport goods and passengers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other three children are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Buy a horse and cart for her husband

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: This young man is a laboratory assistant. He has been in this business for 2 years. Habil was born in 1975. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Absheron region. He is single. Now, Habil needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for his laboratory.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for his laboratory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her current business.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn D., 44, (pictured with her husband in their jicama farm) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Moeun, 43, live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Both of their daughters are married, one of whom lives in the family home. One son is a driver and other son studies in a local school.

Houn and her husband have been farming since they were married in 1986. They grow rice, other crops and vegetables in their farmland in the village. Houn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice seed for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed for growing rice.

loans.name: Meng Hoen

texts.en: Mrs. Meng Hoen C. is a villager in Treuy Treoung village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Phearak, is a blacksmith. Even though they both have businesses, they do not have much money to cover their living expenses, and now their house is old. Thus, Mrs. Meng Hoen C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build her house. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build her house.

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.en: B. Saiyora is a very diligent woman who is 31 years old, married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Thanks to her dear parents' farming skills, she is very familiar with agriculture. Her father gave her a farm five years ago and she's been working on it ever since. This has helped to pay her family's expenses. Saiyora's wants to improve the quality of her produce, and has requested a 12-month loan for $1,200 to buy seeds and fertilizer. By participating in this loan, you can help this hardworking mother continue to care for her family and work with a lot of satisfaction.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom N. is a villager in Chhkei Slap village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Kol Sarun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and earn a living. On his plantation he faces a challenge because his field's soil is infertile, which badly affects his crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sarom N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to enable their field to make the crop more productive. She is 34 years old and the mother of four children, who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to enable her husband's field to make a more productive crop.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon K. is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children. Ilhomjon has been farming since he was a young boy, and now he specializes in the cultivation of wheat and onions. He has worked the land since he was 27 and has gained a rich experience. When it is the season, Ilhomjon works in the field from early morning till late night. 
Ilhomjon has a large and friendly family. They all try to help each other. His daughter, who helps him with the business, is pictured in the photo as Ilhomjon himself was absent at the day of our visit. Now, when the business is stable, Ilhomjon believes that it shall be the main income for him in the future as his dearest children are growing up and their expenses are raising concomitantly. 
Today, Ilhomjon requests 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. He thanks everyone who supports him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Pos

texts.en: Mrs. Pos O. is a villager in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder to make a living. Now she faces some problems because she does not have much money with which to earn a living. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food and ducklings for her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Anh, is a construction worker. Mrs. Pos O. is 27 years old and the mother of three children, who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food and ducklings for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo A. est âgé de 28 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il tient une boutique de fournitures de bureau depuis 2 ans à Kpalime, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Ce crédit lui permettra d’approvisionner son magasin et pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kodzo A. is 28 years old, single and without children. He's been running a shop that sells office supplies for two years in Kpalime, a city located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. This loan will enable him to resupply his shop to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell office supplies

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Madame B. Amivi est née en 1971 à Lomé, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit actuellement à Tsévié avec son mari. Très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de vente de bouillie de maïs les matins et les soirs. Par la qualité de sa bouillie et de l’hygiène quelle pratique, elle est très connue dans sa localité. Elle sollicite un financement pour s’acheter des sacs de maïs et de sucre, les intrants pour son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amivi B. was born in 1971 in Lomé and is married with four children. She presently lives in Tsévié with her husband. Early in her life, she began to sell maize porridge mornings and evenings. She is well known in her area for the quality of her porridge and her cleanliness. She is requesting this loan to buy sacks of maize and sugar and other ingredients for her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stockpiling maize to prepare porridge for sale

loans.name: Guldona

texts.en:
Guldona N. is 55 years old. She is married with seven children. As any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need now and is dreaming that all of them shall have higher education. Her husband is a farmer and Guldona is a farmer too. She has been working the land for 15 years and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. She began cultivating her land through her own and her son’s efforts (who is pictured in the photo) and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Guldona is growing wheat and onions. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. 
She wishes to continue to generate income for her children's development and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Guldona is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. She thanks everyone who trusts in her and is supporting her today. She promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Née en 1948, Madame A. Cécile est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit actuellement à Tsévié avec toute sa famille. Son activité principale est le commerce des ustensiles en plastique et des sandalettes. Un commerce qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 10 ans. Dans le souci d’agrandir son étalage avec d’autres nouveaux produits à l'approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle sollicite un financement pour s’acheter des chaussures, et d’autres nouveautés d’ustensiles. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et dégager plus de profit.
texts.en:
Born in 1948, Mrs. Cécile A. is married and the mother of 7 children. She presently lives in Tsévié with her whole family. Her principle business is selling plastic utensils and sandals, a business she has been in for 10 years. Intent on expanding her inventory by buying new products as the end of year holidays approach, she is requesting a loan to buy shoes and new and different utensils. This will allow her to better satisfy her clientele and make more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling shoes and plastic utensils

loans.name: Mansa

texts.fr: Mansa K. est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2001 au grand marché de Kpalimé, une ville à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, le quatrième à FECECAV accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des pagnes de différentes gammes. Cette chance lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent ses profits, source d’amélioration des conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mansa K. is 54 years old, married, and the mother of five. She has been a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2001 at the grand marketplace of Kpalimé, a city about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan, her fourth one with FECECAV, to expand her commerce by buying different ranges of pagnes. This chance will allow her to increase her turnover and consequently her profit, out of which living conditions improve.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes for resale

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary U., 40, and her husband, Mr. Phea Pok, 44, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Her husband has been a mason since 1991, and he used to be a soldier. They were married in 1984 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a construction worker with his father, and the other children study in the local school.

Since 1980, Sotheary has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh. Sotheary requests a loan of $300 to purchase silk materialS for weaving.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Afikuma

texts.fr: Afikuma A. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Kpalime, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afikuma désire avec ce deuxième crédit acheter des bassines et des ustensiles de cuisine pour la revente. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afikuma A. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of five. She lives in Kpalimé, a cilty located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Afikuma would like to use this second loan to buy basins and kitchen utensils for resale. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and basins for resale

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
Guzal H. is a brave woman who has done agricultural work in far-off fields since she was a child. She takes her cattle and sheep out to pasture every day. She enjoys her daily labor, and once in 2-3 months on weekends, she travels to the markets in her area to sell her animals in order to give daily sustenance to the members of her household. She is married and the mother of 4 children, and she continues working with the great responsibility which she bears. 
Her dream is to increase the amount of livestock that she cares for. In order to continue realizing part of this dream, Guzal is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 12 months to invest in the purchase of a cow. You can help this brave woman to continue her work.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
O. Mahliyo is 39 years old, married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships she has experienced in her life have taught her the value of work. For the last 12 years, she has bought young cattle in the local market for fattening and resale. Mahliyo is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength that many people admire and has always looked for a way to bring extra income to her home. Mahliyo has awakened early every morning to feed her cows and bulls ever since she was taught to do that by her beloved parents. 

Thanks to her hard work, she is able to support her children and give them a good education. Mahliyo wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have set for themselves. With this goal in mind, she has applied for a loan of $750 for 12 months to buy additional livestock. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength. Your generosity can help change her life.

loans.use: To improve her family's living conditions by buying livestock for resale

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
U. Anvar is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. 

Through his business, he has been able to educate his children up to secondary school level. He would now like to extend his animal business and with this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 12 months. He plans to increase the number of animals moved at a single time in future. Anvar thanks you very much for your kindness to others.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Beauté

texts.fr: Agée de 18 ans, Mlle M. Beauté a abandonné ses études fautes de moyens et s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de la couture. Aujourd’hui elle est obligée d’aller chez ses amies afin de satisfaire sa clientèle car elle n’a pas les moyens pour s’acheter une machine à coudre. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter sa propre machine à coudre afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Ms. Beauté M., age 18, abandoned her studies due to a lack of means and got started in a dressmaking apprenticeship. Today, she is obliged to do her work in the homes of her friends in order to satisfy her customers because she does not have the money to buy a sewing machine. She is requesting financing to buy her own sewing machine to satisfy her customers better as the year-end holidays are approaching.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Safouratou

texts.fr: Née en 1938, Madame B. Safouratou est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. C’est grâce aux revenus de ses activités (vente de produits alimentaires et de légumes) qu’elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Souvent confronté à de fréquentes ruptures de stock, elle sollicite un financement pour faire un stock consistant des produits alimentaires et agrandir son étalage. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et de surcroît son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1938, Ms. Safouratou B. is married and the mother of five. Thanks to the income from her business (selling grocery items and vegetables), she manages to help cover household expenses. Often confronted with frequent inventory shortages, she is requesting financing to create a sizable stock of food items and to expand her display of goods. This will enable her to increase her buying power and ability to earn extra income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Née en 1960, Madame K. Bernadette est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Revendeuse de denrée alimentaire (riz, haricot, galette), cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement pour aménager son hangar et s’acheter des sacs de riz, du haricot et autres intrants pour son commerce.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Ms. Bernadette K. is married and the mother of five. She is a retailer of foodstuffs (rice, beans, biscuits). This business enables her to provide for her family. She is requesting financing to fix up her stall and to buy sacks of rice, beans and other goods for her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up a stall and build a stock of rice and beans

loans.name: Jadranka

texts.en:
Jadranka was born in 1972 and she lives in Drevnika, a village in Bosnia. She is married and she has two children who are two and seven years old. Jadranka grows and sells vegetables in the local market, as her husband does not earn enough money to support their family.

Jadranka requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women, International to buy a calf and chickens. By selling chicken meat and milk products, she hopes to generate more income for her family and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy a calf and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A Refrigerator and a Microscope

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.en:
Gulrukhsor S. is a widow and has one child. She has a business selling children's clothing items in the central market of Dushanbe. She offers a big assortment of inventory and has a flexible discount system for her loyal customers. Gulrukhsor’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 10 years. Gulrukhsor is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. 
Today, Gulrukhsor is requesting a loan of 3300 Somoni ($975 USD) to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can support herself and her dearest son. She promises that she will repay the loan within 12 months. Gulrukhsor feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her son can stay in school and have a bright future. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: Increasing of working capital with the purpose of development of business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi T. est revendeuse des sacs et des trousseaux bébé depuis 2003 à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs et aussi en louant un magasin pour l’installation de ses marchandises. Afi est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Afi T. has been re-selling bags and baby clothing since 2003 in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second credit from FECECAV, she would like to grow her small business by buying bags and also by renting a store for the installation of her goods. Afi is 39 years old, is married and a mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of bags and baby clothing

loans.name: Dashgin

texts.en: Dashgin is a blacksmith. He has been in this business for 6 years. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, and he settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.use: Buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, immunizations, and medical equipment.

loans.name: Mahira

texts.en: Mahira is 32 years old and lives in Baku City. Three years ago she started her food market business. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy additional food items for her store.

loans.use: to buy the foodstuffs

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman is 30 years old and lives in Baku City. Five years ago he started his food market business. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy more food items to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 51 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos Marisol de 16, Cristian de 13 y Carla de 12. Pese a sus limitaciones, ya que no sabe leer, ni escribir, se ha desenvuelto muy bien en el negocio de elaboración de bolsos con mantas tejidas de la zona, de esto ya 30 años. Los pedidos que recibe Dionisia son para exportarlos al extranjero, es por eso que se le hace estresante cumplir con las cantidades que le solicitan, pero los 30 años de experiencia que posee hacen que siempre cumpla con todo, siendo su trabajo muy rentable. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que gentilmente Dionisia solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mantas, cierres, hebillas, hilos, etc.  para elaborar sus bolsos y cubrir los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 51 years old, she is divorced and she lives with her children, Marisol who is 16, Cristian who is 13, and Carla who is 12. Despite her limitations, not being able to read or write, she has done very well in the business making traditional bags native to the region, a business she has been running for the past 30 years. The orders received by Dionisia are for international export. It is stressing for her to meet the quantities that are required from her, but given her 30 years' experience she knows how to always meet the requirements, making this very profitable work. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds that Dionisia requests very gratefuly, she will purchase greater quantities of cloth, zippers, buckles, threads, etc. to make her bags and to cover the orders that her clients place.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her work, such as cloth, and threads etc.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es: El grupo Nueva Generación esta representado por la señora Margarita, existen algunos parentescos familiares entre las socias pero cada una posee su propia fuente de ingreso independiente, en su mayoría los socios se dedican a la venta de comida y diferentes comestibles como víveres y verduras, entre los varones tiene actividades como la venta de automóviles o a la reparación de los mismos, son gente trabajadora con experiencia en sus diferentes rubros y con ganas de progresar. En lo que se refiere a experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios ellos llevan cumpliendo su segundo ciclo con el mismo grupo y con algunos integrantes nuevos. Referente al destino del financiamiento será para el incremento de insumos para la venta y a la compra de materiales de trabajo para incrementar sus ingresos y mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Generación" (New Generation) is represented by Mrs. Margarita. Some of the members are related through family but each has her own income. The majority of members sell foodstuffs and various items such as food provision and vegetables. The men in the group work in areas such as selling cars and repairing same. These are hardworking folks with experience in their businesses and a desire to prosper. They are experienced working with solidarity groups as this is their second cycle with this same group and they've added a few new members. As for the financing, it is targeted for acquiring raw materials for buying/selling in the workplace in order to increase their profits and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, ya que aún es soltero y no tiene compromiso. Joven suspicaz y trabajador, ha visto en el negocio de la confección de bolsos una buena fuente de ingresos económicos, es por eso que desde hace 10 años viene realizando este peculiar trabajo. Jaime trabaja por pedidos que le hacen diferentes personas, y también para exportar los bolsos al extranjero, es así que el tiene que trabajar mucho para lograr las cantidades que le solicitan, siendo su trabajo muy rentable. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más tejidos artesanales para elaborar  sus bolsos y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Jaime is 24 years old. He lives at home with his parents since he is still single and is not engaged. A thoughtful and hard working young man, he has seen the business of making bags as a good fountain of economic income. As a result, for the last ten years, he as worked at this job. Jaime completes orders made by different people, as well as exports bags to foreign places. Consequently, he has to work a lot in order to satisfy the quantities requested. He feels his work is very profitable. This is his first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he is requesting, he will purchase more artisanal embroidered fabric to make his bags and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more artisanal embroidered fabric to make his bags.

loans.name: Impecables Group

texts.es:
El grupo impecables esta representado por Leyda Livian,  existen dos hermanas entre las socias la señora Sonia y Rosmeri, cada una tiene ingresos y negocios totalmente independientes ya que una se dedica a la elaboración de masitas y la otra a la compra y venta de vehículos a medio uso, el resto de los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, de comestibles, verduras, animales, electrodomésticos y productos de la temporada en las ferias de nuestra ciudad.
Son gente con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que algunas eran integrantes de otros grupos que se fueron disolviendo y se acoplaron en uno nuevo.
El financiamiento esta destinado al incremento de insumos para la venta y al crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Impecables" (The Impeccables) are represented by Leyda Livian. There are two sisters among the members, Mrs. Sonia and Rosmeri, each has her own income and business; one works making pastries and the other buys and sells second-hand vehicles. The remaining members sell cosmetics, foodstuffs, vegetables, animals, electronics and seasonal products at the markets in our city. They are experienced in solidarity groups as some of them have previously been members of discontinued groups so they joined a new one. The financing is targeted for increasing materials for selling and growing their small businesses to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 26 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su abuelita y su tía. Es natural de la ciudad de Arequipa, vino a Puno hace 2 años por su profesión de cosmeatra para progresar en esta ciudad, dedicándole todo su tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio es muy rentable, ya que Ana con su facilidad de palabra y mucha alegría persuade a su clientela a adquirir sus productos de belleza.
No se le hace difícil su trabajo, más bien lo disfruta al máximo, ya que le gusta ayudar a  exteriorizar la belleza que sus clientas poseen. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero, Ana aumentara su stock para mejorar su venta, lograr mejores ingresos y así lograr todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old, single, and lives with her grandmother and aunt. She was born in Arequipa and came to Puno 2 years ago in order to grow her business selling cosmetics in this city, dedicating all her time to selling beauty products. The business is very profitable, as Ana easily chats with others, is very happy, and easily persuades her clientele to purchase her beauty products. She doesn’t find her work difficulty, and she enjoys it to the maximum as she likes to help bring out the beauty her clients possess. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money Ana will increase her stock to improve her sales, obtain better income, and in this way achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her stock of beauty supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 54 años, esta separada D. su pareja, vive con sus hijas, Irma  y Geraldine. Se dedica a la venta D. productos elaborados a base D. quinua, hornea tortas, galletas, etc. pero todo a base D. quinua, este producto andino con muchas propiedades alimenticias. A Juana le gusta hornear estos productos porque sabe que son beneficiosos para los que los consuman, logrando que se sienta muy gratificada con su trabajo. Lo más difícil es el tener que cubrir con la cantidad D. pedidos que le realizan las instituciones, ayudándose muchas veces con sus dos hijas, las cuales la apoyan incondicionalmente. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más quinua para hornear, torteras, moldes, etc para realizar todo tipo D. postres.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years old, is separated from her partner and lives with her daughters, Irma and Geraldine. She is dedicated to selling products maD. from quinoa, including baked cakes, cookies, etc., but all based on quinoa, an Andean (grain) product with many nutritional benefits. Juana likes to bake these products because she knows that there are benefits for those who eat them, which makes her feel her work is very gratifying. The most difficult thing is to cope with the quantity of orders requested by institutions. Her two daughters help her a lot, supporting it unconditionally. This is her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the requested money she will buy more quinoa for baking, cakes, molds, etc. to make all kinds of desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils to make her desserts

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de Yulisa de 17, Ana Gabriel de 4 y Gabriel Omar de 2. Se dedica a la venta de pijamas de forma ambulatoria, negocio con el que viene trabajando durante un año, ya que está acostumbrada a realizar todo tipo de oficios.

Al tener que mantener a tres hijos, Julia trabaja incansablemente para lograr cubrir los gastos que requieren sus pequeños, lo bueno de su trabajo es que le permite ganar para solventar estos gastos, lo más difícil es el tener que viajar para traer las prendas a otras ciudades, pero Julia, en su afán de progresar, ve estos inconvenientes como cosas mínimas, impulsándola a seguir adelante.

Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma.El dinero que solicita será invertido en adquirir mayor cantidad de pijamas de bonitos diseños y mejor calidad para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Julia is 35 years old and is a single mother of 17 year old Yusila, 4 year old Ana Gabriel, and 2 year old Gabriel Omar. She sells pajamas as a traveling saleswoman, a business which she has been doing for a year, although she is already accustomed to working in all types of business.

Having to care for 3 children, Julia works tirelessly to be able to cover the costs her little ones require. The good thing about her work is that it allows her to earn enough to cover these costs. The hardest part is that she has to travel to take her garments to other cities. But Julia, in her eagerness to progress, sees these inconveniences as minimal, driving her to move forward.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The money that she requests will be invested in acquiring a large quantity of pajamas with pretty designs and better quality to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of pajamas to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina es madre soltera de dos hijos Wilber de 24 y Jenaro de 18. Se dedica a lo que mejor sabe hacer, el tejido de prendas de vestir en base a lana de Alpaca, ella recibe pedidos de centros artesanales para exportarlos al extranjero, trabajando durante casi todo el día para cubrir las cantidades que le solicitan. El trabajo de Rufina empieza a las 8 de la mañana y termina a altas horas de la noche, ya que el tejer tiene su grado de dificultad y ella tiene que elaborar gran número de prendas. Le ha ido bien en su trabajo, el cual realiza hace ya 10 años y con el que ha podido brindarles una buena educación a sus dos hijos. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayores cantidades de lana y algunos accesorios para cubrir con los pedidos que tiene y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rufina is a single mother of two sons: 24 year old Wilber and 18 year old Jenaro. She works in what she knows best; weaving clothing out of Alpaca wool. She receives requests from handicraft centers to export her products to foreign countries, and works nearly all day to cover the quantities they ask for. Rufina starts work at 8 in the morning and finishes in the late hours of the night, since the weaving has a degree of difficulty and she has to make a large number of garments. Her business has been doing well, and she has been doing it for 10 years already. With the business, she has been able to offer a good education to her two sons. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she requests she will purchase larger quantities of wool and some accessories to meet the orders that she has and therefore improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of wool

loans.name: Jeanett

texts.es:
Jeanett es una mujer emprendedora ya que realiza diferentes actividades de producción, para fiestas y bautizos; elabora colitas, cintas y otros productos y en otras épocas del año elabora chocolate. Su esposo es consultor y tiene dos hijos.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chocolates para las fiestas navideñas; esto le beneficiará con el aumento de ingresos como también generará fuentes de trabajos ya que requiere para este trabajo la contratación de dos empleados.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jeanett is an enterprising woman who produces different items. For parties and baptisms she makes ribbons and other products. In other seasons of the year, she makes chocolate. Her husband is a consultant, and they have two children. The credit that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to make chocolate for the Christmas season. This will benefit her by raising her income as well as generating sources of jobs, since she needs to hire two employees to do this work. This is the second time that she is requesting a credit with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a responsible client with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make chocolate for the Christmas season

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica es una joven de 21 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. A su corta edad, realiza desde hace un año la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, negocio que le ha permitido lograr cierta independencia de sus padres y apoyar con algunos gastos de su hogar. El deseo de Mónica es seguir trabajando para  progresar y en el futuro poner un negocio más grande, es por eso que se toma muy enserio su trabajo dedicándole todo su tiempo libre, ya que también estudia, siendo lo más difícil alternar entre estas dos actividades. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá más cantidad de productos de belleza para comercializarlos y lograr mejores ingresos y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Monica is a 21 year old young woman. She is single and lives in her parents' house. At her young age, she has been selling cosmetics by catalog for a year. The business has allowed her to have a certain amount of independence from her parents and to help them with household expenses. Monica's desire is to continue working to progress and, in the future, to have a larger business. It is because of this that she takes her business very seriously, giving all of her free time to it. Since she also studies, the most difficult thing is to alternate between these two activities. It is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will acquire a larger quantity of beauty products to market and achieve higher income and therefore improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire larger quantities of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino  vive en la calle Inca Roca  de la zona Alto Tacagua  de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 24 y 16 años respectivamente.

Trabaja como chofer de automóvil en una de las líneas céntricas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinará en la compra de repuestos (pastillas de freno, fluidos, etc.) ya que por el constante uso del automóvil éste requiere un mantenimiento general.
 
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el segundo via kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sabino lives on Inca Roca Street, in the Alto Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He is married and lives with his wife and their two children aged 26 and 16. He works as a taxi driver on one of the main routes in the city. The loan will be used to buy spare parts (brake pads, brake fluid etc). As his vehicle is in constant use, it is always in need of general maintenance. This is his third loan with Impro, and the second with Kiva. The assessment shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Dame K. Léonie est née le 18/06/1968 à Cotonou. Originaire de Ouidah une ville historique du Benin, elle est mariée à DOMINGO Etienne, Administrateur des PTT. Elle est mère de 03 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de Première au Cours Secondaire et faute de soutien financier elle a dû abandonner les classes au profit  de la tresse et coiffure  dont elle semble avoir le don. Elle a ajouté à ce métier la vente de divers artcles: conserves, oeufs et pâtes alimentaires. Cela fait bientôt 03 ans qu'elle s'est mise  dans la distribution de pagnes. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et compte s'approvisionner en pagnes et bijoux.
texts.en:
Ms. Léonie K., born on June 18, 1968 in Cotonou, is originally from Ouidah, an historic city of Benin. She is married to Etienne DOMINGO, Administrator at PTT (postal, telecom, and broadcasting services) and is a mother with three children, who are all in school. She attended school through her junior year of high school, but due to a lack of financial support, she had to drop out in favor of hairdressing and braiding, which is work she seems to be gifted in. She has added to this business the sale of various goods: canned foods, eggs, and pasta. It has been three years since she got started in the distribution of "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth). She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and has intentions for a supply of pagnes and jewelry.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seven lengths of quality cloth and 12 jewelry ensembles (necklace, medallion, earring)

loans.name: Abrahan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Abrahán O. tiene la edad de 27 años habita en el sector de los madrigales, junto a su esposa e hijo, la señora le ayuda con los gastos de la casa ya que ella trabaja como dependienta, los sueños de don Abrahán es llegar a tener su propia casa ya terminada, el tiene su terreno pero actualmente vive en un pequeños cuarto ubicado en mismo terreno. Lo cual el solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para aumentar poco a poco su vivienda. Solicita un monto de C$ 6,000.00 córdobas para comprar materiales de construcción y poder comenzar hacer las mejoras para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Abrahan O. is 27 years old and he lives in the region of Los Madrigales, together with his wife and son. His wife helps him with the household expenses working as an employee. The dreams of Abrahan is to one day have his own home, fully finished. He has a plot of land but they live in a small room located on the land. He is requesting support from Afodenic to slowly improve his home. He requests a loan in the amount of 6000 cordobas to purchase construction materials so that he can start making improvements to their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build his home.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 23 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su hermana. “La Belleza cuesta”, es la frase de Victoria, quien vende productos de belleza hace 6 meses impulsada por los deseos de ayudar a las personas a verse mejor, ella piensa que todas las mujeres son hermosas pero que con sus productos se resalta esa belleza aún más, haciendo que aumente su autoestima, que es lo que más le gusta de su trabajo. E negocio es bueno, ya que recibe pedidos de muchas personas, logrando que su negocio crezca poco a poco y motivando a Victoria a ponerle más empeño. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá más productos para ofrecer y así aumentar sus ingresos para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 23 years old. She lives in her parents' house with her sister. "Beauty costs" is Victoria's motto. She sells beauty products, which she began 6 months ago, driven by her desire to help people see themselves better. She thinks that all women are beautiful, but her beauty products bring out even more beauty, increasing self esteem, which is what she likes most about her work. The business is good, since she receives orders from many people, achieving growth in her business little by little and motivating Victoria to put more effort into it. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money, she will acquire more products to offer and therefore increase her income to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cosmetics that she sells

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr: A. Zénébou est née en 1957 à BEMBEREKE dans  le Nord du Benin. Elle est mariée à ISSIAKA Abdoulaye, agent des forces armées béninoises à la retraîte et a trois enfants dont elle n'a plus la charge. Elle n'a pas fréquenté à cause du décès prématuré de sa mère. Depuis son jeune âge, elle revendait divers articles à savoir savons, fruits et autres. Elle alla en apprentisage de couture et  reçut  son diplôme de fin d'apprentisage. Parallèlement à l'exercice de son métier, elle a commencé  la vente de farine d'igname, de conserves, de pâtes alimentaires et d'autres produits de grande consommation. Elle sollicite ce prêt de 180000f d'une durée de 12 mois pour rehausser le niveau de son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en maïs et ignames.
texts.en:
Zénébou A. was born in 1957 in Bembereke in northen Benin. She is married to Abdoulaye Issiaka, a retired Beninese armed forces agent, and she has three children, none of whom are in her care anymore. She was unable to attend school thanks to the premature death of her mother. Since her youth, she has bought and re-sold various items such as soaps, fruit, and so on. She began an apprenticeship as a seamstress and received her diploma at the end of her apprenticeship. While working at her job, she also started selling yam flour, canned goods, food pastes, and other consumer goods. She is asking for this 12-month loan of 180,000f to raise the level of her business. She intends to supply herself with maize and yams.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of maize and 3 bags of yams

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es viuda, tiene 46 años y es madre de 4 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos independientes, viviendo en la actualidad con el último de sus hijos quien está estudiando. Ella se dedica a confeccionar ropa solo para niños y niñas en todos los modelos, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es  que sus clientes tienen una confianza hacia su buena labor y la recomiendan  mucho a sus amistades. Le es muy rentable porque la gama de clientes que tiene están con ella desde el momento en que puso su taller, entonces su clientela no disminuye, al contrario aumenta poco a poco. Le va muy bien. Este es ya su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar una máquina remalladora, además de comprar más materiales como: agujas, telas, hilos, etc.
texts.en:
Betty is a 46-year-old widow and mother of four, three of which are grown and independent, so she now lives with her youngest who is still in school. For four years she has worked sewing children’s clothing in all styles. What she enjoys about her business is the confidence her clients have in her work and the resulting referrals she receives to their friends. This is very lucrative for her because she’s retained the majority of clients with which she started when she first opened her shop and her client base has not diminished; to the contrary, it grows bit by bit. She is doing well. This is her second loan with MFP. She wants to buy an overlock machine, as well as materials such as needles, fabric, thread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an overlock machine

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Originaire de Bassila dans le Nord Benin, dame C. Cathérine est née en 1949. Elle est veuve depuis 15 ans et a cinq enfants dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Elevée par sa tante , elle n'a pas été à l'école et aidait cette dernière dans les travaux domestiques et champêtres. Après son mariage elle vendit du jus de mil et de maïs appelé TCHAKPALO. Depuis 15 ans elle s'est installée à cotonou ou elle vend divers articles tels le charbon de bois, la farine d'igname, le maïs et les tubercules d'igname. Elle sollicite ce prêt de 120000f en vue de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Coming from Bassila in North Benin, Mrs. Cathérine C. was born in 1949. She has been widowed for 15 years and has 5 children, of whom two are still in her care. Raised by her aunt, she did not go to school but rather helped her aunt with household and field work.

After her marriage, she sold a millet and maize beverage called "Tchakpalo". 15 years ago, she came to live in Cotonou, where she sells various items such as charcoal, coco yam flour, maize, and coco yams. She is requesting this loan of 120,000 f to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 sacks of manioc flour, 15 kg of dried beans, 10 sacks of charcoal, one half sack of coco yam flour, and a sack of corn

loans.name: Bajo San Antonio Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO BAJO SAN ANTONIO ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA LUISA AYDEE, ELLA ES SOLTERA Y TIENE TRES HIJOS A SU CARGO LOS MISMOS SON D. CINCO, SIETE  Y DOCE AÑOS. LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS SON TAMBIÉN MADRES D. FAMILIA QUE SE DEDICAN AL TRAJO D. COSTURERIA, VENTA D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES Y A LA COMPRA Y VENTA D. DIVERSOS PRODUCTOS PARA PODER MANTENER A SUS FAMILIAS. EL FINANCIAMIENTO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN ESTA DESTINADO AL INCREMENTO D. CAPITAL D. TRABAJO Y A LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS PARA LA VENTA. ELLAS NO PODÍAN CONTAR CON FINANCIAMIENTO DEBIDO A LOS BAJOS INGRESOS QUE POSEEN PERO DEBIDO A LA DEDICACIÓN QUE TIENEN AL TRABAJO LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL LES DA UNA NUEVA POSIBILIDAD D. MEJORAR SU CALIDA D. VIDA.
texts.en:
The group "Bajo San Antonio" (Lower San Antonio) is represented by Mrs. Luisa Aydee. She is single and responsible for three children who are aged 5, 7, and 12 years of age. The other members are also mothers with families; their businesses incluD. sewing, selling cosmetics, selling groceries and buying/selling of various products to maintain their families. The financing requested by the group is destined for increasing capital of work and buying materials to sell. Individually they would not qualify for a loan due to their low incomes but due to the dedication they have to working with the Fundación Agrocapital, they have a new possibility to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Léocardie

texts.fr: Dame A. Léocardie est née le 04/09/1975 à Natitingou. Elle est originaire de Djakotomè dans le MONO. Mère de 03 enfants, elle est mariée à DAGNI Lambert, cuisinier  de profession. Dès son jeune âge, elle assistait sa mère qui est une grande revendeuse de maïs et de boisson traditionnelle  à base de vin de palme dans les marchés environnant de leur village. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte il y à 15 ans et revend du maïs qu'elle achète dans le nord Benin. Bientôt deux ans qu'elle s'est spécialisée aussi dans la vente de liqueur à base de vin de palme localement appelée "SODABI" qu'elle livre en bidon de 25 litres .Ce prêt  de 100000fcfa lui permettra de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léocardie A. was born on September 4, 1975 in Natitingou. She comes from Djakotomè in the Mono. She is the mother of 3 children and is married to Lambert Dagni, who works as a cook. From her youth, she helped her mother who is a well-known seller of maize and a traditional drink made from palm wine in the markets near their village. She went out on her own 15 years ago, selling maize that she buys in the north of Benin. For about 2 years, she has also specialized in selling the palm liquor locally known as "sodabi" which she delivers in 25 liter jerry cans. This loan of 100,000 F CFA will allow her to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a barrel of 100 liters of palm wine

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.fr: Dame K. Eugenie est née en 1967 à Zinvié. Elle est mariée à AÏHOUNDA Georges , soudeur de formation. Elle a un seul enfant qui est aujourd'hui âgé de 04 ans. Elle abandonna les classes en Troisième au Cours Secondaire faute de soutien familial. Ensuite elle alla en apprentissage en couture pendant 05 ans et reçu son diplôme de fin d'apprentisage. Parallèlement à l'exercice de son métier, elle faisait de la distribution de pagnes. Mais, aujourd'hui, elle revend divers articles de consommation courante à savoir riz, maïs, condiments. Ce troisième prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eugenie K. was born in 1967 in Zivié. She's married to Georges AÏHOUNDA, a trained welder. She has only one child, who is now four years old. She dropped out of secondary school after the third year, lacking support from her family. She then learned sewing for 5 years and got her diploma. In parallel to this job, she used to sell pagnes (colorful African cloth). But today, she resells various staples such as rice, corn and condiments. This third loan will enable to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of corn, one sack of rice and one basket of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta Es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Roberta es viuda, tiene 61 años y 7 hijos, Roberta es profesora jubilada, Roberta tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asoc. La victoria en donde vende abarrotes y bebidas variadas, atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Además Roberta se dedica a la agricultura de cereales en sus terrenos de Acosvinchos.
Roberta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche y conservas diversas.
Los sueños de Roberta son sacar profesional a su ultimo hijo, continuar con su negocio hasta que pueda.
texts.en:
Roberta is a member of the communal bank Claveles (Carnations). Roberta is a widow, is 61 years old and has 7 children. Roberta is a retired teacher. Roberta has a store in her house, located in the La Victoria Association where she sells groceries and a variety of drinks. She attends her business from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. Additionally, Roberta work in grain farming on her land in Acosvinchos. Roberta needs a 1200 Soles loan, which will be invested in buying rice, sugar, milk, and various canned goods. Roberta's dreams are that her last son will become a professional and will continue with her business until he can.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roberta needs a 1200 Soles loan which will be invested in buying rice, sugar, milk, and various canned goods

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.es:
Sulpicia es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Sulpicia es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Sulpicia vende comida de manera ambulatoria en un lugar llamado 5 esquinas que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza hace muchos años, la especialidad de Sulpicia son anticuchos (preparados a base de corazón), rachi (preparada con los intestinos), durante el día prepara y condimenta la carne con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Sulpicia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, papa, pollo.
Los sueños de Sulpicia son terminar de cancelar de unos terrenos que compro, techar el tercer piso de su casa y el matrimonio de su ultimo hijo.
texts.en:
Sulpicia is a member of the Banco Comunal Claveles. Sulpicia is a 53-year-old married mother of three children. She sells food at a place called five corners in the center of the city. She has been selling food for many years. Her speciality is anticuchos (a quechuan skewered meat prepared in a base of the animal's heart) and rachi (a grilled beef tripe prepared with the animal's intestines). During the day she prepares and seasons the meat with the help of her children. Sulpicia asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of meat, potatoes and chicken. Sulpicia's dreams are to finish paying off territories she purchased, to shingle the third floor of her house, and to see her oldest son marry.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of meat, potatoes and chicken

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Dame K. Denise est née en 1974 à Zinvié. Elle est mariée à grégoire DANSONHOUN, moniteur d'un centre d'auto école, et est mère de 03 enfants dont Peace la benjamine (04 ans) est en classe de CI. Dame K. Denise a été  à fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM1. Elle abandonna les classes pour aider sa mère les jours du marché dans la vente de divers articles et produits vivriers. Ensuite elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec l'aide de sa grand-mère qui lui a trouvée un stand au grand marché Dantokpa de Cotonou où elle vendait  de la farine de manioc, du maïs , du haricot et autres produits vivriers.  Elle a jugé apprendre un métier, ainsi elle a suivi une formation en coiffure et tresse. Elle reçut son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage en 1995. Depuis sa libération, elle exerce ce métier et a ajouté à cela la vente des produits cosmétiques, de mèches, de tissages et autres produits de beauté.Ce troisième prêt  de 130000f viendra renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Denise K. was born in 1974 in Zinvié. She's married to Grégoire DANSONHOUN, an instructor in a driving school center. She's the mother of 3 children, out of which Peace, the youngest, attends school. Mrs. Denis K. dropped out school after middle-school, to help her mother in selling various items and food products during market days. She then became self-employed with the help of her grandmother, who found her a stand in the grand market Dantokpa in Cantonou, where she sells tapioca, corn, beans, and other food products. She also learned hairdressing and braiding, and received her diploma in 1995. Since then, she's been a hairdresser, and she also began selling cosmetics, hair extensions and other beauty products. This third loan of XOF 130'000 will help her bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bale of hair extensions and a dozen boxes of cosmetics

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
Katia es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Katia es casada, tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Katia vende ropa en un tienda ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, cuyo local es alquilado, Katia vende ropa solo para niños, mientras que su esposo tiene otra tienda en donde vende ropa para adultos, para lo cual cuenta con empleadas que le ayudan en la atención, Katia y su esposo adquieren su mercadería de la ciudad de Lima.
Katia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que era invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe.
Los sueños de Katia son mejorar su casa y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the Banco Comunal Claveles. Katis is a 28-year-old married mother of a sole daughter. Katia sells clothing in a rented stand situated on a central street in the city of Ayacucho. She sells children's clothing only. Her husband has another stand where he sells clothing for adults and in which he employs help to attend to customers. Katia and her husband acquire their merchandise in the city of Lima. Katia asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of infant's clothing. Her dreams are to improve her home and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of infant's clothing

loans.name: Banco Comunal Baloncito Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Baloncito está compuesto por 15 personas, la mayoría de los clientes se dedican al comercio de ropa, cosméticos, fruta y venta de comida.
Marita A. H..- es la líder del banco de emprendimiento, la Sra. Marita tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, se dedica a la actividad de la venta de comida y su esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte público en el centro de la ciudad.
Rosmery H. R.- es la secretaria del banco de emprendimiento, ella se dedica a la venta de vajillas y utensilios del hogar, labor que realiza de manera ambulante, vive en una casa familiar tiene un hijo y es madre soltera, por lo que su trabajo representa su único medio de subsistencia.
Su objetivo es colocar con el tiempo una tienda  de barrio, para así aumentar sus ingresos  
Juana Rosa R. D..-  La Sra. Juana es Tesorera del banco de emprendimiento, actualmente vive en la localidad de La Guardia, Santa Cruz, en una pequeña casa en alquiler, se dedica a la  actividad de promotora de cosméticos (avon, yambal, etc.).
Vive con su esposo y su hijo, su esposo se dedica  a la actividad de albañilería desde hace 5 años.
El sueño de ambos es llegar a contar con una movilidad propia para así de esa manera  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Baloncito, is composed of 15 people. The majority of the clients work in the sale of clothing, cosmetics, fruits and food. - Marita A. H. is the leader of this lending bank. Ms Marita has her own home and lives with her husband and three children. She sells food and her husband is a public transportation worker in the center of the city. - Rosmery H. R. is the secretary of this lending bank. She sells tableware and household utensils. She lives in a single-family home. She is a single mother and has a son. Her work provides her with her only means of subsistence. Her goal is to obtain a stand and increase her revenue. - Juana Rosa R. D. is the treasurer of the lending bank. Currently she lives in the La Guardia, Santa Cruz locality in a small rented home. She is a cosmetics (avon, yambal, etc.) salesperson. She lives with her husband. He has worked as a mason for 5 years. As a group, their dream is to gain self-mobility so as to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey dans le Zou, dame Z. Martine est née en 1971 à Cotonou. Mariée à HEMAHO François , cuisinier, elle est mère de 05 enfants dont 03 sont à sa charge. Après son échec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire (CEP), elle a aidé sa mère dans la distribution vente de savons. Puis, elle alla en apprentissage de couture pendant 04 ans, mais malheureusement elle n'a pas obtenu le diplôme de fin d'apprentissage pour des raisons personnelles. Néanmoins elle exerçe le métier à la maison sur les commandes qu'elle reçoit et vend également de la glace, du jus de bissape, du yaourt et autres. Depuis 04 ans, elle s'est lancée dans la vente des habits pour enfants, les lingeries de femmes et les chaussures pour enfants. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martine Z. was born in 1971 in Cotonou and grew up in Abomey in the district of Zou. She is married to Mr. François Hemaho, a cook, and is the mother of five children, three of whom are in her care. After failing her 8th grade school certificate, she helped her mother sell and distribute soap. She then became an apprentice seamstress for four years, but unfortunately did not pass the final exam for personal reasons. Nevertheless, she works as a seamstress at home on a per-order basis and also sells ice cream, hibiscus juice, yoghurt and other products. For the last four years she has been involved in selling children’s clothing, women’s lingerie and children’s shoes. She is requesting this third loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six dozen outfits and six dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
A single parent with one child, Rose A. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn and is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. This type of Kenkey has a fairly long life span and is normally kept in plastic bags and sold at the roadside, most customers being travelers. As well, Rose bakes bread for sale at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast. She has operated both businesses since 1996.

Rose is responsible for the payment of utility bills and her child's school fees. Her loan request will enable her to buy more maize, firewood and other materials needed in the preparation of Kenkey. She also wants to invest in her bread production business, hoping to save the additional profits to eventually acquire a piece of land upon which she hopes to build a house for herself and her child.

loans.use: To buy more maize, firewood and other materials needed in the preparation of Kenkey.

loans.name: José Feliciano

texts.es: El señor José Feliciano L. tiene la edad de 27 años habita en la comunidad palo de leche ubicada en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa eh hijos, la esposa de don José trabaja como domestica para ayudarle con los gastos de casa, este señor tiene siete años de trabajar como agricultor, pero le a costado mucho tener una buena producción ya que anteriormente no tenia el apoyo de ninguna institución para comprar los suficientes insumos. El sueño de don  José es llegar a ampliar sus cultivos para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia esta muy contento ya que Afodenic le esta apoyando para sacar mejor producción y vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Señor José Feliciano L. is 27-years-old and lives in the community of Palo de Leche, which is located in the area of Ticuantepe. He lives there with his wife and children. Don José's wife works as a maid to help him with their home's expenses. This gentleman has worked for 7 years as a farmer, but it has been very difficult for him to have a good yield since previously he didn't have the support of an institution to buy enough supplies. Don José's dream is to expand his crop to give his family better living conditions. He is very happy that Afodenic is supporting him to produce more and to sell his crops at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds to increase and fertilize his crops

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy Es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Nancy vende frutas variadas en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril, su puesto esta ubicado cerca de una de las puertas de acceso al mercado, las frutas los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los días sábados y domingos cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papaya y piña.
Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su casa, tener una tienda de abarrotes y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Banco Comunal Claveles. Nancy is 34 years old and has two children. She sells a variety of fruits at a stand in the 12th of April market. Her stand is located near one of the entrances to the market. She acquires the fruits at the supply market of the city of Ayacucho. On saturdays and sundays her children help her. Nancy asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of papaya and pineapple. Her dreams are to improve her home, to have a grocery stand, and to see her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of papaya and pineapple

loans.name: Massiatou

texts.fr: Originaire de Savè dans le centre du Benin, dame A. Massiatou est née le 13/09/1967 à Cotonou . Mariée à QUENUM Richard ,promoteur d'artistes musiciens, elle est mère de 04 enfants  dont la benjamine Eurudie (07 ans) est en classe de CE2 . Après son echec au Brevet  d'Etude du Premier Cycle (BEPC) et avec l'aide financière de sa mère elle s'est lancée dans la vente des cossettes de manioc et des tubercules d'ignames dans le grand marché Dantokpa. Aprés son mariage, elle s'est installée chez son mari  où elle developpa la même activité en prenant le soin d'y ajouter la vente d'autres articles tels que oeufs, miel, les cartes de recharges pour téléphones mobiles, les menus articles de grande consommation  et les disques  audio. En vue de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 300000fcfa pour une durée de 10 mois.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massiatou A. was born on September 13, 1967 in Cotonou and grew up in Savé, in the center of Benin. She is married to Richard Quenum, a music promoter, and is the mother of four children, the youngest of whom, Eurudie (aged 7), is in third grade. After failing her 9th grade school certificate, and with the financial help of her mother, she became involved in selling cassava chips and yams in the large Dantokpa market. After she got married, she settled in her husband’s home where she continued in the same business, making the effort to add further items such as eggs, honey, cell phone charge cards, miscellaneous staples and CDs. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a third loan of CFA 300,000 over a 10-month period.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 150 CDs, 60 trays of eggs, two bags of cassava chips and 40 cell phone charge cards.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Julia vende zapatillas al por mayor y menor, sus ventas son en gran parte a crédito y los realiza ambulatoriamente, reparte a los comerciantes de los diferentes mercados  y por las tardes se dedica a la cobranza, además los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una tienda estable para vender sus productos y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II (which means Heart of Gold in quechua). Julia is a 52-year-old married mother of 5 children. She sells adult's and children's shoes. Her sales are primarily credit-based. She distributes to merchants of different markets, and dedicates her afternoons to collecting from clients. Saturdays and Sundays she travels to the fairs. Julia asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes. Her dreams are to have a permanent stand where she sells her products and to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of shoes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M., who is married with three children, has been selling used clothing at the market place in Cape Coast since 2002. She uses her income to pay for the children's school fees and the utility bills. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Rebecca is requesting a loan to increase the quantity of used clothing she sells to meet increased demand. She plans to save for future use the increased profits that will result from her expanded business.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of used clothing she sells to meet increased demand.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: María, de 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos, siendo uno de ellos ya independiente, viviendo ahora con dos de sus hijos y su esposo, quien está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos y yucas en las afueras de su casa, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar, este negocio lo viene haciendo hace un año atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es darles una buena atención a sus clientes, como también conoce a mucha gente. Le es rentable, ya que es la única persona que vende estos productos que la gente de la selva consume a diario. Le va excelente. Este es su préstamo Nº 7 en MFP. El dinero será utilizado en mandar a construir un kiosco y así poder vender más tranquila sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a 37-year-old mother of 3 children, one of which is already independent. María lives with her husband and two children. She sells plantains and yuca in front of her home (since it is situated in a great location). She has operated this business for over a year. What she enjoys most about her work is providing great service to her clients. She has been profitable because not only does she know many people but she is the only person who sells these products, which are consumed on a daily basis. This is her 7th loan from MFP. She asks for the loan to use in the construction of a stand, which would help her sell her products more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stand for her business

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan de la cruz C. tiene la edad de 54 años habita en los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa ellos tiene  una pulpería la cual la señora la atiende  a su cargo tiene un hijos ya que los demás están casados y viven por cuenta propia, los sueños de don Juan es mejorar su finca para obtener mejor rendimiento en productividad y de esa manera comprar mas tierras y heredar a sus hijos. Este señor tiene 30 años trabajando como agricultor la dificultad mayor ha sido que no le han brindado financiamiento y las plagas han hechos de que sus cultivos no produzcan lo suficiente  por lo cual no ha tenido un resultado sastifactorio para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Señor Juan de la cruz C. is 54 years of age. He lives by the rivers located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife. He has a store which his wife tends. They have one child in their care, since the others are married and live on their own. Juan's dream is to improve his farm to obtain better performance in productivity and in that way to buy more lands for his children to inherit. This man has worked as a farmer for 30 years. The greatest difficulty has been that he has not had financing and plagues have affected his crops so they do not produce enough, which has lead to an unsatifactory result from his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer and herbicide for his crops.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Odilia es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos,  Odilia viaja todas las semanas a la ciudad de Pisco que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende quesos, papa, cereales, panes típicos, sus productos los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y de Pisco en algunas oportunidades compra choclo que vende en los mercados de Ayacucho.
Odilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, panes.
Los sueños de Odilia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Odilia is a member of the Communal Ccori Soncco II Bank, which means Heart of Gold in Quechuan. Odilia is 44 years old, and is married with 7 children. Odilia travels every week to the city of Pisco which is located 6 hours from the city of Ayacucho where she sells cheese, potatoes, cereals, and traditional breads. She buys her supply of products in the cities of Ayacucho and Pisco and occasionally buys corn for sale in the markets of Ayacucho.
