Odilia needs a loan of $325 that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and grains. Odilia dreams of providing a good education for her children and bettering her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Odilia needs a loan of $325 that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and grains.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: Mirna, de 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y su conviviente quien la apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 8 años, gracias a este negocio está sacando adelante a sus hijos, quienes la apoyan mucho también. Este negocio le es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela que lo consumen sus productos diariamente. Además cuenta también con las ganancias de otros negocios que se encuentran a cargo su pareja, uno; y el otro su hijo. Este es al tercer préstamo con MFP, es una persona responsable en sus pagos.  Con el dinero quiere comprar más productos de pan llevar, y también mandar a construir un kiosco para dar una buena atención a su clientes.
texts.en:
Mirna is 31 years old and lives with her 4 children and her partner who supports her, especially in her business. She has sold groceries and essential goods for 8 years. Thanks to this business she is able to support her children. This business is profitable because she has a clientele that consumes her products daily. Additionally, she counts on the profits of other businesses that her partner and son are in charge of. This is her third loan with MFP. She is a responsible person with her payments. With the money she wants to buy more bread products to carry and to build a kiosk to give good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products in her grocery store.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia Es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Aurelia es casada, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Aurelia es feriante y viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de donde compra quesos, animales, que luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los beneficia y vende de casa en casa.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, carneros.
Los sueños de Aurelia son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccori Concco II” which means Heart of Gold in Quechua. Aurelia is married, 60 years old, and has 3 children. She is a businesswoman who travels to different markets in the region where she buys cheeses and animals that she transports to Ayacucho city. She feeds the animals and sells them house to house. Aurelia needs a loan for 1100 soles to buy cheeses and sheep. Aurelia dreams of improving her business and of her children finishing their studies and becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chese and sheep

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel de 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian, vive junto a su conviviente que la apoya en sus objetivos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa al por menor, los lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares e intercambia ideas con sus clientes.  Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con una clientela selecta. Y le va muy bien. Este es su cuarto préstamo, y ha pagado siempre de manera puntual. Ahora desea comprar más prendas en distintos modelos para niños y adultos, posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old, the mother of 3 school age children, and lives with a partner that supports her in her objectives. For 3 years she has sold clothing, taking them to different places in her area. What she likes about her work is visiting different places and exchanging ideas with her clients. The business is profitable because it has a select clientele. She is doing very well. This is the 4th loan and she has always paid on time. Now she wants to buy more clothing in different styles for adults and children and rent a place to put her clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different styles of children's clothes.

loans.name: Yanira Laura

texts.es:
Yanira es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Yanira es soltera, tiene 27 años y vive con sus padres, Yanira estudio Enfermería y trabaja eventualmente y vende productos naturales denominado Santa Natura, que ofrece a través de catálogos a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito.
Yanira necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos naturales.
Yanira sueña con tener un capital propio, implementar una empresa de salud con productos naturales.
texts.en:
Yanira is a member of the Communal Ccori Soncco II Bank, which means Heart of Gold in Quechuan. Yanira is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Yanira is studying Nursing and works selling natural products called Saint Nature, offered through catalogs to friends and family on credit. Yanira needs a loan of $325 which she will invest in the purchase of natural products. Yanira dreams of having her own capital to start a health care company with natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yanira needs a loan of $325 that she will invest in buying natural products.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Originaire de Savalou dans les Collines au centre du Benin, dame D. Virginie est née le 08/07/1965 à Cotonou. Mariée  à GBAGUIDI Jean ,chauffeur de formation, elle est mère de 04 enfants dont  Innocent le benjamin (18 ans) est en classe de terminale. Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CE2. Après l'abandon classes, elle a commencé par vendre des fruits (oranges surtout), du pains sucrés et autres  menus articles de consommation immédiate avec ses propres revenus. Elle a aussi orienté son activité vers la vente de conserves et de savons. Depuis 05 ans elle a maintenu la vente de ces divers artcles mais ajouta la vente des tissus pour laquelle elle est ambulante. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt  de 200000fcfa pour rehausser le niveau de son activité. Elle compte s'apprivisionner en tissus, sucre et savons.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginie D. was born on July 8, 1965 in Cotonou, Benin, and grew up in Savalou in the central Benin hills known as ‘les Collines’. Married to Jean Gbaguidi, a trained chauffeur, she is mother to four children, the youngest of whom, Innocent (18 years old), is in twelfth grade. She attended school up to third grade. After abandoning her studies she started selling fruit (oranges in particular), sweet rolls and other items for immediate consumption, providing her with her own income. She also steered her business toward selling canned foods and soap. She has continued selling these various items for five years, but she has also added fabrics, which she sells door-to-door. She is requesting this third loan of 200,000 FCFA ($400) to strengthen her business. She intends to stock up on fabrics, sugar and soap.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bolt of fabrics, half a case of sugar cubes and a case of soap

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 25 años, está conviviendo con su esposo, de esta unión, tienen dos hijos pequeños. Celia ha crecido con la actividad de la agricultura, ahora trabaja mucho más porque tienen anhelos de progresar con su pareja. Cada día, una vez preparados los alimentos, se va llevando el almuerzo a los campos, entonces se queda ahí trabajando hasta las 6.00 p.m. con su esposo. Le agrada la chacra, sobre todo sembrar flores en grandes cantidades, porque demora en florecer solo dos meses, Celia tiene sus terrenos apropiados para el cultivo de variedad de flores, asimismo  siembra papa, solo que la siembra de esta es más dificultoso porque se invierte mucho más en fertilizantes. Es una socia que pertenece al VII ciclo, es su 7mo préstamo, y en todo este tiempo sus pagos han sido puntuales. El dinero será invertido en la compra de 70 sacos de semilla de flores.
texts.en:
Celia is 25 years old and lives with her husband, with whom she has two young children. Celia has grown with agriculture, and now she works a lot more because she wishes to make progress with her husband. Every day, once food is prepared, she brings lunch to the fields and she works there until 6:00pm with her husband. The small farm makes her happy. Above all, she enjoys planting lots of flowers because they only take two months to bloom. Celia has the right land to grow a variety of flowers and she also grows potatoes, although this is more difficult because they require more fertilizers. She is a member of the Seventh Cycle Bank, this is her 7th loan, and during her membership the payments have been punctual. This money will be used to buy 70 bags of flower seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flower seeds

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Wilma es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Wilma tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende carne de cerdo, los animales los compra en distintas ciudades como Andahuaylas a donde viaja los viernes y regresa los días domingos, los animales los beneficia en el camal y también vende al por mayor. 
Wilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Wilma sueña con tener una bodega surtida en su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilma is a member of the Communal Ccori Soncco II Bank, which means Heart of Gold in Quechuan. Wilma is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. Wilma has a stall in the market F. Vivanco, located in the center of the city of Ayacucho, where she sells pork. She purchases the animals in different cities like Andahuaylas which she travels to on Friday and returns on Sunday. She makes a profit by slaughtering the pigs and also by selling them wholesale. Wilma needs a loan of $325 that she will invest by purchasing pigs. Wilma dreams of having a small stocked store in her house and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wilma needs a loan of $325 that will be invested in buying pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda hace 12 años, tiene tres hijos que viven con ella. Después de haberse quedado viuda se dedicó a vender postres en la plaza de su pueblo, después le dieron la oportunidad de vender comida y postres en el cafetín de la escuela. Así trabajó hasta hace 8 meses, que tuvo que dejarlo por motivos de salud.  Paralelamente a su negocio, toda su vida ha sembrado papa, ahora con la ayuda de sus hijos siembra diversas variedades de este tubérculo, para su consumo y para la venta, ya que le dan un buen precio y le deja ganancias fuera de su inversión, su mayor dificultad es que no le alcanza dinero para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades. Elena tiene su 7mo préstamo con MFP, todo este tiempo demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. La compra que hará será de 20 sacos de guano para el abonado de la papa que le cuesta un aproximado de S/.500.00, además de pagar al operario.
texts.en:
Elena is a 45-year-old woman who has been a widow for 12 years. She has three children who live with her. After having been widowed, she decided to sell pastry in the town square. She was then given the opportunity to sell food and dessert in a school snack bar, where she worked up until 8 months ago when she had to leave the job due to health reasons. Aside from her business, she has grown potatoes all her life. Now, with the help of her children, she grows several varieties of this tuber, both for their consumption and for sale. Customers pay well for her crops, and she is able to make a profit. Her biggest problem, however, is that she does not have enough money to be able to plant greater quantities of potatoes. This is Elena’s 7th loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated payment punctuality the whole time. She will purchase 20 sacks of guano, which will cost approximately 500.00 PEN, to fertilize the potatoes, and she will pay the workers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for potato crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a single parent and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Elizabeth sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. She also sells bowls and cosmetics at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. Elizabeth uses her income for the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more maize as raw materials and firewood as fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey. She also wants to invest in her business of selling bowls and cosmetics. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to increase the quality of education for her children.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more maize and firewood

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba B. sells used clothing at Cape Coast. Habiba has received no formal education. She is a single parent and has 3 children. Habiba has been selling used clothing since 2004. She is responsible for payment of school fees, utility bills, rent and other family expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital for the buying of more used clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land she wants to buy to put up a house for her children and herself.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital for the buying of more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Valeria Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Wiracocha (“Sun God” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is a 66-year-old widow with three children; she currently lives alone. Norma has a store in a rented space in the San Cristóbal Cultural Center in the center of the city of Ayacucho. She sells local crafts and artwork such as altarpieces, ceramics, alabaster and textiles. She works all day, six days per week.

Norma needs a loan of 1250 soles (US$425) to buy altarpieces and weavings. Norma’s dreams are to improve her store, sell silver jewelery, and travel to Israel to see the Holy Land.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.

Norma es V., tiene 66 años y 3 hijos, actualmente vive sola, Norma tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en el centro cultural San Cristóbal ubicada en el centro D. la ciudad en donD. venD. artesanía ayacuchana como retablos, cerámica, piedra D. huamanga, textiles, actividad que realiza 6 días a la semana durante todo el día.

Norma necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. retablos y tejidos
Los sueños D. Norma son mejorar su tienda, vender joyas D. plata y viajar a Israel a conocer la Tierra Santa.

loans.use: Buy altarpieces and weavings

loans.name: G.s Pan Y Fuerza Group

texts.es:
La señora Sabina Simona Narváez T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es acompañada, ella tiene tres hijos una mujer  de 28 años de edad quien es costurera, un varón de 23 años que trabaja por cuenta propia y un varón de 15 años quien recientemente cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora en un  camión de acarreo, el deseo de Doña Sabina es superar su negocio y montar un local adecuado y que preste las condiciones adecuadas porque su vivienda es muy pequeña y debido a las circunstancias ha convertido su casa en un taller de costura y así no podrá desenvolverse muy bien en su trabajo,  por lo que su amiga Doña Cándida le ha brindado el apoyo para que esta siga adelante con su negocio, otros de sus deseos es mantener una mano amiga dispuesta como Fundación León 2000 que siga financiando sus necesidades comerciales para así sobrellevar la difícil situación progresar en lo que es su trabajo. 

Su actividad económica es costurera como lo es: la realización de uniformes, vestidos y pantalones  para damas y caballeros , el tiempo de estar en el  negocio son de 10 años, ella inicia su negocio trabajando con otra persona, pero mas tarde decide vender  en el mercado de Chinandega, luego con sus ganancias decide comprar una  maquina en la que empieza la realización de los pedidos de uniforme por lo que es necesario el  financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo la compra de  materia prima como lo es la tela, hilo, zipper  para la fabricación de los distintos pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, ella dice estar agradecida con fundación y las diferentes organizaciones por facilitar este tipo de ayuda en crédito.

Doña Cándida Eufemia M. T.  tiene la edad de 51 años su estado civil es acompañada, tiene seis hijos de los cuales las mujeres tienen las edades de 32,30 y 17 los varones tienen edades de 22,28 y 25, su compañero de vida no labora, en sus propósitos tiene establecer una  pulpería  en su vivienda y establecer un negocio mas fuerte y productivo  y así mantener su crédito disponible con Fundación León 2000 para capitalizar la actividad económica, otros de sus propósitos es proporcionar mejores ingresos a su familia ya que no  a cumplido sus propósitos  por la situación económica que el país  pasa actualmente, por lo que sus deseos son de darle un futuro a su hija para que mas adelante ella pueda defenderse con sus estudios y así coronar su carrera.
Doña Cándida tiene la actividad comercial hace 20 años vendiendo productos que estuvieran en flota como lo es: maíz, semilla de jícaro y maní, ella inicia su negocio por el interés de incursionar en este tipo de negocio ya que buscaba la forma de poder sustentar a su familia es   como ella llega a la conclusión de que este negocio proporciona ingresos y  mas tarde logra adquirir experiencia en este parte del negocio  lo  que la hace sentirse  a ella  mas afianzada obteniendo el apoyo de su amiga Sabina y de sus  hijas, el financiamiento lo necesita para capital de trabajo ya que desea invertir en una venta  para tener otro medio de ingreso que le genere ingresos  para pagar sus compromisos contraídos.
texts.en:
Sabina Simona Narvaez T. is 47 years old. She has a domestic partner and three children: one 28 year old daughter who is a seamstress, one 23 year old son who is self-employed and one 15 year old son who recently finished his third year of high school. Her life partner works in trucking. Sabina's wish is to advance her business and start a shop and provide the right conditions because their house is very small. Due to circumstances, she has converted her house into a seamstress shop and, as a result, she is not able to unwind from her work. Her friend, Candida, has offered support so that she can get ahead with her business. Her other wishes are to maintain an open hand of friendship like Fundacion Leon 2000 that continues to finance her commercial needs so that she can overcome the difficult situation of progressing in her work.

Her economic activity is seamstress work such as making uniforms, dresses, and women's and men's trousers. She has had this business for ten years. She started it working with another person, but later, she decided to sell in the Chinandega market. Then with her earnings, she decided to buy a machine with which she could fulfill orders for uniforms. This loan will be used as working capital to buy raw materials like fabric, thread and zippers for different orders that her customers make. She says that she is thankful for the funding and the different organizations that facilitate this type of loan assistance.

Candida Eufemia M. T. is 51 years old. She has a domestic partner and six children. Her daughters are 32, 30 and 17 years old and her sons are 22, 28 and 25 years old. Her life partner does not work. Among her goals are to establish a store in her home and to start a stronger and more productive business. In this manner she can maintain the credit available with Fundacion Leon 2000 and capitalize on economic activity. Her other goals are to provide better earnings for her family since she has not achieved her goals due to the current economic state of the country. Her desires are to give her daughter a future so that later she can pursue her studies and have a successful career.

Candida has worked for twenty years selling products that were shipped like maize, jicama seed and peanuts. She began her business through the interest in entering this type of business since she was searching for a way to support her family. She came to the conclusion that this business would provide income. Later, when she had experience, what made her feel more confident was obtaining the support of her friend Sabina and her two daughters. She needs a loan for working capital since she wishes to invest in a sale so that she can have another means of income that generates earnings so she can pay her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 44 años, tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos aun viven con ella, el mayor ya tiene su esposa. Desde los 14 años trabajaba en un restaurante como moza, luego a los 18 años ascendió como cajera, época donde tuvo a su primer hijo, tiempo después conoció al que es su esposo y se fue a vivir a Patay, pueblo de su esposo, desde entonces, exactamente 19 años, tiene una bodega denominad “Don Diego”. Con Prisma viene trabajando desde el 2005, esto le ha ayudado a su esposo para la siembra su chacra de papa, y ella en su bodega. Al medio día envía almuerzo para su esposo y operarios, a veces lleva misma lo lleva, pero regresa rápidamente para no perder clientela, no tiene dificultad en su negocio, ni en la chacra su esposo. Esta socia está en el ciclo VII (7mo préstamo) es una socia muy activa y puntual en sus pagos. Con este dinero comprará arroz y azúcar, varios sacos, porque los precios están variando constantemente, el con el resto comprarán fertilizantes para sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Nelly is 44 years old and has 4 children, 3 of them still live with her and the oldest is married. From the age of 14 she worked in a restaurant as a waitress and later at the age of 18 she became a cashier, during which time she had her first child. Later she met her husband and went to live in Patay where her husband is from. For 19 years she has had a small grocery store called “Don Diego”. She has been working with Prisma since 2005, helping her husband plant their potato farm and working in the grocery store. At noon she sends lunch for her husband and the workers. Sometimes she takes it herself but returns quickly so she doesn’t lose customers. She doesn’t have any problems with her business or her husband’s farm. This is her 7th loan and she makes her payments regularly and on time. With this money she will buy several bags of rice and sugar because the price is constantly changing and with the remaining money she will buy fertilizer for the potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Demecio

texts.es:
El Sr. Demecio Gutiérrez es nacido en la localidad de Vallegrande de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, actualmente vive en Pto. Rico, en la localidad del Torno, Santa Cruz, tiene casa propia en la cual vive con su esposa y sus hijos.
El se dedica conjuntamente su esposa al comercio de patos y animales en las feria ganaderas de la localidad. Hace tres años que trabaja con EMPRENDER, él mismo comenta que gracias al microcrédito que le fue otorgado, pudo seguir trabajando con su negocio y así pudo construir su casita los prestamos otorgados fueron de gran  beneficio.
texts.en:
Mr. Demecio Gutiérrez is a native of Vallegrande, Santa Cruz, Bolivia, but now lives in Puerto Rico, Torno, Santa Cruz. He has his own home in which he lives with his wife and children. He works alongside his wife in a duck and animal business in the animal markets of the area. He has worked with EMPRENDER for three years and he says that thanks to the microloans he received, he was able to keep working in his business and he was able to build his house. The loans he has received have been of great benefit to him.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice M. sells groceries like Milo, milk and other things at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast. Eunice has received a junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children and her husband is a commercial driver. Eunice has been selling groceries since 2004. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to add clothing, fabric and footwear to the groceries she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to include clothing, fabric and footwear to the groceries she sells.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 33 años, es conviviente, en un año se casará con su pareja, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos.  Cuando era soltera trabajaba en la chacra de sus padres, pero ahora desde que tiene sus hijos pequeños está al cuidado de ellos, ya que por el clima se están enfermando constantemente. Por ello, ahora se está dedicando a cocinar el almuerzo y luego le llevarlo al campo a su esposo, y regresa de inmediato. En cambio su esposo trabaja desde las 7.00 a.m. hasta las 5.00 p.m. en sus cultivos de papa, han sembrado 3 hectáreas. Esta socia de un banco comunal de MFP, y está en su 7mo préstamo, ella se responsabiliza de los pagos puntuales. Con este dinero comprará 12 sacos de semilla de papa, fertilizante y abono, durante la siembra se abona para que coseche el producto sin gusanos
texts.en:
Mayela is 33 years old and currently lives with her partner who she will be marrying in one year. The fruit of this relationship has been 3 children. When she was single she worked on her parents small farm, but now she has small children who she cares for, particularly because due to the climate they are constantly getting sick. For that reason, she now dedicates herself to cooking lunch and then taking it into the fields to her husband after which she return immediately. In turn her husband works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. in their potato crop; they have planted 3 hectares. Mayela is part the MFP community bank, and is on her 7th loan, for which she takes the responsibility of making her payments on time. With this loan she will buy 12 sacks of potato seed, and fertilizer that they will use during the planting season so that their crop is free of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi tiene 27 años, su estado actual es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Ella es ama de casa, se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. a preparar el almuerzo, después da de comer a sus animales o los sujeta en el campo ante una estaca, después de esto a las 11 lleva el almuerzo para su esposo, en seguida se queda trabajando en su chacra de papas, que es el producto que siembra en mayor cantidad. A Ovi le agrada esa actividad, ya que desde niña lo hizo. Para ella, la agricultura es rentable,  sobre todo cuando en el mercado tiene buen precio, les deja ganar muy bien y recuperar su inversión, lo difícil es cuando tiene que comprar los fertilizantes, solo en pensar en ello, le producen un dolor de cabeza. Es una socia muy puntal en sus pagos, este es su 7mo préstamo. El dinero será usado en la compra de insecticidas para controlar el bicho llamado “la rancha” que se forma cuando llueve y solea.
texts.en:
Ovi is 27 years old, currently lives with her partner, and has 3 children who are the reason for her hard work. Ovi is the homemaker and wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare lunch, after which she feeds the animals or ties them to a stake in the fields. At 11 she brings lunch to her husband, and then stays to work on their small potato farm, which is the crop that they plant in largest quantity. Ovi enjoys this activity which she has done since she was a small girl. For her, agriculture is profitable, especially when the market is doing well, which allows them to earn very well and regain their investment. What is difficult is when she has to buy fertilizer; only thinking of buying fertilizer gives her a headache. She is part of the communal bank and is always very punctual on her payments. This is her 7th loan. She will use the loan to buy insecticide to control a pest called “la rancha” that develops when it rains and then becomes sunny.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Sonia tiene 43 años, es conviviente con su esposo, tuvo cuatro hijos, de los cuales ahora viven con uno de ellos. Es de padres agricultores, ahora que tiene su esposo también realiza la misma actividad, se dedican a sembrar arvejas en mayor cantidad. Primero siembra papas y abona bien esas tierras, en seguida, en esa misma chacra siembra en grandes cantidades de arvejas, con la finalidad de aprovechar el abonado de la chacra. Sembrar arvejas le es más rentable, porque nos dice que es menos la inversión, por ello le gusta sembrar ese producto, lo más dificultoso es el alza de los fertilizantes, porque van con una determinada cantidad de dinero y no les alcanza. Este es préstamo Nº 7 con MFP, tiempo en el cual ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará 8 sacos de “temex” producto que sirva para contrarrestar la gusanera de la papa, producto que cuesta cada uno S/.245, con el resto del dinero, comprará también pesticidas para las hojas de sus arvejas, lo que le costará S/.1,200.00, solo en pesticidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 43 years old, lives with her husband, had 4 children, and now they live with one of them. Her parents where farmers, and now that she has her husband she also farms. Mostly they dedicate themselves to cultivating peas. First they plant potatoes and fertilize well that land, after which on that same small plot of land they plant peas in large quantities, with the aim to make the most of the fertilizer of their small farm. Plating peas is more profitable for them because it’s a smaller investment, and for that reason they like plating that crop. What is most difficult is purchasing fertilizer, because they go with a fixed amount of money and it is not enough. This is Sonia’s 7th loan with MFP, and she has been punctual with her payments. With this loan she will buy 8 sacks of “temex” a product that will help counteract the potato pest, which costs 245 PEN per sack. With the rest of the money, she will also buy pesticides for their pea leaves, which will cost 1,200.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides and pesticides for her crop

loans.name: Jaemie

texts.es:
La señora Jaemie tiene 30 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 1096 Río Seco, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Jaemie estudió para Auxiliar de Educación, pero no ejerce su profesión porque no hay plazas disponibles. Se casó a los 21 años y tiene un hijo de 3 años.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de productos de belleza y joyas por catálogo, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, entonces los fines de semana hace parrilladas o polladas y los días miércoles cebiche. Realiza su negocio en su casa y en forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito fue de S/. 300, el cual canceló en 4 cuotas y compró insumos para preparar combinados.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, alquilará un puesto en el mercado de su zona.
Jaemie sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jaemie is 30 years old. She belongs to the "Mientras Tanto Decisiones" Group and lives on Astopilco street, 1096 Rio Seco, El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad region, Peru.

Jaemie studied as an Education Assitant but has not gone into her profession because there are no available positions. She married when she was 21 and has a three-year-old son.

Her business consists of selling beauty products and catalog jewelry. However, since she is an entrepreneurial woman, on the weekends, she cooks barbecue and chicken and, on Wednesdays, ceviche. She conducts this business from her home and on foot.

Her first loan was for S. 300, which she reapid in four parts and bought ingredients to make her dishes. With this loan of S. 500, which will be repaid in four parts, she will rent a stall in her area's market. Jaemie dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will rent a stall in the market in her area.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 26 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 niños, su esposo trabaja en una mina y llega a casa cada cierto tiempo. Desde los 15 años trabajó en la chacra, ayudando a sus padres, después cuando se comprometió y tuvo sus hijos, hubo un tiempo en que no iba con mucha frecuencia a sus campos, por sus pequeños. Pero ahora se levanta a las 5.00 a.m., prepara los  alimentos y se va a sus tierras donde cultiva flores, como gladiolos, en tiempo de cosecha busca a gente que le ayude. Sembrar flores le es más rentable porque en tiempo de fiestas, como octubre, llega a vender cada fardo de 12 docenas a  S/.90.00, cuando pasan las fechas festivas los negocia a S/.30.00 y siembra papa y arvejas, pero en menor cantidad. Esta madre trabajadora pertenece al ciclo VII, es decir su 7mo préstamo, en este tiempo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero, esta vez, comprará pesticidas, el kilo cuesta S/.280.00, esto le sirve pare mantener las hojas de sus flores limpias y de capullo frondoso, con el resto contratará personas que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. Her husband works in a mine and returns home every once in a while. From the time she was 15 years old she worked on a small farm helping her parents. When she became engaged and had her children there was a time when she didn’t often go to the fields because of her small children. Now she wakes up at 5:00 a.m., prepares the food, and goes to her land where she grows flowers, like gladiolas. During harvest time she looks for people to help her. Planting flowers is most profitable to her because during times of festivities, like October, she can sell each bundle of 12 dozen flowers for 90 PEN. When the time of festivities pass she negotiates to 30 PEN a bundle and she plants potatoes and peas, but in small quantities. This working mother belongs to cycle VII, that is to say she is on her 7th loan, and during this time has been punctual in her payments. With this loan, she will buy pesticides that cost 280.00 PEN a kilo. These pesticides will help maintain the leaves of her flowers clean and with lush buds, and she will use the rest to employ people to help her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides for her flower fields

loans.name: Elvy Gloreny

texts.es: El Sr. Elvy Gloreny, vive en la Localidad de San José en Santa Cruz, Bolivia, hace 3 años que vive en el lugar y su actividad es la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante, donde tambien tiene una pequeña radio, trabajando además como locutor en sus tiempos libres. Él cuenta con casa propia vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Su objetivo es agrandar su negocio y agrandar su radio.
texts.en:
Mr. Elvy Gloreny lives in the San José locality in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He has been there for three years, and his activity is the sale of food in a small restaurant where he also has a radio and works as an announcer in his free time. He owns his home, and lives with his wife and school-aged children. His objectives are to grow his business and his radio activities.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture.

loans.name: Laura Esther

texts.es:
La señora Laura tiene 54 años de edad, es presidenta de su Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 456 Río Seco del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad,  Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, se casó a los 15 años, actualmente es viuda con 9 hijos, tres de los cuales son estudiantes y dependen de ella.
Tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas en la casa Banante, centro de Trujillo y otro en su casa, pero es pequeña. Tres días vende en la casa Banante y los demás días en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas se inició en el negocio de golosinas.
Con este crédito de S/. 700 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará golosinas al por mayor.
Laura sueña con tener una gran tienda de abarrotes.

El desembolso de su préstamo fue el  21/10/08
La tasa de interés de su préstamo es del 3.5%
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura is 54 years old and is the president of a group named In the Meanwhile Decisions. She lives at 456 Astopilco Street, Rio Seco, in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, of the La Libertad department, Peru. She finished secondary school, and got married at the age of 15. She is currently a widow with 9 children, 3 of which are students and depend on her. She has a business in the sale of sweet in the Banante house in the center of Trujillo, and another in her home, which is small. 3 days a week she sells in the Banante house, and the remaining days in her own home. With her first loan of 300 PEN that was paid in full in 4 installments, she began her sweets business. With this loan of 700 PEN, which will also be paid in full in 4 installments, she will purchase wholesale sweets. Laura dreams of someday having a large grocery store. The loan was dispersed on 10/21/08 The interest rate on the loan is of 3.5%

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale sweets.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, con dos hijos que están estudiando en el colegio. Desde niña ayudaba a la chacra, ahora ya con sus hijos, siembra solo para su consumo; papa y maíz. Hace 6 años aperturó una bodega, actividad que había  empezado con unos cuantos productos, y al pasar el tiempo ha ido creciendo, a la vez no deja de sembrar sus chacras, también hace algunos años está criando carneritos, en horas de la tarde, cierra su bodega para llevar sus carneros al campo. A ella le agrada estar en contacto con la gente, solo que a veces se incomoda cuando no le alcanza el dinero para que pueda surtir su negocio, por ello le prestará mayor dedicación a la chacra sembrando arvejas, de ese modo ganar dinero adicional para invertir en su negocio. Es su 7mo préstamo, en los pagos, no tuvo dificultad en pagar puntualmente. Con S/1.000.00 comprará mercaderías para incrementar su bodega, la otra parte la usará para adquirir los fertilizantes, comprará 6 bolsas de este.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old, and is a single mother with two children who are both studying in school. From the time she was a girl she helped on the small farm, but now that she has her own children she only plants potatoes and corn for their own consumption. 6 years ago she opened a neighborhood store, which she began with a few products, and as time has passed it has continued to grow. At the same time, she has not stopped planting on her small farm, and a few years ago she began raising sheep. In the later hours of the day she closes her neighborhood store to take her sheep into the fields. Sonia enjoys being in contact with people, however, sometimes she finds it difficult when there is not enough money to stock her business. For that reason, she plans to dedicate more of her time to her small farm by planting peas in an effort to earn additional money to invest in her business. This is her 7th loan, and she has never had difficulty making her payments on time. With 1,000.00 PEN she will purchase merchandise to develop her neighborhood store, and the rest she will use to acquire 6 bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señorita María del Carmen tiene 23 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor y vive en la calle Titu Cusi Yupanqui 1166, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
María del Carmen es Bachiller en Contabilidad, trabaja como cajera en Totus y como es una mujer emprendedora, también tiene su propio negocio que consiste en comprar zapatos, especialmente medias de niña y los vende en una tienda de sus padres que se localiza en El Mercado Modelo de Piura.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará medias y también incrementará el negocio con carteritas.
María del Carmen sueña con tener su negocio independiente.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 23 years old, she belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor,” and she lives on 1166 Titu Cusi Yupanqui Street, in the district El Porvenir, a province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. Maria del Carmen has a high school degree in accounting. She works as a cashier in Totus. Since she is an enterprising woman, she also has her own business in which she buys shoes, especially girl's stockings, and sells them in her parent’s store that is located in El Mercado Modelo of Piura. With the credit of 300 soles ($100) that will be paid in four installments, she will buy stockings and also, will increase business by purchasing purses. Maria del Carmen dreams to own a business independently.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy stockings and purses

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La sra. Flora M. es una cliente muy antigua trabaja con nuestra institución desD. el año 2004.
Es nacida en la provincia Florida D. Santa Cruz, y actualmente vive en el Barrio 6 D. mayo, municipio el Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia.
Es dueña D. casa vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales ya son mayores D. edad.
Su esposo se dedica a la actividad D. albañilería desD. hace 10 años. La actividad principal D. la Sra. Flora es la panadería la cual cumple muy bien desD. hace 21 años y el préstamo que será otorgado será para la compra D. insumos y mejoramiento D. un galpón en el que trabaja.
texts.en:
Flora M. is an old client who has worked with our institution from 2004. She is a native of the provice of Florida in Santa Cruz, but now lives in the "6 D. Mayo" suburb in the town of Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She is the lady of the house, living with her husband and her four children, who are already adults. Her husband has worked for the last ten years in construction. Flora's principal activity is baking, a task she has undertaken with great skill for the last 21 years. The loan which will be authorised will be for the purchase of ingredients and the improvement of a warehouse where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital injection

loans.name: Maritza Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Esther tiene 38 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Atahualpa 453 Rio Seco distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad,  Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer el año de primaria y no continuo estudiando por graves problemas económicos que su familia tuvo que afrontar. 
Se casó a los 21 años de edad, tiene  2 hijos y una hija, los 3 son estudiantes. 
Maritza se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, en especial aves de corral, las cuales vende en carne o en pie. Su negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, arreglará los corrales de los animales.
Maritza sueña con terminar su casa y tener una tienda muy grande para abastecer de productos a toda su comunidad.

El desembolso de su préstamo fue el  21/10/08
La tasa de interés de su préstamo es del 4.0%
texts.en:
Maritza Esther is 38 years old. She belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Decisiones” and lives on 453 Atahualpa Street, Rio Seco, in the district of Porvenir, in the province Trujillo, of the state La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the third year of primary school, and didn’t continue studying due to grave economic problems that her family had faced. She married when she was 21 years old. Maritza has two sons and a daughter. Her three children are students. Maritza cares for small animals, especially game birds, that she sells as meat or live. Her business is located in her house. With this credit of 300 soles ($100) that will be paid in four months, she will repair the corrals of the animals. Maritza dreams to stop selling from her house, and to have a very big store in order to supply products to her entire community. Her loan was given on 10/21/2008. The interest rate for the loan is 4.0%

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will fix her animal corrals.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 59 años D. edad, es tesorera en su Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 1096 Río Seco, distrito El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando por falta D. apoyo. Se casó a los 15 años, pero no descuidó su formación, estudió cursos D. costura, repostería, entre otros. Tiene 8 hijos que son independientes.
Rosa venD. gaseosa y cerveza en su casa, especialmente los días feriados.
Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas comenzó a incrementar su negocio.
Con este crédito D. S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará gaseosas, cerveza y empezará a comprar polos D. vestir para el verano.
Rosa sueña con tener una tienda D. víveres.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old, she is the treasurer of her group “Mientras Tanto Decisiones,” and she lives on 1096 Astopilco Street, Rio Seco, in the district El Porvenir, province Trujillio, in the state of Libertad, Peru. She finished primary school, but didn’t continue studying for lack of monetary support. She married at 15, but she didn’t stray from her training, and took courses in sewing and baking, among others. She has 8 children that are independent. With her first loan of 300 soles ($100) that was paid off in 4 installments, she began to increase her business. With this credit of 700 soles ($250) that will be paid off in 4 installments, she will by sodas, beer, and will begin to buy polos (clothing) for the summer. Rosa dreams of having a supplies store.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will by sodas, beer, and polos (clothing.)

loans.name: Inocencia Jovhanna

texts.es:
La Sra. Inocencia vive en el barrio Miraflores del Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus  tres hijos todos, se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.
Su actividad principal es el comercio D. ropa, labor que realiza desD. hace 6 años, actualmente mantiene a sus hijos junto a su esposo, quien tiene un automovil que trabaja como taxi, en la localidad. Tiene como objetivo abrir su propia tienda D. ropa, es decir tener un puesto fijo ya que con el que actualmente cuenta es ambulante.
texts.en:
Inocencia lives in the Miraflores del Torno neighborhood, in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She lives in her own home with her husband and three children who are students. Her main activitity is the sale of clothing, which she has done for the past 6 years. She supports her children together with her husband, who has his own car which he uses as a taxi. Her goal is to open her own clothing store; that is, to have a fixed stand rather than the mobile stand she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
La señora Salome tiene 76 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 480 de Rio Seco, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de primaria debido a que no tenía apoyo, al quedar huérfana la recogió una prima hermana. Se casó a los 20 años de edad y tuvo 10 hijos, lamentablemente 2 de ellos fallecieron. Tiene a su cargo tres nietos huérfanos  por los que sigue trabajando.
Su negocio consiste en preparar menú, es decir en su casa vende almuerzos tanto para comer ahí mismo o para llevar.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas mandó arreglar su refrigeradora y compró servicios.
Con este crédito de S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para trabajar en el verano.
Salome sueña con tener un negocio muy grande y que sus nietos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Salome is 76 years old, belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Decicisiones,” and lives on 480 Astopilco Street of Rio Seco, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the state La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the second year of primary school due to the fact that she didn’t have monetary support. After being orphaned, she had to take care of a sister. Salome married when she was 20 and had 10 children, sadly, two of them died. She has in her care, her three orphaned grandchildren and it is for them that she keeps working. Her business consists of her preparing a lunch menu, which she sells in her house to be eaten there or to go. With her first loan of 300 ($100) soles that she repaid in 4 installments, she sent her refrigerator to be fixed and paid for servicing. With this loan of 700 soles ($250), that will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy food supplies so that she can work in the summer. Salome dreams of having a very big business and that her grandchildren will grow to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food supplies so she can work in the summer.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Irma López reside  en el bario Naciones Unidas, su esposo el Sr. Wilfredo Choque con el cual tienen 5 hijos, se dedica a la venta de piedra, arena Y ripio en la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia. La actividad  principal de la señora Irma, es la venta de alimentos para animales, en el mercado central de la localidad de El Torno, Santa Cruz. Trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2004, comenta que desde entonces  se encuentra identificada con nuestra institución, nos considera unos de sus principales apoyos para que su negocio sea prospero, por tal motivo ella solo trabaja con nuestra entidad microfinanciera.
texts.en:
Irma López lives in the Nacional Unidas neighborhood. Her husband, Wilfredo Choque, with whom she has five children, sells stone, sand and rubble in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Irma's principle job is selling animal feed in the central market of El Torno, Santa Cruz. She has worked with our institution since 2004. She comments that since finding herself linked with our institution, she considers us to be one of her principle supporters of her business being successful. For that reason, she works only with our microfinance entity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An increase in capital.

loans.name: Yessica Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yesica tiene 24 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 518 Río Seco, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta el tercer ciclo de computación en un Instituto, pero se unió a su pareja Josías Carbajal y tienen una hija de 6 meses.
Tenía un puesto en el mercado, pero por el momento no puede atenderlo porque tiene que atender a su pequeña hija. Tuvo que cambiar a otro trabajo más fácil de realizar y optó por comprar tarjetas telefónicas, las cuales las vende en su casa y en el quiosco que tiene su madre en un hotel de la ciudad.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en aretes y otras joyas para venderlos en el puesto del mercado.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, piensa comprar más tarjetas telefónicas.
Yesica sueña con tener su casa propia y un gran negocio.
texts.en:
Yesica is 24 years old, belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Decisiones," and lives on 518 Astopilco Street, Rio Seco, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad. She studied until her third cycle of computation in an institute, but she married her partner Josias Carbajal and they have a daughter of 6 months. Yesica had a stand in the market, but for the moment she can't attend to it because she has to care for her little daughter. She had to change to another job that was easier for her to handle, and opted to buy phone cards that she sells in her house and in her mother's kiosk in a hotel in the city. Yesica invested her first loan of 300 soles ($100) that she paid in 4 installments, in earrings and other forms of jewelry to be sold at her stand in the market. With this loan of 500 soles, or $175 that will be paid in 4 installments, she is thinking of buying more telephone cards. Yesica dreams of having her own house and a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Yola Yobani

texts.es:
La señora Yola Yobani tiene 25 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 1069 en Río Seco, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de T., departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió 2 años de educación superior en el Instituto Pedagógico Oxford, pero se casó a los 18 años y tiene dos hijos quienes son niños y requieren mucha atención.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de gaseosa en el restaurante de su hermana, el cual se ubica en Río Seco en la calle Cóndor Canqui 899.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300, cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comida rápida  que vendía diariamente en las noches.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en gaseosa, cerveza y otros.
Yola sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Yola Yobani is 25 years old, belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Decisiones" and lives on 1069 Astopilco street in Rio Seco, in the district El Porvenir, in the province of T., in the state La Libertad, Peru. She studied for 2 years of superior school in the Oxford Pedagogical Institute, but married when she was 18 years old and has two sons that require a great deal of attention. Her business consists of selling sodas in her sister's restaurant, that is located in Rio Seco, on 899 Condor Canqui street. Yola invested her first loan of 300 soles ($100 that she repaid in 4 installments), in buying fast food that she sells daily, at night. With this loan of 500 soles ($175), that will be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in sodas, beer, etc. Yola dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. S. L. habita en la comarca El Sinchal, Tecolostote, donde habita junto a su esposa y 1 hija menor de edad, como pequeño productor arrocero socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza a traves de la cual tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio en la instalacion de 1 trillo arrocero, lo que le permitira obtener mayores rendimiento economico, ya que en la actualidad por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 4 mzs de arroz, las que atiende personalemente, esto le permite obtener utilidades que le garantizan el bienestar familiar, su sueño es ser socio de este trillo que le permitira contar con el equipo de trillado en su comunidad y propio.
texts.en:
S. L. lives in the Sinchal, Tecolostote region alongside his wife and young daughter. He is a small producer of rice and a member of the Esperanza cooperative through which he has the opportunity to participate as a partner in the installation of one rice thresher, which will allow him to obtain greater economic performance. Currently, through his own efforts, he has established four rice fields, which he tends to personally. This allows him to obtain profits that will guarantee the wellbeing of his family. His dream is to be a member of this thresher cooperative that will allow him to rely on his community's threshing team and himself.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% contribution to the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La señora Zenaida tiene 58 años D. edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor y vive en la calle Hermanos Angulo 521 del distrito El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Primaria Completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta D. apoyo D. parte D. sus padres ya que no podían responder económicamente. 
Se casó D. 20 años D. edad, tuvo 4 hijos y ya no tiene ningún hijo a su cargo. Su negocio consiste en la venta D. comida en su propio local, como el ceviche, caldo y combinado.
Con este crédito D. S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cerveza y gaseosa.
Zenaida sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener un restaurante granD. que pueda atender con las tres comidas diarias.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 58 years old and is part of the group "Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor". She lives in Hermano Angulo Road, in the district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, state of La Libertad, Peru. Zenaida completed primary school but did not continue studying due to lack of economic support from her parents. She got married at 20 years old and had 4 children, who are now no longer in her care. Zenaida sells food in her own store, such as ceviche, soup and rice & meat plates. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be paid in 4 payments, Zenaida will purchase beer and soda. Zenaida dreams of expanding her business and having a big restaurant where she can serve breakfast, lunch & dinner.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and soda for her store

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge C. vive en la casa de su hermano en el barrio San Martín (El Torno), Santa Cruz  desde el año 2003, su esposa la señora Mónica López con la que tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a labores del hogar y a la crianza de sus pequeños niños. Su actividad principal es la venta de materiales de construcción (arena, ripio, piedra, otros). Trabaja con nuestra Institución desde el año 2005, en una charla con él, nos comento que con el microcrédito ha podido hacer crecer su negocio, el comenzó con un capital pequeño,  por lo que hoy en día ya cuenta con su propia draga (motor que sirve para seleccionar materiales del río).
texts.en:
Señor Jorge C. has lived in his brother's house in the neighborhood of San Martín (El Torno) in Santa Cruz since 2003. His wife is señora Mónica López, with whom he has 4 children. She is a housewife and is dedicated to raising their young children. His main business activity is selling construction materials (sand, rubble, stone, etc.) He has worked with our institution since 2005. In a chat with him, he told us that with microcredit, he has grown his business. He started with a small amount of capital, and now he has his own dredge (a machine that is used to remove materials from the river).

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and stove

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. A. se dedica a la siembra de arroz en pequeña escala, tiene 6 Mzs realizadas por esfuerzo propio y con el apoyo de su compalera de vida y un hermano que se dedican al manejo del cultivo, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar (3er grado de primaria), es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza y atraves de ella tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio de 1 trillo arrocero que le permitira reducir sus costos de produccion y asi obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia; su mayor anhelo es participar como socio de este trillo y tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitan mejorar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor A. grows rice on a small scale. He has six manzanas (1 manzana = 1.728 acres) which he works with his own effort and the support of his wife and his brother who manage the farm. He has one school-age son who is in third grade. Señor A. has the opportunity to participate as a member of a group that would buy a rice thresher, which would allow him to reduce his production costs and to obtain more income that would let him improve his family's living conditions. His biggest dream is to participate as a member of this group and to have a source of income that will allow him to improve his family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support 30% of the costs of building a rice thresher

loans.name: Edicson

texts.es: El Sr. J. Alvarado, pequeño productor de arroz, socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, actualmente tiene establecida 4 mzs de arroz, el que asiste junto a su esposa, la que atiende el hogar y produccion de especies menores que le genera ingresos adicionales que le permitan mantener el sustento familiar; en los periodos de siembra y cosecha apoya al marido en las labores de manejo de cultivo, a travez de la cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio de un trillo en la comunidad de la peña, para lo cual requiere de C$.15,000.00, lo que permitira realizar sus sueño para el futuro y asi contar con mejores condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. J. Alvarado is a small producer of rice and an associate of "La Esperanza" (Hope) cooperative agribusiness. At present he has established 4 plantations of rice, which he works along with his wife, who attends the home and the production of smaller crops that generate additional income which permit them to maintain the family living. During planting and harvest seasons, she helps her husband with the cultivation management work. Because of the cooperative he has the opportunity to participate as an associate of a store of rice for the community of La Peña, for which he requires of 15,000 cordoba (Nicaraguan currency). This will permit him to carry out his dream and in this way provide better family living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay 30% of the cost of producing a store of rice for the community of La Peña

loans.name: Carlos Edén

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas desde muy tempranas horas en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, el caballero Carlos Montalvan abre las puertas de su pulpería para ofreciendo diferentes tipos de productos con el propósito de mantener su hogar que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Hoy en día Carlos ha mejorado su negocio ya que muy sabiamente ha comenzado a invertir en su negocio por medio de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. La razón por la cual una vez más acude a la institución es para solicitar un nuevo créditos con el cual comprar la mercadería porque sus estantes nuevamente están vacíos. Con el crédito se beneficiara de igual forma su familia la cual tiene que mantener
texts.en:
Every morning in the early hours in Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega, Carlos Montalban opens the doors to his store to offer different types of products with the purpose of maintaining his home that needs his support so much.

Today, Carlos has improved his business since, very smartly, he has begun to invest in his business through the loans granted to him by Ceprodel. The reason why he again has turned to this institution is to request a new loan with which he will buy merchandise since his shelves are empty again. With this loan, his family, who he supports, will equally benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es: La Sra.  Venancia B., es nacida en Potosí, Bolivia. Actualmente vive en la Localidad D. limoncito  municipio el Torno, Santa cruz,  es dueña D. casa vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos. Su actividad principal es “servicio D. molino” D. semillas, como segunda actividad se dedica a vender cosméticos. Su esposo cuenta con una carpintería en la cual se dedica a la elaboración D. muebles. Su objetivo es equipar un poco más su carpintería y hacer terminar D. estudiar a sus hijos para que salgan profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Venancia B. was born in Potosi, Bolivia. Currently she lives in the area of Limoncito, in the municipality of El Torno in Santa Cruz. Venancia owns her home where she lives with her husband and six children. Her principal activity is to proviD. seed grinding services. Her secondary activity is to sell cosmetics. Her husband has a carpentry business, where he builds furniture. Her objective is to better equip the carpentry business and allow for her children to finish their schooling so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Sr. M. B. es socio activo de la cooperativa agropecuario la Esperanza, pequeño productor de arroz, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 hijo y su esposa, su hijo esta estudiando 3er año de secundaria, por lo que trabaja medio tiempo en el campo despues de sus obligaciones escolares, uno de sus principales problemas es el proceso de trillado de su produccion y le reduce sus ingresos ya que tienen que vender su produccion en granja abajo pero a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio en la construccion de 1 trillo tecnificado, para lo cual requiere de C$.15,000.00,  con este credito estaria logrando su sueño de ser socio de este trillo y garantizar mejores condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. M. B. is an active member of the agricultural cooperative La Esperanza (“Hope”). He is a small producer of rice, an activity that he undertakes with the help of one son and his wife. His son is studying in his third year of secondary school, working half the time on the farm after completing his school obligations. One of his main issues is problems related to the threshing process of his harvest, which reduce his earnings since he has to sell his crop at lower prices. However, through the cooperative, he has the opportunity as a member to participate in the construction of a threshing machine for which he needs 15,000.00 Cordobas ($775USD). With this loan, he would be achieving his dream of being a partner of the automated thresher and guarantee better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% of construction for rice thresher La Peña.

loans.name: Apu Siwina Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “APU SIWINA”, se fundo en septiembre del 2005, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo D. la segunda etapa, esta conformada por  15 socias, 11 mujeres y 4 hombres, lleva el nombre D. la montaña que es el símbolo del centro poblado D. ACCHA, el “APU SIWINA” montaña que representa la figura D. una mujer. 
El distrito D. Accha D. la provincia D. Paruro, Dpto D. Cusco, se encuentra a 3 horas  D. la ciudad del Cusco, por carretera afirmada.
Las socias son mujeres campesinas, que provienen D. unidades económicas familiares dedicadas a labores agropecuarias, donD. ellas participan activamente en la venta D. los excedentes D. las principales cosechas, maíz, papa y habas. Otra actividad es la venta D. animales menores, como cerdos, aves D. corral, cuyes. Actividades desarrolladas en los principales mercados del distrito.
En relación al servicio financiero valoran, la facilidad, los requisitos mínimos, la entrega y devolución en la misma comunidad. Sin embargo la valoración D. la cultura D. ahorro promovida por la Unidad D. Microfinazas tiene mayor importancia.
texts.en:
The Apu Siwina village bank was founded in September 2005. It is currently in the 3rd cycle of the 2nd stage; it consists of 15 members, 11 women and 4 men. It carries the name of the mountain which is the symbol of the city of Accha; the Apu Siwina mountain represents the figure of a woman. The Accha district in the Paruro province of Cusco, Peru is 3 hours from the city of Cusco by highway. The members are women from the country-siD. whose families are generally involved in agriculture and farming activities; these women actively participate in the sales of their harvests--corn, potatoes and beans. They also sell small animals like pigs, poultry, and guinea pigs in the central markets of their district. They value the financial services offered through the village bank, mostly due to the ease of use, the minimum requirements to qualify, and the fact that the money is delivered and returned in their own community. What they value most is the culture of savings that is encouraged through the Unity of Microfinances.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sales of agricultural products in the main markets of their district

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard G., not yet married, received schooling through Senior High and has sold men's clothing at Ewim in Cape Coast since 2002.  He uses his income to pay for both rent and utility bills and is requesting a loan to increase his stock of goods for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Richard plans to renovate and improve the condition of his shop.

loans.use: To increase his stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "SAN ANTONIO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MIRTHA QUIEN TIENE NEXO CONSAGUINEO CON LA SEÑORA MARIA ESTER Y LA SEÑORA VIVIANA COM PAMELA, PERO CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENE INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES PARA ASUMIR SUS RESPONSABILIDADES. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES Y D. SERVICIO COMO SER PROMOTORAS D. COSMETICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, ALGUNA D. ELLAS SE DEDICAN A LA PELUQUERIA Y AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN LO QUE RESPECTA A LOS SOCIOS PARTICIPANTES.COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA. EL CREDITO ESTA DESTINADO, SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. LAS SOCIAS, AL INCREMETO D. SU MERCADERIA Y COMPRAR HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO.EFECTIVAMENTE LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS YA QUE ALGUNAS TRABAJAROSN CON LA FUNDACION AGROCAPITAL EN ANTERIORES GRUPOS, Y SE SABE QUE SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y CAPAZA D. MEJORAR AUN MAS SU FUENTE D. TRABAJO.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "San Antonio" are represented by Mrs. Mirtha, who is a blood relative of Mrs. Maria Ester, and by Mrs. Viviana, who is related to Pamela, but each has her own independent income in order to fulfill her responsibilities. The members each manage a variety of businesses and services such as selling cosmetics, selling groceries, selling pastries and food, and some of them work in hairdressing and in public transport. As in every business there exists competition in regards to supply and demand. The loan will be used, according to the members, to augment their merchandise and to buy work tools. The members have asserted they are experienced with solidarity groups since some of them have worked with Fundación Agrocapital in previous groups, and they are known to be responsible and able to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel O. sells clothing for men and footwear at Ewim in Cape Coast. Daniel has received Senior High education.  He is not yet married and has no children. Daniel has been selling clothing for men and footwear since 2001. He is responsible for paying utility bills, clothing and other personal expenses. His loan will be used to increase the sale of the clothing and shoes. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to plough back into this growing business.

loans.use: to increase the sale of the clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte D. sells rice, oil, and foodstuffs wholesale to her customers who in turn sell the products retail (in smaller quantities) to consumers who cannot buy in bulk. Charlotte has received Junior high education. She is married and has 3 children, and her husband is a mechanic.

Charlotte has been selling rice, oil, and foodstuffs since 2003. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods for sale

loans.name: Cumplidas Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "CUMPLIDAS",  ESTÁN REPRENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA NANCY QUIEN PRESENTA NEXO CONSANGUÍNEO CON LA SEÑORA ANONIA ELLA SON HERMANAS PERO TIENEN INGRESOS DEPENDIENTES POR LO QUE NO PRESENTA MAYOR PROBLEMA EN EL GRUPO. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, COMO PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, LOS SOCIOS PARTICIPANTES, UNO ES PROPIETARIO D. UN INTERNET Y EL OTRO ES  COMERCIANTE. TODOS LOS SOCIOS SOLICITARON EL PRÉSTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS Y A INCREMENTAR LOS INSUMOS PARA LA VENTA. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA PERO ELLAS SABEN COMO MANEJAR EL MERCADO EL CUAL YA CONOCEN. LAS SOCIAS YA TRABAJARON CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ANTERIORMENTE POR LO QUE TIENE  EXPERIENCIA Y RESPONSABILIDAD EN LOS PAGOS.
texts.en:
The members of the "Accomplished Women" village bank are represented by Mrs. Nancy who is related by blood to Mrs. Anonia. They are sisters and their incomes depend on each other. The group members are involved in varoius economic activities such as cosmetics sales, grocery sales, food sales, etc. One member runs a small internet cafe and another is a local merchant. All the members requested the loan to invest in their businesses and increase their inventory of goods to sell. As in all commercial undertakings, there is competition and supply and demand, but these women know how to manage their local markets that they know well. These members worked on unified groups beforehand so they have experience and are very responsible in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their business operations

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra B. sells cosmetics and artificial hair extensions. Barbra has received junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children; her husband is a businessman. Barbra has been selling cosmetics and hair products since 1999. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her sale of cosmetics and hair products to meet increasing demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: expand her sale of cosmetics and hair products to meet increasing demand

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys H. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Gladys is a hairdresser who owns a beauty saloon, which she has run since 2001. Her husband is a trader. Gladys uses her income to pay for school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Gladys will use the loan to purchase wigs and other hairdressing products. She wants to improve her services to attract more customers to her salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to support her husband in their children's education.

loans.use: Gladys will use the loan to purchase wigs and other hairdressing products.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric B. D. sells wedding accessories and general goods including shoes and clothing. Eric has received a senior high school education.  He is married and has 3 children, and his wife is a trader. Eric has been selling wedding accessories and general goods since 1996. He is responsible for paying the utility bills, clothing expenses and the children's school fees. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him increase the stock of goods, especially fabric and shoes for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his children's education and also pay for other family expenses.

loans.use: Increase the stock of goods, especially fabric and shoes, for resale.

loans.name: Fortalecimiento Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "FORTALECIMIENTO" TIENEN COMO REPRESENTANTE A LA SEÑORA VERÓNICA QUIEN TIENE PARIENTES DENTRO DEL GRUPO PERO ESO NO REPRESENTA PROBLEMAS EN LOS PAGOS DEBIDO A LA INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA D. CADA UNA D. LAS FAMILIAS. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES Y D. SERVICIO. COMO SER PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, TAMBIÉN SE DEDICA A LA PELUQUERÍA, COSTURERA Y TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN LO QUE RESPECTA A LOS SOCIOS PARTICIPANTES. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA. EL CRÉDITO FINANCIADO ESTA DESTINADO PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA Y A LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO. LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE YA TRABAJARON CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS, UNA MAYORÍA D. LAS SOCIAS YA TRABAJARON CON AGROCAPITAL EN OTROS GRUPOS POR QUE SABEN LA MODALIDAD D. TRABAJO QUE SE MANEJA EN LA FUNDACIÓN.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Fortalecimiento” have as a representative Veronica who has relatives within the group but this is not a problem as each of the families is economically independent. The members have different commercial business and services, such as selling cosmetics, groceries, food, beauty salon, sewing, and public transportation. As with all business there exists competition and customer demand. The loan will be used to increase merchandise and buy tools and supplies needed for their work. The members say that they have worked with support groups, a majority of the members have worked in agrocapital groups and they know how these community groups function.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase merchandise and supplies for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling used clothing.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. C.
