M. es unpequeño productor socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza, junto a sus 2 hijos mayores se dedica a la produccion de arroz en 12 Mzs por esfuerzo propio, 2 niños estan en 3ero y 4to grado de primaria; durante la cosecha presenta problemas con el trillado de su produccion, lo que le reduce sus ingresos familiares, a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio de un trillo de arroz para lo cual solicita el presente financiamiento; su mayor anhelo es integrar esta sociedad, ya que le permitria vender mejor su cosecha y mantener en mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. C. M. is a small-time farmer and member of the La Esperanza (Hope) village bank cooperative. Together with his two older children, they grow rice on 12 blocks of their own land. Two of his children are in 3rd and 4th grade respectively of elementary school. During harvest times, he has problems with threshing which reduces his family income. Through the cooperative, he has the opportunity as a member to use a rice threshing machine but in order to do so, he needs this loan. His great desire is to become a full-fledged member of this cooperative which will help him to sell more of his harvest and improve the living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% to the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Mercedes habita en la Cmca. Masapia junto a su familia compuesta por su Sra. Socorro Somoza y 2 hijos menores, los que estudian 2do y 3er grado de primaria, muy temprano atiende su cultivo de arroz de 3 Mzs a la que le brinda el manejo adecuado; la Sra. Socorro es profesora de la escuela de la comunidd, don Jose es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, la que a traves de 1 proyecto le permite acceder como socio de 1 trillo, teniendo que aportar el monto de C$.15,000.00.  Su sueño es alcanzar esa meta y asi reducir sus costos de produccion y por ende obtener mayores beneficios que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Mercedes lives in the Masapia neighborhood with his family which consists of Mrs. Socorro Somoza and their two young children who are studying in 2nd and 3rd grade of elementary school. Jose tends to his 3 blocks of rice fields early every morning which brings him a decent income. Mrs. Socorro es a teacher in the community school. Jose is a member of the agricultural cooperative La Esperanza (Hope), which allows him to become a partner in the purchase of a rice threshing machine if he can contribute $775. His dream is to realize this goal and reduce his production costs in order to improve his income and the living conditions of his family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% to the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "BOLÍVAR" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MAGDA KARINA QUIEN ES CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD; LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS TANBIEN SON MADRES DE FAMILIA, CON NIÑOS MENORES DE CINCO AÑOS. EXISTE UN PARENTESCO EN LA FAMILIA ENTRE MARIBEL Y DILMA QUE SON HERMANAS PERO AMBAS TIENEN NEGOCIOS INDEPENDIENTES. LA PRESIDENTA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALZADOS, HACE YA CINCO AÑOS. Y LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS SON COMERCIANTES EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL ELLAS TIENEN BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN ESTA ACTIVIDADES PRÉSTAMO LES SERVIRÁ PARA AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO AXIAL COMO PARA EL INCREMENTO DE MERCADERÍA PARA LA VENTA.ELLAS NO TENÍAN OPCIÓN A UN CRÉDITO PERO GRACIAS A LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL YA CUENTAN CON ESTE SERVICIO.
texts.en:
The Bolivar Group is represented by Mrs. Magda Karina who is married and has two young children. The other members are also mothers with small children younger than 5 years old. Two of the members, Maribel and Dilma are sisters but both have independent businesses. The president has worked selling shoes for the past five years. The other members are merchants in the central market who also have a lot of experience in sales. This loan will help them to increase their working capital to increase the merchandise they have available to sell. They could not obtain a loan elsewhere but thanks to the AgroCapital Foundation, they are able to obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their business operations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in used clothing to retail in the community.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El Sr. A. C. habita en la Cmca. La Palma, Tecolostote, junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Maria Esquivel y 2 hijos en edad escolar cursando el 5to y 6to grado de primaria.  El mayor ayuda a su papá en las actividades productivas, la Señora Maria muy temprano prepara la alimentacion para su marido y sus hijos ya que despues se integra junto al marido a darle seguimiento al cultivo de arroz de 6 Mzs.  El Sr. A. es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria donde a traves de una inversion de C$.l5,000.00 tiene la oportunidad de ser socio de 1 trillo paa arroz, o que le permitira contar con este equipo, instalaciones que le dejaran mejores ingresos para el sosten familiar y hacer realidad su sueño de ser socio de este trillo que le servira como una empresa productiva para comunidad y sus socios.
texts.en:
Mr. A. C. lives in the La Palma neighborhood in Tecolostote with his family which consists of his wife Maria Esquivel and their two children who are studying in the 5th and 6th grades of elementary school. The oldest helps his father with their farmwork, while Maria gets up very early to prepare meals for her husband and children before helping in farming the rice with her husband. Mr. A. is a member of the agricultural cooperative where he has the opportunity to invest $775 to become a partner in obtaining a rice threshing machine. Having access to the machine will help him to improve his income to support his family. Realizing his goal of becoming a partner in this machine will help him to feel like a successful businessman in his community and amongst his partners.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% to the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Wiracocha Village Bank. Wiracocha means “Sun God” in Quechua. Ruth is 21 years old and lives with her husband and her one-year-old daughter. She is studying to be a pharmacist at Ayacucho’s university. Ruth has a small store in her parents’ house in the Jesus Nazareno District where she sells dry goods and sweets during the day, with the help of her brother.

Ruth needs a loan of 750 soles to buy rice and sugar. Ruth dreams of finishing school and becoming a successful pharmacist and of expanding her business so that she can provide her son with the very best.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua. Ruth es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hija de 1 año, estudiante de Farmacia en la Universidad de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Ruth tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno en donde vende abarrotes, golosinas, actividad que realiza durante el día con la ayuda de su hermano. Ruth necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. Ruth sueña con terminar su carrera y ejercerla exitosamente, ampliar su negocio para brindarle todo lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: Ruth would like to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Wiracocha Village Bank. Wiracocha means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband; they are currently expecting their first child. Julia has a small store in her parents’ house where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables and meat every day. She also has a bakery, where she bakes all different kinds of breads using a rustic, wood-fired oven. She sells the bread in her store and also sells it in bulk to other stores.

Julia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Julia’s dreams are to expand her business, offer a wider variety of merchandise, keep strengthening her values system, and have a beautiful family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua. Julia es conviviente, tiene 34 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Julia tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza diariamente. Además Julia tiene una panadería en donde elaboran toda variedad de panes, el horno es rustico a leña, sus ventas los realiza en su tienda y también reparte por mayor a las tiendas. Julia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite. Los sueños de Julia son surtir y ampliar su negocio, enriquecer sus valores y tener una linda familia.

loans.use: Julia would like to buy rice, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es: Maria tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es quien le colabora en las actividades del hogar. El esposo tambien trabaja como maestro albañil en diferentes obras de la ciudad. La cliente ha cambiado de actividad antes se dedicaba a la produccion y venta de chicha, pero ahora se dedica a la compra y venta de articulos de cuero como  por ejemplo cinturones y billeteras. La cliente cuenta con alguna competencia, ya que existen algunas vendedoras de similares productos en la zona del mercado donde tiene su puesto de venta, pero la ubicación de su negocio es muy buena ya que se encuentra en plena avenida. La cliente con el credito obtenido ampliara las operaciones de su negocio, comprara mayores cantidades de productos de cueros y ampliara sus operaciones a las provincias de la cuidad. Se trata de la tercera secuencia de la cliente con Agrocapital, los anteriores creditos los cancelo con normalidad.
texts.en:
Maria has 4 children, her husband is in charge of the housechores and he also works as a bulding worker at different construction sites of the town. The client has changed her activities as she used to make and sell maize liquor but now she buys and sells leather articles such as belts and wallets.There is some competition as there are other stallkeepers selling similar products in the part of the market where she has her stall, but the location of her business es very good as it is located on the avenue. With the loan, the client will increase her business operations, she will buy more leather products and start business in other provinces of the town. This is her third loan from Agrocapital. The previous loans were repaid regularly.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather products to increase sales.

loans.name: Av 2016 Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO AV. 2016 ESTA REPRESENTADA POR L. SEÑORA MARCEL. MAYRA ELL. ES CASADA  Y TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, ELL. SE DEDICA A L. VENTA D. ZAPATOS, AL IGUAL QUE LAS DEMAS SOCIAS QUE SE DEDICAN A L. VENTA D. COSMETICOS, LIBROS, COMIDA Y ALGUNOS SON PROPIETARIOS D. PEQUEÑAS TIENDAS D. BARRIO. L. MAYORIA D. LAS SOCIAS TIENEN MAS D. CINCO AÑOS DEDICADAS AL COMERCIO LO QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN SU RUBRO, ELLAS VENDEN EN EL MERCADO CAMPESIBNO DESD. MUY TEMPRANO PARA PODER ACABAR CON L. VENTA Y PODER DEDICARLES ALGO D. SU TIEMPO A SUS FAMILIAS. EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA L. COMPRA D. MERCADERIA PARA SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA Y PARA HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCION. ELLAS ADMITEN QUE ES L. PRIMERA VEZ TRABAJANDO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS PERO SE CONOCEN ENTRE ELLAS Y SABEN QUE SON PERSONAS CUMPLIDAS , RESPONSABLES Y TRABAJADORAS POR LO QUE L. FUNDACION AGROCAPITAL LES DA L. OPORTUNIDAD D. INGREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS Y AYUDAR A SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
The group Av. 2016 is represented by Mrs MarceL. Mayra. She is married and has 4 children. She sells shoes, and the other women in the group sell cosmetics, books, food, and some are owners of small stores in the town. The majority of the group members have been in business for more than 5 years, and therefore have a lot of experience. The women sell in the farmer's market from very early in the morning, so they can finish before the end of the day to leave some time to spend some time with their families. The loan will be to purchase merchandise for their business and to allow them to grow their business. The women of the group admit that this is the first time they obtain a loan as a group, but they know each other well and know that they are accomplished, responsible and hard working, which is why Fundacion Agrocapital is giving them the opportunity to increase their earnings and help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gueider

texts.es: GUEIDER TIENE 39 AÑOS, SU ESPOSA 35 AÑOS, TIENE 3 HIJOS, Y LA VIVIENDA ES PROPIA. EL SEÑOR SE DEDICA AL SECADO DE ARROZ EN UN INGENIO ARROCERO, RECIBE RENTA DE 3 MOTOS Y SU ESPOSA ES EMPLEADA DOMESTICA. EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA EN EL TRANSPORTE DE MOTO, PERO TAMBIEN BASTANTE DEMANDA, PARA EMPLEADA DOMESTICA HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA. LA RENTA QUE RECIBE POR MOTO ES DE 30 Bs por dia, Y TIENEN SUELDO FIJO POR EL SECADO DE ARROZ Y POR LAS LABORES DOMENTICAS. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGO E INFOCRED NO PRESENTA ASPECTOS NEGATIVOS.
texts.en:
Gueider is 39 and his wife is 35. They have 3 children and own their own home. Gueider dries rice in a rice refinery. He also rents out 3 motorcycles, and his wife is a maid. There is quite a lot of competition in motorcycle transportation, but there is also a lot of demand. There is also a lot of demand for maids. He receives 30 bolivianos ($4.25) per day from renting out the motorcycles. They have a fixed salary from drying rice and working as a maid. Gueider does not present any negative aspects in terms of credit risk.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Dario Paulino

texts.es: El cliente tiene 1 hija, y su esposa es quien le ayuda en LA OBLIGACIONES del hogar. asimimo la esposa es ayudante de cocina. El cliente se dedica al trozado de carne a primeras horas de la mañana y posteriormente se dedica a conducir su vehiculo de taxi. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en ambas actividades y es muy conocido en el medio. En la actividad del trozado de carne no tiene mucha competencia  y en el servicio de taxi existe bastante afluencia de gente por la zona en el sector donde trabaja por lo que es media la competencia. el cliente con el credito obtenido comprara un maquina de cortar y herramientas ya que anteriormente era dependiente ahora se esta independisando  en el rubro de cortado de carne. Se trata de la cuarta secuencia del cliente con Agrocapital, los anteriores creditos los cancelo con normalidad.
texts.en:
Dario has one daughter and his wife helps him maintain the household and does the cooking. He works cutting up meat in the morning and after that he works driving a taxi. He has a lot of experience in both jobs and knows them well. There is not very much competition in meat cutting but there is a lot of competition in the taxi business because of the affluence of the people in the area where he works. With this loan he will buy a cutting machine and tools. He was dependent before, but now he is making himself independent in the area of cutting meat. This is the fourth loan that he will be receiving from Agrocapital, and all his previous loans were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Wiracocha Village Bank. Wiracocha means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is 50 years old and married with two children. She and her husband buy and sell products from the jungle like peanuts, sesame seeds, annatto and palillo (a condiment). Justina has a small store in Ayacucho and another in a rented space in the city of Hatun Rumi. Her husband travels to the jungle to buy these products. After cleaning and storing her products, Justina sends them to the city of Lima, and she also sells the products in the city of Ayacucho.

Justina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy peanuts and sesame seeds. Justina dreams of opening a processing plant to add value to the products she sells and dreams that her children will finish their studies and grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua. Justina es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Justina junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de productos de la selva como ajonjolí, maní, achiote y palillo, Justina tiene un almacén en la ciudad de Ayacucho y en la ciudad de Hatun Rumi el cual es alquilado, Su esposo viaja a la selva para poder comprar de los productores luego de almacenar y limpiar los productos los envía a la ciudad de Lima y Justina se dedica a la venta en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Justina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maní y ajonjolí. Justina sueña con tener una empresa de transformación y darle valor agregado a los productos que comercia y que su hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Justina would like to buy peanuts and sesame seeds to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: MARGARITA CUENTA CON 59 AÑOS DE EDAD, ACTUALMENTE VIUDA, CON 5 HIJOS INDEPENDIENTES LA MISMA QUE CUENTA CON VIVIENDA PROPIA DOTADA DE SERVICIOS BASICOS. ELLA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE ARROZ EN CHALA PARA COMERCIALIZARLO PROCESADO Y CUENTA CON UNA VAGONETA QUE SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS QUE LE GENERA RENTA DIARIA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDAS, CUENTA CON 12 AÑOS DEEXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, SIENDO LA ACTIVIDAD UNIFAMILIAR. DICHAS ACTIVIDADES TIENEN COMPETENCIA EN LA ZONA SIN EMBARGO SU EXPERIENCIA Y CONSOLIDACION EN EL MERCADO HACEN QUE TENGAN BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL CREDITO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA REPARACION DE SU VAGONETA YA QUE LA MISMA SUFRIO UN CHOQUE YA QUE LA MISMA ES UNA SUS PRINCIPALES HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO Y FUENTES DE INGRESOS. LA CLIENTE  CUENTA CON 8 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION CON EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGOS Y TAMBIEN TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUICONES FINANCIERAS DONDE TAMBIEN CUENTA CON BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO.
texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children who now support themselves. She has her own home, equipped with basic services. She sells corn once it has been processed and also has a car that she uses to transport people. This gives her income during the week. On the weekend she sells food. She has 12 years of experience in these areas, and they have been a good source of income for her single family. There is a lot of competition in the activities she is involved in, but thanks to her experience she has been able to capture a lot of the market and therefore has high demand. This credit will be used to repair her car, because it was in an accident. Since the car is a principal source of income for Margarita, it is important that she repair it. Margarita has had 8 loans with excellent payment history. She has worked with other financial institutions where she also had a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her car

loans.name: Marcos Adony

texts.es:
El señor Marcos C. Montoya se destaca por ser muy trabajador y además por ser un excelente padre para sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual ha atendido desde hace 2 años 

Desde que el inicio en este negocio  se ha  venido esforzando porque ha  podido  sobrevivir  con su carga familiar  y una de las necesidades que  le está perjudicando es la de obtener dinero para la compra de productos para abastecer su negocio y es por eso que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un préstamo para poder mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo ya que de esta manera beneficia a su familia llevando el alimento a su mesa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos C. Montoya stands out because he is very hard working and an excellent father to his two young, school age children. He puts a lot of effort into his general store, which he has had for 2 years. From when he began the store, he has been working very hard to ensure that he can take care of his family. One thing that has been hurting his store the most is lack of money to buy products to stock his store. To fulfill this necessity he went to Ceprodel to obtain a loan so that he may improve and expand his business, so that it can ensure he can provide for the basic needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for store

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años, La esposa es quien le colabora en las actividades del hogar.  Y ademas ayuda con la venta hamburguesas  en la puerta del taller. El cliente trabaja en la empresa  Imabol, industria maderera boliviana  por varios años es muy conocido por su trabajo y responsabilidad, realiza trabajos de varnizado, lijado acabado de los muebles en general. La competencia es baja debido a la gran demanda de mano de obra calificada en el rubro. Tiene estabilidad en el trabajo. El cliente con el credito obtenido  esta comprando herramientas y accesorios para su taller ya que piensa en un futuro independisarse, a la fecha el cliente biene realizando trabajos esporádicos en su domicilio. Se trata de la quinta secuencia del cliente con Agrocapital, los anteriores creditos los cancelo con normalidad,
texts.en:
Maximo has two children who are 5 and 3 years old. His wife helps him around the house and also helps him to sell hamburgers at his business. Maximo works at Imabol, a Bolivian timber company. He has worked there for many years and he is well known for his work and his responsibility. He does sanding and varnishing work on furniture. Competition is low due to a large demand for skilled professionals. Maximo has stability in his job. With this loan he will purchase tools and accessories for his work. In the future he would like to work independently. At the moment he does independent work sporadically from his home. This is the 5th loan Maximo has received from Agrocapital. He paid off the previous loans normally.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: CASILDA TIENE 4 HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES PEQUEÑO AGRICULTOR, TIENE 3 HIJAS, TRABAJAN COMO EMPLEADAS PARA MANTENERSE YA QUE A SU MADRE NO LE ALCANZA, ADEMAS QUE SUS HIJAS SIGUEN ESTUDIANDO. ELLA ES CASADA, TIENE UNA CASA EN EL KM 21 (EL PALMAR) ES UNA CASA DE MADERA DE DOS AMB/ MAT..........VENDE VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO 1º DE ABRIL YA VENDE 4 AÑOS, ANTES VENDIA ROPA AMERICANA PERO ASEGURA QUE LA VERDURA EN MEJOR YA QUE PUEDE ALIMENTAR CON ELLA A SU FAMILIA........LA CLIENTA TIENE VARIAS PERSONAS QUE OFRECEN EL MISMO PRODUCTO, SUS COLEGAS TIENEN PUESTOS MAS GRANDES EL EXCITO DE SU NEGOCIO ES LA PERSISTENCIA Y RESPONZABILIDAD YA QUE ASI TIENE CLIENTELA SEGURA...............LA CLIENTE INVERTIRA EN EL COMERIO DE VERDURAS, COMPRARA PAPA GRANDE CON 560 BS. PAPA PEQUEÑA CON 200 BS. CEBOLLA CON 140 BS. UNA CAJA DE TOMATE CON 60 BS. Y OTRAS ESPECIES CON 78 BS........LA CLIENTE INVIERTE ESTAS ,MISMAS CONIDADES YA QUE NO HAY ESPACIO PARA MAS VERDURAS Y RENUEVA CADA CIERTO PERIODO SU MERCADERIA......ADEMAS OTRO PARTE DEL CREDITO LO DESTINARA PARA LA COMPRA DE VENENO YA QUE TIENE ARROZ SEMBRADO........ ES SU CUARTA OPERACION Y EN TODOS SUS CREDITOS ESTA CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO.
texts.en:
Casilda has 4 children, her husband is a small farmer, their 3 daughters work to support themselves as what their mother makes is not enough. In addition their daughters continue studying. She lives at Kilometer 21 (El Palmer), in a wood house with two rooms. She has been selling vegetables in the 1st of April market for 4 years. Prior to that she sold American-style clothing but she assures us that vegetables are better and she can feed her family with this business. The client has various colleagues who offer the same products, her colleagues have larger stands and the success of her business is her persistence and responsibility as she has a steady clientele. The client will invest in her vegetable business, buying large potatoes (560 BS), small potatoes (200 BS), onion (140 BS) a case of tomatoes (60 BS) and other items (78 BS). The client will invest in these items as there isn’t any more room for vegetables and she rotates her merchandise after a certain period of time. In addition part of the loan will be used to buy insecticide as she has planted some rice. This is her fourth loan and all her loans have been repaid promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. Rosa is 39 years old, separated, and has two children. She sells clothing from a rented stand at the Mariscal Caceres market. She works every day, and buys her products in bulk in the city of Lima. She also travels to regional fairs from time to time. Rosa needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy athletic wear and children’s clothing. Rosa’s dreams are to build a house, for her children to grow up to be professionals, to expand her business, and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Rosa es separada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Rosa vende ropa en un puesto alquilado del campo ferial Mariscal Cáceres que se ubica en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Rosa en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias de las regiones. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos y ropa de niños. Los sueños de Rosa son construir su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, hacer crecer su negocio y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Rosa would like to buy athletic wear and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: 21 De Enero Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "21 D. ENERO", ESTÁN REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA ELIANA, EXISTEN PARENTESCOS ENTRE EL GRUPO PRESENTAN  COMO NEXO CONSANGUÍNEO ENTRE LAS SEÑORAS GABRIELA, LAURA, CARMEN  Y ELIODORA REYNALDO Y ELIANA ELLOS SON HERMANOS PERO CON INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES LO QUE NO OCASIONA PROBLEMAS EN EL GRUPO. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, COMO PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, SE PRESENTA EN EL BANCO SOCIAS QUE PRESTAN SUS SERVICIOS PROFESIONALES D. FORMA INDEPENDIENTE. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA EL CRÉDITO QUE SE LES OTORGÓ, SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. LAS SOCIAS ESTA DESTINADO PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA Y COMPRAR HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO.EFECTIVAMENTE LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE YA TUVIERON CRÉDITOS ANTERIORES  POR LO QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS.SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y MUY CUMPLIDAS YA QUE ALGUNAS YA TUVIERON LA OPORTUNIDAD D. TRABAJAR CON AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The members of the “21 D. Enero” microfinance institute are represented by Ms. Eliana. Some peope in the group are related. Gabriela, Laura, Carmen, Eliodora, Reynaldo, and Eliana are all siblings. However, they all have their own income, which does not create problems in the group. The members partake in different business activities, such as cosmetics, general stores, petit fours and food sales, etc. Members who proviD. independent professional services turn up at the microfinance institute. As in any commercial realm, there is always competition with supply and demand. According to the members, the loan will be used to increase their merchandise and purchase work tools. Indeed, the members say that they have previously received loans, which means that they have experience working in solidarity. They are very responsible people because some of the members have already had the opportunity to work with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa Blass tiene la edad de 35 años habita en San Juan de la concepción comunidad los Martínez, junto a su esposo y sus hijos, el esposo es agricultor y comerciante de frutas, al igual que doña rosa, los sueños de ella es logra ampliar tanto la producción como su negocio, esta señora ha tenido siempre el apoyo de Afodenic y esta contenta ya que poco a poco esta logrando lo que se propuso hasta ahora , ella quiere darle mejor condición de vida a sus hijos ya que ellos están por salir de la secundaria y quiere que vayan a la universidad para verlos profesionales ya que ella no pudo estudiar quiere que sus hijos vivan mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa B. is 35 years old and lives in the Martínez community of San Juan de la Concepción, along with her husband and children. Her husband is a farmer and a fruit vendor like Ms. Rosa. She dreams of expanding both her business and production. She has always had Afodenic’s support, and she is pleased because everything that she has set out to do has been achieved little by little. She wants to give her children better living conditions as they are almost finished with their secondary studies. She wants them to go on to college so that they can become professionals because she was unable to continue with her studies. She wants her children to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: JHONY TIENE 2 HIJOS A QUIEN MANTIENE EL ES CASADO Y SU ESPOSA ESTA EN ESPAÑA, TIENE CASA PROPIA DONDE VIVE CON SUS HIJOS.........EL SE DEDICA  A LA EXTRACCION Y VENTA DE PESCADOS DE RIOS, EL CLIENTE YA LLEVA 12 AÑOS EN ESTA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, EL CLIENTE ATRAPA PESCADOS Y LOS VENDE A LOS RESTAURANES ESPECIALIZADOS EN ESTE TIPO DE ALIMENTOS................ TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE LA PESCA ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE GENERA MUY BUENOS INGRESOS, PERO TAMBIEN HAY QUE TENER MUCHO CONOCIMIENTO DE ESTA ACTIVIDAD ....................... EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA COMO CAPITAL DE OPERACION PARA LA COMPRA DE ARTICLOS DE COSMETOLOGIA YA QUE SU HIJO ESTA ABRIENDO UNA TIENDA DE ESTE TIPO DE PRODUCTOS DON JHONNY MECIONA QUE EL DINERO ES PARA SU HIJO Y SU YERNA YA QUE DESEA AYUDARLOS EN LA APERTURA DE UNA TIENDA. LOS PRECIOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS SON VARIADOS YA QUE COMPRO VARIOS TIPOS DE PRODUCTOS.................. ES SU CUARTA OPERACION Y TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO ES SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS Y SOLO TIENE CREDITO EN AGROCAPITAL.SE HACE NOTAR QUE EL SEÑOR JHONNY NO SE ENCONTRABA EN LA TIENDA POR LO QUE SE TOMO LA FOTO A LA YERNA.
texts.en:
Jhonny has 2 children whom he supports. He is married and his wife is in Spain. He owns his own home where he lives with his children. He works fishing and selling freshwater fish. This client has been in this business for 12 years, catching fish and selling them to restaurants specializing in this type of food. Fishing is a very competitive business because it generates good income, but it also requires much knowledge. The loan will be used as start-up capital in the purchase of cosmetic products as his son is opening a store to sell such products. Jhonny mentions that the money is for his son and his daughter-in-law as he wants to help them open their store. The products sell for a variety of prices as he has bought many different kinds of products. This is his fourth loan; he has a proven track record with his previous loans and he has taken loans out only with Agrocapital. Please note that because Jhonny was unavailable, it is his daughter-in-law in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to be invested in a variety of cosmetic products

loans.name: Perpetua Felicitas

texts.en:
Perpetua is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. Perpetua is 48 years old, separated, and has four children. Perpetua sells sawdust from her home, located in Las Americas. The sawdust she sells is then used to make adobe bricks and to transport livestock and frozen fish. Her children help her with the business. Perpetua needs a loan of 1300 soles to buy sacks of sawdust. Perpetua’s dreams are to have her own car to transport her products to other places and to help her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Perpetua es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Perpetua es separada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Perpetua se dedica a la venta de aserrín en su casa ubicada en las Américas, su producto los adquiere de las diferentes carpinterías y madereras de la ciudad, el aserrín es utilizado para la fabricación de ladrillos, transportar ganado, pescado congelado, sus ventas los realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Perpetua necesita un préstamo de 1300 soles dinero que será invertido en la comprar de aserrín por sacos. Los sueños de Perpetua son tener un carro para transportar sus productos a otros lugares, salir adelante con sus hijos.

loans.use: Perpetua would like to buy sawdust in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Delia Frinee

texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Wiracocha (“Sun God” in Quechua) Village Bank.

Delia is 55 years old and is divorced with six children. Delia has a store in her daughter’s house, located on a busy street, where she works six days per week selling tires. She buys tires directly from the manufacturers. Delia also has rental income from a house that she owns.

Delia needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy more tires. She dreams of buying a house in Lima to live in with her grandchildren and also of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.

Delia es divorciada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Delia tiene una tienda en la casa de su hija ubicada en una avenida concurrida en donde vende llantas, actividad que realiza durante 6 días a la semana, sus productos los adquiere a través de pedidos a las empresas. Además Delia alquila su casa que le genera un ingreso.

Delia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de llantas. Delia sueña con comprar una casa en Lima e irse a vivir con sus nietos y tener otra tienda mas.

loans.use: Buy tires

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: DOMINGO ES CASADO, LA FAMILIA COMPONE DE 3 HIJOS DE 6, 16 Y 18 AÑOS, TODOS SOLTEROS, CON RESIDENCIA EN MINERO. SUS ACTIVIDADES SON COMERCIO DE COMIDAS Y RENTA DE MOTOTAXI, LA MISMA CUENTA CON MUCHOS AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO,  TIENE POCA COMPETENCIA EN LA ZONA., EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRA DE MOTO. PARA HACER TRABAJAR Y PERCIBIR RENTA DEL MISMO, EL CLIENTE TIENE BUEN HISTORICO CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION, NO TIENE DEUDA DIRECTA O INDIRECTA CON OTRAS INSTITUCIONES.
texts.en:
Domingo is married, his family made up of 3 children aged 6, 16 and 18 years of age, and all of whom are single. They live in Minero. His business is selling prepared foods and passenger transport, having many years experience in each, and has very little competition in the region. This loan is destined to purchase a motorcycle, to put to use and to rent it out. This client has a good past history with the institution, having no outstanding debts with this or other institutions.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married with five children. Francisca has a store in her home, located in the Artesanos neighborhood, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, chicken and condiments with the help of her husband. Francisca also works as a nurse technician at a local hospital. Francisca needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice and sugar. Francisca’s dreams are to have a bulk goods store and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Francisca es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Francisca tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asoc. Artesanos en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, pollo, condimentos, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su esposo. Además Francisca trabaja en el hospital como técnica en enfermería. Francisca necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. Los sueños de Francisca son tener una tienda de venta por mayor y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 46 years old and separated with five children. Leonidas travels to regional fairs twice a week to sell fruits and vegetables and buy grains and tubers, which she then sells in markets in the city of Ayacucho. She accepts payment both in cash and on credit. Leonidas also has a kiosk near the hospital where she sells drinks and snacks. She also works on a small farm in Pampa Cangallo. Leonidas needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy fertilizer for her farm. Leonidas’ dreams are to move to the city of Cangallo and open a store there, and for her children to finish their education and have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Leonidas es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Leonidas es separada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Leonidas viaja a las ferias de la región dos veces por semana en donde vende verduras, frutas, y de las ferias compra cereales, tubérculos que luego los comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas son al crédito y contado. Además Leonidas tiene un kiosco cerca al hospital regional en donde vende bebidas y abarrotes, también se dedica a la agricultura en Pampa Cangallo. Leonidas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono para sembrar. Los sueños de Leonidas son tener una tienda en la ciudad de Cangallo e irse a vivir allá, sus hijos terminen de estudiar y tengan un buen futuro.

loans.use: Leonidas would like to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: DOÑA LILIANA TIENE UN SOLO DEPENDIENTE DE 16 AÑOS DE EDAD; TIENE CASA PROPIA. DOÑA LILIANA  TIENE UNA PENSION EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO; POR OTRO LADO TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO LA CUAL ES ADMINISTRADA POR ELLA Y SU HIJA. TIENE 5 1/2 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA. LA COMPETENCIA EN LA VENTA DE COMIDA  Y DE LA TIENDA DE BARRIO NO SON MUY ALTAS YA QUE ES UNA DE LAS POCAS PERSONAS QUE TIENEN UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO Y ADEMAS VENDEN ALMUEZO Y CENA EN ESA ZONA. LA CLIENTA PIENSA AMPLIAR SU VIVIENDA CON LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN HALL MAS GRANDE PARA LA VENTA DE SU COMIDA . EL CREDITO ACTUAL ES SU 3 OPERACIÓN,TUVO PRIMERO EN UNA DE LAS PROVINCIAS CON EXCELENTES REFERENCIAS DE PUNTUALIDAD.
texts.en:
Ms. Liliana P. has one 16-year-old dependent child. She has her own home, which also serves as a guesthouse. Additionally, she has a neighborhood general store, which is managed by her daughter. She has 5 ½ years of experience. She does not have very much competition as far as food sales and general stores are concerned because she is one of the few people who have a general store in her neighborhood. She also sells lunch and dinner in the area. This client plans on expanding her home by building a bigger dining hall for her food sales. This is her third loan. Her first loan was in one of the provinces, and she has excellent references in punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating costs

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. C. M. habita en la Cmca. La Palma, Tecolostote dedicado al cultivo de arroz, tiene 8 Mzs por esfuerzo propio, atiende de manera personal el establecimiento y manejo del cultivo apoyado por 2 hijos, que despues de estudiar por la mañana se incorporan al trabajo por la tarde.  Su esposa Sandra Mendoza garantiza muy temprano la alimentacion de su hijo para la escuela y su marido al trabajo.  Uno de sus principales problemas es el trillado de su produccion, por lo que tienen que vender  en granza a menor precio, lo que le reduce sus ingresos que son el sosten familiar; a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de asociarse para la instalacion de 1 trillo en la comunidad, lo que le garantiza mejores y mayores ingresos, para lo cual requiere el presente financiamiento y asi alcanzar su sueño de ser parte asociativa de esta futura empresa productiva.
texts.en:
Mr. C. M. lives in the La Palma neighborhood of Tecolostote. He cultivates rice for a living. He has 8 Mzs (manzanas—about 5.6 hectares) of rice from his own efforts. He personally attends to the establishment and managing of the crops with the help of two of his children who work in the rice fields in the evening after attending school in the morning. His wife, Sandra Mendoza, prepares food her children and husband early in the morning. One of his main problems is threshing the rice, which is why he has to sell rice husks at a lower price, and this in turn reduces his earnings—his family’s means of support. He has the opportunity of becoming an associate in his co-op so that they can install a rice huller in the community, which guarantees better and greater earnings. For this reason, he needs this loan so that he can realize his dream of becoming a part of this future company.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% towards construction of rice huller for La Peña rice

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: EL  GRUPO PRIMAVERA ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA BERONICA, EN ESTE BANCO COMUNAL EXISTE PARENTESCO ENTRE LAS SRAS. ANGELA Y MARTHA TEREZA QUE SON HERMANAS, AL IGUAL ENTRE LAS SRAS. CLAUDIA  Y MARIA , TAMBIÉN EXISTE PARENTESCO ENTRE LAS SRAS. MATILD.  Y LA Sra. MERCEDES PERO ESO NO REPRESENTA DIFICULTAD YA QUE CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENE INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES. EN ESTE BANCO COMUNAL LOS SOCIOS SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. COSMÉTICOS , VENTA D. COMIDA, VENTA D. PAN, VENTA D. ROPA Y OTRAS ACTIVIDADES RELACIONAS CON LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. LA ÉPOCA. LA GRAN MAYORÍA REQUIERE EL DINERO PARA INCREMENTAR LOS INSUMOS Y EL MATERIAL QUE PONEN A LA VENTA. ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE TRABAJAN CON  LA FUNDACIÓN PERO ESTÁN SEGUROS D. CUMPLIR CON LOS PAGOS PORQUE SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” (Spring) Group is represented by Beronica. In this communal bank there are a few related members: Angela and Martha are sisters, as are Claudia and Maira, and MatilD. and Mercedes are related. These relationships do not represent a difficulty as each of the members has independent income. In this communal bank the members sell cosmetics, food, bread, clothing and other businesses related to seasonal products. The majority require money to increase stock and materials used in their sales. This is the firs ttime they are working with the Foundation but they are sure they can make their payments because they are hard-working and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. B. G. habita junto a su familia en la comunidad de Mazapia, Tecolostote, dedicado a la siembra de arroz y socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 8 Mzs de arroz, un problema es la falta de un trillo en la comunidad, por lo que tiene que vender a bajo precio su produccion, lo que le reduce sus ingresos que son el sosten de su familia a traves  de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio en la construccion de un trillo en su comunidad, para lo cual solicita el presente financiamiento  y asi alcanzar su mayor deseo que es ser parte de esa sociedad que le permita mejoar sus condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. B. G. lives with his family in the Mazapia community in Tecolostote. He works in rice cultivation and is a member of the La Esperanza agricultural co-op. He has established 8 Mzs (manzanas—about 5.6 hectares) of rice from his own efforts. One problem that he faces is the lack of a rice huller in his community, which causes him to sell his crop at a lower price, thus reducing his income—the family’s means of support. Through his co-op, he has the opportunity to participate as a member in the construction of a rice huller in his community. For this reason, he is requesting this loan so that he can reach his greatest wish, which is to be a part of this association that allows him to improve his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% towards construction of rice huller for La Peña rice

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Maria de Jesus junto a su marido se dedican a la actividad agricola de la siembra de arroz, generalmente establecen 5 Mzs de arroz de secano anualmente, lo que les permite economicamente asistir a su familia compuesta por 1 hijo menor de edad y su marido Arnulfo Estrada, quien se dedica al manejo  de cultivo diariamente; a traves de su cooperativa esta accesando al proyecto de construccion de 1 trillo arrocero, donde los socios aportaran el 30% del costo del mismo.  En la comunidad de La Peña, zona donde habitan los socios se estra construyendo estas instalaciones.  La Sra. R. mantiene su posibilidad de accesar al proyecto y ser socia de este trillo, para lo cual espera que se le financie el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesús, together with her husband, dedicates herself to the agricultural activity of planting rice. Generally, they establish 5 months of rice annually. This allows her to help out the family which is comprised of one minor child and her husband Arnulfo Estrada who manages the crop on a daily basis. Through their partnership, she is accessing a project to build a rice thresher where the members will contribute 30% of the cost for the endeavor. In the La Peña community, where the members live, there is one of these intallations being built. Mrs. R. maintains the possibility of participating in this project and becoming a member of the thresher, for which she hopes that the requested loan is financed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% of the cost to build a rice thresher in La Peña.

loans.name: Irma Cintia

texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 22 and lives with her husband and her son. Irma sells beauty products and cosmetics from two catalogues: Avon and Esika. She also sells clothing by special order, which she buys in the city of Lima. She and her husband also have a motorcycle taxi, which her husband uses to provide public transportation. Irma needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy pants, polo shirts and repair her mototaxi. Irma’s dreams are to grow as a person, expand her business and provide her son with a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Irma es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Irma vende productos de belleza, cosméticos por catalogo de dos líneas Esika y Avon, que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, además Irma vende ropa a pedido que compra en la ciudad de Lima. Además junto a su esposo tiene una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo haciendo transporte publico. Irma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalón, polos y reparación de su mototaxi. Los sueños de Irma son crecer como persona, ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena vida a su hijo.

loans.use: Buy pants and polo shirts and repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 57 years old and married with five children. She has a small store in her house (near the stadium in the city of Ayacucho) where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat, fish and drinks. She works 7 days a week from 6am to 11pm. Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, rice, beer and soda. Rosa dreams of totally outfitting her business and leaving a business to each one of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Rosa es casada, tiene 57 años y 5 hijos, Rosa tiene una bodega en su casa que se ubica cerca al estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne, pescado, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los dias de la semana, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, cerveza, gaseosa. Rosa sueña con implementar su negocio, dejar negocios para cada uno de sus hijos.

loans.use: Rosa would like to buy rice, sugar, beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. C. L. pequeño productor agricola, con un hijo en edad escolar, junto a su familia y por esfuerzo propio cultiva 4 Mzs de arroz, para lo que dedica tiempo completo, cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo que luego de asistir a la escuela se integra a las labores productivas junto a su padre y asi colaborar con el sustento familiar.  Oscar es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza localizada en la Cmca. La Peña y a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de asociarse en la construccion de 1 trillo arrocero que le permitira contar con esta parte del proceso productivo y reducir sus costos, ya que en la actualidad tiene que viajar a largas distancias para el trillado de su cosecha; solicita el presente financiamiento para aportar y lograr su sueño de ser socio de este trillo y obtener mejores ingresos para el bien familiar, ya que es parte del patrimonio que le dejara a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mr. C. L. is a small agricultural producer with one school-aged child. Together with his family, and through his own efforts, he cultivates four months of rice to which he dedicates himself wholly. He counts on his son’s help who, after attending school, participates in the labor with his father and in this way collaborates in the support of the family. Oscar is a member of the La Esperanza cooperative, located in the La Peña community. Through the cooperative, he has an opportunity to associate himself with the construction of a rice thresher that wil permit him to participate in this part of the production process and reduce his costs. Currently, he has to travel to various locations in order to thresh his harvest. He requests the current financing to be able to contribute and achieve his dream of becoming a member of this thresher and obtain greater profits for the benefit of his family, as this is part of the assets he would leave to his son

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% of the construction costs for a rice thresher in La Peña.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband and their son. Maribel is a social worker, but hasn’t yet found work in this area. She has a call center in a rented space in front of the municipal office of the San Juan Bautista neighborhood. She has three phone booths. An employee runs the call center in the mornings, and Maribel works in the afternoons. She also sells pre-paid cell phone cards, virtual recharges and some cell phone accessories. She and her husband also own a motorcycle taxi, which her husband drives. Maribel occasionally sells food at markets and on national holidays. Maribel needs a loan of 800 soles to buy phone cards and virtual recharges. Maribel dreams of having her own home, of working as a social worker and of providing her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maribel Es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Maribel es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Maribel es asistenta social que aun no ejerce, tiene un locutorio en un local alquilado ubicado al frente de la municipalidad de San Juan Bautista, tiene 3 cabinas telefónicas, por las mañanas atiende un personal y por las tardes atiende ella misma, también vende tarjetas telefónicas, recargas virtuales y algunos accesorios de celulares. Además Maribel junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo. En algunas oportunidades Maribel vende comida en las ferias y fiestas patronales. Maribel necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de recargas y tarjetas telefónicas. Maribel sueña con tener una casa propia, realizarse como profesional y brindarle una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Maribel would like to buy pre-paid cell phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. S. U. habita en la Cmca. San Nicolas junto a su familia, por esfuerzo propio se dedica a la produccion de 4 Mzs de arroz, las que atiende personalmente con el apoyo de 1 hermano que habita junto a el; uno de sus principales problemas es el trillado de su produccion, ya que por la lejania vende su cosecha en granza, lo que le reduce sus ingresos que son el sosten familiar; es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza,  y esta le presenta la oportunidad de participar como socio de la instalacion de 1 trillo arrocero en la comunidad, lo que le permitira obtener mayores ingresos que garantizaran mejores condiciones de vida familiar, siendo su principal anhelo la asociatividad de esta futura empresa de produccion, para lograr incrementar sus ganancias y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. S. U. lives in the San Nicolas community along with his family, and through much effort he dedicates himself to the production of four months of rice. He tends to his crop himself, along with the help of one brother who lives with him. One of his biggest problems is the threshing of his product and, due to distance, he sells his crop piecemeal which reduces his income to support the family. He is a member of the La Esperanza cooperative which is offering him the opportunity to participate in the construction of a rice thresher for the community. This would allow him greater earnings which, in turn, would improve his family’s standard of living. His biggest desire is to participate in this future venture so he can improve his profits and provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% toward the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 45 years old and married with three children. She works at the regional hospital as a nurse technician, and also travels to different regional fairs to sell dry goods and fruits. At the fairs, she buys grains to sell in markets in the city of Ayacucho. She and her husband also own a car, which they use for urban transport. Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Maria’s dreams are to have good investment capital, to keep working, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Maria es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, trabaja en el hospital regional como técnica en enfermería, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que realiza en sus días libres, donde vende abarrotes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego distribuye en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Maria junto a su esposo tiene un carro que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad. Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo. Maria sueña con tener un buen capital, seguir trabajando, darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Maria would like to buy rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Sumaq Ayllu Village Bank. Sumaq Ayllu means “beautiful family” in Quechua. Juana is 43 years old and separated with two children. She runs an Internet café in a rented space in the city of Ayacucho, her son and one employee administer the business. Juana also offers photocopies and sells computer accessories at the café. She also owns a restaurant in a rented space a block from the main plaza of the city of Ayacucho. She employs three people to run the restaurant. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sacks of sugar and rice. Juana dreams that her children will grow up to be working professionals, of improving her house and of expanding her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Ayllu que significa Linda Familia en quechua. Juana es separada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene cabinas de Internet que se ubican en un local alquilado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, negocio que es administrado por su hijo con la ayuda de una empleada, también brindan servicios de fotocopiado, venta de accesorios de computadora. Además Juana tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado a una cuadra de la plaza principal, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 3 personas. Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz por sacos. Juana sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su casa y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Juana would like to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Sumaq Ayllu Village Bank. Sumaq Ayllu means “beautiful family” in Quechua. Maritza is 40 years old and separated with four children. Maritza owns a car and a motorcycle taxi which she rents out each day, and this provides her with income to support her family. She also grows purple corn on a plot of land she owns in Santiago de Pischa.

Maritza needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of seeds and to make payments on her tractor. Maritza’s dreams are for her children to grow up to be working professionals, to give them the skills to work with, and to buy more cars. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Ayllu que significa Linda Familia en quechua. Maritza es separada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Martiza tiene un carro y mototaxi que alquila diariamente el cual le genera ingresos para mantener su hogar. Además Maritza se dedica a la agricultura de maíz morado en sus terrenos de Santiago de Pischa. Maritza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y pago del tractor. Los sueños de Maritza son que sus hijos sean profesionales, forjarles una herramienta de trabajo y comprar mas carros.

loans.use: Buy seeds and make payment on a tractor

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es: El Sr. D. S. habita en la Cmca. El Sinchal-Tecolostote junto a su familia compuesta por 3 hijos mayores y su esposa; por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 4 Mzs de arroz, el que tiene que vender en granza a menor precio, lo que reduce sus ingresos familiares, un hijo labora junto a el en la agricultura; es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza, y a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar en la instalacion de un trillo arrocero en la cumunidad, lo que le permitira maximizar sus ingresos familiares, su mayor deseo es participar de este proyecto como socio y asi garantizar ingresos adiciones que le permitan un mejor futuro a su familia y la comunidad.
texts.en:
D. S. lives in Cmca. El Sinchal-Tecolostote together with his family, made up of 3 grown children and his wife. On his own he has established a plantation of 7 hectares of rice. He has to sell at a better price thereby reducing his family income. His son works together with him in the fields. He is a member of the cooperative La Esperanza (meaning The Hope), and thruogh this cooperative he has the opportunity to contribute towards the installation of a rice thresher in the community, permitting him to maximize his family income. His greatest wish is to participate in this project as a member and guarantee an income, which will permit a better future for his family and the community.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% of the construction of a rice thresher in La Pena.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz D. Motupe, distrito D. Independencia,  provincia D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Claudia afirma que su mayor logro ha sido mantener su negocio durante 30 años. Su puesto D. venta se encuentra ubicado en el jr. 13 D. diciembre 237, Huaraz, en un puesto provisional que queda en la calle. Inició su negocio en la ciudad D. Paramonga y por sus hijos vino a la ciudad D. Huaraz para poder educarlos, junto a su esposo emprendió el viaje, empezando así en Huaraz con un poco D. verduras, que poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora ella junto a su esposo venden sacos D. ajíes y ajo que lo trae desD. la costa. La mayor dificultad que ellos han tenido, es que han sufrido robos en su puesto D. venta y también en sus viajes cuando realizaban las compras D. sus productos. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará sacos D. ají ya que el ají es muy costoso porque cada kilo cuesta casi veinte soles.
 
Claudia afirma que le gustaría recibir charlas para saber llevar mejor su familia y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia belongs to the Cruz D. Motupe Community Bank in the Independence district, in the Huarez province, in the Ancash region.

She is 57 years old, is married and has four children. Claudia confirms that her greatest achievement has been running her business for thirty years. Her stall can be found on Jr. 13 of December 237, Huarez in a provisional spot on the street. She began her business in the city of Paramonga. She came to Huarez so that her children could be educated. Along with her husband, she undertook the journey, beginning in Huarez with some produce that gradually grew. Now, with her husband, she sells bags of peppers and garlic that is brought from the coast. The greatest difficulty that they have had is that they have suffered burglaries of their stall and also on the trips they've maD. to purchase their products.

With this loan of S. 1,200, which will be repaid in six months, she will purchase bags of peppers since pepper is very expensive since every kilo costs almost 20 soles.

Claudia confirms that she would like to receive advice in order to know how to take better care of her family and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase bags of peppers at S. 20 per kilo (more or less).

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. A. U. habita en la Cmca. La Peña, casado, con 2 hijos, su esposa Gloria Gomez se dedica a la atencion del hogar y sus dos hijos pequeños y garantiza la alimentacion a su marido,  don Sergio se dedica a la siembra de arroz secano, y desde muy temprano atiene su cultivo de 5 Mzs de arroz; es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza y a traves de esta tiene la oportunidad de ser asociado en el montaje de un trillo de arroz que le permitira obtener mayores ingresos para el sustento familiar; su mayor anhelo es alcanzar un ingreso adicional para el bienestar de la familia en el futuro.
texts.en:
Señor A. U. lives in la Cmca. in La Peña. He is married with two children. His wife, Gloria Gomez, is a housewife, raises their two young children, and prepares food for her husband. Don Sergio grows dry rice and attends to his 5 manzanas (8.65 acres) of land starting very early in the morning. He is a member of the agricultural cooperative "La Esperanza." Through this, he has the opportunity to collaborate in assembling a rice thresher that will let him make more income to sustain his family. His biggest dream is to make additional email for his family's future well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support 30% of the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz de Motupe del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Es madre soltera de tres hijos y tiene 34 años de edad. Piensa que su mayor logro ha sido recuperar a sus hijos, comenta que ellos se encontraban a cargo de su papá, así mismo manifiesta que ha comprado sus cosas para poder ver mejor a sus hijos y eso le he traído mucha satisfacción personal. 

Es vendedora ambulante de prendas de vestir, de zapatos, carteras o bolsos, todo lo que le pueda ser útil para el negocio nos afirma. Compra desde la ciudad de Lima y Trujillo y lo vende caminando y utiliza su casa de almacén. La mayor dificultad que tiene es que ha sufrido robos cuando ha viajado a realizar sus compras, tan es así que incluso le ha sido y aún le es difícil recuperarse del último robo que sufrió que la obligó a empezar de nuevo. Ahora menciona que se encuentra tranquila junto a sus hijos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200 el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en arreglar su casa, debido a que desea tener en mejores condiciones a sus hijos.
 
A Delicia le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Delicia belongs to the Motupe Cross Communal Bank in the district of Independence, Huaraz province, department of Ancash. She is a single mother of three children and is 34 years old. She thinks that her greatest success is getting her children back, who were in the care of their father. She has bought things to better take care of her children and this has brought her a lot of personal satisfaction. She is a street vendor of articles of clothing, shoes, wallets and bags, everything that would be useful for business, she says. She buys these in the city of Lima or Trujillo and sells them on the street or from her home. The greatest problem she has had is that she has been robbed when she was traveling to make her purchases. It has been and still is difficult for her to recover from the last robbery that forced her to start from square one. Now she says that she is happy spending time with her children. With this loan of 1,200 soles ($400), which she will repay over 6 months, she will invest in the improvement of her home, as she would like her children to live in better conditions. Delicia would like to prepare herself to improve her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in home improvement

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.en:
Rigoberta is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 49 years old and married with five children. Rigoberta has a stand in the April 12th Market in the center of Ayacucho where she sells meat. She buys the animals at weekend livestock fairs and then brings them to the city slaughterhouse. She also sells clothing in markets and sometimes sells animals.

Rigoberta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy skirts, blouses and aprons to sell. Rigoberta’s dreams are to see her business grow and to meet all of her family’s basic needs. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Rigoberta es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. Rigoberta es casada, tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, Rigoberta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad, en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias los días sábado y domingo luego lo beneficia en el camal de la ciudad. Además vende ropa en las ferias y en algunas oportunidades canjea con animales. Rigoberta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, blusas, mandiles. Rigoberta sueña con que su negocio crezca y en su familia no falte las cosas elementales.

loans.use: Buy skirts, blouses and aprons for resale

loans.name: G. S Belen Group

texts.es:
Evelyn  cristela Alemán L. tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, esta joven tiene 2 hijos de los cuales tienen las siguientes edades una niña de 13 años  que cursa el primer año de secundaria, un varón de 9 años que cursa el tercer grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como obrero, los propósitos de Evelyn son de tener su propia casa y en sus propósitos seguir aportando ingresos para sus hijos para que así tengan un futuro en sus estudios y cuando tenga realizado su deseo de tener su propia casa darle las respectivas  mejoras a su vivienda y dejarle a sus hijos un lugar adecuado para vivir.

Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, el tiempo que tiene en este negocio es de 20 años la ubicación del negocio es en el mercado central, ella inicia su negocio por una amiga pero las intenciones de trabajo las mantuvo siempre, por lo que decide llevar a vender su producto hasta el mercado central y así como obtiene este medio de trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de materia prima como es el maíz y la leña para obtener mas producción y con la ayuda de su amiga María Cristina quien le brindo el apoyo para que juntas conformaran este financiamiento.

Su nombre es María Cristina V. D., tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña María tiene 5 hijos sus edades son las siguientes una niña de la edad de 19 años que cursa que cursa el 1 año de la carrera técnica 	quirúrgica, su otra hija tiene la edad de 17 años que cursa el 5 año de secundaria y un varón  de 14 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria y su otra hija que tiene 17 años y cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como obrero, en sus deseos esta el construir una vivienda por lo que ella tiene el lugar pero no tiene el suficiente dinero para la construcción de esta y en sus propósitos esta encaminar a todos sus hijos para que estos tengan un provechosos porvenir.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado central, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 12 años, ella inicia este negocio por su amiga que se llama Evelyn Cristela  quien es la que le da el apoyo para que esta establezca su negocio y logra vender en el mercado, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de sus productos y agradece tanto a su amiga Evelyn como a Fundación León 2000 y alas organizaciones correspondientes por este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Evelyn Cristela A. L. is 31 years old and she is married and has two children: one girl aged 13 years and going to grade 7, and a boy aged 9 and going to grade 3. Her life partner is a laborer. Evelyn's goal is to have her own home and to keep earning an income for her children so that they have a future in their studies. And when she does have her own home she wants to make renovations to it so that she can give her children an adequate place to live.

Her business is selling tortillas. She has been running this business for the past 20 years, selling in the central market. She started her business for a friend but she just kept going afterwards. She takes her products all the way to the central market and this is the work she carries out. The loan she requests is destined as working capital because she needs to purchase items such as corn and firewood to be able to increase her production. With the help of her friend Maria Cristina who provided her with so much support, together they will responsible for this financing.

Her name is María Cristina V. D. and she is 35 years old and has a boyfriend. Maria has 5 chidren: one girl aged 19 and she is doing her first year of a surgery technician program, another girl aged 17 and she is in grade 11, and a boy who is 14 and is going to grade 7. She has another daughter aged 17 and going to grade 9 and is married. Her life partner is a laborer. Maria's dream is to build a home. She has a plot of land but she does not have enough money to build and in her plan is to guide all of her children so that they have a promising future.

Her business is selling tortillas, selling them in the central market. She has been running her business for the past 12 years. She started her business thanks to her friend Evelyn Cristela, who has given her the support to establish her business. She sells in teh market and the loan is destined to finance the purchase of materials to make her products. She is so grateful to her friend Evelyn and to the Fundacion Leon 2000, and all of the related organisations for their support.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 41años de edad y tiene 3 hijos con su conviviente. Menciona que ha podido salir adelante aún cuando su centro de trabajo es su casa, que queda en la Av. Arias Graciani s/n Yungay, lugar donde funciona su tienda de abarrotes. Piensa que su mayor logro ha sido sacar adelante a su 3 hijos y hacer crecer su negocio junto a su conviviente, porque cuando ella empezó, nos manifiesta que empezó con una cantidad de S/. 1,000 y ahora ella estima que tiene en todo su negocio un aproximado de S/.180,000. En estos momentos, comenta, se encuentra tranquila porque todo le va muy bien, invirtiendo y teniendo utilidades específicamente para sacar adelante a su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará víveres complementarios como cajas de detergente, jabones y crema dental.

Deysi menciona que asiste a capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y que también le encantaría recibirlas por parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Deysi belongs to the Community Bank "Mujeres Al Progreso" of teh district and province of Yungay in the region of Ancash.

She is 41 years old and she has 3 children with her common law husband. She says that she has seen success running her business from her home, located at Av. Arias Graciani in Yungay. From her home she runs a convenience store. She says that her greatest success has been raising her 3 children and having expanded her business with the help of her husband. When she started out she only had S/.1000 and now they estimate that they have S/.180,000 including everything in their store. Currently she feels comfortable because everything is going very well and especially because she has the means to take care of her family.

With this loan of S/.1700, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase products such as boxes of detergents, soaps, and toothpaste.

Deysi says that she is making efforts to improve her business and she would also like to continue being part of the movement Manuela Ramos.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as detergents, soaps, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Silvio J., casado, habita junto a su familia en la Cmca. Mazapia-Tecolostote, San Lorenzo, y junto a su esposa y por esfuerzo propio se dedican a la produccion de 4 Mzs de arroz como  parte de este sector es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza y atraves de esta tiene la oportunidad de accesar como socio del proyecto de trillo arocero que le permitira reducir sus costos de produccion y la obtencion de in ingreso adicional, lo que le permitira mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, su sueño es ser parte de la sociedad de este trillo, que seguro le permitira garantizar mejor futuro a su familia y la comunidad.
texts.en:
Señor Silvio J. is married and lives with his family in Mazapia-Tecolostote in San Lorenzo. Together with his wife and through his own effort, they produce rice on 4 manzanas (6.92 acres) of land. He is a member of the cooperative "La Esperanza," and through it, he has the opportunity to become a member of a project that will build a rice thresher. This will allow him to reduce his production costs and obtain additional income, which will let him improve his family's living conditions. His dream is to be part of this project, which will surely guarantee a better future for his family and his community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support 30% of the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña

loans.name: Ega

texts.es:
Ega pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 34 años de edad y tiene un sólo hijo con su conviviente. Su mayor anhelo es conseguir un trabajo estable, aunque menciona que hasta ahora ha vivido tranquila con  su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, los cuales se los llevan a a su casa, en la Av. Graciani s/n, Yungay. Ella debe ofrecer y repartir sus productos aún cuando su mayor dificultad en el negocio es que a veces no le pagan puntualmente o simplemente olvidan su deuda, pero se siente tranquila porque siempre está ganando premios en productos y de esa manera ella al venderlos puede comprar algunas cosas para su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en promoción para tenerlos en reserva y pueda venderlos a mayor precio, así mismo pretende lograr muchos premios con la adquisición de éstos.

Ega sonríe a la vida aún cuando menciona que su esposo trabaja temporalmente y ella apoya a la casa mediante su negocio.
texts.en:
Ega belongs to the "Women of Progress" Communal Bank of the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash. She is 34 years old and has only one son with her partner. Her greatest hope is to obtain stable work, although she mentions that, up to now, she has lived peacefully with her small beauty products sale business, which she carries out in her house on Graciani Ave., Yungay. She must offer and distribute her products even when her greatest difficulty in the business is that at times her clients do not pay promptly or simply forget their debt to her. But she feels calm because she is always winning prizes in products and upon selling them she can buy some things for her family. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy promotional beauty products to have in reserve so she can sell them at a greater price. In this way she intends to win many prizes with the acquisition of these products. Ega smiles at life even when she mentions that her husband does temporary work and she supports the house by means of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for sale

loans.name: Gladys Marisol

texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. Gladys is 34 years old and married with two children. Gladys sells clothing at various regional fairs. On Sundays, she sells at the Americas fair. She occasionally sells from a mobile cart in the Nery Garcia market and also sells to other vendors on credit. She collects payments on a weekly basis. Gladys needs a loan of 600 soles to buy polo shirts, sweaters and skirts. Gladys’s dreams are to buy more merchandise, educate her children and open a store from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección.
